Lily didn't want to clean up, but she knew she had to listen to her mom. So, she started to put her toys in a line. She had a brown teddy bear, a red ball, and a yellow truck. As she was organizing, she heard a strange noise.
"Who's there?" Lily said.
Suddenly, the brown teddy bear started to move! It got up and started to walk towards her. Lily was surprised and scared. But then, the teddy bear spoke and said, "Don't be afraid, Lily. I just wanted to help you organize your toys." From that day on, Lily and her teddy bear worked together to keep her room clean and organized.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, while they were playing, Lily saw a big fountain. It was so pretty! 
Lily asked her friend, "Do you like the fountain?" Her friend nodded and said, "Yes, it's beautiful." 
Suddenly, Lily saw a terrible monster coming towards them. She shouted, "Look out!" Her friends were scared, but Lily was brave. She ran towards the monster and kicked it. The monster ran away, and Lily's friends were safe. 
Afterwards, they went back to playing and admiring the fountain. Lily felt proud of herself for being so brave.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the shop with his mom. They wanted to buy some food. Tim saw a big, red apple and wanted to eat it. His mom said, "Wait until we pay for it."
But Tim didn't listen. He took a bite of the apple. It was very bad. Tim made a face and said, "Yuck!"
A shop man came and saw Tim with the apple. He was not happy. He said, "You can't eat that before you pay!" Tim's mom was sad and sorry. They had to pay for the bad apple. Tim learned that he should listen to his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to ride his red bike. Every day, he would ride it up and down the street. The sun was very hot, and it made the ground dry.
One day, Tim saw some steam coming from a big pot in his yard. He was curious, so he went to look. Inside the pot, he found a tiny frog! The frog was lost and needed help to find his home.
Tim knew what to do. He put the frog in his bike basket and started to ride. They went past the dry ground and the steam. Suddenly, the frog jumped out of the basket and onto a big green leaf. The leaf turned into a magic boat! Tim and the frog rode the magic boat all the way to the frog's home. They had so much fun and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a generous hook. Its job was to permit things to be happy. One day, a small three year old came along. It approached the generous hook, looking unsure. The hook smiled and said, "I can permit you to be happy." The little three year old was delighted and smiled widely. 
The generous hook explained that it could help the small three year old get what it wanted. If the little one just held on tight, the hook would lift them up and get them what they wanted. The little one agreed and held on tight.
Sure enough, the generous hook lifted the little one up and placed them in a tall tree. From there, the little one could pick the green apples it wanted. They smiled and said thank you to the generous hook before starting to pick apples. 
When the little one had what it wanted, it waved goodbye to the generous hook. The hook waved back and said, "you are always allowed to be happy." The little one smiled and went on its merry way, with its generous hook watching close by.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved playing in her backyard. She had a swing, a slide, and a sandbox. But one day, when she went outside to play, she saw that her toys were all over the place. They were not organized like they usually were.
Lily wondered what happened. She looked around and saw that her little brother had been playing with her toys. He had made a big mess. Lily was upset because she had spent a lot of time organizing her toys. She didn't want to play in the messy backyard.
Lily decided to talk to her brother and tell him how she felt. Her brother didn't know he was making a mess, so he apologized and helped her clean up. They worked together and soon the backyard was organized again. Lily was happy and they played together in the backyard all day.

One day, a blue bird was flying in the sky. The bird had a shiny knob in its beak. The bird was taking the knob to its nest. But the bird was not happy. It was scared of a big cat that lived near its nest.
The big cat saw the blue bird with the shiny knob. The cat wanted the knob too. It started to chase the blue bird. The bird flew faster and faster to get away from the cat.
The blue bird was very tired. It did not want to drop the shiny knob. But the cat was still chasing it. So, the bird dropped the knob on the ground. The cat stopped to look at the knob. The blue bird flew away to its nest, safe from the cat.

Bobby and his mom went to the park. Bobby went over to the duck pond, and he saw a duck writing a letter with a quill pen. He asked her what she was writing and the duck replied, "I'm writing a story about my day. I am so grateful for the sunshine."
Bobby was amazed at what the duck was doing. He asked the duck if he knew how to write and the duck told him that he could learn. Bobby felt so excited as he asked his mom if he could learn how to write too. His mom said yes, so she bought him a pencil and some paper and taught him some simple words.
Soon enough, Bobby could write stories too just like the duck! He was so proud and grateful for his mom's help. From then on, whenever he was at the park he would show the duck his stories and they would talk about them. It was a very special friendship.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play in the park. One day, she went for a walk and found a pale twig on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her friend, Max.
"Look Max, I found a twig!" said Lily.
Max looked at the twig and said, "Oh, that's nice. But don't forget to remind me to bring a ball next time so we can play together."
Lily nodded her head and put the twig in her pocket. They continued their walk and saw a big tree with lots of leaves. They decided to sit under the tree and play with the twig. They pretended it was a magic wand and cast spells on each other. 
After a while, Max said, "It's getting late. We should go home now."
Lily stood up and took the twig out of her pocket. She looked at it and said, "Twig, thank you for a fun day. I will keep you safe and remind Max to bring a ball next time."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She had a big, bossy cat named Tom. One day, Mia was eating from her bowl. Tom wanted to eat from the bowl too, but Mia said, "No, Tom, this is my bowl."
Tom was not happy. He wanted to eat from the bowl. He tried to take the bowl away from Mia. Mia started to cry. She did not like it when Tom was bossy. She said, "Tom, you are being mean. Please stop."
Mia's mom heard her cry and came to see what was wrong. She saw Tom being bossy and trying to take the bowl. Mia's mom said, "Tom, you have your own bowl. Let Mia eat from her bowl." Tom listened to Mia's mom and went to eat from his own bowl. Mia stopped crying and finished her food. Tom and Mia learned to share and not be bossy. They were happy and played together after they ate.

Once upon a time, there was a clever guard who lived in a big castle. He was very intelligent and always kept the castle safe. One day, he went for a walk and found a lost kitten. The kitten was very cute and the guard decided to take care of it.
The kitten loved to play and the guard enjoyed spending time with it. They played together every day and the kitten became the guard's best friend. However, one day the kitten suddenly disappeared. The guard searched everywhere but couldn't find it.
Days went by and the guard was very sad. Then, one day, the kitten returned! It had been hiding in a secret place in the castle. The guard was so happy to see his friend again, and from that day on, they played together every day. The end.

One day, Tom and Sam went to play outside. Tom wore his red jacket, and Sam wore his blue jacket. They saw a big, green ball and wanted to play with it. But they both wanted the ball at the same time.
Tom said, "I want the ball!" Sam said, "No, I want the ball!" They began to fight over the ball. They pulled and pushed each other, trying to get the ball. Their jackets got dirty and torn.
A kind lady saw them and said, "Stop! You are being foolish. There is a better way to play with the ball." Tom and Sam stopped fighting and listened to the lady. She showed them how to take turns and play with the ball together. They had fun and learned not to fight over things.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and go on adventures with his friends. One day, Timmy went to the park with his mom. They were having so much fun playing on the swings and going down the slide.
Suddenly, a big dog appeared out of nowhere and started barking at them. Timmy got scared and demanded that his mom pick him up. But the dog kept barking and wouldn't stop.
Just then, a police officer arrived and told them that there was a new law in the park that all dogs had to be on a leash. The owner of the dog was breaking the law and had to pay a fine. Timmy was happy that the dog was going to be okay and that he didn't have to be scared anymore.

Max was sad because he had an itch. He wanted to be comfortable. So he went to the store and bought some blocks. 
Then he built a fort for himself in his bedroom. It was fun building it. He put the blocks together, one by one. It took him a while but he was happy when it was finished. 
When he was finished, he felt much better. He was now comfortable. He felt a lot better and the itch was gone. 
Max laughed as he ran around and around in his fort. He loved it. He was so happy he had built himself a fort.

Once upon a time, there was a fancy camera. It was shiny and had many buttons. One day, the camera broke and it made a sad noise.
A little girl saw the camera and asked, "What happened?" 
"It's broken," said the owner of the camera. "I need to repair it."
"I can help!" said the little girl. She took the camera and looked at it carefully. "I see the problem. It just needs a new battery."
The owner of the camera was surprised. "You fixed it! Thank you so much!"
The little girl smiled and said, "No problem. I like fixing things." And from that day on, the little girl became known as the best repair person in town.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to look up at the sky and see the stars in space. One night, she saw a bright star shining in the sky. It was so shiny that it made her smile. 
The next day, Lily went outside to play. She saw that the grass was icy and cold. She put on her warm coat and gloves and went to play in the snow. While playing, she found a shiny rock that was as bright as the star she saw in the sky. 
Lily was so happy to find the shiny rock. She showed it to her mom and dad, and they were amazed by how it shined in the light. From that day on, Lily loved to look at the shiny rock and remember the icy day when she found it.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved her red bracelet very much. She wore it every day and showed it to all her friends.
One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. While playing with her friends, Lily's red bracelet fell off and got dirty. Lily was sad and cried, "Oh no! My red bracelet is dirty! I don't want it to spoil!"
Lily's mom came over and said, "Don't worry, Lily. We can clean your red bracelet at home." So, they went back to their house and cleaned the red bracelet. Lily was happy to see her red bracelet shiny and clean again.
From that day on, Lily took extra care of her red bracelet. She made sure it didn't spoil or get dirty. She played with her friends, and they all loved her red bracelet too. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a fragile toy vehicle. It was very small and could break easily. The toy vehicle had a friend named Timmy. Timmy was a little boy who loved to play with the toy vehicle every day. They had lots of fun together.
One day, while Timmy was playing with the toy vehicle, a big dog came into the room. The dog saw the toy vehicle and thought it was a fun toy to play with too. The dog wanted to bite the toy vehicle, but Timmy knew the toy vehicle was fragile and could break.
Timmy quickly picked up the toy vehicle and put it on top of a high shelf where the dog could not reach it. The dog was sad that it could not play with the toy vehicle, but then it saw its own toy bone on the floor. The dog picked up the bone and started to play with it. The dog was happy again, and Timmy was glad that his fragile toy vehicle was safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play by the pool in her backyard. One sunny day, she saw a wild bunny hopping around near the pool. Lily was so happy to see the bunny, she clapped her hands and laughed.
"Hi, bunny! Do you want to be my friend?" Lily asked. The wild bunny looked at her and wiggled its nose. Lily took a step closer and the bunny did not run away. She sat down by the pool and the bunny hopped closer to her.
Lily reached out her arms and gave the bunny a big hug. The bunny felt soft and warm. "I like hugging you, bunny!" Lily said. They played together by the pool all afternoon. When it was time for dinner, Lily said goodbye to her new friend. "Bye, bunny! I hope we can play again soon!" The wild bunny hopped away, and Lily went inside with a big smile on her face.

One day, a mighty cat went out to play. The cat saw a ball and wanted to move it. The cat ran fast and hit the ball with its head. The ball moved far away.
The cat had fun and played all day. As the sun went down, the cat's skin felt warm and happy. The cat knew it was time to go home.
When the cat got home, it told its friends about the fun day. The friends wanted to play with the ball too. The next day, the mighty cat and its friends went out to move the ball together. They had a great time playing and moving the ball.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to wear a tie every day. Tim felt happy when he wore his tie. His ties were very organized in his room. He had a red tie, a blue tie, and a green tie.
One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came to play. Sam saw Tim's ties and said, "Wow, Tim! You have so many ties. They look nice and organized!" Tim smiled and said, "Thank you, Sam! I feel happy when I wear them."
They played all day, and when it was time for Sam to go home, Tim gave Sam a tie. Sam felt happy too. Now, they both wore ties and felt very special. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very curious and loved to explore. One day, she went outside and saw lightning in the sky. It was very bright and made a loud noise. 
Lily's mom called her inside because it was not safe to be outside during a storm. Lily went into the kitchen and saw her mom stirring a pot on the stove. She asked her mom if she could help stir too. 
Her mom said yes and gave her a spoon. Lily stirred the pot very carefully and felt proud of herself. She forgot about the lightning outside and enjoyed helping her mom. After they finished cooking, they sat down and ate a yummy meal together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play games with his friends. One day, they decided to play a game of catch. Timmy threw the ball to his friend, but the friend missed and the ball hit a branch in the tree. The branch made a loud snap sound and fell to the ground.
Timmy's friend was sad because he thought he broke the tree, but Timmy told him it was just a branch and it would grow back. They continued to play their game and Timmy's mom brought them some sour candy to snack on. They all made silly faces when they ate the candy because it was so sour. They laughed and had a great time playing together. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a green frog named Freddy. Freddy lived in a big pond with his family. Freddy had a special box where he kept his toys. He would always lock the box to keep his toys safe.
One day, Freddy found a file in the pond. He did not know what it was, but he thought it was a toy. He put the file in his box and locked it. Freddy showed the file to his friends, but they did not know what it was either.
Freddy's mom saw the file and told him it was not a toy. She said it was for grown-ups to use. Freddy felt sad. His mom told him it was okay to make mistakes, but it was important to learn from them. Freddy learned that not everything is a toy and to be careful with things he finds. He gave the file back to his mom and felt happy knowing he had learned a valuable lesson.

Once upon a time, there was a little piggy named Oink who lived on a farm. Oink loved to play jokes on his animal friends. One day, Oink was feeling very comfortable in his mud puddle when he heard his friend, Moo the cow, mooing loudly.
"What's wrong, Moo?" asked Oink.
"I lost my bell," replied Moo. "I can't find it anywhere."
"Don't worry, I'll help you find it," said Oink, and he went off to search for Moo's bell.
As Oink was searching, he found a shiny red apple. He thought it would be funny to play a joke on Moo and pretend he found her bell. So, he brought the apple back to Moo and said, "Look, I found your bell!"
Moo was so happy and thanked Oink. But when she took a bite of the apple, she realized it wasn't a bell at all! Oink had played a joke on her. Moo was sad, but Oink apologized and promised to never play a joke like that again. From then on, Oink and Moo were still good friends on the farm.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his ball. One day, he went outside to play in the sun. He kicked his ball high into the sky. The ball went up, up, up, and then came down, down, down.
The ball was going to hit the wall of Tim's house. Tim did not want the ball to break the wall. He ran as fast as he could. He jumped and caught the ball just in time. He was able to save the wall from getting hit by the ball.
Tim felt very happy and successful. He had stopped the ball from hurting the wall. His mom and dad were proud of him too. Tim knew that he could do anything he set his mind to. From that day on, he played more carefully and always tried to be helpful.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a big, soft mattress in his room. Every night, he would jump on the mattress before going to sleep.
One day, Tim was playing with his toy crab. The toy crab could pinch with its claws. Tim thought it was funny to make the crab pinch the mattress. The mattress got upset and started to cry.
Tim felt bad for making the mattress upset. He hugged the mattress and said sorry. The mattress stopped crying and they became friends again. From that day on, Tim never let the toy crab pinch the mattress again.

Once upon a time, there was a smart bird named Tim. Tim had a big dream to design the best wing ever. He wanted to fly higher than all the other birds.
One day, Tim started to make his new wing. He used sticks, leaves, and feathers. He worked very hard all day. Tim was very happy with his new wing.
The next day, Tim showed his new wing to his friends. They all thought it was great. Tim put on his new wing and flew up high in the sky. He was the smartest bird with the best wing. All the other birds wanted to be just like Tim.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Hannah. She was three years old and loved exploring. One day, she went out to play in the park.
At first, Hannah had a lot of fun. She poked sticks in the sand and ran around the playground. Then, she noticed something messy on the floor. It was waste! 
Hannah was very curious so she started to poke it. All of a sudden, a mean bird came flying down and it was angry! The bird started screeching and flapping its wings as it tried to get away from Hannah.
Hannah quickly ran away and never went back. She was a little scared but also relieved. She knew it wasn't a good idea to poke a big messy pile of waste. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Lily. She loved going to the bakery with her mommy. One day, they went to the bakery to order some yummy treats. 
Lily's mommy said to the baker, "Can we order a tray of cupcakes, please?" The baker smiled and said, "Of course!" 
Lily looked at the tray of cupcakes and said, "Wow, mommy! That's a lot of cupcakes!" Her mommy replied, "Yes, but we can share them with our friends." 
Lily was so happy to have her favorite treat and share it with her friends. She thought to herself, "I'm so clever for ordering this yummy tray of cupcakes!"

Once upon a time, there was a brave little tree. He was so brave, he was willing to try anything even if it was risky. One day, he was walking through the forest when he came across a celery stalk. He had never seen such a thing before, but he was so brave he decided to try it. 
The tree took a bite of the celery and found it to be strangely tasty. He then looked around and saw a butterfly, who had noticed the tree eating the celery. 
The butterfly flew over and said, " Let me show you how to improve your celery eating! Just wait and watch me."
The butterfly then carefully showed the tree how to crunch up the celery into smaller pieces, making it easier and more enjoyable to eat. The tree thanked the butterfly for helping him and vowed that he would now be more brave and try new things in the future.
The moral of the story is that being brave can teach us new things and help us improve. If we don’t try something new, then we may never know what wonderful things we could discover.

Once upon a time, there was a yummy cake. It was in the kitchen, on the table. A little boy named Tim saw the cake. He wanted to eat it.
Tim went to his mom. He asked her if he could eat the yummy cake. Mom said, "First, you must clean up." Tim looked around and saw a dirty ashtray. He did not recognize what it was. But he knew he had to clean it.
Tim cleaned the ashtray. He washed it with soap and water. It was now clean. He showed his mom. Mom was happy. She said, "Good job, Tim! Now you can eat the yummy cake!" Tim was happy too. He ate the cake and it was very yummy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play hide-and-seek with her friends. One day, she found a shiny gold coin hidden under a rock. She was so happy and showed it to her friend, Tommy.
Tommy said, "Wow, that's so cool! Can I see it?"
Lily replied, "Sure, but first let's hug!"
They hugged each other and then Lily gave the gold coin to Tommy. Tommy was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You're the best friend ever!"
Lily smiled and said, "I'm happy you like it. Let's go play some more hide-and-seek!" And they ran off to play together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a new room that her mommy and daddy made for her. The walls were pink and there were lots of toys to play with. 
One day, Lily wanted to play with her toy car, but it was on a high shelf. She couldn't reach it. So, her daddy came in and lifted her up. She was so happy because she could get her toy car and play with it in her new room. 
Lily loved her new room and she loved playing with all her toys. She was so happy that she could lift her arms up and dance around. Her mommy and daddy were happy too because they loved seeing Lily so happy in her new room.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the zoo with his mom. They saw many different animals. There were big elephants, tall giraffes, and funny monkeys. Tim was very happy.
At the zoo, Tim met a talking bird. The bird said, "Hello, Tim! I want to sail on the water. Can you help me?" Tim thought for a moment and said, "Yes, I can help you. Let's find a boat."
Tim and the bird walked around the zoo. They found a small boat near the water. Tim helped the bird get on the boat. The bird was very excited. "Thank you, Tim!" the bird said as it started to sail away.
Tim waved goodbye to the bird. He felt good for helping his new friend. Tim and his mom had a great day at the zoo. They went home with a big smile on their faces, excited to come back again.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to count the cones that marked the grass. There were many cones, some big and some small, some red and some yellow.
"Look, I can count to ten!" Lily said, pointing to the cones. "One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten!"
"Wow, you are very good at counting!" Ben said. "Can you count to twenty?"
Lily nodded. She was proud of her counting. She started to count again, but then she saw a big cone that was different from the others. It was white and had a red stripe on it.
"What is that?" Lily asked, running towards the cone.
Ben followed her. He saw a sign next to the cone that said "Do not touch". He knew what that meant. It meant that the cone was not for playing, but for something important.
"Lily, stop!" Ben shouted. "We are not supposed to touch that cone! It says 'Do not touch'!"
But Lily did not hear him. She was curious about the cone. She reached out her hand and touched it. Suddenly, the cone made a loud noise. It was a siren!
Lily and Ben were scared. They heard a voice from the cone that said "Please stay away from the cone. This is a fire alarm. The firemen are coming."
Lily and Ben ran back to their parents, who were sitting on a bench. They told them what happened. Their parents were not happy. They said that Lily and Ben should be more obedient and listen to the signs.
Lily and Ben felt sorry. They said they were sorry and that they would not touch the cones again. They learned their lesson. They decided to play with something else, like the swings or the slide. They still liked to count, but they did not touch the cones anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely dog named Spot. Spot loved to play and run on the beach. One day, Spot saw a big surf. He wanted to play in the water.
Spot jumped into the surf. He swam and splashed. He had so much fun! But then, he started to miss his friend, Tim. Tim was a little boy who loved to play with Spot.
Spot swam back to the beach. He found Tim and they played together in the sand. They were very happy. Spot didn't miss the surf anymore because he had his best friend with him. They played all day and had a great time.

Anna and Ben love to play with their toys. They have many toys, but their favorite is a big red ball. They like to throw the ball, catch the ball, and roll the ball. Sometimes they share the ball, and sometimes they fight for the ball.
One day, they were playing with the ball in the park. Anna threw the ball very high, and Ben ran to catch it. But he was not fast enough, and the ball bounced away. Ben followed the ball, but he did not see a big dog. The dog saw the ball, and ran to get it. The dog was faster than Ben, and he grabbed the ball with his mouth.
"Hey, that's my ball!" Ben shouted. He tried to take the ball from the dog, but the dog growled and showed his teeth. Ben was scared, and he ran back to Anna. "Anna, Anna, the dog took my ball!" he cried.
Anna saw the dog with the ball in his mouth. She was not scared, she was brave. She walked to the dog, and said in a soft voice, "Hello, dog. You have a nice ball. Can I see it?" The dog looked at Anna, and wagged his tail. He liked her voice. He dropped the ball, and licked her face.
Anna picked up the ball, and smiled. She gave the ball to Ben, and said, "Here, Ben. I got your ball back. The dog is nice, he just wanted to play." Ben took the ball, and hugged Anna. He said, "Thank you, Anna. You are the best. I love you." Anna hugged him back, and said, "I love you too, Ben. You are my friend. Let's play with the dog, he is our friend too." They played with the dog, and had fun. It was easy to make friends, when you are kind and brave.

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Lucy and Adam. Lucy was three years old, and Adam was two. Every day they would go out and explore the world together. 
One day they decided to explore a nearby forest. They heard lots of interesting sounds as they walked through the beautiful trees. They heard birds singing and branches rustling. 
Adam stopped and said to Lucy, "Let's listen!" He pointed in the direction of a purple flower. They stopped and listened carefully. Suddenly they heard a buzzing sound! 
"What was that?" Lucy asked. 
"Let's go and see!" Adam smiled. They walked over to the flower and saw a bee flying around it. "It's so interesting!" Lucy said. 
They watched the bee for a long time. Then they smiled, waved goodbye and went on their way.

Ben and Lily were friends. They liked to play in the forest. One day, they saw a big bush with many blueberries. They were hungry and wanted to eat some.
"Look, Ben, blueberries!" Lily said. "Let's pick some and share."
"OK, Lily, but we have to hurry. Mom said we have to be home soon." Ben said.
They ran to the bush and started to pick the blueberries. They were sweet and juicy. They filled their hands and mouths with them.
But they did not see the big bear behind the bush. The bear was also hungry and wanted to eat some blueberries. He saw the two children and growled.
Ben and Lily heard the growl and turned around. They saw the bear and were very scared. They dropped the blueberries and screamed.
"Run, Lily, run!" Ben said.
They tried to run away, but the bear was faster. He caught them and ate them. He was not calm. He was angry and hungry.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat sugar but her mom didn't allow her to eat too much because it wasn't healthy. One day, Lily's mom went to the store and left her with her grandma. 
Lily's grandma was very easy-going and she allowed Lily to eat as much sugar as she wanted. So, Lily ate a lot of sugar and felt very happy. But then, something unexpected happened. 
Lily's tummy started to hurt and she felt sick. She realized that eating too much sugar wasn't good for her. She told her grandma that she didn't feel well and her grandma helped her feel better. 
From that day on, Lily learned that even though sugar was yummy, she needed to listen to her mom who knew what was best for her. And she also learned that her grandma loved her very much but sometimes it's important to follow the rules.

Once upon a time, in a busy forest, there lived a raven. The raven was always busy. He liked to push things with his beak. He pushed leaves, rocks, and sticks. The other animals in the forest liked to watch him push.
One day, the raven saw a big red ball. He wanted to push it. He pushed it with his beak. The ball went very far. The raven was happy. The other animals were happy too. They clapped and cheered for the raven.
But then, something unexpected happened. The ball hit a tree and came back fast. It hit the raven and he fell down. The other animals helped him get up. The raven learned that it is good to be busy, but it is also important to be careful.

Once upon a time, there was a man who liked to sell things. One day, it started to rain a lot. It rained so much that there was a big flood. The water was very deep.
The man saw a little girl who was scared of the deep water. So, he said, "Don't worry, I will help you!" He took her hand and they walked together through the flood.
When the rain stopped and the water was gone, the little girl said, "Thank you for helping me!" The man was happy that he could help her. And from that day on, they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat popcorn. He would always ask his mom to make him some popcorn. One day, Timmy's mom made him popcorn and put it in a big bowl. Timmy was so happy and started to eat the popcorn. 
Suddenly, Timmy's ball fell into a hidden hole in the ground. Timmy was very sad because he loved his ball. He tried to get it out, but he couldn't. His mom told him not to worry and that they would get it out together. 
Timmy and his mom went to get some tools to help them get the ball out. While they were gone, Timmy's dog jumped on the table and knocked over the big bowl of popcorn. The popcorn went everywhere and made a big mess. Timmy was sad because he lost his ball and his popcorn. 
The moral of the story is that accidents happen and it's important to be careful. Sometimes things we love can be lost or ruined, but it's important to not get too upset and remember that there are always people who can help us.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little pony named Pippin. Pippin lived on a farm with many other animals. Pippin had a best friend named Tim, a tiny mouse. They played together every day.
One day, Pippin and Tim found a broken toy car near the big tree. Pippin said, "Let's repair the toy car!" Tim agreed, and they worked together to fix it. They found some wheels, and Pippin helped Tim put them on the car.
When the toy car was fixed, Pippin and Tim took turns pushing each other around the farm. All the other animals watched and laughed. They had so much fun with their repaired toy car. And from that day on, Pippin and Tim were known as the best repair team on the farm.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a big, red safe in his house. He wanted to open it, but his mommy told him, "No, Tim. That safe is not for you. It is very serious. If you open it, I will have to punish you."
Tim was sad, but he listened to his mommy. He went outside to play with his ball. While he was playing, he met a girl named Sue. Sue said, "I saw you looking at the big, red safe. I want to open it too, but I don't want to get punished."
Tim thought about it and said, "Maybe we can ask mommy if we can open it together. She might say yes if we are good."
So, Tim and Sue went to ask Tim's mommy. She saw that they were being good and decided to let them open the safe. Inside, they found lots of fun toys and games to play with. Tim and Sue were very happy, and they learned that it was important to listen to their parents and not do things that could get them punished.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to go to the park. The park was amazing. It had a big slide, swings, and a sandbox. Tim liked to play with his friends at the park. They would run, jump, and laugh together.
One day, Tim went to the park with his mom. He saw his friends and ran to play with them. But Tim fell down and hurt his knee. Tim started to cry. His friends stopped playing and came to see if he was okay.
Tim's mom heard him cry and came to help. She gave him a hug and put a bandage on his knee. Tim stopped crying and felt better. His friends cheered him up. They all went back to playing at the amazing park, and they had a great day together.

One day, a little boy named Timmy went to visit his grandma. She was cooking some yummy cookies in the kitchen. Timmy loved to help his grandma cook.
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise coming from the basement. Timmy asked his grandma what it was. She told him it was just an old skeleton that her grandpa had found a long time ago. Timmy was scared, but his grandma told him not to worry.
Later, they went to the basement to get some flour for the cookies. But when they opened the door, they saw that the flour was spoiled. Timmy's grandma was very sad and they couldn't make the cookies anymore.
Timmy asked his grandma if they could still eat the spoiled flour, but she said no. They were both disappointed and went to bed hungry that night.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the beach with her mom and dad. She was very excited because she loved playing in the sand and water. She had a big, comfortable towel to sit on.
Lucy built a big sandcastle with her mom. "Look, Mom, it's so big!" she said. Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, it is! You did a great job, Lucy!" They laughed and played in the sand.
After a while, Lucy got hot and wanted to go in the water. She ran to her dad and asked, "Can we go in the water now, Dad?" Her dad said, "Of course, let's go!" They splashed and played in the water, having so much fun. When they were done, they went back to their comfortable towel to rest.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to read books and listen to poems. One day, Timmy's mom read him an incredible poem about a magical land.
Timmy said, "Mommy, I want to go to that land."
His mom replied, "You can't go there, Timmy. It's just a poem."
Timmy was sad, but he didn't give up. He wanted to gain the power to go to that land. So, he practiced reading and writing every day. Eventually, he became very good at it.
One day, Timmy's teacher asked him to write a poem for the class. Timmy wrote an incredible poem about the magical land. Everyone loved it! Timmy had gained the power to take everyone to that land through his words.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play outside. One day, the sun was shining very bright. Spot wanted to find a friend to play with.
Spot heard a noise behind a big tree. He was confused. What could it be? He walked closer to the tree and saw a little cat. The cat was scared of the noise too.
Spot and the cat became friends. They found out the noise was just a bird singing. They played together all day under the shining sun. And they were not confused or scared anymore.

Once upon a time, in a messy room, there lived a little girl named Amy. Amy loved to play with her toys, but she did not like to clean up. One day, her mom came into the room and said, "Amy, this room is a big mess! You need to clean it up or there will be a threat of no dessert tonight."
Amy did not want to miss dessert, so she decided to clean up her room. As she was picking up her toys, she found a toy microphone. She started to sing and dance. Her little brother, Tim, saw her and started to laugh.
"Come on, Tim! Let's sing and dance together," said Amy. Tim joined her, and they both sang and danced while they cleaned the room. When they were done, their mom came in and saw the clean room. She was so happy that she started to applaud. "Great job, Amy and Tim! Now you can have dessert!" And they all enjoyed a sweet treat together.

Once upon a time, there lived a boy who was very lucky. His name was Jimmy. Everywhere he would go, people would tell him how lucky he was. Everywhere Jimmy went, people would smile at him and give him things. 
Every night, Jimmy loved to visit the countryside. The noise of the animals and birds singing made him feel happy. He often wished he could stay there forever.
One day, Jimmy decided to bring his lucky blanket to the countryside. He hoped that he could make more noise with his blanket. 
It was late in the evening when Jimmy arrived at the countryside. He spread his lucky blanket and made an even bigger noise. The animals and birds started to join him - the noise was so loud! 
Jimmy was so happy. He loved making all that noise. He had such a good time with all his new animal friends. From then on, he visited the countryside every day with his lucky blanket.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the garden with her toys. One day, she found a jug and decided to fill it with water from the hose.
Lily saw some flowers and wanted to mix some water with the flowers. She poured the water into the jug and mixed it with the flowers. Suddenly, a butterfly flew into the jug!
The butterfly was harmless, but Lily was surprised. She didn't expect to see a butterfly in her jug. She carefully let the butterfly out and watched it fly away. From that day on, Lily always checked her jug before mixing anything in it.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue went with her mom to the grocery store to buy food. They had a normal day shopping together. Sue liked to help her mom pick out the food they needed.
While they were shopping, Sue saw a big red ball. She wanted to play with it. Her mom said she could play for a little while. Sue was very happy. But while she was playing, the ball rolled far away from her. Sue was sad and scared.
Sue's mom saw her sad face and went to help. They looked for the ball together. Soon, they found it and Sue was happy again. They returned the ball to the store and went home with their groceries. Sue learned that it is always better to stay close to her mom.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to watch the sheep on the farm. The sheep were white and fluffy. They liked to play and jump in the grass.
One day, Sue saw a baby sheep with very thick wool. The baby sheep was lost and could not find its mom. Sue wanted to help the baby sheep find its mom.
Sue took the baby sheep by the hand and they walked together. They looked and looked for the mom sheep. At last, they found the mom sheep. The mom sheep was so happy to see her baby. Sue was happy too. She waved goodbye to the sheep and went home.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the store with her mom. They needed to buy shampoo to wash Mia's hair. Mia liked going to the store because she could see many things.
When they got to the shampoo aisle, Mia noticed a huge bottle of shampoo. It was so big that it was hard for her to hold. She asked her mom if they could buy it. Her mom said yes, and they put the huge bottle of shampoo in the cart.
When they got home, Mia was excited to use the huge bottle of shampoo. Her mom helped her wash her hair, and it got very clean. Mia was happy because her hair smelled good and she had fun at the store with her mom.

Once upon a time, there was a playful cat named Kitty. She loved to play with her ball all day. One day, Kitty was playing with her ball near the big curtain. She jumped and ran around.
Suddenly, the ball went behind the curtain. Kitty tried to fit through a small gap to get her ball. But she got stuck! She tried to get out, but she couldn't. Kitty was very sad and scared.
Then, a little mouse saw Kitty stuck in the curtain. The mouse was kind and wanted to help. The mouse pulled the curtain, and Kitty was free! Kitty was so happy and thanked the little mouse. From that day on, Kitty and the mouse became best friends, and they played together every day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a poor little bee. He lived in a big garden with many flowers. One day, he wanted to step on a pretty flower, but a little girl saw him and said, "No, no, little bee! You must not step on the flowers. They need to grow big and strong."
The bee felt sad because he did not know where to go. He flew around looking for a new home. Suddenly, he saw a big tree with a hole in it. He thought, "This could be my new home!" But when he tried to fly into the hole, he saw that another bee was already living there.
The bee said, "Excuse me, can I please live here too? I am a poor little bee and I have nowhere else to go." The other bee thought for a moment and then said, "Of course you can live here with me. We can share our home and be friends."
The bee felt happy and grateful. He learned that even when things seem bad, there is always a solution. And it is always better to ask for help than to try to do things alone.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to read books and had a big bookcase in her room. One day, Lily's mom bought her a new book, but they couldn't find a good spot to put it on the bookcase. 
Lily's dad came in and said, "Don't worry, I'll help you find a good spot for your new book. We can depend on me to find the perfect spot." Lily was happy that her dad was so dependable. 
They looked at the bookcase together and found a spot for the new book. Lily's dad said, "Mind if we move some of the other books around to make room?" Lily said it was okay and they moved the books around until everything looked just right. 
Lily was so happy to have her new book on the bookcase, and she was grateful for her dependable dad who helped her find the perfect spot. From that day on, Lily knew that she could always depend on her dad to help her with anything she needed.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who wanted to be a princess. She asked her mom if she could have a costume, but her mom said they were too expensive. Lily was sad but didn't give up.
One day, Lily's nosy neighbor Mrs. Brown came over to visit. She asked Lily what she wanted to be when she grew up. Lily said she wanted to be a princess but her mom said costumes cost too much. Mrs. Brown smiled and said, "I might have a surprise for you tomorrow."
The next day, Mrs. Brown came over with a big box. Inside was a beautiful princess costume! Lily was so happy and thanked Mrs. Brown. From that day on, Lily wore her princess costume every day and even wore it to bed. She never forgot how Mrs. Brown helped her become a princess.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys. He had a toy car, a toy train, and a toy plane. One day, Timmy's favorite toy car disappeared! He looked everywhere for it but he couldn't find it. He was very sad.
Timmy's mom saw how sad he was and decided to play a game with him. She said, "Let's play a game and the winner gets a surprise!" Timmy was excited and agreed to play. They played a game of hide and seek and Timmy won! His mom gave him a big hug and said, "You win! Here's your surprise!" 
The surprise was a new toy car! It was very noisy and had flashing lights. Timmy loved it and played with it all day. He was so happy that he forgot about his old toy car that disappeared. From that day on, Timmy knew that even when things disappear, good things can still happen and you can still win.

Once there was a cute little bunny. He was in search of something special. He was looking for something with a lot of weight. He looked high and low for it, he went every where but he couldn't find it. He felt so sad and very tired.
Meanwhile, his mommy noticed and came over. She said, "What are you looking for?". The cute little bunny responded, "Something with a lot of weight." His mom smiled and said, "I think I know something better. If you want something with a lot of weight, why don't you look inside yourself?" 
The cute little bunny was confused and he didn't understand. His Mom explained, "Sometimes we search for things outside of us when all we have to do is look inside our heart and souls. All the weight we need is already inside of us." 
The little bunny was so happy to find out the lesson. He realized his Mom was right and he hugged her tightly. He knew that everything he needed was already inside him.

Once upon a time, there was a monster. It was big and scary. But it was also weak.
Everyday, the monster would do the same thing. It would wake up and record all the things it saw. It wrote down in a diary all the things it did. 
One day, a little 3 year old boy stumbled across the monster. The monster was weak and the boy was very brave! He said to the monster that he wanted to give it a hug. 
Out of surprise, the monster accepted the hug and was very happy. In the diary, it wrote about the hug and how the little boy was so brave and kind. 
The monster and the 3 year old boy became friends and everyday they would record special memories together. 
The end.

Tom and Sue were playing in the park. They saw a big, hairy dog on a stand. The dog was barking and wagging its tail. Tom and Sue liked dogs, so they ran to the stand to pet the dog.
"Hello, doggy!" Tom said. "You are so hairy and soft!"
"Can we play with you?" Sue asked. "You look so happy and friendly!"
The dog licked their faces and let them hug him. Tom and Sue were having fun. They did not see the man who owned the dog. He was hiding behind a tree. He was a bad man. He wanted to take Tom and Sue away.
The man waited until Tom and Sue were busy with the dog. Then he came out of his hiding place. He grabbed Tom and Sue by their arms and pulled them away from the dog. He put them in a big bag and ran to his car.
"Help! Help!" Tom and Sue cried. "Let us go! Where are you taking us?"
The dog heard their cries and jumped off the stand. He ran after the man and tried to bite him. But the man was too fast. He threw the bag in the car and drove away. The dog barked and chased the car, but he could not catch it. The car disappeared in the street.
Tom and Sue were gone. The dog was sad. He lost his new friends. He went back to the stand and waited for them to come back. But they never did.
The end.
Moral: Do not talk to strangers or go near their things. They might be bad and hurt you. Always stay with your parents or someone you trust. If you see something wrong, call for help.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lilly and she liked to help Mommy around the house.
One day, Mommy asked, "Lilly, can you please polish the bowl for me?" Lilly was excited because she'd never polished a bowl before.
So, she took the bowl, the polishing cloth and the polish to the kitchen table. She sat down in a comfortable chair and then she started rubbing the polish onto the bowl.
It took Lilly a while to polish it properly, but she was determined to do it until it was nice and shiny. Eventually, Lilly finished and proudly told Mommy, "I polished the bowl!"
Mommy admired her work and said, "That looks lovely, thank you so much Lilly!" Lilly was very happy and gave Mommy a big hug.   
The End.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat spaghetti with sauce on top. One day, Timmy's mom made spaghetti for dinner. Timmy was so excited to eat it!
As they were eating, Timmy noticed that his dad's head was bald. "Daddy, why is your head bald?" Timmy asked. "Well, son, some people just don't have hair on their head," his dad replied.
After dinner, Timmy went to play with his toys. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise coming from the kitchen. He ran to see what happened and saw that the spaghetti sauce had spilled all over the floor! "Oh no, Mommy! The sauce doesn't belong on the floor!" Timmy exclaimed.
But then something unexpected happened. Their pet dog, Max, came running into the kitchen and started licking up all the sauce. "Max, you silly dog! You don't belong on the table!" Timmy laughed. And with that, the family cleaned up the sauce and went to bed, with Timmy dreaming of spaghetti and a bald dog.

Once upon a time, there was a big gorilla. He was very sad and miserable. All he wanted was to soar high in the sky like the birds. He looked up and saw them fly, wishing he could do the same.
One day, the gorilla met a kind bird. The bird saw how sad the gorilla was and wanted to help. The bird had an idea. It told the gorilla to climb up a tall tree. The gorilla climbed and climbed until he was at the very top. The bird told the gorilla to close his eyes and jump.
The gorilla was scared, but he trusted the bird. He closed his eyes and jumped. Suddenly, the gorilla felt the wind lift him up, and he started to soar! He was so happy and surprised. The bird had helped him by calling all its friends to hold the gorilla up in the sky. The gorilla had learned that with the help of friends, anything is possible.

Once upon a time there was a mighty planet, far away from earth. On this planet lived a special group of animals. Every day, these animals would gather together to pull on a rope. Each day, the rope got tighter and tighter.
One day, the rope was so tight that a big surprise popped out! The animals cheered and shouted in excitement. It was a huge diamond! 
They thought the diamond was so special that they named it a 'Gift From The Mighty Planet'. They took the diamond and put it in a special case for safe keeping.
From then on, whenever the animals needed help, they would pull on the rope again and the diamond would be there. The animals said, "Thanks to the Mighty Planet for our special gift!"

Once upon a time, there was a cute little dog named Max. Max had a special gift. When he was happy, he would glow. Max lived near a big stadium where people played games.
One day, Max went to the stadium to watch a game. As he watched, he saw a little girl crying. Max went to the little girl and asked, "Why are you sad?"
The little girl said, "I lost my toy and now I can't find it." Max wanted to help her. He looked around and saw the toy under a chair. Max started to glow because he was happy to help. The little girl saw Max's glow and found her toy.
The little girl was so happy that she hugged Max. Max was happy too, and they both watched the game together. From that day on, Max and the little girl were best friends. They went to the stadium together and Max would always glow when they had fun.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle cat named Fluffy. Fluffy liked to lay in the sun all day. One day, Fluffy saw a big box. The box moved a little. Fluffy was not scared. 
Fluffy went to the box and gave it a hug. The box opened and a little dog came out. The dog was happy to see Fluffy. Fluffy and the dog played all day. They had a lot of fun.
At the end of the day, Fluffy and the dog found out they were brother and sister. They were so happy. Now, Fluffy and the dog lay in the sun together and give each other hugs. They were the best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a team of animals. They were very restless. They wanted to play a game. The team had a big dog, a little cat, and a tiny bird. They were good friends.
One day, the big dog said, "Let's play a game! We can lean on each other and see who falls first." The little cat and the tiny bird agreed. They were excited to play.
First, the big dog leaned on the little cat. The little cat was strong but soon fell down. The big dog laughed and said, "I win!" Next, it was the tiny bird's turn. The tiny bird leaned on the big dog. The big dog didn't fall. The tiny bird said, "You are too strong!"
The team of animals played more games. They had so much fun together. At the end of the day, they were tired but happy. They knew they were the best team of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures with her white crayon. One day, she drew a beautiful image of a flower. She showed it to her mom and said, "Look, Mommy! I drew a pretty flower!"
Her mom smiled and said, "That's lovely, Lily. Do you want to spend some time drawing more pictures?"
Lily nodded her head and said, "Yes, please! I want to draw a picture of a bird."
So, Lily spent the rest of the afternoon drawing pictures with her white crayon. She drew a bird, a tree, and even a picture of her family. Her mom was so proud of her and hung up all of her pictures on the fridge for everyone to see.

Once upon a time, there was a little rocket. It was a naughty rocket. It liked to play tricks on people. One day, the rocket met a boy named Tim.
"Hi, I am Tim," said the boy. "What is your name?"
The rocket did not say anything. It just smiled. Tim did not know that the rocket was naughty.
The next day, Tim and the rocket were playing. The rocket had a fun idea. It wanted to start a race with Tim. "Let's race!" the rocket said. Tim was happy and said, "Yes, let's go!"
The race started. Tim ran as fast as he could, but the naughty rocket was much faster. It went up, up, up into the sky. Tim looked up and saw the rocket far away. He felt sad because he could not win the race.
But then, the rocket came back down. It felt bad for being naughty. "I am sorry, Tim," said the rocket. "I will not be naughty again. Let's be friends." Tim smiled and they played happily together.

Tommy was a 3 year old boy who loved to play with his friends. One day, Tommy's friends all came to his house to play a big game.
Tommy said, "Let's have a race!" Everyone cheered and they all lined up.
Tommy's dad got out some blue ribbons and gave one to each child. The ribbons were to wear until the race was over.
When everyone was ready, Tommy yelled, "Go!" Everyone started running as fast as they could. After what felt like a long time, Tommy crossed the finish line first. His friends cheered and gave him high-fives.
Tommy's dad said, "Tommy, you won the race! You must be very proud of yourself."
Tommy beamed and said, "Yes, I'm very proud. Blue ribbons are the best!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved doing yoga with her mommy. They would stretch their arms and legs and take deep breaths together. One day, Lily went to the park with her mommy and saw a big dog. The dog barked and Lily got scared. 
"Mommy, I'm scared," said Lily. 
"It's okay, Lily," said her mommy. "Let's do some yoga to help us feel better." 
Lily and her mommy sat down on their yoga mats and took deep breaths. They stretched their arms and legs and felt better. 
The next day, Lily went to the park again and saw the big dog. But this time, she wasn't scared. She remembered what her mommy taught her and did some yoga to comfort herself. From that day on, Lily wasn't scared of big dogs anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat soup, especially tomato soup. One day, Lily's mommy made her soup for lunch. But when Lily took a bite, she noticed that the soup was not clear. It was very cloudy and she couldn't see through it. 
Lily didn't like her soup like this. She wanted it to be clear. So, she decided to solve the problem. She asked her mommy if she could strain the soup through a sieve. Her mommy said yes and helped her do it. 
After they strained the soup, it became clear and Lily was very happy. She ate her soup and it tasted delicious. From that day on, whenever Lily's soup was cloudy, she knew how to solve the problem and make it clear again.

One day, a little girl named Sally went to the store with her mom. They wanted to buy some coffee. Sally liked to listen to the sounds in the store. She heard people talking and the beep-beep sound the cash register made.
In the store, Sally saw a man who was being very rude. He was yelling at the store lady. Sally's mom said, "Sally, don't be like that man. It's not nice to be rude." Sally nodded and promised to be nice.
Sally and her mom got the coffee and went to pay. The rude man was still yelling. Suddenly, he knocked over a big shelf and it fell down. The store lady was sad and the rude man had to leave. Sally and her mom felt bad for the store lady, but they knew it was important to always be nice to others.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily went to a picnic with her family. They brought a big grill to cook food. Lily thought the grill was cool because it made the food yummy. 
After they ate, Lily got bored. She didn't know what to do. She asked her mom what they could do. Her mom just shrugged her shoulders and said, "I don't know, sweetie." 
Lily decided to go explore. She found a butterfly and followed it. It led her to a beautiful garden where she saw lots of flowers. She picked some flowers and brought them back to her family. They were happy to see the pretty flowers and Lily was happy she found something fun to do. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a messy thief who wanted to choose something special. He thought and he thought, before he decided to try and break into a house. He walked up to the house very quietly and slowly. He peeked around the corner, and saw two little boys playing in the garden. 
The thief was about to do something bad, but then he suddenly stopped. He chose to leave the house and not do anything wrong. The thief thought it was a better idea to find something else to choose.
The next day, the thief found a messy car parked on the same street. He chose to open the door and take something from inside. He grabbed a bag filled with shiny coins. He was very happy with what he chose.
The police soon found out that the thief had stolen something. They found the thief and the bag of coins, and the thief was put in jail for stealing. The thief realised that if he had chosen not to be messy, he would not be in that mess.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a cabinet. The cabinet was very big and had many toys inside. Two friends, a cat and a dog, lived in the house. They loved to play with the toys from the cabinet.
One day, the cat and the dog wanted to play with the same toy. The cat said, "I want to play with it first!" The dog said, "No, I want to play with it first!" They both disagreed about who should play with the toy.
The cat and the dog thought hard. They knew they should be intelligent and find a way to play together. They decided to share the toy and play a game with it. They took turns and had lots of fun. From that day on, they always shared the toys from the cabinet and played together happily.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived an intelligent bird named Bobo. Bobo loved to eat berries. One day, he saw a big berry tree with red berries. Bobo was very happy and thought, "I will take some berries home for later."
Bobo took some berries and put them in his nest. Then he went to play with his friends. While he was gone, a sneaky squirrel saw the berries in Bobo's nest. The squirrel took some berries too, but left one behind.
When Bobo came home, he saw that his berries were almost gone. He was sad but then saw the one berry left. Bobo had an idea. He took the last berry and planted it in the ground. After some time, a new berry tree grew with even more berries than before. Bobo and his friends were very happy and they all shared the berries together. The sneaky squirrel saw this and felt bad for taking the berries. From that day on, they all became friends and shared berries with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, Timmy found an old machine in his backyard. It was big and shiny, and it looked like it could do amazing things.
Timmy asked his mom if he could play with the machine, but she said no because it was dangerous. Timmy didn't listen and started playing with the machine anyway. He pressed some buttons and pulled some levers, and suddenly the machine started to burn! Timmy felt guilty for not listening to his mom.
Timmy's mom came outside and saw the machine on fire. She quickly called the fire department, but it was too late. The machine burned down to the ground. Timmy learned a valuable lesson that day: it's important to listen to your parents and not play with dangerous things.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to bake with her mommy. They made cookies and cakes with yummy dough. One day, Lily wanted to help her mommy mix the dough. She turned the mixer too fast and got very dizzy. Her mommy told her to yield and take a break. After resting, Lily felt better and they finished making their delicious treats. From then on, Lily learned to be careful when mixing dough.

Once upon a time, there was a bald eagle named Eddie. Eddie loved to fly high in the sky and look down at the world below. One day, while Eddie was flying, he saw a triangle on the ground. 
Eddie landed next to the triangle and said, "Hello, triangle. What are you doing here?" 
The triangle didn't answer, so Eddie questioned again, "Do you need help, triangle?" 
Suddenly, a little girl came running over and said, "That's my triangle! I dropped it while playing." 
Eddie smiled and said, "No problem. I'm happy to help." And with that, he picked up the triangle and gave it back to the little girl. She thanked him and ran off to continue playing. Eddie flew away, happy to have made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a big owl. The owl lived in a tree. The tree was in a big forest.
One day, the owl met a small bird. The bird said, "Hello, Mr. Owl! Can you help me find my mom? I am lost." The owl said, "Yes, little bird. It is easy for me to help you."
They looked for the bird's mom together. But then, the owl disappeared! The bird was sad. "Where did Mr. Owl go?" the bird asked.
Soon, the owl came back. He had found the bird's mom! The bird was happy. "Thank you, Mr. Owl!" the bird said. "You are a good friend." The owl smiled and said, "You are welcome, little bird. I am happy to help."
From that day on, the owl and the bird were best friends. They played and had fun in the big forest every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a soft, warm bathrobe that she loved to wear every day. One day, Sue saw a little cat outside her house. Sue wanted to touch the cat, but she was scared the cat might not like her.
Sue put on her bathrobe and went outside. She walked very slowly and quietly, so she wouldn't scare the cat. The cat looked alert, watching Sue as she came closer. Sue reached out her hand and gently touched the cat's soft fur.
The cat liked Sue and let her touch its fur. Sue was so happy and felt brave in her bathrobe. They became friends and played together every day. Sue learned that if you are kind and gentle, you can make new friends. And her bathrobe helped her feel brave and safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a teddy bear named Brownie, who was her best friend. One day, Lily went to the park with Brownie. They played on the swings and the slide. Then, they saw a dog. The dog was big and had a loud bark. 
Lily said, "Brownie, stay close to me. I don't want the dog to scare you." Brownie nodded his head and stayed close to Lily. 
Suddenly, a man in a black robe appeared. He looked very serious. "I am the judge," he said. "I am looking for the most original toy in the park." 
Lily thought for a moment and said, "Brownie is the most original toy because he is my best friend." The judge smiled and said, "You are right. Brownie is the winner!" 
Lily was so happy that Brownie won. She hugged him tightly and said, "You are the best toy in the whole world!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, Lily went to the park to play on the swings. She saw her friend, Timmy, and they played together.
Suddenly, the sky turned gloomy and dark clouds covered the sun. Lily and Timmy felt sad because they couldn't play in the sun anymore. But then, Lily saw her mom waving at her from the car. She knew it was time to go home.
On the way home, Lily's mom asked her if she wanted some pepper on her sandwich. Lily nodded her head and said, "Yes, please!" When they got home, Lily's mom made her a sandwich with pepper and they ate it together. Lily felt happy again, even though the sun was not shining.

Once upon a time, there was a big owl. The owl lived in a tree. The owl liked to make things. One day, the owl wanted to make a new friend. The owl looked around the forest.
The owl saw a small bird. The owl said, "Hi, bird! Let's be friends." But the bird flew away. This was difficult for the owl. The owl felt sad.
The next day, the owl tried again. The owl saw a squirrel. The owl said, "Hi, squirrel! Let's be friends." The squirrel said yes. The owl and the squirrel played all day. The owl was happy to have a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to go on walks with his big dog, Max. Max was very strong and always protected Tim from any danger.
One sunny day, Tim and Max went on a walk. They saw a small, hurt bird on the ground. Tim said, "Oh no! The bird is hurt. What can we do, Max?" Max barked and wagged his tail, telling Tim that they should help the bird.
Tim and Max gently picked up the hurt bird and took it to their home. They gave it food and a warm place to rest. Soon, the bird felt better and could fly again. The bird said, "Thank you, Tim and Max, for protecting me and helping me feel better." Tim smiled and said, "You're welcome, little bird. We're happy to help."
The moral of the story is to always be kind and protect those who are hurt or in need.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big temple. People loved to go there. One day, a little boy named Tim and his mom went to the temple.
At the temple, Tim saw a man with a big door. The man said, "I close the door when it is time to go home." Tim asked, "Why do you close it?" The man replied, "So everyone is safe at home with their family."
Tim looked up at the clear sky and thought about what the man said. He told his mom, "I want to be a good boy and help people be safe." His mom smiled and said, "That is a great idea."
From that day on, Tim always made sure to close doors and gates to keep everyone safe. He learned that helping others is important and makes him happy. And everyone in the town loved Tim for his kind heart.

Once upon a time, there was a little boat. The boat was white and it had a big sail. The boat liked to sail on the blue water. One day, the boat saw itself in a mirror. The boat was happy to see its white sail and its little body. The boat sailed away, feeling proud of itself. The end.

Once upon a time there was a truck. It was a very special truck because it had a long fuel tank. The truck was full of fuel when it started a long trip. 
The truck rolled through the countryside, looking for places to go. Along the way it passed a wide, deep river. The truck stopped and the driver looked at the river. 
The driver said to himself, "I wonder if I can make it across the river with all this fuel?" He decided to try.
So the driver wrapped the truck in thick blankets. Then he drove the truck into the river. The truck was just barely able to make it across, and came out the other side completely dry. 
The driver was happy and drove the truck on again. He said, "That was a close call!"

Once upon a time, in a big sky, there was a small star. This star was all alone and felt empty. It wanted to join other stars and be happy.
One night, the little star saw a group of stars far away. It decided to join them. The small star tried to fly, but it could not. It was sad and did not know what to do.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and helped the small star fly. The wind took the star to the group. The little star was so happy! It joined the other stars and was not empty anymore. They all shined bright together in the big sky.

Lily was a humble girl who loved her family very much. She liked to help her mom and dad with chores, play with her baby brother, and read books with her grandma. She always said thank you and sorry, and shared her toys with her friends.
One day, Lily's family went to the park for a picnic. They brought sandwiches, fruits, and cookies, and a big blanket to sit on. Lily was very happy to see the trees, the flowers, and the birds. She ran around with her brother, played on the swings, and fed the ducks. She also made a new friend, a boy named Max, who had a red ball.
Lily and Max had fun playing catch with the ball, and they laughed a lot. They also talked about their families, and Lily learned that Max had no mom or dad. He lived with his aunt, who was very nice, but very busy. Max said he sometimes felt lonely and sad.
Lily felt sorry for Max, and she wanted to make him feel better. She remembered how her mom and dad always hugged her when she was sad, and how that made her feel warm and safe. She decided to do the same for Max. She gave him a big hug, and said, "You are my friend, and I like you. You are not alone, because I am here. And you can always play with me and my family."
Max smiled and hugged her back. He felt happy and grateful. He said, "Thank you, Lily. You are very kind and sweet. You are my friend, too. And I like your family. They are very nice and fun."
Lily and Max hugged again, and then they joined Lily's family for the picnic. They shared their food, their stories, and their smiles. Lily's family welcomed Max, and they all had a good time. Lily was glad that she could share her hug and her family with Max. She felt humble and proud. She knew that hugs and family were the best things in the world.

Once upon a time, there was a sad boy named Tim. He had a toy that he did not like anymore. He wanted a new toy to play with.
One day, Tim went to the park and saw a girl named Sue. She had a toy that Tim liked. Tim had an idea. He asked Sue if they could switch toys. Sue said yes, and they both were happy with their new toys.
After playing with the new toy, Tim learned to value his old toy too. He was not sad anymore. Tim and Sue became good friends and they played with their toys together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved animals and he always wanted to learn more about them. One day, he went to the zoo with his mom and dad. They saw many animals like lions, tigers, and bears. 
Suddenly, Timmy saw an ostrich. He had never seen an ostrich before. The ostrich looked very big and had long legs. Timmy asked his dad, "What is that bird?" His dad said, "That's an ostrich. They are very tall and they can run very fast." 
Timmy was very thoughtful about what his dad had said. He wanted to learn more about ostriches. He asked the zookeeper, "Can you tell me more about ostriches?" The zookeeper said, "Ostriches are the biggest birds in the world. They lay the biggest eggs too!" Timmy was amazed and happy that he learned something new.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very excited because her mommy said they were going to have a picnic in the park. Lily ran to her bedroom to get her favorite dress. She looked in her closet and saw her dress was dirty. She was impatient and wanted to wear her dress right away. 
Lily's mommy told her to be patient and wait for her to wash the dress. Lily went to the park with her mommy and had lots of fun. They played on the swings and had a yummy lunch. 
After the picnic, they went home and Lily went to her bedroom to change into her pajamas. But when she went to get her pajamas, she saw something strange. Her bedroom window was open and it was very cold. Lily went to close the window, but she couldn't because it was frozen shut. 
Lily called for her mommy and they tried to close the window together, but it wouldn't budge. Her mommy remembered that she had left the window open earlier in the day and it had gotten very cold outside. Lily's mommy told her that they would have to wait until morning when the sun would come out and warm up the window. Lily remembered what her mommy said earlier about being patient and she knew she had to wait until morning. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go outside and play in the park. One day, she was playing with her ball when she saw a butterfly. The butterfly had many colors on its wings. Lily said, "Look, Mommy! The butterfly has many colors!" Her mommy said, "Yes, Lily. It is very pretty." 
Lily wanted to observe the butterfly closely, so she walked slowly towards it. The butterfly flew away, but Lily saw another one. This butterfly had clear wings. Lily said, "Mommy, look! This butterfly has clear wings!" Her mommy said, "Wow, Lily! You are very observant." 
Lily was happy because she saw many butterflies that day. She went back home and told her dad about her adventure. He said, "Lily, you are very smart. You observed the colors and the clear wings of the butterflies. I am proud of you." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Daddy."

Once upon a time, there was a little ant named Tim. Tim was a slow ant, but he was very happy. He loved to find food for his family. One day, he went to look for food and found a big, green mint leaf.
Tim wanted to take the mint leaf back to his family, but it was too big for him. He tried to lay on the leaf and push it, but it did not move. Tim felt sad and didn't know what to do. He needed help to move the big mint leaf.
Then, Tim met a strong beetle named Ben. Tim asked Ben for help, and Ben said yes. Together, they pushed the mint leaf back to Tim's family. Tim's family was so happy to have the mint leaf. Tim learned that even slow ants can do big things with a little help from friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in her bathtub, splashing and making bubbles. One day, her mom gave her a new toy boat as a present. Lily was happy to receive it and played with it in the bathtub.
Lily was feeling creative and decided to make a boat out of her shampoo bottle. She was having so much fun that she didn't notice the water overflowing from the bathtub. Suddenly, the floor became slippery, and Lily slipped and fell. 
She hurt her head and had to go to the hospital. Lily learned that it's important to be careful and not get too carried away with our creative ideas. From that day on, she never played in the bathtub without her mom's supervision.

Once upon a time, there was a big rhinoceros who loved to jump. He would jump high up in the sky and feel very happy. One day, he met a little girl who was feeling dizzy. "Why are you dizzy?" asked the rhinoceros. "I spun around too much," replied the girl. "Oh, I see," said the rhinoceros. "Do you want to jump with me? It will make you feel better." The little girl smiled and said, "Yes, please!" So, they jumped together and the little girl felt much better. From that day on, they became good friends and jumped together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to hop around in the fields and play with his friends. One day, Benny's friend Sally told him about the library. "The library is a place where you can borrow books to read," Sally said. Benny was curious and wanted to go to the library too.
So, Benny hopped all the way to the library. He saw lots of books on the shelves and felt envious of all the kids who could read them. "I wish I could read too," Benny said to the librarian. The librarian smiled and said, "You can start by borrowing some picture books." Benny was excited and borrowed a few books to take home.
As he hopped back home, Benny saw his friend Tommy playing with a toy car. "Wow, I wish I had a car like that," Benny said. Tommy replied, "I wish I could hop like you, Benny. You're the best hopper in the field!" Benny felt happy and proud of his hopping skills. From that day on, Benny visited the library often and read lots of books. He also taught his friends how to hop like a bunny.

One day, a little girl named Amy went for a walk. She wanted to meet new friends. As she walked, she saw a tasty apple on the ground. Amy picked up the apple and took a big bite. "Yum!" she said.
Amy kept walking and saw a nail on the ground. She picked it up and thought, "I can use this nail to make something." Just then, a little boy named Tim came up to her. "Hi, I'm Tim. Can we be friends?" he asked. Amy smiled and said, "Yes, let's be friends!"
Together, they found a big box. Amy had an idea. She used the nail to make a door on the box. They both went inside the box and pretended it was a house. Just then, the box started to move! It was a magic box! They laughed and had fun as the box took them on an adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to drink hot cocoa from her favorite mug. One day, her little brother Jack accidentally broke her mug. Lily was sad and cried a lot.
Her mom saw her crying and asked her what happened. Lily told her about the broken mug. Her mom said, "Don't worry, Lily. We'll buy you a new mug tomorrow."
The next day, they went to a fair and Lily saw a beautiful mug that she really liked. She asked her mom if she could buy it. Her mom said, "Yes, I permit you to buy the mug."
Lily was very happy and thanked her mom. She went home and drank hot cocoa from her new mug. She was no longer sad about the broken mug because she had a new one that she loved.
