They walked to the house and saw a man. The man had a bottle. The bottle had wine in it. The cat said, "What is that?" The man said, "This is wine. It is for grown-ups."
The cat and the dog looked at the wine. They said, "We are not grown-ups. We cannot have wine." The man said, "That's right. You can have water instead." So, the cat and the dog had water and they were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little red car named Zoomy. Zoomy loved to zoom around the town with his loyal friend, a cute puppy named Spot. They had so much fun playing together and going on adventures.
One hot day, Zoomy and Spot wanted to cool off. They decided to find a pool to play in. They zoomed through the town, looking for the perfect pool. As they drove, they saw a big blue pool with lots of kids splashing and having fun.
Zoomy and Spot jumped into the pool and started to play. They splashed, swam, and laughed all day long. The kids in the pool loved playing with Zoomy and Spot too. At the end of the day, Zoomy and Spot zoomed back home, tired but happy. They couldn't wait for their next adventure together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a deep love for the color purple. One day, Sue went to the park with her mom. At the park, she saw a big purple ball. Sue went to the ball and said, "Wow! I love this purple ball!"
Sue's mom saw her playing with the ball and said, "Sue, do you want to receive this ball as a gift?" Sue was very happy and said, "Yes, mom! I want this purple ball!"
Sue received the purple ball from her mom, and they played together at the park all day. Sue loved her new purple ball, and it made her very happy. From that day on, Sue and her purple ball were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to cook yummy food with her mommy in the kitchen. They would make pancakes, spaghetti, and cupcakes together.
Lily also loved to learn new words in her language. She was very intelligent and could remember all the new words she learned. She would practice saying them every day.
One day, Lily's mommy accidentally left the stove on while they were cooking. The fire started and they both got hurt. They had to go to the hospital and Lily's mommy never woke up. Lily was very sad and missed her mommy very much. She didn't want to cook or learn new words anymore.
From that day on, Lily never spoke her language again. She stopped being so intelligent and just played with her toys all day long. She missed her mommy and wished she could cook with her again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with water. She would fill up her bucket with water and splash around in it all day long. One day, Lily's friend came over to play. Her friend was not very creative and didn't know what to do with the water. 
Lily had an idea. She told her friend to get a big bowl and separate the water into different cups. Her friend didn't understand at first, but Lily showed her how to do it. They separated the water into red, blue, and yellow cups. 
Lily's friend was amazed. She had never thought of doing something so creative with water before. Lily taught her that sometimes it's good to think outside the box and try new things. They both learned that being creative can be a lot of fun. And that's the moral of the story: be creative, try new things, and have fun!

Once upon a time, there was an elderly woman who lived in a small house. She loved to knit mittens for everyone in her village. One day, a little girl came to her and said, "I want a mitten too, please." The elderly woman smiled and said, "Of course, my dear. I will knit you one."
The little girl was very happy and said, "Thank you so much." The elderly woman started knitting the mitten and the little girl watched her. Suddenly, the little girl saw a pair of scissors and said, "Can I cut the yarn, please?" The elderly woman said, "No, my dear. You might cut the wrong thread and ruin the mitten."
The little girl was sad but understood. When the mitten was finished, the elderly woman gave it to the little girl. The little girl was very happy and said, "Thank you so much. I promise I won't cut anything without permission." The elderly woman smiled and said, "That's a good promise to keep. Always ask before you cut anything, my dear."
From that day on, the little girl always asked before cutting anything. She learned that it's important to be careful and ask for permission before doing something that might cause harm.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to cook with her mommy in the kitchen. They always kept their food in the refrigerator.
One day, Lily's mommy was feeling nervous because they were having a special guest for dinner. They wanted everything to be perfect. So, they decided to cook a big chicken for their guest.
But when they opened the refrigerator, they saw that the chicken was missing! They looked everywhere, but they couldn't find it. Just when they thought they would have to cancel dinner, they heard a noise coming from the backyard.
They went outside and saw that their dog had stolen the chicken and was eating it! They quickly took the chicken away from the dog and cooked it again. The dinner was saved and everyone had a great time. From that day on, they always made sure to keep the refrigerator closed tightly so the dog couldn't get in. The end.

One day, a girl named Lucy went for a walk. She saw a weird landscape with many colors. She saw big trees, small flowers, and a blue river. Lucy wanted to talk to someone about this place.
Lucy saw a big bird and said, "Hello, bird! Do you want to talk?" The bird looked at her and said, "Yes, let's talk!" Lucy was so happy. They talked about the trees, the flowers, and the river. They had a lot of fun.
Then, something unexpected happened. The bird said, "I have a secret. I am not really a bird." The bird changed into a little girl, just like Lucy! They both laughed and played together in the weird, colorful landscape.

Once upon a time, there was a little birdie who loved to fly. One day, he saw a big and juicy worm on the ground. He was very hungry and wanted to eat it, but he knew he had to be careful. He looked around to make sure no one was watching him.
Suddenly, a big and scary cat appeared. The little birdie was scared and flew away as fast as he could. The cat tried to catch him, but the little birdie was too quick. He thought he was safe, but he didn't know that the cat was ready to pounce.
The little birdie flew into a tree and thought he was safe, but the cat climbed up after him. The little birdie tried to fly away, but the cat caught him in his claws. The little birdie tried to escape, but it was too late. The cat revealed his sharp teeth and ate him up. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy trumpet. He liked to play with his trumpet all day. His mom would say, "Tim, mind your trumpet, please!" He would laugh and play more.
One day, Tim went to the park with his trumpet. He saw his friend, Sue. Sue had a big red ball. Tim wanted to play with Sue's ball. He felt envious. But Sue wanted to play with Tim's trumpet too.
So, Tim and Sue decided to share their toys. Tim let Sue play with his trumpet, and Sue let Tim play with her big red ball. They played together all day and had lots of fun. They learned that sharing made them both happy.

Lily and Sam were friends. They liked to play with toys and books. One day, Lily got a new phone from her mom. It was blue and shiny. Lily was very happy.
"Look, Sam, I have a new phone!" Lily said. "It can make sounds and show pictures. Do you want to play with it?"
Sam nodded. He wanted to see the phone. But Lily did not share. She held the phone close to her chest. She said, "No, this is my phone. You can't touch it. Go play with something else."
Sam felt sad and angry. He did not like Lily's words. He said, "That is not nice, Lily. Friends share their things. You are being selfish. I don't want to play with you anymore." He walked away.
Lily did not care. She played with her phone by herself. She made sounds and saw pictures. But soon, she felt bored and lonely. She looked around. She saw Sam playing with other kids. They were laughing and having fun. They had cars and dolls and blocks. Lily wanted to join them. She wanted to have fun too.
She took her phone and ran to Sam. She said, "Sam, I'm sorry. I was wrong. I want to share my phone with you. Can I join your game?"
Sam looked at Lily. He saw her blue phone. He saw her sorry face. He smiled. He said, "Yes, Lily, you can join us. Thank you for sharing your phone. That is very kind of you. Friends share their things. Friends have fun together."
Lily smiled too. She gave her phone to Sam. He thanked her. They played with the phone and the other toys. They laughed and had fun. They were happy.
The moral of the story is: Sharing is caring. Friends share their things. Friends have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a delicate frog. The frog loved to jump around and play in the pond. One day, the frog saw a big rock on the other side of the pond. The frog wanted to jump to the rock, but it was too far away.
The frog thought and thought about how to get to the rock. Then, the frog had an idea! The frog saw a lily pad and decided to jump on it. The frog knew that lily pads were not strong, but the frog thought it would be okay.
The frog jumped on the lily pad and it started to sink. The frog was scared, but then the frog remembered something. The frog had completed a swimming lesson before and knew how to swim. The frog swam to the rock and was safe. The frog learned that it's important to remember what you've learned.

One day, Ben was playing outside in the sun. Suddenly, he noticed something strange. There was a big shadow on the ground. It was moving with him, wherever he went. Ben was very curious and had to find out more.
So, he walked over to the shadow. He slowly bent down and looked closer. He saw that there were shapes forming in it. Ben was amazed. He couldn't believe his eyes. He stood still, watching the shadow for a long time.
Then, suddenly, he remembered something. He remembered that he could turn around in circles. So, he began to spin around, faster and faster. As he spun, the shapes in the shadow changed too. When he stopped, a big beautiful butterfly had taken shape in the shadow. Ben was delighted and immediately wanted to do it again.
He spent the rest of the day spinning around in circles and watching the amazing shapes and creatures that formed in his shadow. He had so much fun!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to wear pretty clothes. One day, her mommy bought her a new dress from the store. But when Lily put it on, she didn't like it. She thought it looked fake. She started to complain to her mommy, "I don't like this dress. It's not pretty." Her mommy said, "It's okay, we can take it back to the store and find a different dress that you like." And so, they went back to the store and found a beautiful dress that Lily loved. She was so happy and twirled around in her new dress. From that day on, Lily learned that it's okay to complain if something doesn't feel right, and that there's always a solution to every problem.

Once upon a time, there was a powerful flashlight named Fred. Fred lived in a small house with a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with Fred all day long.
One night, Tim and Fred went outside to play. Tim said, "Let's balance on the big log!" So, they climbed up on the log and tried to balance. They wobbled and wiggled, but they did not fall off. They laughed and had so much fun.
After playing, Tim and Fred went back inside. Tim said, "Thank you for playing with me, Fred. You are the best flashlight ever!" Fred felt happy and proud. They went to bed and had sweet dreams, knowing they would play again tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was a boy. He liked to wander around. One day, he was wandering in his garden. He saw a chair and he got excited. He ran to the chair and sat on it. He felt the chair was very useful for him. It was a nice place for him to rest.
When the boy stood up, he started to wander in his garden again. He played with the flowers, insects and trees. He filled his basket with some flowers. He felt very happy.
The boy made the chair very useful. He put his basket filled with flowers on the chair. When he wanted to rest, he sat on the chair. When he wanted to wander, he moved the chair to another spot in the garden.
The chair was a very useful thing for the boy. He loved the chair and kept it near him all the time. He never ran out of ideas to use it. It was a great companion for the boy. The boy and his chair were the best friends forever.

One day, a girl named Lily found a scarf. It was a modern scarf with pretty colors. She loved the scarf and wanted to wear it all the time. Lily's mom said not to wear it when she ate or played, so she would not spoil it.
Lily wore the scarf to the park. She played with her friends, but she forgot to take off the scarf. While they played, the scarf got dirty. Lily was sad that she spoiled the scarf.
But then, something unexpected happened. Lily's mom saw the dirty scarf and smiled. She said it was okay because the scarf was special. The modern scarf could change colors when it was dirty. Now, the scarf had new pretty colors. Lily was happy and learned to be careful with her things.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was going out to play, but it was cold outside. His mom said, "Tim, wear your coat, hat, and gloves!" So Tim put on his coat, hat, and gloves, and went outside to play.
While playing, Tim saw a big, fearful dog. The dog looked sad and cold. Tim said, "Hello, dog! Are you cold too? Let's be friends!" The dog wagged its tail and followed Tim home.
When they got home, Tim's mom saw the dog and was surprised. "Oh, Tim! What a big dog!" she said. Then, the dog did something unexpected. It started to talk! "Thank you for being my friend, Tim," said the dog. "I am a magic dog, and because you were so kind, I will grant you one wish!" Tim wished for a warm coat for his new dog friend, so they could both play outside without being cold.

Once upon a time in a small village, there was a poor boy named Tom. Tom liked to act in plays with his friends. One day, Tom and his friends decided to put on a play for the whole village.
Tom's mom said, "Tom, you have to act well if you want the village to like the play." Tom practiced very hard and was ready to act in the play. The village was excited to see the play, and everyone came to watch.
In the play, Tom acted as a hero who saved the village from a big, bad monster. At the end of the play, Tom's friends acted as if they were scared of the monster, but Tom bravely fought and won. The village was so happy and clapped for Tom and his friends. Tom's mom was proud of him, and Tom knew that all his hard work had paid off.

Once upon a time, in a big park, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside. One day, it rained, and there were many puddles in the park. Tim put on his boots and went outside to have fun.
Tim saw a big puddle and wanted to jump in it. But his mom said, "Be careful, Tim! It can be dangerous to jump in big puddles. You might slip and fall."
Tim listened to his mom and decided to try something else. He found a long stick and tried to balance on it like a tightrope walker. He put one foot in front of the other and walked very slowly. He did not want to fall into the puddle.
As Tim was balancing, a little girl named Lily came to play. She saw Tim and said, "Wow, you are good at balancing! Can I try too?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, but be careful. We don't want to fall in the puddle."
Lily tried to balance on the stick too. They both had a lot of fun playing in the park, and they were careful not to jump in the dangerous puddles. Tim and Lily became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time there was a mint. It was very mild and round. Every day it would shrink a little bit. One day, it started to shrink very fast. 
The mint was scared. It ran away and tried to hide. It heard a voice say, "I see you, mint". It was a little girl. She had a big smile on her face. 
The little girl picked up the mint. She put it in her pocket and said, "I'm going to turn you into something special". 
The next day, the little girl took out the mint and showed it to her friends. She put the mint in warm water, and then stuck it in the freezer. 
After a few minutes, the mint came back to life. It had shrunk even more and looked like a tiny ice cube! Everyone was so happy. 
The little girl put the mint in a cup of hot tea. It made the tea mild and tasted delicious. From then on, the little girl always kept a jar of tiny mint ice cubes in her freezer. 
The end.

Once upon a time there was a saw. It sawed things to make them smaller. But one day it sawed too much and it made a tiny squeak. Suddenly, it was deaf! It couldn't hear anything. 
The saw felt sad but then it saw a supply truck. It had everything the saw needed to make the noise again. The truck supplied the saw with new parts and the saw heard again!
The saw was so happy to hear again. It could saw things even better than before. It could hear the tiny squeaks it made when it was sawing. So the saw kept sawing until the night and sang happily.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to run and play outside, but she never listened to her mom when she said to wear knee pads. One day, she tripped and hurt her knee. It hurt so much that she couldn't play for a long time.
Lily's mom told her to be careful and wear knee pads next time she played. But Lily didn't listen and played without them again. This time, she fell and hurt her knee even worse. She had to go to the hospital to get better.
After that, Lily learned her lesson and always wore her knee pads when she played. She repeated the rule to herself every time she went outside. Her knee got better and she could play again, but she never forgot the bright lesson she learned about listening to her mom and being safe.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Spot. Spot was a good dog who loved to play fetch with his owner, Timmy. One day, Spot found a bone in the backyard. It was a great bone! Spot picked it up and ran to Timmy.
"Look, Timmy! I found a bone!" Spot barked.
Timmy smiled and said, "That's great, Spot! But you can't chew on that bone. It's too old and might hurt your teeth."
Spot sighed and put the bone down. He was sad he couldn't play with it, but he knew Timmy was right. Instead, they played fetch with Spot's favorite toy, a ball. Spot was happy again, knowing he had a great owner who cared about him.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved getting packages in the mail. One day, a package arrived for her, and she was so excited! She opened it up and found a beautiful dress inside. 
Lily's friend, Timmy, came over to play. When he saw the dress, he said, "That dress is too big for you, Lily. It won't fit." Lily felt sad, but she didn't want to believe him. She tried the dress on, and it was too big, just like Timmy said. 
Lily was disappointed, but then she had an idea. "Maybe we can make it fit," she said to Timmy. They worked together to pin the dress and make it smaller. When they were finished, the dress fit perfectly! Lily was so happy and proud of herself. She couldn't believe they made it work.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw and design her own pictures. One day, she went to the park with her mom and saw a butterfly with delicate wings. 
"Mommy, look at the pretty butterfly! Can we film it?" asked Lily.
"Yes, we can film it with our camera," replied her mom.
Lily carefully followed the butterfly and filmed it with her mom's help. After they finished, Lily said, "I want to design a picture of the butterfly with its delicate wings."
"That's a great idea, Lily! Let's go home and draw it together," said her mom.
And so, Lily and her mom went home and spent the afternoon designing and drawing the butterfly with its delicate wings. It was a fun and creative day for Lily and her mom.

Lily was a young girl who liked to play with her toys. She had a doll, a bear, a ball and a car. She liked to make them talk and do things together. She was happy when she played.
One day, her mom said, "Lily, we have a guest today. He is your cousin Ben. He is also young and he likes to play. Can you welcome him and share your toys with him?"
Lily nodded and smiled. She liked to meet new friends. She ran to the door and saw Ben. He had curly hair and big eyes. He was holding a book.
"Hi, Ben. I am Lily. Welcome to my home. Do you want to play with me?" Lily asked.
"Hi, Lily. Thank you. Yes, I want to play with you. What do you have?" Ben said.
Lily showed him her toys. She gave him the bear and the car. She kept the doll and the ball. They sat on the floor and played.
"Look, my bear can drive the car. Vroom, vroom!" Ben said.
"Wow, that's cool. My doll can kick the ball. Boing, boing!" Lily said.
They laughed and had fun. They made up stories and games with their toys. They were happy when they played.
After a while, Lily's mom came and said, "Lily, Ben, it's time for a snack. Do you want some juice and cookies?"
"Yes, please. We are hungry." Lily and Ben said.
They followed Lily's mom to the kitchen. They washed their hands and sat on the chairs. They ate the cookies and drank the juice. They said, "Thank you."
Lily's mom said, "You are welcome. You are very good kids. You played nicely and shared your toys. You passed the test."
Lily and Ben looked at each other and smiled. They did not know what a test was, but they were glad they passed it. They were happy when they ate.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and run around outside. One day, he was playing with his toy car and accidentally knocked over a candle. The candle started to burn the carpet and Timmy got scared. He quickly told his mommy and daddy, who put out the fire with water.
After that, Timmy learned to be more polite and careful around candles. He also learned about trade when his daddy went to work at the store. Daddy would trade things with other people to make money for their family. Timmy thought that was very cool.
From then on, Timmy played safely and learned new things every day. He never forgot about the time the carpet almost burned, but he was glad he had his mommy and daddy to help him.

Once upon a time, there was a big race in a distant land. All the animals were very excited. They wanted to see who was the fastest. The prize was a big meal.
The big race started. The animals ran and ran. The rabbit was very fast, but the turtle was slow. Everyone thought the rabbit would win. But then, something unexpected happened. The rabbit saw a big meal and stopped to eat.
While the rabbit ate, the turtle kept going. He did not stop. He passed the rabbit. The rabbit saw the turtle and ran fast, but it was too late. The turtle won the big race. The animals cheered for the turtle, and he shared the big meal with everyone.

Once upon a time, there was a gloomy man. He was sad because he had no friends. One day, he went for a walk to find a friend. He saw a big tree and thought, "Maybe I can start being friends with the tree."
The man sat under the tree and started to talk to it. He told the tree all his secrets and the tree listened. The man felt happy. He came back to the tree every day to talk. The tree would sway its branches, and the man felt like the tree was talking back to him.
One sunny day, the man came to the tree and saw a little bird. The bird was singing a beautiful song. The man smiled and started to sing with the bird. They became friends, and the man was not gloomy anymore. The tree had helped the man find a friend, just like he had hoped.

Once upon a time, there was a small town. In that town, there were two best friends named Timmy and Tommy. They loved to play together and have fun. One day, Timmy invited Tommy to a sleepover at his house.
While they were playing, Timmy's mom came in and said, "Boys, be careful. There might be an earthquake tonight." The boys didn't know what an earthquake was, but they didn't worry about it.
Later that night, while they were sleeping, the ground started shaking. The boys woke up and were scared. But Timmy's mom had prepared them for this. She had put a small flashlight and some snacks under their pillows. They felt safe and were able to sleep through the rest of the earthquake.
The next morning, Tommy said, "I'm glad we had a sleepover. We had so much fun and we were safe during the earthquake." Timmy replied, "Me too! I'm happy I invited you over."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and his dog, Max. One day, Timmy fell down and hurt his arm. His mommy took him to the hospital to get an x-ray.
At the hospital, Timmy was surprised to see so many people and big machines. The doctor took an x-ray of Timmy's arm and showed him the incredible picture of his bones. "Look, Timmy, your bones are strong like a superhero!" said the doctor.
Timmy smiled and felt better knowing his bones were strong. When they got home, Timmy showed Max the picture of his x-ray and told him all about his incredible bones. Max barked in agreement, "Woof, woof, Timmy, you're a superhero!"

Once upon a time there was a boy who was very tired. He lay on the floor all day, staring at the ceiling, too tired to move. He watched as his mom ironed some clothes in the corner. His mom looked over at him and chuckled.
"What am I going to do about you?" she said. 
The boy just sighed and lay still.
Later that evening, his dad called him over to the kitchen and gave him a box. Inside the box was an iron. 
The boy was so excited that he jumped up and gave his dad a big hug.
"Go on now," said his dad. "The iron is just what you need to help your mom with her chores."
The boy didn't understand, but he was happy to help. He took the iron into the next room and watched as his mom smiled in surprise. With the iron, they finished their chores much sooner, and his mom thanked the boy for his help.
The boy was so proud that he lay down on the couch and went to sleep. He had been so tired all day, but now, he was no longer tired. He knew that his dad had given him the iron for a reason.

Once upon a time, in a big temple, there lived a cat. The cat liked to sleep all day. The temple was her home, and she was very happy.
One day, a little boy came to the temple. He saw the cat and said, "Hello, cat! Why do you sleep all day?" The cat looked at the boy, feeling confused. She did not know what to say.
The boy smiled and said, "It's okay, cat. We can be friends." The cat liked the boy and they played together. After playing, the cat went back to sleep. The boy and the cat were the best of friends, and they lived happily in the big temple.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jake. Jake was three years old. Jake wanted to go to the park and play, but his mom said it was too dangerous.
“But Mommy, I want to go to the park!” Jake said, a bit worried.
“No, Jake,” his mom said. “The park is dangerous. We will have to do something else today.”
At first Jake was sad, but then he had a brilliant idea. He suggested playing in the backyard instead. His mom agreed, so Jake ran outside and started to play.
At first, everything was fun. Jake got to play with his toys, jump in muddy puddles, and even take a few swings around the trees. As the sun went down, though, Jake started to worry.
The backyard suddenly seemed very dark and dangerous. Jake called for his mom, but she did not come. He called again and again, but there was still no answer.
 
Suddenly, his mom opened the door and walked into the backyard. Jake ran to her and she said, “It’s ok, sweetie. I was just inside and heard you calling. I knew you would need me to keep you safe.”
She hugged him tight and said “I will always repeat - the park can be dangerous, but our backyard is a safe place

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy and his friends were playing hide and seek. Timmy was "it" and was counting to ten while his friends hid. 
As Timmy was counting, he noticed the sun was up high in the sky. He knew that meant it was noon, time for lunch. Timmy's tummy started to rumble, and he realized he forgot to have breakfast that morning. 
Timmy went to his mom and said, "Mommy, I forgot to have breakfast. Can I have something to eat?" His mom said, "Sure, Timmy. I have some fruit that will fit perfectly in your tummy." Timmy was excited and grabbed an apple. 
As he was eating his apple, he heard his friends giggling. Timmy turned around and saw that they were all hiding behind a tree. Timmy ran towards them, but he didn't see the big rock on the ground. He tripped and fell, but when he got up, he noticed something unexpected. His friends were hiding behind a giant birthday cake! They yelled, "Surprise, Timmy! We have a birthday cake for you!" Timmy was so happy and blew out the candles. It was the best noon ever!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside with his friends and ride his bike. One day, Timmy's mom came outside and told him some unusual news. She said they were going to the zoo!
Timmy was so excited that he started to hurry and put on his shoes. He couldn't wait to see all the animals and have fun with his family. When they got to the zoo, Timmy saw lots of animals he had never seen before. He saw a big elephant, a tall giraffe, and even a funny monkey.
Timmy had so much fun at the zoo that he didn't want to leave. But his mom said they had to hurry home for dinner. Timmy was sad to leave, but he knew he would always remember his special day at the zoo.

Once upon a time, there was a young cat named Tim. Tim was very confused one day. He didn't know where his mom was. Tim was sad and wanted to find her.
Tim decided to stand up and look for his mom. He walked around the big tree and saw a big dog. The dog was nice and wanted to help Tim. They looked for Tim's mom together.
After a while, they found Tim's mom near a small house. Tim was happy to see her. The confused young cat was not sad anymore. Tim, his mom, and the big dog became good friends. They played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going on the bus with his mom. They would ride the bus to the park and have a picnic. One day, Timmy saw an interesting bug on the bus. He wanted to catch it, but his mom told him not to.
Timmy didn't listen to his mom and tried to catch the bug. He accidentally knocked over his juice and it spilled all over the bus seat. His mom got mad and told him to cover the juice with a napkin. Timmy did as he was told, but he was sad that he couldn't catch the bug.
When they got off the bus, Timmy's mom noticed that he had left his favorite toy on the seat. They went back to the bus, but it was gone. Timmy was very sad that he lost his toy. His mom told him that he should have listened and not tried to catch the bug. They went home without Timmy's toy, and he cried himself to sleep that night.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in her backyard. One day, she found a toy that was very special to her. It was her original teddy bear that her mommy gave her when she was just a baby. 
But then, she lost it while playing. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. She was very sad. Her mommy saw her crying and asked what was wrong. Lily told her about her lost toy. 
Her mommy said, "Don't worry, I will provide a surprise for you." Later that day, her mommy found the original teddy bear in the backyard. Lily was so happy to have her special toy back. She hugged it tightly and thanked her mommy. From that day on, she made sure to always keep her original teddy bear close to her.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird was very sad because it was all alone. It flew around looking for friends but couldn't find any. 
One day, the bird saw a big field of wheat. It decided to sit on a stalk of wheat and rest for a while. As it sat there, it saw other birds flying around and having fun together. 
The lonely bird felt even sadder and wished it had friends to play with. Suddenly, it heard a chirping sound and looked around. It saw another little bird sitting on a nearby stalk of wheat. The lonely bird flew over to the other bird and they became friends. They sat on the wheat stalks together and sang songs all day long. From then on, the little bird was never lonely again.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. He saw a lot of candy on the shelf. Tim asked his mom, "Can I have some candy, please?" His mom said, "Yes, you can pick one."
Tim looked at all the candy and saw one that looked very fun. It was big and colorful. Tim picked it and went home with his mom. He was so excited to try the candy.
When they got home, Tim opened the candy and took a bite. But it didn't taste good. Tim said, "Yuck! This candy is fake!" His mom looked at the candy and laughed. She said, "Oh no, that's not candy. That's a toy!" Tim was sad, but he learned to look more closely at things before trying them.

Once upon a time, there was a shy little girl named Lucy. Lucy did not like to talk to people. She liked to play with her toys and read books.
One day, Lucy's mom asked her, "Lucy, do you need to use the toilet?" Lucy felt shy and did not want to say yes. She shook her head and refused to go. Her mom said, "Okay, but let me know if you change your mind."
Later, Lucy really needed to use the toilet. She was scared to tell her mom, but she knew she had to. She went to her mom and whispered, "Mom, I need to use the toilet now." Her mom smiled and said, "I'm proud of you for telling me, Lucy. Let's go to the toilet together."
From that day on, Lucy was not so shy about using the toilet. She learned that it was okay to ask for help when she needed it. And her mom was always there to help her.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved sugar. He liked to eat sugar on his toast, in his cereal, and sometimes he even put sugar on his ice cream. He had a big bag of sugar in the kitchen.
One day, Tim heard a loud noise outside. He ran to the window and saw a big truck. The truck was very loud and made him jump. Tim wanted to see the truck better, so he stood on a chair.
While Tim was standing on the chair, he saw the big bag of sugar on the table. He had an idea. He took some sugar and threw it out the window at the loud truck. The truck driver saw the sugar and laughed. He honked the horn and waved at Tim. Tim laughed too and waved back. From that day on, every time the loud truck passed by, Tim would stand on the chair and wave, and the truck driver would honk and wave back.

Lily and Max liked to play with their toys in the living room. They had many toys, but their favorite was the giant dinosaur. It was green and scaly and had big teeth and a long tail. They pretended it was their pet and they fed it and took it for walks.
One day, they decided to make a display for their dinosaur. They used cardboard and crayons and stickers to make a jungle scene. They cut out trees and flowers and animals and glued them on the cardboard. They were very proud of their work and wanted to show it to their mom.
"Mom, mom, come and see our display!" they shouted as they ran to the kitchen. "We made a jungle for our dinosaur!"
Mom smiled and followed them to the living room. She saw the colorful display and the giant dinosaur on the floor. She praised them for their creativity and imagination.
"That's a wonderful display, Lily and Max. You worked very hard on it. Your dinosaur must be very happy in his jungle."
"Thank you, mom. We love our dinosaur. He is our best friend," Lily said.
"Can we keep the display here, mom? We want to play with it some more," Max asked.
"Sure, you can keep it here for now. But remember to clean up your toys when you are done playing, okay?" Mom said.
"Okay, mom. We will," Lily and Max said.
Mom went back to the kitchen to finish making lunch. She did not notice that the window was open and that it was starting to rain outside. She did not hear the thunder and the wind. She did not see the water dripping from the ceiling and the walls. She did not know that soon, the living room would be very wet and that the display and the dinosaur would be ruined.

Once there was a mom and her little girl, who was only three. They went to a big building to shop. In the building, they rode the elevator to get to the higher levels. 
At first the little girl was very excited, but on the way out the elevator suddenly stopped. Mom and the little girl began to panic, for the elevator would not move. 
The girl shouted: "Mommy, let's go! I want to go home!" But there was no response. 
Mom tried to call for help, but there was no signal. Suddenly, a voice came from the elevator speaker: "Welcome! The elevator is now stuck."
The little girl got scared and began to cry. 
Mom was angry and shouted: "This is so stupid!"
The moral of the story is to be careful when using an elevator and never trust that it will always work. Mom and her daughter shouldn't have panicked, and they should have realized that the elevator might have some troubles.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally was a curious girl who loved to explore. One day, she went for a walk in the forest and saw a turkey. She was so excited and wanted to peek at it, but the turkey ran away.
Sally was sad that she couldn't see the turkey up close, but she didn't give up. She walked deeper into the forest and saw a man with a big net. The man said, "I'm going to catch that turkey for dinner tonight."
Sally knew she had to do something to save the turkey. She ran back to her house and told her mom what she saw. Her mom called the forest ranger, who came and caught the man with the net before he could catch the turkey.
Sally was happy that she saved the turkey and learned that sometimes being curious can help you save the day.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Benny. Benny had a goal to find the biggest carrot in the garden. He searched and searched but couldn't find the carrot he was looking for.
One day, Benny met a new friend, a little bird named Lily. Benny introduced himself to Lily and they became fast friends. Benny told Lily about his goal to find the biggest carrot in the garden.
Lily knew where the biggest carrot was and offered to take Benny there. Benny was so happy and followed Lily to the carrot patch. But when they got there, they found out that the biggest carrot had already been eaten by a sneaky rabbit.
Benny was frustrated that he couldn't achieve his goal but Lily had a surprise for him. She showed Benny a secret patch of carrots that were even bigger and juicier than the one he was looking for. Benny was so happy and grateful to have a friend like Lily who introduced him to something even better than he could have imagined.

Once upon a time, there was a helpful dog named Spot. Spot liked to go on walks. One day, Spot went for a walk to the west.
On his walk, Spot saw a big tree. He saw a little bird in the tree. The bird was sad. Spot asked, "Why are you sad?" The bird said, "I lost my mom." Spot wanted to help the bird find her mom.
Spot and the bird walked and walked. They looked for the mom bird. Then, something unexpected happened. The little bird started to fly. The bird flew high up in the sky. Spot looked up and saw the bird's mom in the tree! The little bird was happy to find her mom. Spot was happy too. He was a helpful friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a rag doll that she loved very much. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. She saw a big swing and asked her mom if she could swing. Her mom said yes, so Lily ran to the swing.
As she was swinging, she accidentally dropped her rag doll. It fell on the ground and got dirty. Lily started to cry because she loved her rag doll so much. A kind boy saw her crying and asked her what was wrong. Lily told him that her rag doll was dirty and she couldn't clean it.
The boy said, "Don't worry, I can help you clean it." He took the rag doll and wiped it with a clean rag. Lily was so happy that she gave the boy a big hug. She said, "Thank you so much, you are so kind." The boy smiled and said, "You're welcome. I don't like to see anyone sad, it makes me bitter." From that day on, Lily and the boy became good friends and they would always swing together in the park.

One day, a boy named Ben went to the zoo with his mom. He liked to see all the animals, but his favorite was the octopus. He wanted to touch it and play with it, but his mom said no.
"Octopus lives in the water, Ben. You can't touch it, or it will be sad and hurt. You can look at it and say hello, but that's all," his mom said.
Ben nodded, but he was not happy. He wanted to be friends with the octopus. He thought it was not fair that he could not touch it. He wondered what it felt like, and what it could do with its eight arms.
He waited until his mom was looking at another animal, and then he ran to the octopus tank. He climbed on a stool and reached his hand into the water. He felt something soft and slimy. He smiled and said, "Hi, octopus. I'm Ben. Do you want to play with me?"
The octopus did not say anything, but it wrapped its arms around Ben's hand and pulled him into the water. Ben screamed and tried to get away, but the octopus was too strong. He felt scared and sorry. He wished he had listened to his mom.
His mom heard his scream and ran to the tank. She saw Ben's head under the water and the octopus holding him. She shouted for help and grabbed a net. She tried to free Ben from the octopus, but it was not easy. The octopus did not want to let go of Ben. It thought he was a toy or a snack.
Finally, a zookeeper came and helped Ben's mom. He used a stick to poke the octopus and make it let go of Ben. He lifted Ben out of the water and gave him to his mom. Ben was wet and cold and crying. His mom hugged him and said, "Oh, Ben, are you okay? You scared me so much. Why did you do that? You know you can't touch the octopus. It's not an ordinary animal. It's dangerous and wild. You could have been hurt or drowned."
Ben nodded and said, "I'm sorry, mom. I was curious. I wanted to play with the octopus. But it was not fun. It was scary. I don't want to play with it anymore. I want to go home."
His mom nodded and said, "Okay, Ben. We'll go home. But you have to promise me that you'll never do that again. You have to respect the animals and follow the rules. They are not toys. They are living creatures. Do you understand?"
Ben nodded and said, "I understand, mom. I promise. I love you."
His mom said, "I love you too, Ben. Come on, let's go." She took his hand and walked away from the tank. The octopus watched them go and waved its arms. It was not angry or sad. It was just an octopus.

One sunny day, a little girl named Mia played in her backyard. She loved to dream about going on big adventures. Her original plan was to find a treasure. She told her mom, "I will find the biggest treasure ever!"
Mia's mom smiled and said, "You can find it, but don't forget to look in special places." Mia thought about her mom's words and got an idea.
The next day, Mia searched high and low in her backyard. She found a small box hidden under a big rock. Excited, Mia opened the box and found beautiful, shiny stones. She ran to her mom and said, "I found the treasure! You were right, mom!" Mia's mom hugged her and said, "I knew you could do it!" From that day on, Mia knew that she could dream big and find amazing things.

Once upon a time, there was a little brown bear named Benny. Benny loved to play in the forest with his friends. One day, Benny and his friends found a shiny laser in the woods. They didn't know what it was, but they thought it was cool.
Benny's friend, Timmy, accidentally pointed the laser at a tree and it made a big hole. Benny said, "Oh no! We need to reverse what we did!" Timmy didn't understand what that meant, so Benny explained that they needed to fix the hole by making it go back to the way it was before.
They all worked together to fix the hole and make the tree look normal again. Benny was proud of his friends for helping him. He said, "Thank you for helping me reverse what happened to the tree. We need to be careful with the laser next time." From that day on, they played in the forest without touching anything they didn't know.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named Tom. Tom did not like to play with the other cats. He liked to be by himself. One day, Tom was very thirsty. He went to find something to drink.
Tom saw a big wrap near the water. He did not know what was in the wrap. He was scared, but he was also very thirsty. So, he went closer to the wrap to drink the water.
When Tom drank the water, the wrap opened. Inside the wrap was a toy. The toy made Tom very happy. He played with the toy all day. Now, Tom was not grumpy anymore. He played with the other cats and shared his toy.

Once upon a time, there was an old lady who loved to drink coffee every morning. She had a special mug that she always used for her coffee. One day, she accidentally dropped her mug and it broke into many pieces. She was very sad and didn't know what to do.
But then, a kind neighbor came over and let her borrow a new mug to use for her coffee. The old lady was so happy and grateful. She thanked the neighbor and promised to take good care of the new mug.
The next day, the old lady woke up early and went to make her coffee. She carefully poured the hot coffee into the new mug and took a sip. It tasted delicious! She realized that the new mug was even better than her old one. From then on, she used the new mug every day and was always thankful for her kind neighbor who let her borrow it.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Billy who loved to wear his red vest. He would wear it every day, even when it was hot outside. One day, Billy's mom asked him to take off his vest so she could wash it, but Billy didn't want to. He said it was too difficult to take off.
Later that day, Billy and his mom went to the park. Billy was having so much fun playing on the swings and the slide that he forgot all about his vest. But when it was time to go home, Billy realized he had lost his vest. He looked everywhere, but he couldn't find it.
The next day, Billy and his mom went back to the park to look for the vest, but it was nowhere to be found. Billy was so sad. He loved that vest so much. From then on, Billy learned to take better care of his things and to always look after them, so he wouldn't lose them again.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named Tom. Tom did not like to play with the other cats. He liked to be alone. One day, a little bird named Tim came to Tom. Tim wanted to be friends with Tom.
Tim said, "Tom, let's play together!" But Tom did not want to play. Tom said, "No, I am grumpy. I don't want to play." Tim was sad but he had an opinion. He thought, "I can make Tom happy!"
Tim saw a ball. He picked up the ball and shoot it to Tom. The ball hit Tom's nose. Tom was surprised. He looked at the ball and then at Tim. Tim said, "Let's play with the ball, Tom!"
Tom did not want to be grumpy anymore. He played with the ball and Tim. They had so much fun! Tom and Tim became good friends. They played together every day. And Tom was not grumpy anymore.

One day, a little boy named Tom found a big cardboard box. He thought it was a great toy. He played with it all day. He made it into a car, a house, and a boat. Tom was very happy.
While playing, Tom found a zip on the cardboard box. He pulled the zip and the box opened up. Inside the box, there was a big, high ladder. Tom was surprised. He did not know what to do with the ladder.
Tom decided to climb the high ladder. When he got to the top, he found a big slide. It was a magic cardboard box! Tom slid down the slide and landed back in his room. He played with the magic cardboard box all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very adventurous. He loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Tim saw a big puddle. He wanted to jump in it and soak his feet.
Tim said, "Mom, can I jump in the puddle?" His mom was very patient. She knew Tim loved to play in water. She said, "Yes, Tim, you can jump in the puddle. Just be careful."
Tim was so happy. He ran to the puddle and jumped in. Splash! The water went everywhere. Tim's feet were all wet, but he didn't care. He was having so much fun. He played in the puddle until the sun went down.
When it was time to go inside, Tim's mom said, "Now, let's dry your feet." She helped Tim dry his feet with a soft towel. Tim was tired but happy. He had a great day playing in the puddle.
That night, as Tim lay in bed, he thought about his adventurous day. He couldn't wait to see what fun things he could do tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved cars and he had a toy car model that he played with every day. One day, Timmy's mom surprised him with a new car model. Timmy was so happy and felt very lucky to have a new toy car. 
Later that day, Timmy's friend came to play. Timmy showed him his new toy car model and they played together. Suddenly, Timmy's mom came and said it was time for dinner. Timmy and his friend went inside and ate spaghetti for dinner. After dinner, Timmy's friend had to go home. Timmy said goodbye and went to bed with his new toy car model. He was very happy and felt lucky to have such a fun toy.

Once upon a time there were two little rabbits, called Fluffy and Flop. They were always together, playing and hopping it around their little burrows. One day, they heard a strange sound. They stopped and listened carefully, and realized it was a file! Fluffy and Flop were excited, so they hopped over to investigate.
The file was very sweet and Fluffy and Flop wanted it all to themselves. So they started pushing each other to try and get it first. Suddenly, they heard a loud pop. They stopped pushing, and noticed the file was broken into two pieces! The two little rabbits had broken it.
Fluffy and Flop quickly realized their mistake. They decided to share the file, so that way each of them got a tasty treat. The two little rabbits learned a valuable lesson that day: it’s always better to share than fight!

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Timmy. Timmy had many friends in the forest. One day, the weather was very heavy. The wind blew hard, and the rain fell from the sky. Timmy was scared.
Timmy's best friend, Bobby the squirrel, had a big tree. Bobby knew the weather was bad. He wanted to help his friend. Bobby warned Timmy, "Come to my tree! It's safe there!" Timmy listened to his friend and went to the tree.
The heavy weather got worse, but Timmy and Bobby stayed safe in the tree. They played games and told stories. When the weather was better, they went outside. Timmy thanked Bobby for warning him. They were happy and played in the sun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to bake. One day, she wanted to make some cookies for her friends. She asked her mom, "Mommy, can I make some cookies?"
Her mom said, "Yes, you may make some cookies, but you must ask for my help."
Lily was happy her mom permitted her to make cookies. She got all the ingredients and began to mix them together. But then she saw a knot in the dough. She asked her mom, "Mommy, what is this knot?"
Her mom replied, "It's just a little bump in the dough. Keep mixing and it will go away."
Finally, the cookies were ready and they smelled so tasty. Lily's friends came over and they all enjoyed the cookies together. Lily was proud that she made them all by herself (with a little help from her mom).

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play hide-and-seek with her friends in the park. One day, she found a big, white sheet and decided to use it to hide.
Lily covered herself with the sheet and waited for her friends to find her. But as she waited, she heard a strange sound. It was a key turning in a lock. She got nervous and wondered who could be coming.
Suddenly, the sheet was lifted off her and she saw her mom's smiling face. Her mom had been looking for her and found her hiding under the sheet. Lily was surprised but happy to see her mom. From then on, they played hide-and-seek together and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big frog. He lived near a big fence. Every day, he would see the other animals playing on the other side of the fence. He wanted to play with them too.
One day, the frog decided to dive over the fence. He tried and tried but he couldn't make it. His friends saw him trying and came to help. They told him that he needed to practice and get stronger.
The frog practiced every day and soon he was able to jump over the fence. He was so happy to be able to play with his friends. The moral of the story is that if you work hard and practice, you can achieve your goals.

One day, a cat named Tom went for a walk. Tom saw a huge post. He wanted to ring the bell on the top of the post. Tom tried and tried, but he could not reach the bell.
A big bird named Sam saw Tom. Sam wanted to help Tom ring the bell. Sam flew up and rang the bell for Tom. They both smiled and were happy.
But then, something unexpected happened. The bell on the post was magic! When the bell rang, Tom and Sam switched places. Now, Tom could fly like a bird and Sam had to walk like a cat. They laughed and played together, enjoying their new fun lives.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a favorite vest that he loved to wear. It was a good vest, with red and blue colors. He wore it every day.
One day, Tim was playing in the park when he saw a little girl crying. He walked up to her and asked, "Why are you crying?" The little girl said, "I lost my toy!" Tim wanted to comfort her, so he said, "Let's look for it together!"
As they looked for the toy, they found a big box. They opened the box and found many toys inside! Tim said, "Wow, this is unexpected!" The little girl's toy was in the box too. They were both very happy and decided to share the toys with other kids in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved ice cream so much that she asked her mom for it every day. One sunny day, her mom bought her a nice ice cream cone. Lily was so happy that she opened it quickly and started licking it.
But then, she got distracted by a butterfly and left her ice cream in the sun. It started to melt and soon enough, it was all gone. Lily was sad and realized that she should have been more careful with her ice cream. Her mom told her that sometimes things can disappear if we don't take care of them properly.
From that day on, Lily always made sure to finish her ice cream before it could melt. She learned that it's important to take care of the things we have and not take them for granted.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a little girl named Mia. One day, Mia's mom told her that a new friend would arrive soon. Mia felt anxious because she had never met this friend before.
As Mia played outside, she saw a boy walking towards her. "Hi, I'm Tom," said the boy. "I just moved to the village." Mia smiled and said, "Hi Tom, I'm Mia. My mom told me you would arrive today." They started to play together and became fast friends.
One day, while they were playing, they found a big box. Mia and Tom looked at each other and remembered when they first met. They knew that something fun was inside the box. They opened it and found lots of toys to play with. They were so happy and played together with their new toys for hours.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a beautiful tie that he loved very much. His mom gave it to him for his birthday. Tim felt happy when he wore his beautiful tie.
One day, Tim went to a park to play with his friends. He wore his beautiful tie. His friends liked his tie too. They played catch, and they played on the swings. They had lots of fun.
When it was time to go home, Tim could not find his beautiful tie. He was sad. His friends helped him look for it. They found the tie under a big tree. Tim was happy to have his beautiful tie back. He thanked his friends for their help. From that day on, Tim took good care of his beautiful tie and played happily with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and sing songs. One day, Lily's mom took her to the store to buy some fruits and vegetables. While they were walking around, Lily saw a big scale that the store used to weigh things. She thought it was so long and tall.
Later that day, Lily and her mom went to visit her grandma. Her grandma had a lot of pictures on the wall. Lily looked at them and recognized some of the people in the pictures. Her grandma told her stories about the people in the pictures and Lily listened carefully.
The next day, Lily went back to the store with her mom. She saw the big scale again and remembered how long it was. But this time, she recognized that it was used to weigh things like fruits and vegetables. She felt proud that she remembered something new. From that day on, Lily loved going to the store and seeing the big scale.

Once upon a time, there was a peaceful town. In this town, there was a little house. In the little house, there lived a kind man. The kind man liked to help people.
One day, the kind man found a box. The box was not close. The kind man wanted to close the box. He looked for a nail to close the box. He found a big nail and a small nail.
The kind man used the big nail to close the box. He hit the nail with a hammer. The box was now close. The people in the peaceful town were happy. The kind man smiled and went back to his little house.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to hold her teddy bear tight every night when she went to bed. One day, Lily's mom asked her to help with an important task. They needed to go to the store to buy some tuna for dinner. Lily was excited to help and held her mom's hand as they walked to the store. At the store, Lily saw a big fish tank with lots of tuna swimming around. She thought they looked funny and wanted to hold one, but her mom told her they were not for holding. They bought the tuna and went home to make a yummy dinner. After dinner, Lily held her teddy bear tight once again and fell asleep with a full tummy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside and fly his kite. One day, his mommy bought him a new kite. Timmy was so happy to receive it! 
The weather was warm and sunny, perfect for kite flying. Timmy ran outside and started to fly his new kite. It was so pretty with bright colors and it flew high in the sky.
As Timmy played, he felt warm from the sun shining down on him. He ran and ran with his kite, feeling so happy. He couldn't wait to show his friends his new kite and play with them too.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to create a race. He wanted everyone to see who had the most speed. He told all his friends to come and bring their bikes. They were all excited to race and find out who was the fastest.
On the day of the race, the sun was shining, but it was a cold day. Everyone wore warm clothes. They all lined up with their bikes, ready to go. Tim blew a whistle, and they all started to race as fast as they could. They raced down the street, around the park, and back to the starting line.
As they raced, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew a lot of leaves into the air. The leaves covered the path, and the racers could not see where they were going. Everyone had to slow down and be careful. Tim was sad that the race was not about speed anymore. But then, he saw that all his friends were laughing and having fun, even though they were going slow. Tim realized that it was not about who was the fastest, but about having fun with friends. The race became a fun ride, and everyone had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and draw pictures with her crayons. One day, Lily went to the bathroom to wash her hands. She looked in the mirror and saw her pretty face. She smiled and said, "I love my face!"
After she washed her hands, she tried to open the door, but it was locked. She couldn't get out! She knocked on the door and called for her mommy. "Mommy, help me! The door is locked!" Her mommy came and opened the door for her.
Lily was happy to be free again. She ran to her room and looked in the mirror again. She saw her happy face and said, "I'm glad I'm not locked in the bathroom anymore!" From that day on, Lily was always careful to make sure the door was open before she went in.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went for a walk. They saw a big, hard rock. Tim said, "Let's sit on the rock, Spot!" Spot nodded and wagged his tail.
As they sat on the rock, they saw a pot. It was a small pot with a pretty flower in it. Tim said, "I like this flower, Spot. Do you like it too?" Spot nodded and barked.
Tim and Spot took the pot with the flower home. They put it on the window sill. Every day, Tim and Spot looked at the pretty flower and smiled. They were very happy to have found the pot with the flower.

Once upon a time, there was a big clock. The clock lived in a small room. It had a long hand and a short hand. The clock liked to tell time for all the people in the house.
One day, a little girl named Lily came into the room. She looked at the clock and said, "Hello, clock! Can you tell me when it is time to sleep?" The clock nodded its long hand and said, "Yes, Lily! I will tell you when it is time to sleep."
The day went on, and the clock kept telling time. The sun went down, and the moon came up. The clock's long hand moved slowly. Lily came back into the room and looked at the clock. The clock said, "Lily, it is time to sleep now."
Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, clock!" She put on her pajamas and went to bed. The clock watched over Lily as she slept. It made sure she had a good, long sleep. And when the sun came up, the clock woke Lily up with a gentle tick-tock sound. Lily woke up, stretched, and said, "Good morning, clock! Thank you for helping me sleep!"
The clock was happy to help Lily. From that day on, the clock and Lily were the best of friends. And every night, the clock made sure Lily had a good, long sleep.

Once upon a time, there was a man who loved shiny things. He always looked for cheap things that shone bright. One day, he found a shiny rock on the ground. He picked it up and it made him very happy. He showed it to his friends and they thought it was very pretty too. The man was so happy to have found something so shiny and cheap. He kept it with him always and it made him smile every time he looked at it.

Once upon a time, there was a big red barn. It was very important to the farmer because it kept all his animals safe. One day, a big storm came and the wind was very strong. The farmer was worried that the barn might fall down. 
He asked his son, "Can you help me protect the barn? It's very important to us." 
The son said, "Yes, I can help." 
They worked together to put boards and nails on the barn to make it stronger. The son said, "We need to make sure the barn won't destroy in the storm." 
The storm came and the wind was very strong, but the barn didn't fall down. The farmer was very happy and said to his son, "Thank you for helping me. We saved the barn because we worked together." 
The moral of the story is that when you work together, you can accomplish great things.

Once upon a time, there was a good goose. The goose had a big problem. It could not find its egg. The good goose was very sad.
One day, a little boy came to help the goose. He wanted to solve the problem. They looked high and low, but they could not find the egg. The good goose and the little boy were tired.
Then, they saw a big bird with the egg. The big bird was not bad, it just wanted to help. The big bird gave the egg back to the good goose. The good goose was happy, and the little boy was happy too. They all became friends and played together.

Once upon a time, in a pretty garden, there were many fruit trees. The trees had apples, bananas, and oranges. The fruits were very yummy and colorful.
One day, a little girl named Lucy came to the garden. She saw the pretty fruits and wanted to eat them. But her mommy said, "Lucy, you must behave. We cannot take the fruits without asking."
Lucy listened to her mommy and behaved. They went to find the gardener to ask if they could have some fruits. The gardener was happy that Lucy behaved and said, "Yes, you can have some fruits. Thank you for asking."
Lucy and her mommy picked some apples, bananas, and oranges from the pretty garden. They went home and shared the yummy fruits with their family. Everyone was happy, and Lucy learned that it is important to behave and ask before taking something.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and eat oatmeal for breakfast. One day, he went outside to play and saw a silly clown walking down the street. 
Timmy thought it would be fun to catch the silly clown, so he ran after him. But as he was running, he tripped and fell into a big pile of oatmeal! 
Suddenly, the silly clown stopped and came over to help Timmy up. But when he did, he slipped on the oatmeal and fell down too! 
Timmy and the silly clown laughed and laughed as they sat in the pile of oatmeal together. From that day on, Timmy knew that sometimes unexpected things can happen, but they can still be fun and silly.

Once upon a time, there was a big tower. It was very tall and could be seen from far away. A little boy named Timmy loved to look at the tower. One day, he went to the tower and saw a man there. The man said, "Hello, little boy. Can I serve you in any way?"
Timmy replied, "No, thank you. I just came to look at the tower."
The man smiled and said, "I work in the tower. It is my job to serve the people who come here."
Timmy was curious and asked, "Does it hurt to work in the tower?"
The man laughed and said, "No, it doesn't hurt. It's actually quite fun. Would you like to come up and see the view?"
Timmy was excited and said, "Yes, please!" So, the man took Timmy up to the top of the tower and they looked out at the beautiful view together.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Bob. Bob loved to play with gears, which are round things with teeth that turn. One day, Bob went to the park to play with his gears. 
As he was playing, he heard a funny noise. He turned around and saw a monkey! The monkey was laughing and playing with Bob's gears. Bob was surprised but happy to see the monkey. 
Suddenly, the monkey stopped laughing and ran away with one of Bob's gears. Bob was sad because he couldn't play with all of his gears anymore. But then, the monkey came back with a new gear! Bob was so happy and he laughed with joy. From that day on, Bob and the monkey played with gears together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her friends and have fun. One day, Lily and her friends were talking about what they wanted to do for fun.
Lily said, "Let's plan a crazy party! We can have balloons and cake and play games!"
Her friend, Timmy, said, "That sounds like so much fun! Let's invite everyone we know!"
Lily and Timmy started to plan the party. They made a list of all the things they needed and asked their parents for help. They worked hard to make the party perfect.
Finally, the day of the party arrived. All of their friends came and they had so much fun playing games and eating cake. Lily and Timmy were so happy that their plan worked out and everyone had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to imagine things and play in the park. One day, she went for a walk on a path in the woods. She saw a bird and followed it.
Suddenly, she saw a big, rude bear! The bear growled and Lily was scared. But then, the bird came back and landed on the bear's nose. The bear sneezed and the bird flew away. Lily laughed and ran back home.
When she got home, her mommy asked her what happened. Lily said, "I saw a rude bear on the path, but a bird made him sneeze!" Her mommy was surprised and happy that Lily was okay. From that day on, Lily always imagined that the bird was her protector.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He was always thinking of ways to have fun. One day he decided to go on an adventure!
The little boy put on his hat and crept out the door. He saw a large university and walked in to explore. He saw all the students learning and started to feel bad.
He went over to a man and asked him why he was sad. The man smiled and said “Someone stole my book!” The little boy was sad and felt very shook.
He decided to help the man find his book. He searched a very large room and sure enough, he found it! The man was so pleased, he thanked the little boy.
The little boy was happy he could help and smiled. He had helped someone with his adventurous way!

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved makeup and always put on her mom's lipstick and blush. One day, Lily's favorite aunt arrived at her house. She had a surprise for Lily - a makeup kit of her own! Lily was so happy and excited to try it out. 
She started putting on the makeup and soon became very popular among her friends. They all wanted to play with her and her new makeup kit. Lily felt like a princess and loved spending time with her friends. 
As the day came to an end, Lily's aunt told her that she was very proud of her for sharing her makeup with her friends. Lily felt happy and proud too. She knew that sharing was important and it made her feel good inside. From that day on, Lily continued to share her makeup with her friends and they all had fun playing together. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a red puppy named Max. Max loved to play outside and chase butterflies. One day, Max's owner, Lily, took him to the park.
At the park, Max saw a little girl with a spray bottle. "What are you doing?" Max asked. "I'm spraying water on the flowers," the little girl replied.
Max thought it looked like fun, so he asked Lily if he could have a spray bottle too. Lily laughed and said, "Sorry Max, but you don't have thumbs to hold a spray bottle."
Max was sad, but then he saw a butterfly and ran after it. He forgot all about the spray bottle and had a great time playing in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly farmer who lived on a big farm. The farmer had many animals, including cows, pigs, and chickens. The animals were all very comfortable on the farm and loved living there.
One day, the farmer was walking around the farm when he saw a little boy walking by. The boy looked lost and scared. The farmer asked the boy if he needed help. The boy said yes and told the farmer that he was lost.
The farmer took the boy by the hand and showed him around the farm. The boy loved seeing all the animals and even got to feed them. As they were walking, the farmer heard a loud snap. He turned around and saw that a branch had fallen from a tree. The farmer told the boy to be careful and always look up when walking outside. The boy thanked the farmer for his help and went back home feeling safe and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat jam on her toast every morning. One day, she couldn't open the jar of jam. She asked her mom for help.
"Mama, can you please open the jam jar? I want some on my toast," Lily said.
"Sure, sweetie. Let me try," her mom replied. She tried to twist the lid off, but it was too tight. "It's really stuck. Can you help me, Lily?"
Lily squeezed the jar with all her might, and the lid finally popped off. She was so happy to see the red jam inside. "Yay! Thank you, Mama!" she said, spreading the jam on her toast. It was the best breakfast ever.

Lily and Ben were going on a trip with Mom and Dad. They packed their luggage with toys, books and clothes. They were very excited to see new places and have fun.
They got in the car and drove to the airport. They saw many big planes and colorful flags. They checked in their luggage and got their tickets. They followed Mom and Dad to the gate.
But then, Lily saw something shiny and pretty. It was a necklace on a lady's neck. Lily wanted to touch it and see how it sparkled. She let go of Mom's hand and ran to the lady.
"Wow, what a nice necklace!" Lily said. "Can I see it?"
The lady was surprised and annoyed. She did not like Lily touching her necklace. She pushed Lily away and shouted.
"Go away, you little brat! This is mine, not yours!"
Lily was scared and sad. She cried and looked for Mom and Dad. But she could not see them. There were too many people and noises. She was lost.
Mom and Dad did not notice that Lily was gone. They were busy looking at their tickets and the screen. They heard the announcement that their flight was boarding. They hurried to the gate and got on the plane.
They did not see Lily crying and looking for them. They did not hear her calling their names. They did not know that she escaped from them.
Lily was alone and afraid. She did not know what to do. She wished she had not run away. She wished she had stayed with Mom and Dad. She wished she had not seen the shiny necklace.
But it was too late. Lily had escaped from her family. And they had left without her.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a round toy. She was very happy and wanted to show her friend, Tom. Tom saw the round toy and wanted to play with it too. But Lily said, "No, Tom! This is my round toy. You can't play with it."
Tom was sad and asked Lily again, "Please, Lily, can we play together with the round toy?" Lily thought for a moment and said, "Only if you help me make my room tidy. Then we can play together."
Tom agreed and they both started to clean Lily's room. They picked up all the toys and put them in their right place. After the room was tidy, Lily was happy and decided to share her round toy with Tom. They played together all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a big box of toys. She loved her toys, but her favorite toy was her doll, Daisy. Daisy had a pretty dress with a pattern on it. Sue and Daisy played every day.
One day, Sue saw that Daisy's dress was ugly. It had a big stain on it. Sue was sad. She wanted to remove the stain and make Daisy's dress pretty again. Sue thought hard about how to fix the problem. She knew she needed to find a way to remove the stain and make Daisy's dress pretty again.
Sue had an idea. She went to her mom and asked for help. Her mom gave her a wet cloth. Sue used the wet cloth to remove the stain from Daisy's dress. The stain was gone, and the pattern was pretty again. Sue and Daisy were very happy. They played together with the pretty dress, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Tom. Tom loved to mix colors. One day, he found three pots of paint. One was red, one was blue, and one was yellow. Tom wanted to see what would happen if he mixed them all.
Tom took a big stick and began to mix the colors. He mixed and mixed until he got a new color. It was a big shock! The color was green. Tom was very happy with his new color. He ran to his friend, a little dog named Max.
"Max, look!" said Tom. "I mixed the colors and made green!" Max looked at the green paint and was also in shock. "Wow, Tom! You are so smart!" Max said. They both laughed and played with the green paint all day. From that day on, Tom and Max loved to mix colors together and make new ones.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a spinning top that she loved to play with every day. One day, while she was playing with her top, it fell down a hole and she couldn't get it back. She felt helpless and sad.
Lily's mommy saw how sad she was and told her to pray for help. So, Lily closed her eyes and prayed for her top to come back to her. Suddenly, a kind old man appeared and asked what was wrong. Lily told him about her top and the man promised to help.
The man went down the hole and found the top. He brought it back to Lily and she was very happy. She thanked the man and he told her that sometimes it's good to pray for help when we feel helpless. From that day on, Lily remembered to pray whenever she needed help.

One day, a boy named Tim and his mom went for a slow walk. They saw a big red automobile on the street. Tim liked the automobile very much.
"Mom, can we go near the automobile?" Tim asked. His mom said, "Yes, but be careful." They went near the automobile and saw it had a shiny bell. Tim wanted to ring the bell.
Just when Tim was about to ring the bell, a dog jumped out of the automobile! Tim and his mom were so surprised. The dog wagged its tail and wanted to play. Tim laughed and played with the dog, and they all had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went for a walk with her mommy in the park. They saw a big tunnel that was very dark. Lily was scared to go inside, but her mommy held her hand and said, "Don't worry, we'll go together."
As they walked through the tunnel, they saw that it was very high and wide. Lily was amazed and said, "Wow, this tunnel is so big!" Her mommy smiled and said, "Yes, it is."
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise and saw that water was filling up the tunnel. Lily started to cry and said, "Mommy, I'm scared!" Her mommy hugged her tightly and said, "Don't worry, we'll get out of here." They ran as fast as they could and finally made it out of the tunnel safely. Lily was so happy and said, "That was so much fun! Can we do it again?"

Once upon a time, there was a soft flower named Bloom. Bloom lived in a big garden with many other flowers. They all liked to play and dance in the sun.
One day, a big motorcycle came into the garden. The motorcycle was very loud and scared the flowers. Bloom was brave and decided to talk to the motorcycle. "Why are you so loud?" asked Bloom. The motorcycle said, "I am sorry, I did not mean to scare you. I just wanted to see the pretty garden."
Bloom and the motorcycle became friends. They played together in the garden every day. The other flowers liked the motorcycle too, and they all had fun together. The motorcycle learned to be quiet and gentle, and the flowers were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to stand and do exercise every day. He wanted to be strong and safe.
One day, Tim saw a big tree. He wanted to climb it. His friend, Sam, said, "Tim, don't climb the tree. It's not safe." But Tim did not listen. He thought he was strong from all his exercise.
Tim climbed the tree. He went up, up, up. Suddenly, he slipped and fell. He got hurt very badly. Tim should have listened to his friend, Sam.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a famous lake. Many people liked to visit the lake. They would swim, play, and have fun. One day, a man came to the lake. He wanted to polish his big boat.
