The man started to polish his boat near the lake. He wanted it to look nice and shiny. While he was polishing, a duck came by. The duck liked the shiny boat, too. The duck wanted to play with the man and his boat.
The man and the duck played near the lake. They had a lot of fun. But then, something unexpected happened. The shiny boat fell into the lake. The man and the duck were very sad. They could not play with the boat anymore. The boat was gone, and the day had a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a rare bear named Bob. Bob was not like other bears. He liked to poke things with his big paw. One day, Bob went for a walk in the woods.
As Bob walked, he met a small bird. The bird was looking for a friend to play with. "Hi, I am Bob," said the bear. "Do you want to play a match with me?" The bird said, "Yes, I want to play with you."
Bob and the bird played a game of hide and seek. Bob was very good at poking around to find the bird. The bird was also good at hiding. They had a lot of fun. After the match, Bob and the bird became best friends. They played together every day, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and build things. He was very creative. One day, Timmy decided to build a ship out of blocks. He asked his mom for help, and she said yes. Together they built a big ship with sails and a flag.
Timmy was so happy with his ship. He played with it for hours, pretending he was a pirate sailing the seas. He showed his ship to his friends and they all thought it was really cool. Timmy felt proud of his creative ship.
As the sun began to set, Timmy knew it was time to go inside. He carefully put his ship away, knowing he could play with it again tomorrow. Timmy went to bed dreaming of all the adventures he would have on his ship.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to run and play outside. One day, she saw a butterfly flying in a zigzag pattern. It made her laugh and she chased after it.
Suddenly, she heard a loud scream. It was her friend, Timmy. He had fallen and hurt his knee. Lily quickly ran to him and asked, "Are you okay?"
Timmy shook his head and said, "It's bad. It hurts a lot." Lily knew she had to help him, so she ran back to her house to get her mom.
Together, they went back to Timmy and helped him up. Lily's mom cleaned his knee and put a bandage on it. Timmy felt better and smiled. "Thank you," he said.
Lily was happy that she could help her friend. She continued to run and play outside, but now she knew that helping others was just as important.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to enter his big backyard to play. One day, he found a small cut on his hand. He was sad, but he knew it was easy to fix.
Tim's mom saw the cut and gave him a soft hug. She put a fun bandage on it to make it better. Tim smiled and felt better. Now, he knew it was easy to fix small cuts.
The next day, Tim entered his backyard again. He played with his toys and had a great time. He was happy because he knew if he got another cut, it would be easy to fix. And so, Tim played all day long in his backyard, feeling brave and strong.

Once upon a time, there was a little tank named Tim. Tim was a fierce tank, but he had a secret. Tim loved to sing. Every day, he would go to the woods and sing his heart out.
One day, while Tim was singing in the woods, a little bird heard him. The bird liked Tim's singing and wanted to sing with him. So, the bird flew down and started singing too. Tim was so happy to have a friend to sing with.
They sang together every day, and their singing made all the animals in the woods happy. Tim the fierce tank and his little bird friend became the best of friends, and they sang beautiful songs for everyone to hear. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a little girl named Sally went to the park with her mom. They went to celebrate Sally's birthday. Sally was very happy. The park was full of mist, but it made everything look like a fairy tale. 
Sally saw a big dog and wanted to play with it. She asked her mom, "Can I play with the big dog, please?" Her mom said, "Yes, but be careful, Sally." The dog looked friendly, but something unexpected happened.
As Sally played with the dog, it got upset. The dog started to bark very loud. Sally was scared and ran to her mom. The dog chased Sally and it bit her leg. Sally cried and her mom was very worried.
Sally's mom called for help. A man came and took the dog away. Sally's leg was hurt, and her mom took her to the doctor. The doctor said Sally would be okay, but she needed to rest.
Sally's birthday celebration was ruined. She was sad and upset. The mist in the park was not magical after all. It hid the danger that was waiting for her. Sally learned to be more careful when playing with animals she didn't know.

Once upon a time, a friendly cat named Tom lived in a small house. Tom loved to study. Every day, he looked at books with many symbols in them. He wanted to learn all the symbols.
One day, a big dog named Max came to Tom's house. Max saw the books and wanted to play with them. Tom did not want Max to play with his books. They both got very sad. They did not know what to do.
Then, Tom had an idea. He asked Max to study the symbols with him. Max agreed and they studied together. They became very good friends. The moral of the story is that sharing can turn conflict into friendship.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to run fast and play with his toys. One day, Timmy went to the park to play with his friends. He saw a boy he didn't know and wanted to say hi. 
But when Timmy tried to speak, the boy didn't understand him. Timmy felt sad because he couldn't make friends with the boy. He tried to speak again, but the boy still didn't understand. 
Timmy thought and thought about what to do. Then he remembered that his mom taught him some words in a different language. He tried to speak those words to the boy and the boy understood! Timmy was happy that he could make a new friend, and they played together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a kind nurse. She took care of sick animals. One day, a little bird was hurt. The bird could not fly. The nurse wanted to help the bird.
The nurse said, "I will replace your dead wing with a new one." The bird was happy. The nurse worked hard to fix the bird's wing. Soon, the bird could fly again.
The bird thanked the nurse. The nurse said, "Always be kind to others, just like I was kind to you." The bird learned to be kind and helped other animals too. The moral of the story is to be kind and help others.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Toby. He loved to travel and was always curious about the world around him. One day, Toby decided to explore a castle that he'd seen on his travels. As he approached the castle, he heard the sound of laughter coming from inside.
Toby knocked on the big wooden door and it opened by itself. Inside, he saw two playful fairies dancing and singing. They waved at Toby and invited him in.
The fairies said, "If you wish, we can take you on a magical journey to the castle. Would you like to travel with us?" 
Toby was so excited. He said, "Yes, I would love to travel with you!" So they all set off on a journey to the castle.
When they arrived, Toby saw amazing things – beautiful gardens, tall towers and friendly animals. Everywhere he looked, Toby saw playful fairies and magical creatures enjoying their day.
Toby couldn't believe his eyes. He had never seen anything so wonderful before. He thanked the fairies for taking him to the castle, and promised to return someday.

Once upon a time, there was a little gray bunny. He loved to play and hop around in the grass. One day, he met a little bird who was sad. "What's wrong?" asked the bunny. "I lost my nest," replied the bird. "Don't worry," said the bunny. "I'll protect you." 
The bunny hopped over to his crib and brought back some soft hay. He made a cozy nest for the bird. "Thank you," said the bird. "You're a good friend." 
The bunny and the bird played together all day. They had so much fun! When it got dark, the bunny said, "It's time for bed. You can sleep in my crib." The bird snuggled up in the hay and fell asleep. The bunny watched over him all night, making sure he was safe and sound. The next morning, the bird woke up and said, "Thank you for protecting me. You're the best friend ever!"

Once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a brilliant nest. A mama bird lived in the nest with her baby birds. They loved their home very much.
One day, a big wind came. It blew and blew. Mama bird was scared. She told her baby birds, "Hold on tight to the nest!" The baby birds held on tight to their nest with their little feet.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big, friendly bear saw the tree shaking. He wanted to help the birds. The bear said, "Don't worry, little birds!" He held the tree with his big paws, and the wind stopped shaking the tree. The mama bird and her baby birds were safe and happy. They all became good friends with the big, friendly bear.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to chew on her favorite gum all the time. One day, her mom told her that chewing gum all day long is not good for her teeth. Lily didn't listen and kept chewing.
One day, Lily was walking in the park and saw an empty candy wrapper on the ground. She picked it up and started chewing on it. Suddenly, she felt a strange motion in her mouth. She tried to spit it out, but it was stuck.
Lily's mom took her to the dentist, who told her that she had swallowed the candy wrapper. From that day on, Lily learned that she should always listen to her mom and not chew on things that are not meant to be chewed.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant named Ellie. Ellie was very heavy because she ate a lot of food. She liked to eat bananas, apples, and carrots. One day, Ellie went to the store to buy some more food. She asked the storekeeper to supply her with lots of fruits and vegetables.
As Ellie was walking back to her home, she saw a scary lion. The lion was roaring loudly and Ellie was afraid. She tried to run away, but her weight made it hard for her to move quickly. Suddenly, she remembered that she had some peanuts in her bag. She threw the peanuts at the lion and it ran away.
From that day on, Ellie always carried peanuts with her. She knew that they could supply her with protection from scary animals.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a stubborn cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play outside in the sun. One day, at noon, Fluffy went out to play with her friends.
As they played, the sky became dark and it started to rain. All the animals ran back to their homes to stay dry. But stubborn Fluffy did not want to stop playing. She stayed outside, getting all wet and cold.
Soon, the rain stopped and the sun came out again. Fluffy's mom found her outside, all wet and shivering. She took Fluffy inside and helped her get dry and warm. Fluffy learned that it is important to listen and stay dry when it rains, even if she is stubborn.

Once upon a time, a big ship was in the water. The ship was very pretty. Many people came to observe the ship, because it was special.
One day, a small bird sat on the ship. The bird was embarrassed because it did not know how to swim. The bird tried to fly away, but it was scared.
A kind girl saw the bird and wanted to help. She took the bird in her hands and put it in a safe place. Now, the bird was happy and not embarrassed anymore. The girl and the bird observed the ship together and became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little red car with a strong engine. The car loved to drive fast and make its engine go "vroom vroom". One day, the car went to a big hill and felt dizzy when it looked down.
The car was brave and decided to go down the hill. As it went down, it started to shiver because it was very cold. The car's engine made a loud "brrrr" sound. The car wanted to be warm again.
At the bottom of the hill, the car found a cozy garage. It went inside and felt warm and happy. The car's engine stopped shivering and went back to saying "vroom vroom". The little red car was glad it went on an adventure, even if it felt dizzy and cold.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, especially her dollhouse. One day, Lily's mom gave her a bell to play with. Lily loved the sound it made when she rang it.
Later that day, Lily's friend Tommy came over to play. Tommy saw the bell and asked, "What's that?" Lily said, "It's a bell. Do you want to hear it?" Tommy nodded his head excitedly.
Lily rang the bell and they both laughed at the sound it made. Then, Lily had an idea. She said, "Let's measure how loud the bell is!" Tommy asked, "How do we do that?" Lily replied, "We can use this app on my mom's phone."
They measured the sound of the bell and found out it was very loud. They decided to play a game where they rang the bell and measured how loud it was each time. It was a fair game because they took turns ringing the bell and measuring the sound.
At the end of the day, Lily and Tommy had so much fun playing with the bell and measuring how loud it was. They couldn't wait to play again tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a favorite shirt. It was a dark shirt with a big star on it. He loved to wear this shirt every day.
One day, Tim was playing in the park with his friend, Sue. Sue saw Tim's dark shirt and said, "I like your shirt, Tim!" Tim smiled and said, "Thank you, Sue! It is my favorite shirt!"
Later, Tim and Sue played hide and seek. Tim hid behind a tree. Sue could not find him because his dark shirt helped him hide. Tim laughed and said, "My shirt is good for hiding!" Sue laughed too and they played until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the festival with her mommy and daddy. They would eat yummy food and play games together.
One day, Lily saw a big bell that would ring every hour. She asked her mommy, "What is that sound?" Her mommy said, "That's the bell ringing, Lily. It tells us the time."
Lily was so excited to hear the bell ring every hour. She was persistent in asking her mommy to take her to see the bell every time it rang. Her mommy and daddy smiled and said, "Of course, Lily. Let's go see the bell together!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with chalk on the sidewalk outside her house. One day, she was drawing a big rainbow when she ran out of chalk. She said, "Oh no, I finished all my chalk!" 
Lily's mom heard her and said, "Don't worry, we can buy more chalk at the store." So they went to the store and bought a big box of colorful chalk. Lily was very happy and said, "Thank you, Mommy! I'm sorry for finishing all my chalk." 
Lily went back outside and drew lots of pictures with her new chalk. She drew a big sun, a flower, and a butterfly. Her little brother came outside and wanted to draw too, but Lily had finished all the blue chalk. She said, "I'm sorry, I finished all the blue chalk. You can use the green one instead!" They drew together until it was time for dinner. Lily was happy to have lots of new chalk to use whenever she wanted.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toy jeep, which was his favorite toy. One day, Timmy and his mom went to the park to play. 
While they were playing, Timmy saw a big hill and wanted to drive his jeep up it. His mom warned him that the hill was too steep and he might not be able to manage it. But Timmy was stubborn and insisted on trying. 
He drove his jeep up the hill and managed to reach the top. He was so happy and proud of himself. But then, as he was driving down the other side, something unexpected happened. His jeep hit a rock and flipped over! 
Timmy was scared and started crying. His mom rushed over to him and hugged him tight. She told him that she had a surprise for him, and pulled out a brand new toy jeep from her bag. Timmy was so happy and hugged his mom back. From then on, he always listened to his mom's warnings and never drove his jeep on steep hills again.

One day, a kind rabbit and a fast fox were playing near a hedge. They liked to play hide and seek. The rabbit was very good at hiding, but the fox was very good at seeking. They were having so much fun!
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. A big bird was stuck in the hedge. The bird was sad and scared. The rabbit and the fox looked at each other and knew they had to help.
The kind rabbit said to the fox, "We need to rush and help the bird!" The fast fox agreed and they ran to the hedge. They worked together to free the bird from the hedge. The bird was so happy and thanked the rabbit and the fox.
The rabbit and the fox felt good about helping the bird. They learned that being kind and working together can solve problems. And then, they went back to playing hide and seek.

One day, a tired little bird named Tim was flying in the sky. He was so tired, he needed to find a place to rest. Tim saw a big tree and thought it was a good place to sit and relax.
In the tree, Tim met a wise old owl named Oliver. Oliver asked Tim why he was so tired. Tim said he was tired because he had been flying all day. Oliver had an opinion on how to help Tim. He said that sitting in the tree would help restore Tim's energy.
Tim listened to Oliver's opinion and sat in the tree. After a while, Tim felt his energy come back. He was not tired anymore. Tim thanked Oliver for his help and flew away, happy and full of energy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily liked to play in her room, but she was scared of the dark. Every night, she would go to bed and pull the covers up to feel safe. Her mom would come in and give her a hug, then say goodnight.
One night, Lily heard a noise outside her room. She was scared, but she wanted to know what it was. Lily peeked out of her bed and saw a big shadow on the wall. She thought it was a monster, so she hid under her covers to stay safe.
But then, the "monster" came into her room, and Lily saw that it was not a monster at all. It was her dad, carrying a big teddy bear for her to sleep with. He put the teddy bear in her bed and said, "Now you have a friend to keep you safe at night." Lily hugged the teddy bear and felt safe. From that night on, she was not scared of the dark anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big hall. In the hall, there were many kids. They liked to play games. They were very competitive. They always wanted to win.
One day, a new game came to the hall. It was called "Soar High". The kids were excited. They said, "Let's play Soar High!" They all wanted to be the best at the new game.
The kids started to play. They jumped and tried to soar high. One kid, named Tim, jumped very high. He was the best at the game. He said, "I win! I can soar the highest!" All the other kids were happy for Tim. They all had fun playing Soar High together.

Once upon a time, there was a big sack. The sack was tired. It wanted to rest. It found a nice spot under a tree. The tree was big and had many leaves.
One day, a little boy found a magazine. The magazine had many colors and pictures. The boy liked the magazine. He wanted to read it. He looked for a place to sit.
The boy saw the tired sack under the tree. He sat on the sack and opened the magazine. The sack was happy. It was not tired anymore. The boy and the sack became friends. They read the magazine together every day.

Once upon a time there was a small, stubborn flower. This flower was determined to bring beauty to the garden. Every day it tried hard to bloom and bring color to the otherwise dull garden.
One day, the other plants noticed the flower trying hard and they decided to help. They decided to make a film about the small, stubborn flower and its journey to bloom.
The plants gathered together and started filming the stubborn flower doing its best to reach its goal. The flower was so amazed and started to bloom even more. 
The film they made was beautiful and everyone wanted to watch it. They decided to show it on the biggest screen every day! 
The small, stubborn flower had achieved its goal and it continued to bloom every day, proud of its accomplishment.

Once there was a little girl called Claire. She was 3 years old and she wanted to ride her little bicycle. She asked her mom if she could go outside and ride.
Mom said, “Yes, you can ride your bike, just stay in the garden.”
Claire was so excited! She took her bike outside and started to ride around the garden. Pretty soon she was going faster and faster. 
Then she stopped at the big rock in the garden. There was a hole in the rock and she noticed something glittering inside.
Claire asked her mom what it was. Mom said, “That’s a mine! A miner put it there to collect minerals, but they never came back for it.”
Claire was troubled. She wanted to find out what was in the mine. So she asked her mom if she could open up the mine and see what was inside.
Her mom said, “OK, but we have to be very careful. It could be dangerous!”
Claire was brave. She carefully opened the mine and inside she found lots of sparkling jewels. It was the most amazing thing she’d ever seen! She shared the jewels with her mom and went home feeling very proud. 
​End.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with paint. They have many colors of paint. They can make red, blue, yellow, green, and more.
One day, they go to the park with their moms. They see a big wall. The wall is white and boring. Lily and Ben have an idea. They want to paint the wall. They ask their moms if they can.
"Can we paint the wall, mom?" Lily says.
"Can we, can we, please?" Ben says.
Their moms look at the wall. They look at Lily and Ben. They smile.
"Okay, you can paint the wall. But you have to stay near us. And you have to be careful. And you have to clean up when you are done. Do you understand?" Lily's mom says.
"Yes, mom, we understand. Thank you, thank you!" Lily and Ben say.
They run to the wall with their paint. They start to paint. They paint flowers, stars, animals, and more. They use many colors. They have fun. They make the wall great.
Their moms watch them. They are proud of Lily and Ben. They take pictures of them and the wall. They say, "You are great painters, Lily and Ben. You made the wall beautiful. Well done!"

Once upon a time, in an ordinary town, there lived a little girl named Lily. She had a cat named Whiskers. Lily and Whiskers loved to play together every day. They were best friends.
One day, Whiskers said, "I recommend we go on an adventure for a week." Lily thought it was a great idea. So, they packed their bags and started their journey. They walked and walked, and saw many new things.
On the last day of their adventure, they met a big, scary monster. The monster roared at them. Lily and Whiskers were very scared. They tried to run away, but the monster caught them. They were never seen again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big bag that she loved to carry around with her everywhere she went. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. She saw that her friend, Max, had a bigger bag than hers. Lily felt envious of Max's bag and wished she had one like it.
Lily went up to Max and asked him, "How did your bag get so big?" Max replied, "I put more toys in it every day, and it grew bigger and bigger." Lily thought that was a good idea, so she started putting more toys in her bag too.
Over time, Lily's bag began to increase in size, just like Max's. She was so happy that her bag was now bigger than Max's. When Max saw Lily's big bag, he felt envious too! But Lily told him that he could put more toys in his bag too, and it would increase in size just like hers did.
From that day on, Lily and Max played together with their big bags, and they were both happy. The end.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. He saw a big ship far away in the water. Tim asked his mom, "What is that big thing in the water?" His mom said, "That is a ship, Tim. It is a big boat that takes people and things from one place to another."
Tim saw a small, harmless bug on the sand. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. "Look, Mom! I found a bug!" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, it is a harmless bug. It will not hurt you."
Tim wanted to tell his friend, Sam, about the ship and the bug. He ran to Sam's house and knocked on the door. Sam came out and Tim said, "Sam, I saw a big ship and a harmless bug at the beach today!" Sam was excited and said, "Wow, Tim! That sounds fun. Let's go to the beach tomorrow and see if we can find more ships and bugs!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who had a fine doll. She loved to play with her doll every day. One day, Lily's friend came over to play with her. 
"Can I play with your doll?" asked her friend.
Lily replied, "Yes, but please be careful with her."
Her friend played with the doll, and Lily watched her. Suddenly, her friend accidentally dropped the doll on the floor. 
Lily was upset and said, "Oh no! My doll!"
Her friend quickly picked up the doll and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. Let's clap our hands and make your doll feel better."
Lily and her friend clapped their hands together, and Lily's doll felt better. From that day on, Lily and her friend always clapped their hands when they played with the doll. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to dance. She would dance all day long. She was a very graceful dancer. Her friends liked to watch her dance.
One day, Mia went to the park to play. She saw a big tree and decided to dance under it. She danced and danced, and her friends clapped and cheered. But then, something strange happened. Mia started to disappear!
Mia's friends were scared. They didn't know where she went. They looked and looked, but they couldn't find her. Then, they heard a soft sound. It was Mia's voice! She was still dancing, but she was invisible. Her friends listened to her dance, and they clapped and cheered. Soon, Mia reappeared, and everyone was happy. They all danced together under the big tree, and they had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a big fish who lived in the sea. The fish was very filthy because he did not like to clean himself. All the other fish did not want to play with him because he was so dirty.
One day, the filthy fish saw a small fish being chased by a mean shark. The shark wanted to eat the small fish. The filthy fish wanted to help, so he swam as fast as he could and shoot water at the shark. The water hit the shark and made him go away.
After that, the small fish thanked the filthy fish for saving him. The other fish saw what the filthy fish did and they all wanted to be his friend now. The filthy fish learned that being kind and helpful was more important than being clean. From that day on, he tried to be a good friend to everyone and also started to clean himself.

Lily liked to read books. She had many books in her room. Some books had pictures, some books had stories, some books had both. Lily wanted to learn new words from her books. She asked her mom to teach her.
Mom was busy. She had to work on her computer. She said, "Lily, I can't teach you now. Why don't you look at this dictionary? It has many words and their meanings. You can learn by yourself."
Lily took the dictionary. It was enormous. It was bigger than her head. It was heavy. Lily opened the dictionary. She saw many letters and words. She did not know most of them. She felt confused. She wanted to ask mom, but mom was still working.
Lily tried to read the dictionary. She found a word she knew. It was "cat". She read the meaning. It said, "a small animal with fur and a tail that says meow". Lily smiled. She liked cats. She had a cat named Fluffy.
She turned the page. She found a word she did not know. It was "xylophone". She read the meaning. It said, "a musical instrument with wooden bars that make sounds when hit with a stick". Lily did not understand. She had never seen a xylophone. She wanted to hear how it sounded. She wanted to ask mom, but mom was still working.
Lily felt sad. She closed the dictionary. She put it on the floor. She went to her bed. She hugged Fluffy. She said, "Fluffy, I don't like the dictionary. It is too big and too hard. I want mom to teach me. I want mom to play with me."
Fluffy licked Lily's face. He said, "meow". He wanted to play too. He jumped off the bed. He ran to the dictionary. He scratched it with his claws. He made a hole in the cover. He pulled out some pages. He tore them with his teeth. He made a mess.
Mom heard the noise. She stopped working. She went to Lily's room. She saw the dictionary. She saw the hole. She saw the pages. She saw Fluffy. She was angry. She said, "Fluffy, what did you do? You ruined the dictionary. It was very expensive. It was a gift from grandma. How could you be so naughty?"
Lily heard mom. She got up from the bed. She saw the dictionary. She saw the hole. She saw the pages. She saw Fluffy. She felt sorry. She said, "Mom, I'm sorry. It was my fault. I did not like the dictionary. It was too big and too hard. I wanted you to teach me. I wanted you to play with me. Fluffy was trying to make me happy. He was not naughty. He was nice."
Mom looked at Lily. She saw her eyes. She saw her tears. She felt sorry too. She said, "Lily, I'm sorry. I was too busy. I did not pay attention to you. I wanted you to learn. I wanted you to be smart. The dictionary was a good tool. It was not too big and too hard. It was full of words and knowledge. You could have learned a lot from it. But you also needed me. You needed my love and my time. I was not nice. I was naughty."
Lily and mom hugged each other. They said, "I love you". They forgave each other. They picked up the dictionary. They put it on the shelf. They decided to read it together. They also decided to play together. They found a xylophone in the closet. They hit it with a stick. They made sounds. They laughed. They were happy. Fluffy joined them. He said, "meow". He was happy too.

Once upon a time, there was a rich man who lived in a big house. He liked to play with bubbles. Every day, he would go outside and blow many bubbles. The bubbles were big and shiny. He loved to watch them fly in the sky.
One day, the rich man saw a little girl. She was trying to blow bubbles too. But her bubbles were small and not so pretty. The rich man wanted to help her. He gave her his special bubble wand. The girl was happy and said thank you.
Together, they blew lots of big, shiny bubbles. They had fun and laughed. The rich man and the little girl became good friends. They liked to complete their bubble fun every day. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was an unusual bird named Blue. Blue was different because she loved the color orange. One day, while flying in the sky, Blue saw a big orange below her. She flew down to take a closer look.
Blue saw a little boy named Timmy standing next to the big orange. Timmy looked at Blue and said, "Hi, bird! Do you like my orange?" Blue nodded her head and made a happy sound. Timmy smiled and said, "You can have it if you want. I value sharing with friends."
Blue took the orange and flew back to her nest. She shared the orange with her family. They all loved the unusual orange and were happy that Timmy shared it with them. From that day on, Blue and Timmy became good friends, and they always valued sharing with each other.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a small mushroom. The mushroom was not happy. It felt bad because it was all alone.
One day, a kind ant walked by. The ant saw the sad mushroom and wanted to help. The ant said, "I will carry you to a new place with more friends." The mushroom was very happy.
The ant carried the mushroom to a new spot in the forest. There, the mushroom met other mushrooms and lots of new friends. The mushroom was not bad anymore. It was very happy, and everyone lived happily together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park. One day, she saw a leaf on the ground. It was different from all the other leaves she had seen before. 
Lily picked up the leaf and showed it to her friend, Tommy. "Look, Tommy! This leaf is different!" she said. 
Tommy looked at the leaf and said, "Yes, it is different. It has a sharp edge." 
Lily was surprised. She had never noticed the sharp edge before. She thanked Tommy for showing her and they continued to play in the park. From that day on, Lily always looked for different leaves with sharp edges when she played outside.

One day, a lovely cat named Kitty went to the store with her mom. They wanted to buy a new couch for their home. Kitty was very excited and couldn't wait to see all the couches at the store. 
When they got to the store, Kitty saw a big blue couch. She said, "Mom, I like this one!" Her mom looked at the couch and said, "Yes, it is very nice, but let's look at some more." They looked at more couches and found a soft, red one. Kitty said, "I like this one too!" 
Just then, something unexpected happened. A little mouse ran out from behind the red couch! Kitty was surprised and so was her mom. The mouse said, "Please don't be scared, I just want a new couch too." Kitty and her mom smiled and helped the mouse pick out a tiny couch for his home. They all became friends and went home with their new couches, happy and excited.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to tie his shoes all by himself. One day, Tim went for a walk with his mom and dad. They walked to the park in the west, where the sun sets.
At the park, Tim found a dead tree. The tree had no leaves and was very old. Tim decided to play near the tree. He saw a big stick and picked it up. Tim had an idea to make the tree happy again.
Tim took the stick and tied it to the tree with a long piece of string he found. He said, "Now the tree has a friend to play with." Tim's mom and dad smiled. They were happy that Tim was so kind. They all went home, and the tree was not lonely anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Tina. She was three years old and loved to learn new things. One day, she decided to ask her mom about university. 
"Mommy, what's university?" asked Tina.
"It's when somebody goes to school and learns a lot of new things," said her mom. 
"Will I go to university one day?" asked Tina. 
"Of course! When you're old enough, you can go to university too," said her mom, smiling. 
A few days later, Tina visited her friend Tom at his house. He was also three years old, and his parents were talking about university. Tina remembered her mom's words and wanted to go to university too, just like Tom. 
Tom saw the expression on Tina's face and asked, "What's wrong, Tina?"
"I'm envious," Tina said. "I wish I could go to university too." 
Tom smiled and said, "You can, Tina. All you have to do is remember what your mom said. And then, when you get old enough, you can go too." 
Tina smiled, thanked her friend, and ran off to tell her mom. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a prince who was very proud of his castle. He would always show it to anyone who came to visit him.
One day, a little girl came to the castle and asked the prince if she could see it. The prince insisted that she couldn't because it was only for important people.
The little girl was sad and said, "But I really want to see it. Please, can I come in?" The prince thought for a moment and then said, "Okay, but only for a little while."
The little girl was so happy and she thanked the prince for letting her see his castle. From that day on, the prince realized that it was important to be kind to everyone, no matter who they were.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the grass and flowers. One day, her friend Timmy came to visit her. He invited her to come play with him at his house. 
Lily was so excited to go to Timmy's house. She ran inside to ask her mommy if she could go. Her mommy said yes, but first Lily needed to put on some powder so she wouldn't get sunburned. 
Lily put on the powder and it made her face look very white. She looked in the mirror and giggled at herself. Then she went outside to meet Timmy. They played together all day and had so much fun. When it was time for Lily to go home, she hugged Timmy and thanked him for inviting her over. 
As she walked home, the sky turned gray and it started to rain. Lily ran as fast as she could back to her house. When she got inside, she changed into dry clothes and snuggled up with her mommy. She told her mommy all about the fun she had at Timmy's house and how happy she was that he invited her over.

One day, a big dog and a little cat went for a walk. They saw a big red ball. The dog said, "I want to play with the ball!" The cat said, "I want to play too!" So they started to play with the ball.
The big dog kicked the ball very high. The little cat tried to catch it, but it was too high for her. The dog laughed and said, "You are too small and stupid to catch the ball." The cat felt sad.
Then, a nice bird came and offered to help the cat. The bird flew up high and brought the ball back down. The cat was happy and said, "Thank you, bird!" The dog felt bad for calling the cat stupid. They all played with the ball together and had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a good boy who loved to play with his toys. One day, Tim's mom said, "Let's spend the day at the park!" Tim was very happy and excited.
At the park, Tim saw a big ice cream truck. He asked his mom, "Can I have a treat, please?" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can have one treat." Tim chose a big ice cream cone. As he was eating his ice cream, he saw a little girl who looked sad and uncomfortable. Tim felt bad for her.
Tim walked up to the little girl and said, "Why are you sad?" She said, "I don't have a treat." Tim thought for a moment, then gave her his ice cream cone. The little girl smiled and said, "Thank you!" Tim felt happy that he could make her feel better.
The moral of the story is that sharing can make others happy and can make you feel good too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to sort her mom's magazines. One day, Sue found a crazy magazine with many colors on the cover. She was very excited to sort this magazine with the others.
As Sue sorted the magazines, the crazy magazine started to shake. Sue was surprised and a little scared. But she touched the magazine and it stopped shaking. She thought maybe it was just her imagination.
Then, something unexpected happened! The crazy magazine opened up and out came a tiny, talking cat. The cat said, "Thank you for finding my magic magazine, Sue!" Sue couldn't believe it. She had a new friend, and they played together all day. From that day on, Sue and the tiny cat had many fun adventures together.

Once upon a time, in a winter town, there lived a naughty dog named Spot. Spot always liked to match his toys by color. He had a lot of fun doing this every day. But one day, something unexpected happened.
Spot was playing outside with his toys, matching them by color, when a big wind came. The wind blew all of Spot's toys away! Spot was very sad and didn't know what to do. He looked around and saw his toys all mixed up and far away.
Spot decided to be brave and go find his toys. As he walked, he saw other animals who were also sad because they lost their things too. Spot had an idea. He helped the animals find their things and match them, just like he did with his toys. Soon, all the animals were happy again.
In the end, Spot found all his toys and matched them by color. The other animals thanked Spot for his help. Spot was not a naughty dog anymore. He learned that helping others was more fun than being naughty. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite purple pin that she loved to wear on her dress. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. While playing, she accidentally dropped her pin on the ground and didn't notice it.
Later on, when she returned home, she realized that her pin was missing. She searched everywhere but couldn't find it. She felt sad and cried a little bit. Her mom noticed her sadness and asked her what happened. Lily told her about the missing pin.
Her mom comforted her and told her that sometimes things get lost but they can always return. The next day, Lily went back to the park and searched for her pin. After a few minutes, she found it lying on the ground. She was so happy to be reunited with her favorite purple pin.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went for a walk in the forest. She saw a big, wild bear! The bear looked very scary, but Lily wasn't afraid. She said, "Hello, Mr. Bear! Do you want to be my friend?"
The bear looked surprised, but then he smiled and said, "Yes, I would like that very much."
Lily and the bear played together all day long. They had so much fun! When it was time for Lily to go home, she said goodbye to the bear and went to bed. That night, she dreamed of her new friend, the big, wild bear.

Once there was a goat. The goat had a friend, a boy. The boy loved to write. He wrote about the goat. The goat liked to climb high.
One day, the goat said, "Let's go high up the hill!" The boy said, "Yes, let's go!" They walked up the hill. The goat climbed high on the rocks. The boy watched the goat and wrote in his book.
At the top, they saw a big tree. The goat climbed the tree. The boy said, "You are so high!" The boy wrote about the goat in the tree. They had fun on the hill. They went home and told their friends about the high tree.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a cute puppy named Max. Lily and Max loved to play together in the park. One day, Lily's mom gave her an envelope and said, "This is a surprise for you, Lily." 
Lily opened the envelope and found a picture of an adorable kitten inside. She showed the picture to Max and said, "Look Max, this kitten is so cute!" Suddenly, they both heard a meowing sound coming from behind a tree. 
They went to investigate and found a real kitten hiding behind the tree. "Can we keep her, Mom?" asked Lily. "Of course, she's adorable!" replied her mom. 
Lily and Max were so happy to have a new friend. They played together all day long. But then, something unexpected happened. The kitten started to bark like a dog! "That's funny," said Lily. "I've never heard a kitten bark before!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a new book with lots of pages, and she wanted to read it with her friend, Timmy.
Lily said, "Look, Timmy! I have a new book with lots of pages. Do you want to read it with me?"
Timmy said, "No, I disagree. I don't like books with lots of pages."
Lily felt sad, but she said, "That's okay, Timmy. Maybe we can read a different book together."
Timmy smiled and said, "Yes, let's find a book with just one page. That sounds like fun!" And so, Lily and Timmy went to find a new book to read together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat yummy food, especially when it was delicious. One day, Timmy's mom made him a sandwich with his favorite ingredients, but she put it in a container and forgot to recommend that he eat it. 
Timmy was hungry and saw the container on the table. He opened it and took a bite. It was so delicious! He ate the whole sandwich, but then his mom came in and saw that he had eaten it without her telling him to. 
"Timmy, I told you not to eat that sandwich yet. I recommend that you wait until lunchtime," said his mom. 
Timmy felt bad for not waiting, but he was also happy because the sandwich was so delicious. His mom forgave him and they hugged. Timmy learned that it's important to listen to his mom's recommendations and that it's always better to wait for the right time to enjoy something tasty. They decided to go for a walk to the east, where they saw a beautiful sunrise.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to a party. She wanted to wear her favorite dress. It was a pretty pink dress with big flowers on it. She was very happy in her pink dress.
At the party, there were many friends and yummy food. Lily's mom had a cup of hot coffee. She liked coffee a lot. The cup was big and brown. Lily wanted to try it, but her mom said it was too hot for her.
Lily played with her friends and had lots of fun. They laughed and danced. Then, it was time to go home. Lily was a little sad, but she knew she would see her friends again soon. And she got to wear her pretty pink dress all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a bird who could fly. He had feathers that were delicate and soft. He lived in a big tree near a big lake.
One day, he wanted to see the world. He hopped out of his tree and flew and flew for hours. Eventually, he stopped to rest.
The bird landed in a luxurious garden. "Wow," he said, looking around. Everything was so beautiful. He saw so many pretty plants and flowers. He also smelled something delicious.
Suddenly, he saw a little girl. She came up to him and said, "Hello! What are you doing here?" The bird replied, "I am just looking around. I'm so happy to have found such a nice place!" The little girl smiled and said, "You can stay here forever if you like!" The bird thanked her and said goodbye.
He then flew back to his tree, happy to have had a lovely day. He thought of the little girl he had met and the delicate beauty of the garden. What a luxury!

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to sing and dance on the stage. One day, her mommy took her to a talent show. Lily was so excited to perform in front of everyone. 
When it was her turn, she sang and danced her heart out. Everyone clapped and cheered for her. A man came up to her and said, "You were amazing! I want to pay you for your performance." 
Lily's mommy told the man that they didn't want any money, because Lily just loved to sing and dance. She was an honest girl who didn't care about money. Lily was just happy to be on the stage and have people enjoy her performance.

Gerry had always wanted a wide bedroom. He saw his friend's bedroom and wished he had one like it. It was so big and had a nice clear window with lots of room for a bed and drawers. 
One day, Gerry's parents decided to make his wish come true. With his help, they painted the walls purple and bought a new bed, a dresser and some shelves. The bedroom looked wide and beautiful. 
But the bedroom was too big for Gerry. He now regretted getting it. His parents said he could give away some of his things, but it still felt too big and lonely. 
Gerry learned an important lesson that day - things aren't always as great as they seem. He was glad his parents encouraged him to think before he acted, and he was determined never to regret anything again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to observe her neighbor, Mr. Fox. Mr. Fox was always anxious and busy. One day, Lily saw Mr. Fox looking very sad. She wanted to help him.
Lily went to her mom and asked, "Mom, can we make a cake for Mr. Fox?" Her mom said, "Sure, let's do it!" They made a big, yummy cake. Lily was very happy. She knew this cake would make Mr. Fox happy too.
Lily and her mom took the cake to Mr. Fox. When he saw the cake, his face lit up. He said, "Thank you, Lily!" Mr. Fox was not anxious anymore. He was happy. Lily learned that being kind to others can make them happy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to play with his toys and run around. One day, Tim saw a big wall in his yard. He was very curious and wanted to touch the wall.
Tim walked up to the wall, but he felt worried. He did not know what would happen if he touched the wall. His mom saw him and came over. She said, "It's okay to touch the wall, Tim. It won't hurt you." Tim felt better and touched the wall.
The wall was hard and a little cold. Tim was not worried anymore. He laughed and played near the wall. His mom was happy to see him having fun. They went inside and had a snack. The end.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went to his friend's house. Tim wanted to introduce his friend, Sam, to his new toy robot. Sam was very excited to meet the toy robot. They played with the robot in Sam's room. The room was very clean.
Tim was hungry, so they went to the kitchen. Sam opened the refrigerator to find some food. They saw many yummy things inside. They took out fruits and sandwiches to eat. They were very happy.
As they ate, something unexpected happened. The toy robot came to life! It walked to the refrigerator and took out some food too. Tim and Sam were surprised but they laughed. They now had a new friend to eat with. They all enjoyed their food together and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy man who lived in a big house. He liked to print pictures of animals every day. He had many animal friends who lived with him. They were happy together.
One day, the wealthy man printed a picture of a cat. The cat in the picture was very pretty. The man showed the picture to his animal friends. They all liked the picture and wanted to meet the pretty cat.
The next day, the wealthy man went to find the pretty cat. He looked around and found her sitting in a tree. He asked her to come live with him and his animal friends. The pretty cat agreed, and they all lived happily together.

Once upon a time, there was a little birdie who lived in a cozy nest high up in a tree. The birdie loved to sing and play with its siblings all day long. One day, a big storm came and troubled the nest. It shook and swayed, making the little birdie scared.
The little birdie's mommy came and said, "Don't worry, my dear. We will leave this nest and find a new one where we will be safe and happy." The little birdie was sad to leave its home, but it knew that it had to go.
The next day, the little birdie and its family found a new nest in a different tree. It was just as cozy and safe as the old one. The little birdie was happy again and sang a beautiful song to celebrate its new home. From that day on, the little birdie knew that it could face any trouble as long as it had its family by its side.

Once upon a time, there was a small dog named Bob. Bob loved to play outside. One day, his mom put a leash on him and they went for a walk.
While they walked, Bob saw a big red ball. He wanted to play with it. But the leash was too short. Bob felt sad. Then, something unexpected happened.
A little girl came to play with Bob. She had a long leash. She gave it to Bob's mom. Now, Bob could play with the big red ball. Bob was so happy and he loved his new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a dancer named Lily. She loved to dance and twirl around. Her dress was bright pink and sparkly, just like her smile. 
One day, Lily went to a dance class. Her friends were there too. They learned new dance moves that included jumping and spinning. Lily was so happy to be with her friends and dance together. 
After the dance class, Lily went home and practiced her new moves. She danced and twirled until she was tired. Then, she went to bed with dreams of dancing in her head. The end.

Once upon a time, a little dog named Spot lived in a small house. Spot loved to play with his hoop. One day, he could not find his hoop. Spot was sad.
Spot went outside to look for his hoop. He saw his friend, Kitty, playing with a hoop. "Can I play with your hoop?" Spot asked. Kitty said, "Yes, you can play with my hoop. It is available."
Spot and Kitty entered the park with the hoop. They played and had fun. They took turns jumping through the hoop. They were very happy. And from that day on, Spot and Kitty always shared hoops and played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the river to see the otters. She loved to watch them swim and play. One day, she saw a small, fragile otter who looked sad.
Lily asked the otter, "Why are you sad?" The otter replied, "I lost my toy in the river and cannot find it." Lily said, "I can help you find it. Let's look together."
They searched and searched, but they couldn't find the toy. Lily said, "Don't worry, little otter. I will let you play with my toy instead." The otter was so happy and they played together all day long. From that day on, they became the best of friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play in the park. She would swing on the swings and slide down the slide. One day, while she was playing, she found a shiny necklace on the ground. She didn't know who it belonged to, but she decided to keep it.
The next day, Lily went back to the park to play, but she couldn't find her necklace. She looked everywhere, but it was gone. She felt sad and didn't know what to do. She wished she had never found the necklace because now it was gone and she couldn't remember what it looked like.
Lily went home and told her mom what happened. Her mom told her that sometimes it's better to give things back to their owners, even if they are unknown. Lily realized that her memory of the necklace was more important than keeping it. She wanted to thank whoever lost it for the happy memory it gave her. But she never found out who the owner was, and so she never got to thank them.

Tom and Anna were twins. They liked to play with their toys and make up stories. One day, they decided to celebrate their birthday. They put on their party hats and blew their horns. They sang a happy song and ate some cake.
But then, they saw a big problem. Their toy volcano was making noise and smoke. It was going to erupt. They were scared. They did not want their toys to get burned.
"Quick, we have to stop it!" Tom said.
"How?" Anna asked.
Tom had an idea. He ran to the kitchen and got some water. He poured it on the volcano. The smoke stopped. The volcano was quiet.
"Yay, you did it!" Anna said. She hugged Tom.
They were happy. They went back to their party. They played with their toys and made up more stories. They had a fun birthday. They were not scared of the volcano anymore. They were brave.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she was playing in her yard when she saw smoke coming out of the chimney. She asked her mom, "Why is the chimney smoking?" Her mom said, "It's because Daddy is making a fire to keep us warm."
Lily went inside to see her dad. She asked him, "Daddy, why is the fire making the chimney smoke?" Her dad said, "The fire is burning the wood and the smoke goes up the chimney."
Later that day, Lily's friend came over to play. They were having fun when suddenly, Lily's mom called them inside. She said, "It's time for dinner!" They went inside to eat and Lily's mom gave them some chicken. Lily's friend said, "This chicken is dry." Lily's mom said, "I'm sorry, I'll make sure it's juicier next time." 
After dinner, Lily's dad rang a bell to signal that it was time for bed. Lily and her friend went to sleep, dreaming of the fun they would have tomorrow.

Imagine a street. It was a busy street, with lots of people running around. But two kids ran the fastest of all.
Their names were Jenny and Jane. They were very competitive and always wanted to finish first! Whenever they raced, they ran their hardest.
One day they raced to the end of the street. They ran so fast that they forgot to look around and enjoy the scenery.
In the end, Jenny won by just a bit - she was the first one to reach the end of the street. Jane was not too pleased, but they quickly hugged and decided to race each other another day.
They both had so much fun racing each other on the street!

Lily had a rag that she loved very much. It was soft and pink and had a bunny face on it. She took it everywhere with her, even to bed. She called it Bun-Bun.
One day, Lily went to the park with her mom and dad. She brought Bun-Bun with her and played on the swings and the slide. She was very happy. But then, she saw a big dog running towards her. She was scared and ran to her mom and dad. She forgot to take Bun-Bun with her.
"Mom, Dad, where is Bun-Bun?" she asked, looking around.
"Oh no, Lily, you left him on the slide!" her mom said. "Let's go and get him."
But when they got to the slide, Bun-Bun was gone. Someone had taken him. Lily felt very sad and cried.
"Who took my Bun-Bun?" she sobbed.
"I don't know, Lily, I'm sorry," her dad said. "Maybe we can find another rag for you."
But Lily did not want another rag. She wanted Bun-Bun. She missed him so much. She could not sleep at night. She was very unhappy.
She never saw Bun-Bun again. She lost her best friend. It was a very bad day.

One day, a little frog named Tim saw an enormous violin. It was so big and pretty. Tim wanted to play the violin, but he was too small. He thought about how he could play it.
Tim had an idea. He called his friends, the birds. The birds were good at flying and could help him. They picked Tim up and flew him to the violin. Tim was so happy. He started to jump on the strings to make music.
As Tim jumped and played, something unexpected happened. The enormous violin began to shrink! It became smaller and smaller until it was just the right size for Tim. Now, Tim could play the violin all by himself. He played beautiful music and thanked his bird friends for their help.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a bit foolish. One day, he went outside to play. It started to rain, but Tim did not want to go inside. He liked the rain.
Tim saw a frog and said, "Hi, frog! I like the rain. Do you like the rain too?" The frog said, "Yes, I love the rain! But you should put on a coat so you don't get cold."
Tim thought for a moment and said, "You are right, frog. I will go put on my coat." He ran inside and put on his coat. Then, he went back outside to play in the rain with the frog.
They played and laughed in the rain until the sun came out. Tim and the frog were happy they could play in the rain together. From that day on, Tim always remembered to put on his coat when it rained.

Lily and Sam were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. They were happy and laughed a lot.
But then, a big dog came. It was not a nice dog. It was angry and loud. It barked and ran at them. Lily and Sam were scared. They tried to run away, but the dog was faster.
"Help, help!" Lily cried. "The dog is bad!"
Sam saw a stick on the ground. He picked it up and threw it at the dog. He hoped the dog would go away. But the dog did not. It jumped and bit Sam's arm. Sam felt a lot of hurt. He screamed and dropped the stick.
Lily ran to Sam. She saw the blood on his arm. She was very sad and scared. She hugged Sam and said, "I'm sorry, Sam. I'm sorry."
The dog was still there. It growled and showed its teeth. It wanted to bite them more. Lily and Sam had no one to help them. They were alone and in danger.
They sighed. They wished they had never come to the park. They wished they were at home with their mom and dad. They wished they had more oxygen to breathe. They wished they could be happy and laugh again. But they could not. The dog was bad. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the forest near her house. One day, she found a pine cone on the ground. She picked it up and felt its rough surface with her fingers. 
Lily was confused because she had never seen a pine cone before. She asked her mommy what it was, and her mommy said it was from a pine tree. 
Lily felt happy to learn something new and decided to keep the pine cone. She put it in her pocket and continued to play in the forest. From that day on, she loved to collect pine cones and feel their rough surfaces.

One day, a little red car named Zoomy loved to play a sport called racing. Zoomy was very fast and always won the races. All the other cars wanted to be like Zoomy.
One day, Zoomy saw a big, dead tree in the way of the race track. Zoomy said to the other cars, "Oh no! We can't race with that tree in the way!" The other cars were sad, but Zoomy had an idea.
Zoomy told the other cars, "Let's work together to move the tree!" So, all the cars pushed the dead tree off the track. Then, they all said, "Now we can race again!" And they all zoomed down the track, happy to play their sport.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to run fast. He would speed up and down the street, his feet hitting the rough ground.
One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue said, "Let's race to the big tree!" Tim agreed, and they both got ready to run. "Ready, set, go!" they shouted together, and they began to speed down the street.
As they ran, Tim looked back to see how far Sue was behind him. But he didn't see the big rock in front of him. Tim tripped and fell, hurting his knee very badly. He cried and cried, as his knee was in pain.
Sue came running to help Tim. She said, "I told you not to run too fast on the rough ground!" But it was too late. Tim's knee was too hurt, and he could not run fast anymore. From that day on, Tim always walked slowly and carefully.

Once upon a time, there was a big forest. In the forest, there was a small bug. The bug was sad because he wanted to become huge. He wanted to be big like the other animals in the forest.
One day, the bug met a wise old owl. The bug said, "I want to become huge. Can you help me?" The owl thought for a moment and said, "I have a magic weapon. If you touch it, you will become huge."
The bug was very excited. He touched the magic weapon and, just like that, he became huge! The bug was so happy to be big. But then, something unexpected happened.
As the bug became huge, he also became very slow. The other animals in the forest started to laugh at him. The bug was sad again. He realized being huge was not so great after all. So, he asked the wise old owl to make him small again. The owl used the magic weapon to make the bug small once more. The bug learned that it was better to be happy with who he was, rather than trying to be something he was not.

Joey was confused. He couldn't figure out why everyone was celebrating. There was balloons, music, and lots of people. He watched as his mom waved a strange object around. It looked like a pistol, but he was sure it couldn't be. His mom would never have one of those! He approached her and asked what was going on.
"We're celebrating, Joey!" His mom said. "This is a special pistol. See? It doesn't hurt people, it just makes a loud noise." Joey was relieved. He realized that the strange object his mom was waving around was actually a toy. Everyone was just having fun.
Joey smiled as he joined the celebration. He picked up another toy pistol, and joined the others in making loud noises. Even the grownups were joining in the fun. What a day to remember!

Billy was a three year old boy. He had a lollipop in his hand and he wanted to use it. But his mom wouldn't let him. "You can't have it yet," she said, "It's still too early." Billy frowned. He really wanted the lollipop. He thought it looked fun and delicious.
But his mom shook her head. "No, Billy," she said sternly. "I said no. You can have it later. Now, let's go make something else. Let's make a disgusting sandwich!"
Billy was upset. He didn't want to make a sandwich because he wanted the lollipop. But his mom wouldn't let him have it. He held the lollipop in his hand and looked sadly out the window. He just wanted to use the lollipop! 
Finally, his mom saw the look on his face and said, "Ok, Billy. I can see you really want it. Here, you can have it. But don't eat it all at once. That would be too much!"
Billy smiled and hugged his mom. He was so happy she let him use his lollipop. He licked it happily and savored the sweet taste.  Later, they made a delicious sandwich and Billy was just as happy as ever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat oatmeal for breakfast every day. One morning, her mom made her oatmeal but forgot to put any oats in it! Lily was very surprised and didn't know what to do. She missed the yummy oats in her oatmeal.
Later that day, Lily went to the park to play on the swings. But when she got there, she saw a big, scary dog. She was frightened and didn't want to go near it. Suddenly, the dog ran away and Lily felt much better.
When Lily got home, she told her mom about the missing oats and the scary dog. Her mom realized that she had accidentally used the wrong container for the oatmeal. They both laughed and Lily was happy to have her yummy oatmeal back.

Once upon a time, there was a red airplane with a pilot. The pilot loved to fly his airplane high in the sky. One day, the pilot got tired and wanted to quit flying. He landed his airplane and went to take a nap. 
While the pilot was sleeping, some birds came and perched on the airplane. They loved the bright red color of the plane. When the pilot woke up, he saw the birds and smiled. He realized that he loved flying too much to quit. So, he got back in his red airplane and flew high in the sky once again. 
The pilot never wanted to quit flying again. He loved the feeling of the wind in his hair and the birds soaring beside him. And the birds loved flying with the red airplane too!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play pretend with her toys. One day, she decided to play restaurant with her teddy bear, Mr. Snuggles.
Lily made a menu with pictures of yummy food. She showed it to Mr. Snuggles and asked, "What do you want to eat?" Mr. Snuggles didn't say anything because he was just a toy. Lily felt a little frustrated, but she didn't give up. She pointed to the food on the menu and said, "I think you want this one!"
Lily went to the toy kitchen and pretended to cook the food for Mr. Snuggles. She brought the pretend food to him and said, "Here you go! Enjoy your meal!" Mr. Snuggles still didn't say anything, but Lily knew he was happy. They played restaurant all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to read her magazine, and she would read it every day. One day, she saw a picture of a dangerous lion in her magazine. The lion was big and scary, but Lily wanted to learn more about it.
Lily went to the zoo with her mom and dad to see the dangerous lion. When they got there, they saw that the lion's cage was not complete. The lion saw Lily and her family, and it came closer to them. Lily's mom and dad were scared, but Lily was not.
Lily saw that the lion was not dangerous, but just wanted to be friends. She talked to the lion, and the lion talked back. They became best friends, and the lion went back into its cage. The zookeepers came and completed the cage. The moral of the story is that sometimes things that look dangerous might not be, and we can learn from them.

Once upon a time, there was a brave fox named Foxy. One day, Foxy was walking in the forest when he saw a little bird's nest. Foxy wanted to see the baby birds, so he climbed up the tree. But when he got to the nest, he accidentally broke one of the eggs.
The little bird was very sad and started to cry. Foxy felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, little bird. I didn't mean to break your egg. I will try to make it up to you."
Foxy then went to find some food for the little bird and brought it back to the nest. The little bird was very happy and said, "Thank you, Foxy. You are a good friend." Foxy felt happy too and learned that it's important to be careful and kind to others.

Once upon a time, there was a child named Tim. Tim was a regular child who loved to play outside. One day, he saw a big frog. The frog could spring very high. Tim wanted to be friends with the frog.
"Hi, frog! Can we play?" Tim asked. The frog did not want to play with Tim. The frog said, "No, I only play with other frogs." Tim was sad. He wanted to find a way to play with the frog.
Tim thought and thought. He had an idea. He found some green paint and painted himself like a frog. He went back to the big frog and said, "Look, I am a frog now! Can we play?" The big frog laughed and said, "You are not a real frog, but you are funny. Let's play!"
They played all day, springing high in the air. Tim learned that sometimes, it is good to be different. It can make new friends and have fun. The big frog learned that being kind to others is important, too. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a big, soft bear named Ben. Mia and Ben were best friends. They played together every day.
One day, Mia was sad because she fell down and hurt her knee. Ben saw Mia cry and wanted to help. Ben said, "Mia, let me give you a hug to comfort you." Mia smiled and hugged Ben. The hug made Mia feel better.
Later, Mia saw a boy crying because he lost his toy. Mia thought of Ben's brilliant idea. She said, "Can I give you a hug to comfort you?" The boy said yes, and Mia hugged him. The boy felt better, and they found his toy together. From that day, Mia learned that a hug can make others feel better too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She liked to dress up in her mom's big clothes. One day, she found a pretty dress in her mom's room. Sue put on the dress and felt very happy.
Sue wanted to have a tea party with her toys. She got a plate and put fake cookies on it. Her toys sat around the table, and they all had fun. Sue was very good at pouring tea for her toys.
But then, something unexpected happened. The plate with the fake cookies started to shake! The cookies jumped off the plate and began to dance! Sue and her toys were so surprised. They all laughed and clapped as the cookies danced around the room. It was the best tea party ever!

Once upon a time, a little birdie named Tweety found a twig. The twig was very small and brown. Tweety thought it was perfect for his nest. He picked it up and started to fly back to his nest. 
But then, a big and scary cat named Tom saw Tweety with the twig. Tom wanted to eat Tweety, but he also wanted the twig for his own nest. Tom started to chase Tweety. Tweety was very scared and flew as fast as he could. 
Tweety flew and flew until he saw a kind man with a car. The man opened the car door and Tweety flew inside. The man started to drive the car away from Tom. Tom couldn't catch up with the car, and Tweety was safe. Tweety felt very lucky to have found such a rare and special twig, and he was happy to be safe in the car with the kind man.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a funny monkey named Momo. Momo loved to play in the trees and eat bananas. One day, while Momo was swinging from tree to tree, it started to rain. The rain made the trees wet and slippery.
Momo did not like the rain because it made it hard for him to play. He tried to keep playing, but he slipped and fell. Momo felt sad and wanted the rain to stop. He thought of a plan to make the rain go away.
Momo found a big leaf and held it over his head like an umbrella. He climbed to the top of the tallest tree and waved the leaf at the sky. The rain stopped and the sun came out. Momo was happy again and could play in the forest with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet cat named Max. Max was a fierce cat, but he loved Lily very much. They liked to play together every day.
One day, Lily and Max went for a walk. They found a small bird under a tree. The bird was hungry, so Lily decided to feed it. She found some seeds nearby and gave them to the bird. The bird was very happy.
After feeding the bird, Lily and Max went back home. They had a great day helping their new friend. From that day on, the bird would visit Lily and Max, and they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy cat named Fluffy. Fluffy lived in a big house with lots of toys. Fluffy loved to play with her favorite toy, a long strip of cloth.
One day, Fluffy saw a little mouse in the house. The mouse was struggling to reach a piece of cheese on the table. Fluffy wanted to help the mouse, so she said, "Mouse, I can help you get the cheese. I have a long strip we can use."
The mouse looked at Fluffy and said, "Thank you, Fluffy. Let's try." Fluffy and the mouse used the long strip to reach the cheese. They pulled the cheese off the table together.
Fluffy and the mouse shared the cheese and became good friends. They played with the long strip every day and had lots of fun. And they lived happily ever after.

Jane was a shy three year old. She often admired her classmate, Emma, from afar. Emma was so brave and confident and always seemed to know what to do.
One day, Jane and Emma were playing together and Jane saw something special about her. Emma had a kind sparkle in her eyes. Jane really admired Emma for it.
When it was time for school the next day, Jane walked in and saw Emma talking to the teacher. Emma looked even more confiden than usual. Jane noticed that the teacher was admiring Emma too.
The teacher asked Emma to be the leader of the class and lead everyone in clapping. Emma smiled, no longer shy. Jane was so proud of her friend and smiled from ear to ear!
At the end of the day, the teacher told everyone that Emma was the best and brightest pupil in the class. Jane couldn't help but admire Emma even more for her hard work and courage.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One sunny day, she went to her garden to pick some tomatoes. She saw a big red tomato and wanted to touch it. But it was too distant, so she had to walk a little bit closer. Finally, she reached the tomato and touched it gently. It felt soft and squishy. She was so happy that she picked it and ran inside to show her mom. Her mom was proud of her and they made a yummy tomato salad together. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to paint and draw pictures. One day, while she was painting, she accidentally spilled some bright blue paint on the carpet. She knew she would get punished by her mom.
Later that day, her mom saw the blue stain on the carpet and was very angry. She told Lily that she couldn't play with her toys for the rest of the day. Lily was sad and went to her room.
But then, something unexpected happened. As Lily was sitting in her room, she noticed a nail sticking out of the wall. She had never seen it before. She pulled on it and a secret door opened! Inside was a treasure chest filled with toys and candy. Lily was so happy and forgot all about being punished. She played with her new toys and ate candy until it was time for bed. From that day on, she knew that even when things seemed bad, something good might be just around the corner.

Once there was a blue bird. He liked to help people. One day, he was flying over a big town. He saw a man walking in the street with a loud voice. The blue bird wanted to help him.
He flew over to the man and said "Be quiet". The man did not understand and kept talking loudly. So the blue bird tried again. He asked the man "Can I help you?".
The man looked up and smiled. He said "Yes, please help me. I need to find a quiet place."
The blue bird knew just the place. He flew with the man to a park with a big, blue lake. The lake was so quiet, it was almost like there was no sound.
The man thanked the blue bird and said "Thank you for all your help". The blue bird was very happy and flew away. He had helped someone and that made him very proud.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to watch videos on his mom's phone. He would watch them all day long. One day, Tim's mom said, "Tim, you need to become more dependable. You can't watch videos all day. You need to help me with some chores."
Tim didn't want to help with chores. He just wanted to watch videos. So, he said, "Okay, Mom. I will be dependable and help." But he didn't really mean it. He just wanted to keep watching videos.
Later that day, Tim's mom asked him to take out the trash. But Tim was still watching videos. He didn't take out the trash. Then, his mom asked him to help clean up the toys. But Tim was still watching videos. He didn't clean up the toys. At night, Tim's mom was very sad. She said, "Tim, you didn't become dependable. You didn't help me at all today." Tim felt bad, but he didn't stop watching videos. The house stayed messy, and Tim's mom was sad.

Once upon a time, there was a happy cow named Betsy. Betsy lived on a colorful ranch with lots of other animals. One day, Betsy saw a small seed in the ground. "What is that?" she asked her friend, the horse. "That's a seed. It will grow into a big plant," said the horse. "Wow! I want to grow too!" said Betsy. 
So, Betsy ate the seed and waited to grow. But, instead of growing big and strong, Betsy got sick. She had eaten a bad seed and it made her very ill. All the other animals on the ranch tried to help her, but it was too late. Betsy passed away, and everyone was very sad. 
The farmer came and saw the sad animals. "What happened?" he asked. They told him about Betsy and the bad seed. The farmer was sad too, but he knew that sometimes bad things happen. So, he buried Betsy on the ranch and planted a new seed in her memory. And, that seed grew into a beautiful plant that everyone loved.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to cook. She was always eager to try new recipes and loved to add pepper to everything she made. One day, Lily was making some popcorn on the stove when she accidentally left the pot on the burner for too long. The popcorn started to burn and smoke filled the kitchen.
Lily's mom came running into the kitchen and asked, "What happened?" Lily replied, "I burned the popcorn, Mommy." Her mom quickly turned off the stove and opened the windows to let the smoke out. 
After the smoke cleared, Lily's mom sat her down and explained to her that cooking can be dangerous and she needs to be careful. She also reminded her to always ask for help when she needs it. 
The moral of the story is that accidents can happen when we are not careful, but we can learn from our mistakes and ask for help when we need it.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up and wear pretty clothes. One day, Lily's mom brought home a big box. Inside the box was a beautiful dress that Lily had never seen before. 
Lily's mom told her that the dress was locked inside the box and they needed a key to unlock it. Lily was very excited to see what was inside. She helped her mom look for the key and finally they found it. 
When they unlocked the box, Lily was amazed by the beautiful dress. It was pink and sparkly and just her size. She put it on right away and felt so fashionable. She twirled and danced around the room, feeling ready for anything. From that day on, Lily wore her new dress whenever she wanted to feel special.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots all day long. One day, Benny saw a big lion walking towards him. The lion roared and Benny got scared. 
The lion said, "Hello little rabbit, can you help me find my way home? I am lost." Benny was surprised that the lion was not trying to hurt him. Benny said, "Sure, I can help you. Just follow me."
