Once upon a time, there was an ordinary boy named Timmy. He liked to play with his toys and go on adventures in his backyard. One day, he found a shiny crown and decided to wear it. "Look, Mommy! I'm a king!" he said with a big smile.
But his mom warned him, "You can't keep that crown, Timmy. It belongs to someone else." Timmy didn't listen and kept wearing the crown, feeling like a powerful king.
Later that day, a man came to their house looking for his lost crown. Timmy's mom explained what happened and returned the crown. But the man was angry and took Timmy away, saying he stole from the king. Timmy didn't understand what was happening and cried for his mommy.
The bad man took Timmy far away from his home and family, and Timmy never saw them again. He learned a hard lesson that day about taking things that don't belong to him.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy who wanted something to make him happy. He wanted a new toy, something special and expensive. He went to the shop and gazed at all the toys. He saw something he liked and asked the shopkeeper how much it cost.
The shopkeeper told him it was very expensive and he had to measure the price carefully. The little boy thought and thought, but he didn't have enough money. He was sad but eventually decided to pick a smaller, cheaper toy. He was still very happy with it and played with it for hours. The end.

One day, a little girl named Sue went for a walk. She saw a big tree with lots of red berries. Sue said, "Wow, these berries look yummy!" She picked some berries and put them in her bag.
Sue walked more and saw a little boy named Tim. Tim was sitting on the ground and looked sad. Sue asked, "Why are you sad?" Tim said, "I am bored. Today is a boring day." Sue showed Tim the berries and said, "Let's eat these together and play!"
Tim and Sue ate the berries and played under the big tree. They laughed and had fun. The day was not boring anymore. They became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big wish to have a pony. Every day, she would ask her parents for a pony. But her parents said they couldn't afford it. 
One day, Lily saw a toy pony in the store. It looked real, but it was fake. She asked her parents if she could have it. They said yes! Lily was so happy to have her own pony, even if it was fake. 
Lily played with her toy pony every day. She would ask it questions and pretend it could talk back to her. She loved her fake pony just as much as she would have loved a real one.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was playing with her toys when she heard her daddy's car coming home. She ran to the door and said, "Hi, Daddy! I missed you!"
Daddy said, "Hi, Lily! I have a surprise for you. We are going to the park!"
Lily was so happy and excited. She said, "Yay! I love the park!"
But when they got to the park, they saw that it was very crowded. Daddy became impatient because there were so many people. But then, something unexpected happened. The crowd started to increase and they saw a parade! Lily and Daddy were so happy and they danced along with the music. It was the best surprise ever!

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very patient boy. He liked to play with his toys and wait for his mom to come home from work. One day, Tim went to the park with his mom. They had a lot of fun playing on the swings and slides.
As they were playing, Tim saw a big puddle of water. He wanted to jump in it and make a big splash. But his mom said, "Be careful, Tim! You might slip and fall." Tim listened to his mom and walked around the puddle instead.
Later, when they were walking back to their house, Tim saw a little kitten stuck in a tree. He wanted to help the kitten, so he climbed the tree very carefully. Tim was very patient and didn't slip. He reached the kitten and helped it get down. The kitten was so happy, and Tim's mom was very proud of him. They all went back to their house and had a nice, warm dinner together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a favorite dress with a big open pocket. Sue loved to put things in her pocket. One day, she found a pretty thread on the ground. She put it in her open pocket and went to play.
Sue went to the store with her mom. Her mom needed to pay for some things. Sue saw a toy she wanted. Her mom said, "No, we can't buy that today." Sue was sad. She reached into her open pocket and felt her pretty thread. It made her smile.
Sue decided to go home and make something with her pretty thread. She made a bracelet and showed her mom. Her mom was so proud of her. Sue forgot about the toy she wanted at the store. She was happy with her pretty thread bracelet.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat jelly sandwiches every day. One day, Lily's mom sent her to the store to buy more jelly. 
Lily walked to the store and saw a charming puppy on the way. "Hello, little puppy!" said Lily. "Do you want to come with me to the store?" The puppy barked happily and followed Lily to the store. 
At the store, Lily picked out her favorite jelly and went to pay for it. The cashier said, "What a charming puppy you have! Can I pet him?" Lily said, "Sure!" and the cashier petted the puppy. 
On the way home, Lily said to the puppy, "Thank you for coming with me to the store. You're my best friend!" The puppy wagged his tail happily. When they got home, Lily's mom said, "You did a great job buying the jelly, Lily. And who is this charming puppy?" Lily said, "I found him on the way to the store. Can we keep him?" Her mom smiled and said, "Of course we can!" And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a graceful bird was flying in the sky. The bird felt cold, so it went to find a warm place. It saw a little girl named Lily playing in her yard.
The bird said, "Lily, I am cold. Can you help me?" Lily thought for a moment and said, "I will send you to my friend, the sun. He can make you warm." The bird was happy and thanked Lily.
Lily and the bird went to the sun. But when they got there, the sun was not warm. It was cold too! The sun said, "I am sorry, I cannot make you warm today." The bird was sad, but Lily had an idea. She took the bird home and they snuggled under a warm blanket. The bird was not cold anymore, and they were both happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to go to school because he got to play with his friends and learn new things. One day, Timmy and his friend Billy were walking to school when they saw a deep hole in the ground.
"Wow, that hole is really deep," said Timmy.
"Yeah, it's so deep that I can't even see the bottom," replied Billy.
As they were looking at the hole, they heard their teacher calling out to them from the school.
"Come on boys, it's time to go to class," the teacher said.
Timmy and Billy quickly ran to school, excited to learn new things. They told their teacher about the deep hole they saw on the way to school, and she reminded them to always be careful and stay away from dangerous places. Timmy and Billy learned an important lesson that day, and they couldn't wait to go back to school the next day to learn even more.

Lily was a little girl who loved birds. She liked to watch them fly in the sky and sing in the trees. She hoped to have a bird as a pet someday.
One day, she found a feather on the ground. It was blue and shiny and soft. She picked it up and put it in her pocket. She thought it was a gift from a bird.
She ran home to show her mom the feather. She knocked on the door and waited. Her mom opened the door and smiled.
"Hi, Lily. Did you have fun at the park?" she asked.
"Yes, mom. Look what I found!" Lily said. She took out the feather and held it up.
"Oh, what a beautiful feather! Where did you get it?" her mom asked.
"I found it on the ground. I think it's from a bird. Can I keep it, mom? Please?" Lily asked.
Her mom nodded. "Of course you can keep it, Lily. It's yours. But you have to be careful with it. It's very delicate and fragile. Don't pull it or tear it or lose it, okay?"
"Okay, mom. I will be very obedient. I will take good care of it. Thank you, mom!" Lily said. She hugged her mom and kissed her cheek.
She ran to her room and put the feather on her pillow. She looked at it and smiled. She hoped the bird that gave it to her was happy and free. She hoped to see it again someday. She hoped to be its friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet parrot named Polly. Polly was very colorful and could talk. One day, Lily was playing with Polly when she accidentally slipped and fell down. She hurt her knee and started crying.
Polly saw that Lily was hurt and wanted to help her. Polly flew to the kitchen and got a band-aid. She brought it back to Lily and helped her put it on her knee. Lily felt much better and gave Polly a big hug.
From that day on, Lily learned that accidents can happen, but it's important to have friends like Polly who can help you when you get hurt.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved music and he always wanted to play the trumpet. One day, Timmy's mom went to the store to buy him a trumpet. She came back with a shiny black trumpet. Timmy was so happy! He practiced every day and soon he became very good. 
One day, Timmy was playing his trumpet in the park. A little girl heard him playing and she loved it. She asked Timmy if she could try playing the trumpet too. Timmy said yes and he brought the trumpet over to her. The little girl tried playing the trumpet, but it was hard for her. Timmy helped her and soon she was able to play a little tune. They played together and everyone in the park loved it. 
From that day on, Timmy and the little girl played their trumpets together every day in the park. They became great friends and everyone loved listening to them play. Timmy was so happy that his mom had brought him the black trumpet.

Once upon a time, there was a little rat. This rat was very humble. He did not like to show off. He was very nice to all his friends.
One day, the rat was playing with his friends. They were having a lot of fun. But then, one of his friends got hurt. The friend started to cry.
The humble rat went to his friend. He said, "Do not cry. I will help you." The rat helped his friend feel better. They all played together again. They were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and look at the stars at night. One day, she found a smelly old shoe while playing in the park.
Lily's friend, Timmy, saw her with the smelly shoe and said, "Ew, that's gross! Why are you playing with that?"
Lily replied, "I'm sorry, Timmy. I just thought it was interesting. Do you forgive me?"
Timmy smiled and said, "Of course, Lily! Friends forgive each other. Hey, let's go look at the stars together tonight!"
Lily learned that it's important to ask for forgiveness when you make a mistake and that true friends will always forgive you. They spent the night looking at the stars and talking about how much they loved each other.

Once upon a time, there was a cute little puppy named Max. Max loved to play in the mud and get dirty. One day, Max's owner said, "Max, it's time for you to take a bath!" Max didn't like baths, but he knew he had to do it. 
Max's owner filled up the bathtub with warm water and put some soap in it. Max climbed into the tub and his owner scrubbed him clean. After his bath, Max felt so fresh and clean. 
Later that day, Max needed to go potty. He ran to the toilet and did his business. Max's owner was so proud of him for using the toilet like a big boy. Max wagged his tail happily. 
From that day on, Max knew that even though he didn't like baths, they were important to keep him clean and healthy. And he also knew that using the toilet was a good thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with pastels and make pretty pictures. One day, Lily's mom came into her room and saw how tidy it was. "Wow, Lily, your room is so neat and clean! I admire how well you take care of your things," said her mom.
Lily smiled and showed her mom her latest drawing. "Look, Mommy! I made a picture of a flower garden," said Lily. Her mom looked at the picture and was amazed at how beautiful it was. "Lily, you are so talented! I admire your creativity," said her mom.
Lily was so happy to hear her mom's kind words. She decided to give her mom the drawing as a gift. "Here, Mommy, this is for you. I made it just for you because I love you," said Lily. Her mom hugged her tight and said, "Thank you, Lily. I will treasure this pastel drawing always."

Once upon a time, there was a small fish named Fin. Fin lived in the big sea with his family. One day, Fin saw a pretty shell near the shore. He wanted to take it to his mom as a gift.
As Fin swam closer to the shore, he met a crab named Carl. Carl said, "Hi, Fin! What are you doing here?" Fin replied, "I want to get that pretty shell for my mom. Can you help me?" Carl agreed to help Fin and they both went to the shore together.
When they reached the shore, they picked up the pretty shell. Fin said, "Thank you, Carl!" Carl said, "You're welcome, Fin! Let's go back to the sea." They swam back to the sea and Fin gave the shell to his mom. She was very happy and hugged Fin. From that day on, Fin and Carl became best friends and always played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run around in the sun. One day, while she was playing, she fell and hurt her leg. It hurt so much that she had to go to the hospital.
At the hospital, Lily met a boy named Max. Max was very sad and looked miserable. Lily asked him why he was sad. Max said he had to stay in the hospital for a long time because he was sick. Lily felt bad for Max and wanted to help him feel better.
Lily decided to choose a toy from her bag and give it to Max. Max was so happy and thanked Lily. From that day on, Lily and Max became friends and played together in the hospital. They were no longer miserable because they had each other to play with.

One day, a happy dog named Spot and a sad cat named Whiskers went for a walk. They came to a creek. The water in the creek was cool and clear. Spot wanted to play in the water, but Whiskers did not.
Spot said, "Come on, Whiskers! Let's play in the creek!" But Whiskers did not want to. Whiskers said, "No, Spot. I don't want to get wet." Spot and Whiskers disagreed.
Spot jumped into the creek and splashed around. He had so much fun! Whiskers watched from the side. After a while, Whiskers saw how much fun Spot was having. Whiskers thought, "Maybe it's not so bad."
Whiskers put one paw in the creek. It felt nice! Whiskers jumped in and played with Spot. They splashed and laughed together. The sad cat was now a happy cat.
After playing in the creek, Spot and Whiskers walked home. They were wet but very happy. They learned that sometimes it's good to try new things, even if you disagree at first.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. Jack went to school every day and he loved his classroom. It was so big and impressive! One day, Jack's teacher Miss Sarah asked him to show the new student, Lily, around the classroom.
Jack was happy to help and he showed Lily everything in the classroom. When they got to the window, Jack saw his mom waving at him from outside. "Look, Lily! That's my mom waving at me!" Jack said excitedly.
Lily looked out the window and saw Jack's mom. "Wow, that's so cool!" Lily said. Jack felt proud that he could show Lily something so special. From that day on, Jack and Lily became good friends and they always waved at Jack's mom together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and catch bugs. One day, Timmy saw a big yacht in the lake near his house. He asked his mom, "Mommy, what is that big boat?" His mom replied, "That is a yacht, Timmy. It's a very big and fancy boat."
Timmy was amazed by the yacht and wanted to take a closer look. He ran to the lake and saw a mighty man on the yacht. The man saw Timmy and said, "Hello there little boy, would you like to come aboard my yacht?" Timmy was so excited and replied, "Yes please!"
The man helped Timmy onto the yacht and they had a fun conversation. Timmy asked the man, "What do you do on your yacht?" The man replied, "I like to sail around the world and catch fish." Timmy thought that was very cool and said, "I want to catch fish too!" The man smiled and said, "Maybe one day you will have your own mighty yacht and catch lots of fish too." Timmy was so happy and couldn't wait to tell his mom about his adventure on the yacht.

Anna liked to sort her toys by color and shape. She had a big box of cones, balls, cubes and stars. She put the red cones in one pile, the blue cones in another pile, and so on. She did the same for the balls, cubes and stars. She was very proud of her work.
One day, her brother Ben came into her room. He was older and bigger than Anna. He did not like to sort his toys. He liked to make a mess. He saw Anna's piles of cones, balls, cubes and stars. He thought they looked boring. He wanted to have some fun.
He grabbed a handful of cones and threw them in the air. He kicked the balls and rolled them around. He tossed the cubes and stars on the floor. He laughed and shouted. He did not care that he was ruining Anna's work.
Anna was very sad and angry. She cried and yelled at Ben. She told him to stop and go away. She said he was ignorant and mean. She did not understand why he did not respect her toys. She tried to pick up the cones, balls, cubes and stars and put them back in their piles.
Ben did not listen to Anna. He thought she was silly and boring. He did not understand why she liked to sort her toys. He thought it was more fun to make a mess. He did not care that he was hurting Anna's feelings. He was ignorant and rude. He kept playing with the cones, balls, cubes and stars. He did not stop until their mom came in and scolded him.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a big, purple calendar. It was very pretty. She put it on her wall. Each day, she looked at the calendar to know which day it was. 
One night, Lily heard a voice. It said, "Boo! I will scare you!" Lily was scared. She looked around her room, but she could not see who was talking. The voice said, "I am the purple calendar!" Lily was surprised. She did not know that calendars could talk.
The next day, Lily told her friend, Tom, about the talking calendar. Tom said, "Let's go see it!" They went to Lily's room. The calendar did not talk. Tom laughed and said, "I was the one who scared you! I was hiding under your bed." Lily laughed too. They were not scared anymore.

Tommy loves blueberries. He likes to eat them for breakfast, snack, and dessert. He likes to pick them from the bush in his backyard. He likes to make them into pies and muffins with his mom.
One day, Tommy sees a big blueberry on the bush. It is the biggest and juiciest blueberry he has ever seen. He wants to eat it right away. He reaches for it, but it is too high. He jumps, but he cannot touch it. He gets a stool, but he still cannot reach it. He is frustrated. He wants the blueberry so much.
He sees a bird flying over the bush. The bird has a long beak and shiny feathers. It is a blue jay. The blue jay sees the blueberry too. It wants to eat it as well. It swoops down and grabs the blueberry in its beak. It flies away with the blueberry.
Tommy is angry. He runs after the blue jay. He yells, "Give me back my blueberry!" He follows the blue jay across the yard, over the fence, and into the woods. He does not see where he is going. He does not see the rocks, the roots, and the branches. He trips and falls. He scrapes his knee and his elbow. He cries.
The blue jay hears Tommy cry. It feels sorry for him. It drops the blueberry on the ground near Tommy. It flies away. Tommy sees the blueberry. He is happy. He picks it up and wipes it with his shirt. He eats it. It is sweet and sour. He smiles. He says, "Thank you, blue jay." He goes back home. He tells his mom what happened. She hugs him and gives him a band-aid. She says, "I'm proud of you, Tommy. You followed your dream."

Once upon a time there was a graceful ladybird. She was always busy, buzzing here and there. One day she decided to take a rest. She had a special spot in the garden where she would always go when she wanted to relax.
The ladybird spread her wings and glided gracefully to the spot. She closed her eyes and listened to the different songs that were in the air. She eventually decided that she wanted to sing a song of her own.
She spread her wings again and this time she flew upwards. Everywhere she flew, she sang a gentle, graceful tune. The birds were all so amazed at the ladybird's song. They all stood still and listened in awe.
When she was finished, the other animals all clapped and cheered for the ladybird. She was so pleased to hear this and decided to sing her song again. Everyone was even more amazed this time, and the ladybird flew away feeling very happy and content.

It was time to go to the classroom. Mommy and Tom said goodbye, and each gave him a big hug before he left. On the way to the classroom, Tom noticed something strange. A store near the school had a very big window and Tom could see lots and lots of toys there! He wanted to play with them, but he knew he couldn't. So Tom waited and waited, until it was time to go back to the classroom.
When the bell rang, Tom was so excited. This meant he could finally go to the store! He raced to the store and went inside. But there were no toys! Instead, there were lots of other items like food, books, and clothes. Tom was frustrated. All of the fun things were gone! He looked around, trying to find something that he could play with. 
But then, he saw something--a basket full of toys! They were the same toys that he had seen in the window of the store. He couldn't believe it--all the toys that he wanted to play with had been store! He was so excited and couldn't wait to tell his friends. Now he knew, from then on, always look in the store to find the things he needs!

One day, a dog and his owner went to the park. The park had wide, open spaces for them to play. The dog liked to run and jump, and the owner liked to watch him.
While they were playing, a big cat came into the park. The cat was not nice. It wanted to take the dog's toy. The dog said, "No, that is my toy!" But the cat did not listen.
The dog asked his owner for help. The owner said, "Don't worry, I will help you." They both went to the cat and said, "Please give back the toy." The cat saw that the dog and the owner were together, and it gave back the toy. The dog and the owner were happy, and they went back to playing in the wide park.

Once upon a time, there was a smooth gray rock. It lived in a big park with lots of trees and flowers. The rock loved to listen to the birds sing and the children play.
One sunny day, a little bird came to sit on the rock. The bird sang a pretty song. The rock wanted to sing too, but it didn't know how. So, the rock asked the bird, "Can you teach me your song?"
The bird said, "Of course! Just repeat after me." The bird sang its song again, and the rock tried to repeat the song. But the rock didn't have a voice! The bird and the rock laughed together. They knew the rock couldn't sing, but they had fun trying.
From that day on, the bird and the rock became best friends. They played together in the park every day. The bird sang songs and the rock listened. They were happy to be together. And the smooth gray rock learned that even if it couldn't sing, it could still bring joy to its friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her purple pencil. One day, she was drawing a picture of a flower when her friend Timmy came over.
"Hi Lily!" Timmy said.
"Hi Timmy!" Lily said back.
"What are you drawing?" Timmy asked.
"I'm drawing a flower with my purple pencil," Lily said.
"It's so pretty!" Timmy said.
"Thank you!" Lily said, smiling. "Do you want to draw with me?"
"Yes, please!" Timmy said, grabbing his own pencil. They drew together for a long time, and Lily was happy to have a friend to share her purple pencil with.

One day, a little girl named True went to the park with her mom. True saw a cheap toy in the park. It was a small ball that could glow. She picked it up and said, "Mom, look! It glows!"
Her mom said, "That's nice, True. But it looks cheap. Let's play with it for a little while and then we can throw it away." True and her mom played with the glowing ball, and they had a lot of fun.
Suddenly, the ball started to glow very bright. True and her mom were surprised. The ball then opened up and a tiny fairy came out! The fairy said, "Thank you for playing with me. I was stuck in that cheap ball. Now, I can go home." The fairy flew away, and True and her mom were happy they could help.

Once upon a time, there was an old man who loved music. He played the guitar and sang songs all day long. One day, a little girl passed by his house and heard the music. She stopped and listened to the old man's beautiful songs. 
"Hello," said the old man. "Do you like my music?" 
"Yes," replied the little girl. "It's very nice." 
"Would you like to sing with me?" asked the old man. 
The little girl nodded and they sang together. From that day on, the little girl passed by the old man's house every day to sing and play music with him. And they both lived happily ever after.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a big pipe near his house. Tim thought it would be fun to play catch with the pipe. He called his friend, Sam, to play with him.
"Let's play catch with this pipe!" said Tim. Sam was happy and said, "Yes, let's play!" They took turns throwing the pipe to each other. They were having a lot of fun.
But then, the pipe got stuck in a tree. Tim and Sam were sad. They tried to get the pipe down, but they couldn't. A tall man saw them and came to help. He reached up and got the pipe down for them.
"Thank you!" said Tim and Sam. They were very grateful. The tall man smiled and said, "You're welcome! Have fun playing!" Tim and Sam continued to play catch with the pipe and had a great day.

Once there was a cat and a mouse. They were good friends. They played together, laughed together, and took long naps together. One day, the mouse was feeling worried. He wanted to tell the cat, but he didn't know how. So he just sighed. He looked so sad and he tapped his foot.
The cat heard the mouse sighing and saw that he was worried. She asked him what was wrong. The mouse told the cat his problem. He was worried because he wanted a cookie, but he didn't know where to find one. 
The cat smiled, because she knew exactly where to find the cookie. She told him to follow her and she showed him where the kitchen was. Once they were there, the mouse spotted a delicious cookie on the table. He reached up and grabbed it and winked at the cat.
The mouse was no longer worried. He and the cat shared the cookie and laughed and smiled. They were friends forever!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside in the park. One day, she found a glove on the ground. It was tough and dirty, but she picked it up anyway.
As she was walking home, she saw a big tree. She decided to lean on it and rest for a bit. But as she leaned on the tree, she heard a strange noise. Suddenly, a squirrel popped out of the glove she was holding!
Lily was so surprised and happy to see the little squirrel. She decided to take it home and make it her new pet. From that day on, Lily and the squirrel were the best of friends and had many fun adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer named Jack. He had a big farm with lots of animals like cows, pigs, and chickens. Every day, Jack would wake up early and work hard on his farm. He would feed the animals, water the crops, and fix broken fences.
One day, a big tornado came and destroyed everything on Jack's farm. The cows, pigs, and chickens were all gone. Jack was very sad and guilty because he thought he didn't work hard enough to protect his farm.
But then, Jack's neighbors came to help him. They all worked together to clean up the mess and rebuild the farm. With everyone's hard work, the farm was even better than before. Jack was very happy and grateful for his kind neighbors.

One day, Billy and his family decided to go to school. Billy was so excited! He put on his blue T-shirt and shoes and took his lunch box. When they got to school, everything was blue: the walls, the floor, even the desks! Billy couldn’t believe it! He thought to himself this was the best school ever. 
But then something strange happened; the teacher asked all the kids to put away their lunch boxes and take out their pencils and paper. Billy got so nervous because he didn’t know what was coming. Soon, the teacher said the word "test", which made everyone so scared. Everyone got so quiet.
But then the teacher handed out a blue paper with puzzles and riddles. Everyone started cheering and laughing. Everyone was so happy! They got to use their brains and have fun. Billy was so excited! He was no longer scared because it was nothing like he expected.
Going to school was one of the best days he had ever had. Even the blue walls and floors were a part of the fun! School wasn’t so scary after all.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her markers, but one day she ran out of ink. She asked her mom for more ink, but her mom said they didn't have any.
Lily was sad, but then she had an idea. She went to her dad's office and saw a big bottle of ink on his desk. She took the bottle and started to draw with it. But then something unexpected happened - the ink spilled all over her favorite dress! 
Lily was very upset and started to cry. Her dad came in and saw what happened. He warned Lily to never take things without asking first. But then he surprised her by saying he had a special surprise for her. He took her to the store and bought her a brand new set of markers. Lily was so happy and her dad told her that even though her dress was spoiled, she would always be his little artist.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Teddy. Teddy loved to play in the forest with his friends. They would run and jump and have so much fun together.
One day, Teddy's friend Billy mentioned that they should go on a hike. Teddy thought that was a great idea! They packed some snacks and water and started walking. The forest was very heavy with trees and bushes, but they didn't mind. They were having too much fun exploring.
As they walked, Teddy and Billy saw some beautiful flowers and animals. They even saw a big, blue bird with a long tail! Teddy had never seen anything like it before. They took lots of pictures to remember their adventure.
When they got back home, Teddy told his mom all about the hike and how much fun he had. She was so happy to hear about it. Teddy went to bed that night with a big smile on his face, dreaming about his next adventure in the forest with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and dress them up in pretty blouses. One day, Lily's mom asked her to help mix the cake batter for her birthday party.
Lily was excited to help and mixed the batter with a big spoon. Suddenly, the spoon broke and flew into the air! Lily and her mom were surprised, but then they started to laugh.
Lily's mom said, "Well, I guess we'll have to mix the batter with our hands now!" Lily thought that was funny and they both giggled. They mixed the batter together and the cake turned out delicious. Everyone at the party loved it, especially Lily. The end.

Tommy liked to march. He marched with his toy soldiers, he marched with his drum, he marched with his dog. He marched all over the house, making loud noises and having fun.
One day, he marched into the laundry room, where his mom was folding clothes. He saw a big pile of laundry on the floor. He thought it looked like a mountain. He wanted to march on the mountain.
He ran to the pile and jumped on it. He started to march, but the laundry was not smooth. It was soft and bumpy and slippery. He lost his balance and fell down. He knocked over the basket and the ironing board. He made a big mess.
His mom heard the noise and came to see what happened. She was not happy. She saw Tommy on the floor, surrounded by laundry and things. She saw his toy soldiers and his drum and his dog. She said, "Tommy, what did you do?"
Tommy looked at his mom. He felt sorry. He said, "I'm sorry, mom. I just wanted to march on the mountain."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play hide-and-seek with her friends. One day, Lily's mom asked her to get a cup from the cupboard. Lily went to the kitchen and opened the cupboard. She saw a shiny red apple inside and pointed at it, saying, "Mommy, can I have that?"
Her mom said, "No, that apple belongs to your brother. He's been wanting it all day."
Lily felt envious of her brother and thought of a plan. Later that day, when her brother was playing outside, Lily snuck into the kitchen and took the apple from the cupboard. She was about to take a bite when she heard her brother coming back inside. In a hurry, she put the apple back and ran to hide.
Her brother went to the kitchen, opened the cupboard and saw the apple. He was so happy and took a big bite. But then, he noticed something strange. There was a bite mark on the apple. He looked around and saw Lily hiding behind the couch. She had taken a bite before putting it back. Her brother laughed and said, "Gotcha! You can have the rest of the apple." From then on, Lily learned that it's always better to share and not be envious.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant. The elephant was very generous. He loved to help his friends. One day, he went to the river to fill water in his trunk.
While at the river, the elephant saw a small bird. The bird was thirsty. The generous elephant wanted to help. He filled his trunk with water and gave it to the bird to drink. The bird was very happy.
But then, the sky became dark. A big storm came. The wind blew and the rain fell hard. The elephant tried to go home, but the storm was too strong. The generous elephant was very sad. He could not find his way home, and he stayed lost in the storm.

Once upon a time, there was a prince named Tom. He lived in a big, pretty castle. Prince Tom loved to play outside in the sun.
One day, it rained and everything became wet. Prince Tom's mom said, "Tom, you cannot play outside today. It is too wet." Prince Tom was sad because he wanted to play.
Then, Tom had a fun idea. He took some paint and spread it on a big paper in the castle. He made a picture of the sun and the sky. When his mom saw it, she smiled and said, "What a beautiful picture, Tom!" Prince Tom was happy because he could have fun inside, even on a wet day.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. Today, Lily has a new sweater. It is pink and soft. She shows it to Ben.
"Look, Ben, I have a new sweater. Do you like it?" Lily asks.
Ben nods. He likes Lily's sweater. It is pretty and warm. He touches it with his hand.
"It is nice, Lily. Where did you get it?" Ben asks.
Lily smiles. She is happy that Ben likes her sweater.
"My mom made it for me. She is good at making things. She said it is a gift for me because I am a good girl." Lily says.
Ben thinks that Lily's mom is very nice. He wishes he had a new sweater too. His sweater is old and has a hole.
"Your mom is very nice, Lily. You are lucky. My sweater is old and has a hole. See?" Ben says and shows Lily his sweater.
Lily sees the hole in Ben's sweater. She feels sorry for him. She has an idea.
"Ben, do you want to share my sweater? We can take turns wearing it. Then we both have a new sweater." Lily says.
Ben is surprised. He looks at Lily. She is very kind. He likes her idea.
"Really? You want to share your sweater with me? Thank you, Lily. You are a very good friend." Ben says.
Lily and Ben hug. They are happy. They decide to share Lily's new sweater. They play in the park and have fun. They are the best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a sister named Rose who was very kind and harmless. One day, Lily and Rose were playing in the park when they saw a little puppy. The puppy looked very sad and lonely.
Lily said, "Rose, let's go play with the puppy!" But Rose said, "No, Lily. We don't know if the puppy is friendly or not. We should ask the owner first."
Lily didn't want to wait, so she ran towards the puppy. But when she got closer, the puppy started barking loudly and Lily got scared. Rose quickly came to her sister's rescue and picked her up. The puppy's owner came and said, "Don't worry, the puppy is harmless. He just wanted to play."
Lily and Rose smiled and played with the puppy. They learned that it's always important to ask first and be careful. From that day on, they became good friends with the puppy and his owner.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily had a regular routine every day. She would wake up, eat breakfast, and play with her toys. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to wrap a present for her friend's birthday. Lily was happy to help and wrapped the present carefully.
Later that day, Lily and her mommy went to the birthday party. When they arrived, they saw that all the other kids had brought presents too. But Lily's present was the biggest and the prettiest. Everyone was so happy and excited to see what was inside. But when Lily's mommy opened the present, they found out that it was empty! Everyone was surprised and started to weep.
But then, Lily's mommy noticed something strange on the wrapping paper. There was a note that said, "Surprise! Your real present is outside!" Everyone ran outside and found a big, beautiful playground waiting for them. They all played and had so much fun. Lily was so happy that she could make everyone smile, even though they had a little scare at first.

One day, a thoughtful dog named Max went for a walk in the park. He saw a big tree with a small cat stuck up high. The cat was scared and needed help. Max thought he could help the cat if he could find a way to reach her.
Max saw a long stick on the ground. He had an idea. He picked up the stick with his mouth and walked back to the tree. Max said to the cat, "Hold on! I will help you with this stick." The cat was not sure, but she had no choice.
Max put the stick up to the cat. The cat touched the stick with her paw. The stick did not yield or break. The cat felt safe to hold on to the stick. Max pulled the stick down, and the cat came down too. The cat was happy and said, "Thank you, Max, for being so thoughtful and helping me!" From that day on, Max and the cat were best friends.

One day, a little cat named Lucy found a long string on the ground. She liked to play with it. Lucy saw a big house near her. A wealthy girl named Amy lived in the big house. Amy liked to play with her toys, but she was alone and wanted a friend.
Lucy played with the string near Amy's house. Amy saw Lucy and came out to play with her. She said, "Hi, little cat! Do you want to play with me?" Lucy looked at Amy and nodded her head. Amy took the string and played with Lucy. They both had fun.
After playing, Amy said, "Thank you, little cat, for playing with me. I am happy now." Lucy was also happy to have a new friend. From that day on, they played together every day. The string helped Lucy and Amy become best friends.

Tom and Anna like to play in the park. They see many things in the park. They see birds, dogs, flowers and people. Sometimes they see weird things too.
One day, they see a man sitting on a bench. He has a big hat and a long coat. He holds a newspaper in his hands. He does not look at the newspaper. He looks at the sky. He talks to himself.
"Who is he?" Tom asks Anna.
"I don't know. He is weird," Anna says.
They go closer to the man. They want to see his newspaper. Maybe it has pictures or stories. They are curious.
"Hello, mister," Tom says. "Can we see your newspaper?"
The man does not answer. He does not look at Tom and Anna. He keeps looking at the sky. He keeps talking to himself.
"Please, mister," Anna says. "We want to see your newspaper."
The man does not answer. He does not look at Tom and Anna. He keeps looking at the sky. He keeps talking to himself.
Tom and Anna are sad. They think the man is rude. They think he does not want to share. They turn around and walk away.
Suddenly, the man says something. He says it very loud.
"Pass the salt!"
Tom and Anna are surprised. They look back at the man. He still holds the newspaper. He still looks at the sky. He still talks to himself.
"Pass the salt!" he says again.
Tom and Anna are confused. They do not see any salt. They do not see any food. They do not know what the man wants.
They run away from the man. They think he is very weird. They do not want to play with him. They find another bench. They sit on the bench. They look at the flowers. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was an adventurous boy who liked to play in his bedroom. He had many toys and he loved to make up fun games with them.
One day, Tim's favorite toy, a small cat, got lost. He started to worry. He looked all around his bedroom, under the bed, and in his toy box, but he could not find the cat.
Tim's mom saw him worry and asked what was wrong. Tim told her about the lost cat. Together, they looked for the cat. They finally found it under a big pillow. Tim was so happy and gave his mom a big hug. From that day on, Tim always put his toys away so he would not worry about losing them again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and explore the world around her. One day, Lily found a small plant in her backyard. She decided to take care of it and watered it every day. 
As time passed, the plant began to grow bigger and bigger. Lily was patient and continued to take care of it. The plant grew so big that it started to take over the whole backyard. 
One day, Lily's mom noticed the plant and said, "Wow, Lily! Your plant has increased so much! It's almost as big as the world!" Lily was proud of her hard work and happy to see the plant thrive. 
The moral of the story is that if you are patient and take care of something, it can grow and increase in size. Lily's patience paid off, and she was able to see the world in her own backyard.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a ball in his yard. He wanted to play with it. So he gave the ball a big kick. The ball went very far and fast. Tim ran after the ball, laughing and clapping his hands.
As the ball rolled, it hit a broken toy car. Tim saw the broken toy car and said, "Oh no! My toy car is broken!" His friend, Sam, heard him and came to see. Sam looked at the broken toy car and said, "Don't worry, Tim. We can fix it."
Tim and Sam worked together to fix the broken toy car. They used glue and tape to make it all better. When they were done, Tim said, "Thank you, Sam. Let's play with the ball now." Sam agreed, and they took turns giving the ball a big kick. They laughed and had lots of fun playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the beach and playing in the sand. One day, she found a jellyfish on the shore. It was slimy and gross, but Lily thought it was cool. She picked it up and showed it to her friend, Max.
Max said, "Ew, that's disgusting! Why do you want to touch it?"
Lily replied, "I think it's interesting. Let's sort the shells and rocks we found with it."
They spent the afternoon sorting the different things they had collected on the beach. When it was time to go home, Lily wanted to take the jellyfish with her. Max said it was a bad idea, but Lily didn't listen.
On the way home, Lily accidentally dropped the jellyfish and got stung. It hurt a lot and she cried. Max helped her and said, "I told you it was a bad idea to take it with you. Sometimes things that look cool can be dangerous. We should always be careful and listen to our friends."

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and pick flowers. One day, she found a crazy looking flower that made her laugh. She picked it and brought it home to show her mom.
But when Lily's mom saw the flower, she got very sick. The flower was poisonous! Lily felt very sad and cried a lot. She learned that she should never pick flowers without her mom or dad.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to the zoo because he loved seeing all the animals. One day, Timmy saw a great big monkey swinging from tree to tree. 
Timmy went up to the monkey and said, "Hi there, Mr. Monkey! Can I borrow a banana?" The monkey looked at Timmy and said, "Sure thing, little buddy! Here you go." Timmy was so happy to have a banana from the monkey.
As Timmy was eating his banana, he heard the monkey say, "I wish I could go home with you, Timmy." Timmy replied, "I wish you could come home with me too, Mr. Monkey. But I don't think my mom would like that." The monkey nodded and said, "You're right. I'll just stay here and swing from tree to tree." 
Timmy said goodbye to the monkey and went home, feeling happy that he got to borrow a banana from a great big monkey.

One morning, a little boy named Tim woke up in his messy room. He saw his toys all over the floor. Tim wanted to solve this problem and make his room clean again. He put on his socks and started to pick up his toys.
Tim's mom came into the room and saw him cleaning. She said, "Good job, Tim! You are solving the messy room problem." Tim smiled and said, "Yes, Mom! I want my room to be nice and clean."
After a while, Tim finished cleaning his room. He felt very happy and proud. His mom gave him a big hug and said, "Well done, Tim! You solved the problem and made your room clean again." Tim smiled and said, "Thank you, Mom! I will try to keep my room clean every morning."

One day, a little girl named Lily was playing on her porch. She saw a silly bird hopping around the yard. Lily laughed and clapped her hands. She wanted to be friends with the bird.
"Hello, bird!" Lily said. "Will you be my friend?" The bird looked at her and flew away. Lily felt sad. She went inside her house and found her mom. "Mom, I want the bird to be my friend, but it flew away," she said. Her mom smiled and said, "Lily, let's pray for the bird to come back."
The next day, Lily went back to the porch. She saw the same silly bird, but this time it had a baby bird with it. Lily was so happy! She said, "Hello, birds! I prayed for you to come back, and now you have a new friend too!"
The birds stayed and played with Lily. They all became good friends. The moral of the story is, when you pray and have hope, good things can happen.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to wake up early in the morning and help her mommy prepare breakfast. One morning, Lily woke up and noticed that her pajamas felt tight. She tried to take them off, but they wouldn't budge. 
Lily's mommy helped her out of her pajamas and they both got ready to make breakfast. As they were cracking eggs into a bowl, they heard a loud noise outside. They went to investigate and found that a big tree had fallen on their house! 
Lily and her mommy were surprised and didn't know what to do. But then they remembered that they had a toolbox in the garage. They quickly went to get it and used the tools to fix the broken parts of their house. In the end, they were able to prepare a delicious breakfast and enjoy their day despite the unexpected event.

Once upon a time there were two best friends, Molly and Mia. They were walking through the woods one day when they came upon a giant castle in the fog.
Molly looked up in awe. "Oh Mia, let's go explore the castle. I wish we could go inside!"
Mia thought for a moment and said "I don't know Molly. It looks kind of scary."
Molly grinned and said "Oh come on, it doesn't look so bad. Just look at the mild fog around it! Let's explore it."
Mia looked around nervously. She said "I'm scared of the castle. Can we just turn around and choose a different path?"
Molly shook her head. "Let's be brave! We can handle this! Let's explore the castle!"
Mia was still scared but she decided to trust Molly and follow her. They walked up to the castle and opened the door. Inside, they found a magical wonderland filled with rabbits, unicorns and fairies!
Molly and Mia looked around in amazement. They had chosen the right path!

Lily and Ben were playing in the park with their mom. They saw a man sitting on a bench. He looked sad and lonely. He had a big bag with him, but it was torn and dirty.
"Mom, can we say hello to him?" Lily asked.
"Sure, honey, but be polite and kind," mom said.
Lily and Ben walked up to the man and smiled. "Hi, mister, what is your name?" Lily said.
The man looked up and nodded. "Hello, little ones. My name is Sam."
"Nice to meet you, Sam. We are Lily and Ben. Do you want to play with us?" Ben said.
Sam shook his head. "No, thank you. I have to watch my bag. It has all my things in it."
Lily and Ben looked at the bag. They saw a wallet sticking out of a hole. It was old and worn.
"Is that your wallet, Sam?" Lily asked.
"Yes, it is. It has some money and a picture of my family," Sam said.
"Can we see the picture?" Ben asked.
Sam hesitated, then took out the wallet and opened it. He showed them a faded photo of a woman and a boy.
"This is my wife and my son. They died in a fire a long time ago. I miss them very much," Sam said.
Lily and Ben felt sorry for Sam. They hugged him and said, "We are sorry, Sam. That is very sad."
Sam smiled a little and hugged them back. "Thank you, Lily and Ben. You are very compassionate. You made me feel better."
Mom came over and joined the hug. She said, "Sam, you are welcome to join us for lunch. We have some sandwiches and juice. Would you like that?"
Sam nodded and said, "Yes, please. That is very kind of you."
They all went to a picnic table and shared their food. Lily and Ben talked to Sam and made him laugh. Sam felt happy and grateful. He thanked them again and said, "You are a wonderful family. You have a big heart."

Jack ran across the icy carpet to find his toy. As he was searching, he heard a deep voice urge him to keep looking. It was his mother, who was helping Jack from the other side of the room. Jack kept looking and soon found his toy hiding under the carpet. He was so happy to have it back in his hands. 
Jack ran back to his mother and showed her the toy. His mother smiled and gave him a hug. She said, "I knew you'd find it! Always use your eyes and urge yourself to look." 
Jack thanked his mother and hugged her tightly. She then said, "Let's get off this icy carpet and find something warm to do!" Jack agreed and they headed into a different room.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Timmy went to the store with his mom. They got a big cart to put all their groceries in. Timmy was pushing the cart and it was very heavy.
Suddenly, a can of beans fell out of the cart and rolled away. Timmy's mom said, "Timmy, be careful! Don't let anything else fall out of the cart."
Timmy tried his best, but he accidentally knocked over a box of cereal. He felt sad because he wanted to be helpful. His mom saw that he was upset and said, "It's okay, Timmy. Accidents happen. Let's just release the cart and start again." 
Timmy felt better and they continued shopping. He learned that it's okay to make mistakes and that it's important to always try to be helpful.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat dessert after dinner. One day, her mom made her favorite chocolate cake for dessert. Lily was so happy and excited to eat it.
She took a big bite and started to chew. "Mmm, this cake is so yummy!" she said to her mom. But then, she ate too much and started to feel dizzy. "Mommy, I don't feel good," she said.
Her mom helped her sit down and gave her some water. "It's okay, Lily. You ate too much dessert. Next time, we'll have a smaller piece," her mom said. Lily nodded and felt better soon. From then on, she learned to not eat too much dessert at once.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy made of copper. He loved his toy very much. But one day, the toy broke. Tim was sad.
Tim's mom saw him crying. She said, "Don't worry, Tim. I will improve your toy." Tim's mom took the toy and put a tight band around it. The toy was fixed.
Tim was happy. He played with his toy all day. The tight band made the toy even better. Tim knew that his mom could always help him. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had an adorable puppy named Max. One day, Max hurt his paw and couldn't walk. Lily's mom said, "Let's lift Max up and take him to the vet." 
At the vet, the doctor said Max needed a massage to help his paw feel better. Lily's mom said, "Can you please give Max a massage?" The doctor said yes and started to rub Max's paw gently. 
Max felt so much better after the massage. Lily said, "Thank you for making Max feel better!" The doctor said, "You're welcome, Lily. Max is an adorable puppy." Lily smiled and said, "I know, he's my best friend."

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny liked to play with his friends and eat carrots. One day, Benny saw a pretty bunny named Bonnie. He liked Bonnie a lot and wanted to kiss her.
But Benny was too shy and embarrassed to ask Bonnie for a kiss. He didn't know what to do. So, he went to his mommy and asked her for advice. His mommy told him that it's okay to be embarrassed sometimes, but he shouldn't be afraid to ask for what he wants.
So, Benny went back to Bonnie and asked her for a kiss. Bonnie was happy and they kissed. Benny felt very happy and proud of himself. He learned that it's important to be brave and ask for what you want. Benny also learned that going to university is important so that you can learn new things and be brave. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy aeroplane. One day, Timmy's mom said, "Timmy, it's time to bathe before bed." But Timmy was angry and didn't want to stop playing.
Timmy's mom said, "Timmy, if you don't bathe, you might get sick." But Timmy didn't listen and kept playing with his aeroplane. Suddenly, Timmy's aeroplane crashed into the wall and broke. Timmy started to cry.
His mom came in and asked, "What happened?" Timmy said, "My aeroplane broke." His mom said, "I'm sorry, Timmy. But remember, if you had listened and bathed earlier, your aeroplane wouldn't have crashed. It's important to listen to your parents." Timmy learned his lesson and promised to always listen to his mom. The end.

Once upon a time, a loyal dog named Max lived with a little girl named Lily. They played together every day. Max liked to see Lily laugh and smile.
One sunny day, Max and Lily found a magic stone. Lily picked up the stone and said, "I wish for a big ice cream!" Suddenly, a big ice cream appeared! They were very happy and ate the ice cream together.
The next day, they went to the park with the magic stone. A little boy named Tom saw the stone and said, "I wish for a big toy car!" To their surprise, a big toy car appeared! Max, Lily, and Tom played with the toy car all day long. They learned that when they used the magic stone to make others happy, they felt happy too.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat with soft fur. The cat lived in a big house with its friend, a small dog. They liked to play together every day. They had a lot of fun running around and chasing each other.
One day, the cat saw an interesting bug outside. It was a very pretty bug, with many colors. The cat wanted to catch it and show it to the dog. So, the cat tried to jump and catch the bug, but it was too high. The cat tried again and again, but it could not catch the bug.
The dog saw the cat trying to catch the bug and wanted to help. The dog tried to jump too, but it was also too short. They both tried together, but still could not catch the bug. They were tired but happy because they had fun trying. In the end, the cat and the dog went back inside the house and played together, knowing they both tried their best.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named Whiskers. Whiskers didn't like to play with other animals or be petted by humans. He just wanted to be left alone.
One day, Whiskers' owner brought home a big box with a label that said "cat toys". Whiskers didn't care and just went back to sleep. But when his owner opened the box, Whiskers woke up and saw a shiny ball inside. He started to play with it and forgot about being grumpy.
Days went by and Whiskers played with all the toys in the box. But one day, he noticed that the box was almost empty. He felt sad because he knew that the fun would end soon. But then, his owner came back with a new box of toys and Whiskers' happiness returned.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely girl named Sue. Sue loved to cook with her mom. One day, they wanted to make a big cake. They got all the things they needed: eggs, milk, and sugar. But they needed one more thing: salt.
Sue went to the big box with all the food. She found the salt, but it was very high up. She tried to reach it, but she could not. She got a chair and stood on it. Now she could reach the salt. But when she took it down, the salt box split open.
The salt fell all over the floor. Sue was sad. Her mom came and saw the mess. She said, "It's okay, Sue. We can clean it up." They got a broom and swept up the salt. Then they put new salt in the cake. They baked it, and it was very good. Sue and her mom were happy. They had a lovely time making the cake together.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweetie. Tweetie lived in a birdcage in a house with a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily forgot to close the door to the birdcage and Tweetie flew out.
Lily was sad because she loved Tweetie very much. She asked her mom if they could find Tweetie. Her mom said, "Let's go outside and look for him."
As they walked outside, they saw Tweetie sitting on a tree branch. Lily said, "Look, Mom! Tweetie rose up in the sky! He's so useful, he can fly wherever he wants!"
Lily's mom said, "Yes, he is a very special bird. But we need to bring him back home to his birdcage so he can be safe." They called to Tweetie and he flew back down to them. Lily was so happy to have Tweetie back in his useful birdcage.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had an itch on his arm that wouldn't go away. He scratched and scratched, but it still itched.
Timmy's mom came into the room and asked, "What's wrong, Timmy?" Timmy said, "My arm has a powerful itch." His mom said, "Let me see." She looked at his arm and said, "I guess you need some medicine to make it feel better."
Timmy's mom got some medicine and put it on his arm. The itch went away and Timmy was happy again. He said, "Thank you, Mommy. You made my itch go away." His mom replied, "That's what mommies are for, to help you feel better."

Once upon a time, there was a jolly frog named Freddy. Freddy loved to jump and play all day long. One sunny day, he saw a pond and wondered what was inside. He decided to dive into the pond to find out.
As he swam deeper into the water, he saw many colorful fish and plants. Freddy was amazed and wondered how many more things were hidden in the pond. He continued to dive and explore until it was time to go home.
Freddy hopped back to his home feeling happy and excited. He couldn't wait to tell his friends about his adventure in the pond. From that day on, Freddy would often dive into the pond to see what wonders he could discover.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sue. Sue was a creative girl who liked to make things. One day, she saw a big truck deliver a mattress to her neighbor's house. Sue got an idea.
Sue asked her mom, "Can I have a mattress like that?" Her mom said, "Yes, but you need to think of a way to use it." Sue thought and thought. Then, she had a plan.
Sue and her mom went to get a mattress. Sue used the mattress to make a big slide in her yard. All the kids came to play on Sue's slide. They had so much fun, and Sue was happy she could share her creative idea with her friends.

Tom and Sam were brothers. They liked to play in the park near their home. There was a big slide, a swing, a seesaw and a sandbox. Tom liked the slide best, and Sam liked the swing best.
One day, they went to the park with their mom. Tom ran to the slide and climbed up the ladder. Sam ran to the swing and pushed it with his feet. They were having fun.
But then, a big boy came to the park. He had a mean face and a loud voice. He walked to the slide and said to Tom, "Get off the slide. I want to go first." Tom was scared, but he said, "No, I was here first. You have to wait your turn." The big boy did not mind. He pushed Tom off the ladder and went on the slide.
Sam saw what happened and ran to help his brother. He said to the big boy, "That was not nice. You should say sorry to Tom." The big boy did not mind. He laughed and said, "You are too small to tell me what to do. Go away or I will push you too." Sam was brave, but he was also smart. He knew he could not fight the big boy. He had a better idea.
He ran to the sandbox and picked up a handful of sand. He waited for the big boy to come down the slide. When he did, Sam threw the sand in his face. The big boy screamed and rubbed his eyes. He could not see. Sam said, "That is what you get for being mean. Now leave us alone." The big boy ran away, crying.
Tom and Sam hugged each other and smiled. They went back to their favorite place in the park. They played on the slide and the swing until their mom called them. They were happy. They were persistent. They did not let the big boy ruin their fun.

One day, a chubby cat named Kitty went to play outside. Kitty loved to run and jump in the sun. She saw her friend, a little bird named Birdy, sitting on a branch. Kitty liked to tease Birdy by jumping high to reach her.
Birdy flew away and Kitty followed her. They played near a big tree. Kitty saw something new on the ground. It was a picture. The picture showed bones. Kitty and Birdy looked at the picture. They did not know it was an x-ray.
Kitty and Birdy showed the x-ray to their friend, a wise old owl named Mr. Owl. Mr. Owl told them it was an x-ray. He said it showed what was inside someone. Kitty and Birdy thought it was cool. They played with the x-ray and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little monkey named Max. Max loved bananas more than anything in the world. One day, Max saw a gray banana. He had never seen a gray banana before. Max asked his friend, a wise owl, "What happened to this banana? Why is it gray?" The owl said, "It's not ripe yet. Wait a few days and it will be yellow and delicious."
Max waited and waited, and finally, the banana turned yellow. He was so happy and excited to eat it. But when he peeled it, he saw that it was not complete. There was a big bite taken out of it! Max was sad and disappointed. He asked his friend, the owl, "Who took a bite out of my banana?" The owl said, "I think it was the sneaky squirrel who lives in the tree next to yours. He loves bananas too."
Max decided to set a trap for the squirrel. He put a banana with a big X on it, and waited. Sure enough, the sneaky squirrel came to take the banana. But when he took a bite, he got stuck in the trap! Max was happy that he completed his plan, and he got to enjoy a whole banana without any bites taken out of it.

Once upon a time, there was a little infant named Tim. Tim had a cool toy car that he loved to play with every day. He would push the car around the house and make fun noises as it went.
One day, Tim's toy car got dirty. He wanted to make it clean again, so he decided to rub the dirt off. He took a soft cloth and gently rubbed the car until it was shiny and new again. Tim was very happy to have his cool toy car looking nice and clean.
After Tim finished cleaning his car, he went outside to play. He found a nice, cool spot under a big tree and played with his car all day long. Tim had so much fun, and he knew that if his car ever got dirty again, he could rub it clean with his soft cloth. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing in the snow. One day, she saw a big, hairy dog walking in the snow. 
"Hi doggy, what's your name?" asked Lily.
"Woof woof, my name is Max," replied the dog.
Lily wanted to pet Max, but she was scared. "Can I test if Max is friendly?" she asked her mom.
"Sure, just approach him slowly and let him sniff your hand," said her mom.
Lily did as her mom said and Max licked her hand. From that day on, Lily and Max became good friends and played in the snow together every winter.

Once upon a time, there was a little birdie named Timmy. Timmy had big dreams of flying high in the sky with his wings. One day, Timmy met a wise old owl who said, "Timmy, if you want to succeed in flying, you must practice every day."
Timmy listened to the owl's advice and practiced flying every day. He would flap his wings and soar through the air. After a few weeks, Timmy finally succeeded in flying high up in the sky. He felt warm and happy inside.
Timmy flew back to the owl and said, "I did it! I succeeded in flying high!" The owl smiled and said, "I knew you could do it, Timmy. Your wings are strong and you are determined." From that day on, Timmy flew with confidence and knew that he could accomplish anything he set his mind to.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They walked on the sand and saw many shells. Tim's mom told him to be careful and not to stumble on the rocks. Tim liked to find shells, and he looked for them very hard.
Then, Tim found a big oyster shell. It was not easy to open, but Tim tried and tried. Inside the oyster, he found a shiny pearl. Tim was very happy and showed it to his mom. She was happy too and said it was a special find.
But then, something unexpected happened. A little crab came out of the sand and took the pearl from Tim's hand. Tim was sad, but the crab looked happy. The crab put the pearl in its home and danced. Tim and his mom laughed and let the crab keep the pearl. They knew it was the crab's special treasure.

Lily and Ben are playing with a box and some string. They make a house for their toys and tie the string to the box. They pretend the string is a lock and they can open and close the box with it.
"Look, we have a lock for our house!" Lily says. "No one can get in without the key!"
Ben nods and holds the other end of the string. He says, "I have the key! I can open and close the lock!"
They take turns opening and closing the box and putting their toys inside. They have fun and laugh.
But then, Tom comes. Tom is bigger and meaner than Lily and Ben. He sees their box and their string and he wants them. He runs to them and grabs the string from Ben.
"Hey, that's mine!" Ben shouts. "Give it back!"
"No, it's mine now!" Tom says. "I like this lock and this box!"
He pulls the string hard and breaks it. Then he kicks the box and makes it fall. The toys spill out and get dirty.
Lily and Ben are sad and angry. They cry and yell at Tom. They want their lock and their box and their toys back.
But Tom does not care. He laughs and runs away with the string. He says, "Too bad for you! I have the lock and you don't!"
Lily and Ben are left with nothing. They hug each other and sob. They wish they had their lock and their box and their toys back. They wish Tom was not so mean. They wish they could play again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toys and going on adventures. One day, he went to the park with his mom and saw a man with a big, shiny pistol.
Timmy asked his mom, "What is that man holding?" His mom replied, "That's a pistol, Timmy. It's not a toy, so we shouldn't touch it."
Timmy nodded and continued playing. Later that day, Timmy and his mom went to the store to buy some candy. Timmy saw a candy bar he really wanted, but it was too expensive. His mom said, "I'm sorry, Timmy. We can't buy that candy bar. It's too expensive and we don't want to spoil our dinner."
Timmy understood and they left the store. As they walked home, Timmy said, "Mommy, it's important to be honest and not touch things that aren't ours." His mom smiled and said, "You're right, Timmy. It's always important to be honest and do the right thing."

Once upon a time, there was a king who was worried. He had lost his crown and didn't know where it was. He asked all his knights and servants, but no one had seen it. Finally, he went to the store to buy a new one.
The store had many crowns, but none of them were as shiny and beautiful as his old one. The king picked one that was close, but he still felt sad. As he was walking back to his castle, a thief snatched the crown from his head and ran away.
The king was very sad and didn't know what to do. He searched everywhere, but he couldn't find the thief or his crown. From that day on, the king was never happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a favorite dish that she loved to eat from. One day, Sue's dish fell on the floor and it broke. Sue was very sad because of her broken dish.
Sue's mom had an idea. She took a string and tied the broken dish together. It looked funny, but it worked! Sue was happy again and could eat from her dish.
But then, something unexpected happened. The dish started to talk! The dish told Sue that it was now a magic dish because of the string. Sue and the magic dish became best friends and went on many fun adventures together. They were never sad about the broken dish again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a teddy bear that she loved very much. She owned it since she was a baby. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. While playing, she accidentally dropped her teddy bear and it got lost.
Lily was very upset and started to cry. Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't worry, we will find your teddy bear." A kind lady overheard them and asked what was wrong. Lily told her about her lost teddy bear. The lady said, "I have a teddy bear at home that I don't need anymore. You can have it."
Lily was so happy and hugged the lady. She thanked her and said, "I will take good care of it, just like I did with my own teddy bear." The moral of the story is that sometimes we lose things that we love, but there are always kind people who can help us.

Timmy was bored. There was nothing to do and he didn't know what to do. He thought that maybe he could write but he had no paper or pencils. He looked around the room and he saw a bucket.
Timmy remembered that he had some crayons and he thought it would be fun to write with them. So Timmy grabbed his crayons and started writing on the bottom of the bucket.
It was fun for a few minutes, but soon the writing started to look boring. Timmy wanted something more exciting, but he didn't have anything else to write with.
He decided to take his bucket outside and ask his friend to play with him. When his friend arrived, Timmy showed him the bucket. His friend suggested they draw a picture together on the bottom of the bucket.
Timmy thought this was a great idea and got to work with his friend. They drew a beautiful picture, made a story and enjoyed each other's company. When they were done they had created something they were both proud of and Timmy had forgotten all about how boring it was before.

Once upon a time there was a small rabbit called Sally. She was hopping around a desert looking for something to eat. Suddenly, she noticed a mighty cactus in the distance. She wanted to get to the cactus for a snack.
But when Sally got closer, she saw a dingo blocking the way. He smiled and said, "You won't be passing, small rabbit". Sally was scared, but she was determined to get to the cactus.
So Sally began hopping around in circles, getting faster and faster each time. The dingo could not keep up and eventually he had to jump out of the way. Sally hopped past the dingo and happily munched the cactus.
The moral of this story is that determination and courage can help you to pass any challenge. Just like Sally, you can find the strength to overcome any obstacle if you try hard enough.

Once upon a time, there was a little boat with a big sail. The boat loved to speed through the water. It was very fast and always had fun.
One day, the boat saw a big storm coming. It was scared, but it knew it had to find a safe place to hide. The boat used its sail to speed away from the storm.
The little boat found a safe spot behind a big rock. It stayed there until the storm went away. When the storm was gone, the boat went back to speed through the water with its sail, happy and safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to read books and learn new words. He had a great big dictionary that he used every day. One day, Timmy's friend Billy came over to play.
"Hey Timmy, what's that big book you have?" asked Billy.
"It's my dictionary. It helps me learn new words," replied Timmy.
"Can I use it too?" asked Billy.
"Sure!" said Timmy, happy to share his great big book.
But Billy didn't take good care of the dictionary. He ripped some pages and spilled juice on it. Timmy was sad and cried when he saw the damage.
"I'm sorry, Timmy. I didn't mean to break your book," said Billy.
"It's okay. But now I can't use it anymore," said Timmy sadly.
And so, Timmy's great big dictionary was ruined and he couldn't learn new words anymore. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play hide and seek with her friends in the park. One sunny day, Lily and her friends went to the park to play their favorite game.
Lily was very good at hiding. She found a big vine near a tree. She decided to hide behind the vine. Lily was very patient while she waited for her friends to find her.
Her friends looked and looked, but they could not find Lily. She was hiding so well! Finally, her friend Max saw the vine move. He went closer and found Lily. They all laughed and played more hide and seek. Lily and her friends had a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant. He was enormous! He liked to walk around the jungle and meet his friends. One day, he met a little monkey.
"Hi, monkey! Do you want to walk with me?" asked the elephant.
"Yes, please!" said the monkey.
As they were walking, they saw a ball. The monkey picked up the ball and said, "Look, elephant! Let's roll the ball!"
The elephant and the monkey started to roll the ball back and forth. They had so much fun! After a while, the elephant said, "Thank you for playing with me, monkey. Let's walk again tomorrow!"
"Okay, elephant! See you tomorrow!" said the monkey.
And so, the elephant and the monkey continued to walk and play together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a thin cat named Mittens. Mittens liked to eat a lot of food, but her owner didn't always have enough food to supply her. One day, Mittens ate too much and got a tummy ache. Her owner took her to the vet, who said Mittens needed to eat less and drink more water. Mittens' owner made sure to supply her with just the right amount of food and water from then on.
One day, Mittens was playing with a ball of yarn when she suddenly had to go to the toilet. She ran to the litter box, but it was full. Mittens' owner had forgotten to clean it. Mittens meowed loudly to let her owner know she needed a clean toilet. Her owner quickly cleaned the litter box and Mittens was happy again. From then on, Mittens' owner made sure to supply her with a clean toilet every day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. Tim brought his favorite toy, a spade. He wanted to dig in the sand and build an impressive sandcastle. Tim's mom said, "Let's find a good spot to sit and play."
Tim started to dig a big hole with his spade. He worked very hard. A girl named Sue came over to see what Tim was doing. "Wow, that's an impressive hole!" she said. "Can I help you dig?"
Tim said, "Yes, please! We can build a big sandcastle together!" So, Tim and Sue used their spades to dig and build. Their moms watched and smiled. They were proud of their little helpers.
At the end of the day, Tim and Sue had built an impressive sandcastle with the help of their spades. They were tired but happy. Tim's mom said, "Good job, Tim! You and Sue worked well together." Tim and Sue high-fived each other and laughed. They couldn't wait to come back to the beach and build more sandcastles.

Once upon a time, there was a big blue pen. The pen had ink inside. It blinked with a light on top when someone used it. The pen had a friend named Bill. Bill was a little boy. They played and drew pictures together.
One day, Bill's mom gave him a new toy. It was a red car. Bill liked the red car a lot. He played with the red car all day. The big blue pen felt sad. Bill did not play with it anymore. The pen blinked with its light on top. But Bill did not see it.
The next day, the red car got dirty. It was spoiled. Bill was sad. The big blue pen saw Bill was sad. The pen said, "I can help you, Bill!" The pen blinked its light and drew a new red car on paper. Bill was happy again. They played together and were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a good train. The train liked to work hard every day. It went on the rail to take people to fun places.
One day, the train saw a big rock on the rail. The train knew it could not work with the rock in the way. The train told its friend, the bird, to get help.
The bird flew fast and found a strong man. The man came and moved the rock off the rail. The train was so happy and could work again.
The train said "thank you" to the man and the bird. The train worked hard and took the man and the bird to a fun place. They all had a good day.

Once upon a time, there was a tall elephant. He lived in the jungle with his friends. One day, the elephant saw some paint on the ground. He decided to paint himself with the paint. He wanted to look pretty. 
But the paint was not good for the elephant. It made him sick. He fell down and could not get up. His friends tried to help him, but it was too late. The elephant died. 
Everyone was sad. They missed their friend. They learned that sometimes, things that look pretty can be dangerous. They decided to never play with paint again.

One day, a boy named Tim found a mysterious baseball in his yard. It was big and shiny. Tim was very happy. He wanted to play with it.
Tim's friend, Sam, came over to play. They threw the baseball back and forth. They had a lot of fun. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing.
Suddenly, the baseball flew very high into the sky. Tim and Sam could not see it anymore. They were sad. Tim shouted, "Where did it go?" Then, the mysterious baseball came back down. It landed in Tim's hands. Tim and Sam smiled and kept playing. They had a great day.
