The next day, Lily went back to the creek and saw the truck again. This time, the driver was using his tools to build a bridge over the creek. Lily thought it was a very powerful bridge because it could hold up the big truck. She thanked the driver for making the bridge and went on her way. 
From that day on, Lily would often go to the creek and play on the powerful bridge. She felt very lucky to have such a cool bridge near her house. And every time she saw the truck driving by, she knew that someone else was going to have a very special house designed just for them.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a cart that he loved to play with. He would speed up and down the street with it. One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue had a pretty cart too.
"Can I play with your cart?" asked Tim. "No, it's mine!" said Sue. Sue was a spoiled girl. She didn't like to share her things. Tim felt sad, but he still let Sue try his cart. Sue liked how fast Tim's cart could speed.
Later, Sue's cart broke. She was very sad. Tim saw her crying and said, "You can play with my cart if you want." Sue was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" They both played together and had lots of fun.
The moral of the story is to always share your things with others. It makes everyone happy and it's a kind thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a purple shrimp. The shrimp lived in the sea. The shrimp had many friends. One day, the shrimp met a new friend. The new friend was a fish.
"Hi, fish!" said the purple shrimp. "Do you want to play?"
"Sure!" said the fish. "Let's spring up and down in the water."
The purple shrimp and the fish had lots of fun. They swam fast and slow. They played hide and seek in the sea plants. They laughed and had a great time.
Soon, it was time to go home. The purple shrimp and the fish said goodbye. They promised to play again soon. The purple shrimp swam back to his family, happy to have a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to eat popcorn with salt. One day, Timmy's mommy sent him to the store to get some more salt. Timmy walked to the store and found the salt on the shelf. He picked up the salt and was about to pay when suddenly he saw a bad man trying to steal some candy. 
Timmy quickly ran to the store owner and said, "Bad man, bad man! He wants to take candy!" The store owner was surprised and called the police. The police came and arrested the bad man. Timmy was very happy that he helped catch the bad man. When he got home, he told his mommy all about his adventure and how he sent the bad man to jail. His mommy was proud of him and gave him extra popcorn with salt as a reward.

Once upon a time, there lived a little lamb. He was always up to no good, running around and making a mess of things. 
But one day, the lamb happened upon a pit in the ground. He looked confused and uncomfortable. The lamb stepped closer to the pit and felt something strange against his foot. 
The lamb bent down to investigate, and felt a tight squeeze on his foot! He jumped back in surprise and saw that the thing squeezing his foot was a rat! 
The rat must have been living in the pit and now it was uncomfortable. The lamb ran away, not wanting to get too close to the rat. 
But from that day on, the lamb was extra careful when walking around pits. He always looked twice before stepping closer. He wanted to make sure nothing else was squeezed!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to gather flowers in the big park near her house. One day, she saw a stage in the park. People were getting ready for a show.
Amy was anxious because she wanted to be in the show too. She asked her mom if she could join. Her mom said yes and helped her get ready. They found a pretty dress and put flowers in her hair.
When it was time for the show, Amy went on the stage. She danced and twirled with the flowers. Everyone clapped and cheered for her. Amy was so happy and had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was nice and liked to play with his toys. One day, Tim's mommy told him, "Tim, you should read more books. It will help your brain grow bigger."
Tim thought about it and wanted to increase his brain. He asked his mommy, "Where can I find good books?" His mommy said, "We have many available books in our home. Let's go look for them."
They found some books with big pictures and simple words. Tim and his mommy read the books together. Tim liked the stories and learned many new words. He was happy that reading books made his brain bigger.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with clay and make different shapes. He was very intelligent and always came up with new ideas.
One day, Timmy's mom told him it was time to take a nap. Timmy didn't want to nap, he wanted to play with his clay. "Can I please play with my clay instead?" he asked his mom.
"No, Timmy. You need to take a nap," his mom replied.
Timmy was sad but he went to take a nap. While he was sleeping, his little sister came into his room and started playing with his clay. She made a big mess and ruined all of Timmy's creations.
When Timmy woke up, he was so upset to see what happened to his clay. He started to cry and his mom came in to see what was wrong. Timmy told her what happened and his mom was very surprised. She didn't expect Timmy's sister to do that.
Timmy's mom told him not to worry and that they could make more clay together. Timmy felt better knowing his mom was there to help him.

Once upon a time, there lived two friends called Frank and Tom. They did everything together and they were very happy.
One day, Frank said: "Tom, I want to show you something!" Tom replied "It's ok, I will support you!"
Then Frank said "Let's go on a journey through the woods". Tom was excited and they both started walking in the path.
They kept walking until they reached a very distant and strange place. Then Tom noticed a strange way at the edge of the woods.
"What is it? Should we follow it?" asked Frank.
"I think so" replied Tom and they started walking along the strange way.
At the end of the way, they both saw a magical lake with lots of beautiful creatures. They just stood there for a moment and admired the beauty.
Tom smiled and said: "Thanks for supporting me, Frank, I'm glad we followed this way together." 
Frank smiled and said "Me too".

Once upon a time, there was a modest boy named Tim. Tim loved to design things, and he loved baseball. One day, he made a plan to design a new baseball game for his friends to play.
Tim and his friends went to the park to play the new game. They were all excited and happy. They started to play but then, something unexpected happened. A big dog came running into the park!
The dog picked up the baseball in its mouth and started to run away. Tim and his friends chased the dog, but it was too fast. They were sad because they couldn't play their new game without the baseball.
But then, the dog stopped running and dropped the baseball. The dog had designed a new game for them! The dog wanted to play too. Tim and his friends laughed and played the new game with the dog. They had so much fun and made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her yellow toy car. One day, she was playing with her car outside when her friend Jack came to play with her.
"Hi Lily, can I play with your car?" Jack asked.
Lily thought for a moment and then said, "Yes, but be careful with it. It's my favorite toy."
Jack played with the car for a while and then accidentally broke it. Lily was upset and said, "Why did you break my car, Jack?"
"I'm sorry, Lily. Let's discuss how we can fix it together," Jack said.
Lily and Jack talked about how they could fix the car and decided to glue it back together. They worked together carefully and soon the car was as good as new. Lily was happy again and said, "Thank you for helping me fix my car, Jack."

Lily and Ben are playing in the park. They see a big round thing that can spin. They run to it and take turns to sit on it. Lily pushes Ben and he spins very fast. He laughs and says, "This is fun!"
Then Ben pushes Lily and she spins very fast too. She likes it, but she feels a little sick. She says, "Stop, stop, I want to get off!" Ben stops pushing and helps her get off. She holds her tummy and sits on the grass.
Ben sees a flower and picks it up. He smells it and says, "This is pretty and it smells good." He gives it to Lily and says, "Here, this is for you." Lily smiles and takes the flower. She smells it and says, "Thank you, Ben. You are a good friend."
But then she sees a bee on the flower. She is scared and drops the flower. The bee flies away and does not sting her. But the flower lands on a smelly pile of dog poop. Lily and Ben say, "Ew, yuck!" They hold their noses and run away from the smelly flower.
They find a slide and slide down. They forget about the flower and the bee. They have fun and play until it is time to go home. They hold hands and wave goodbye. They say, "See you tomorrow!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Elsa. She was very eager to go to the theater. 
On the night of the performance, Elsa got dressed in her prettiest outfit. Her mom said, "You look stunning, Elsa!"
"Thanks, Mommy. Let's go!" Elsa said, with excitement in her voice.
When they arrived at the theater, Elsa ran inside and gasped. The stage was filled with people and lights, and the music was playing.
Elsa said to her mom, "Can I dance?"
Mom said, "Yes! Go ahead! Have fun!"
Elsa was so happy that she started bouncing and twirling around. Everyone laughed and clapped as she danced.
When the show was over, Elsa was exhausted, but very happy. She had a wonderful time at the theater, eager to come back again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a fat clown. He had a big red nose and wore a funny hat. The fat clown liked to make people laugh and smile. He lived in a small house with a close door.
One day, the fat clown went to the park to play. He saw a little girl who was sad. The fat clown wanted to make her smile. So, he did a funny dance and made a funny face. But the little girl did not laugh.
Then, something unexpected happened. The little girl took off her hat, and she was a clown too! She had a small red nose and funny hair. The fat clown was surprised. The two clowns played together and made everyone at the park laugh and smile. And they became close friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a furry little bunny named Bun Bun. Bun Bun lived in a cozy lab with his best friend, a kind scientist named Dr. Lily.
One day, Dr. Lily showed Bun Bun a new invention she made. "Look, Bun Bun! This is a machine that can make you fly!" she said.
Bun Bun was so excited. He hopped onto the machine and Dr. Lily turned it on. Suddenly, Bun Bun was flying up high! He was so happy that he started to applaud.
But then, something went wrong. The machine started to shake and smoke. Dr. Lily tried to turn it off, but it was too late. The machine exploded and poor Bun Bun was hurt. Dr. Lily tried to help him, but it was too late. Bun Bun had to say goodbye forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Mary who really wanted a job. She went to her mum and asked, “Can I have a job? Please!”
Mum smiled and said, “Yes, I'll give you a job. Your job will be to keep your bedroom clean. Can you do that for me?”
Mary was filled with joy and eagerly nodded her head. She quickly went to her bedroom and began cleaning. When she was finished, she was so proud of herself. 
Mum came into the bedroom and said, “Well done! You did a great job! Now come and see what I have for you.”
Mum opened the cupboard door and released a beautiful butterfly. Mary's eyes widened in amazement. She said, “Wow! It's so pretty!”
Mum said, “Yup, it sure is! You have done a great job, so now it's time to release the butterfly and let it fly free.” 
Mary smiled and released the butterfly, watching as it gracefully flew away into the sky, free to begin its own journey. 
What a wonderful job she had done!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside. One day, he wanted to make a camp in his backyard. He asked his mom, "Can I make a camp, please?"
His mom said, "Yes, you can. Just make sure to display your toys nicely." Tim was so happy. He went outside and found a big, comfortable box. He put the box in the grass and put his toys inside. He called his camp "Tim's Toy Camp."
Tim invited his friend, Sue, to play at his camp. Sue came over and said, "Wow! Your camp is so comfortable and your toys are displayed so nicely!" They played together all day long and had so much fun at Tim's Toy Camp.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside, but one day it started to rain. She got very wet and cold. She went inside and told her mommy, "I'm tired and wet. Can you fix me?" 
Her mommy said, "Of course, my dear. Let's get you dry and warm." She got a towel and dried Lily off. Then she put on some warm clothes and made hot chocolate for them to drink. 
Lily felt much better and said, "Thank you, mommy. You fixed me!" Her mommy smiled and said, "I'm glad I could help. Now let's watch the rain together and stay cozy inside." And they did just that, enjoying the sound of the rain outside while staying warm and dry inside.

One day there was a special race. All the animals came to compete. The little rabbit wanted to win, so he worked very hard.
Finally the race started. All the animals tried their best. The little rabbit ran as fast as he could, until he came first. Everyone cheered. What a victory!
The rabbit was very happy. He felt proud and he laughed with joy. He was wearing a purple ribbon to celebrate his victory. Everyone saw the lovely purple ribbon and laughed too.
The little rabbit was so proud. He laughed all the way home, feeling victorious and delighted with his purple ribbon!

Once upon a time, there was a kind and honest boy named Tim. Tim had a big friend, a tiger named Tom. They lived in a small house in the woods.
One day, Tim and Tom were playing when they found a big box. Tim said, "Let's send this box to a friend." They put the box on a cart and started to push it to their friend's house.
As they pushed the cart, the box opened, and many balloons came out. Tim and Tom were very surprised. They did not know the box was full of balloons. The balloons lifted them up into the sky, and they had a fun ride. They laughed and played in the sky, and their friend saw them and joined the fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little nosy dog named Max. Max liked to go to his friend's house and play. One day, Max went to visit his friend, a big cat named Lily.
When Max got to Lily's house, he saw a new toy on the floor. Max admired the toy and said, "Wow! What a fun toy! Can I play with it?" Lily said, "Welcome, Max! Yes, you can play with my new toy."
Max and Lily played with the toy all day. They had so much fun together. In the end, Max learned that being nosy can sometimes lead to new friends and fun times.

Once upon a time, there was a fat cat named Kitty. Kitty had a friend, a little girl named Sue. Sue liked to wear her mom's apron and play in the kitchen. One day, Kitty and Sue saw a big box in the kitchen.
Sue wanted to know what was in the box, but it was too high for her to reach. Kitty had an idea. Kitty would carry Sue's apron and climb up the shelf. When Kitty was high enough, she would use the apron to pull the box down.
Kitty climbed up the shelf and used the apron to pull the box down. The box fell and opened on the floor. Inside the box were lots of yummy treats! Sue and Kitty were very happy. They shared the treats with their friends.
The moral of the story is to always help your friends and share what you have.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl named Lucy. She loved to go outside and play. One day, Lucy saw a big mailbox near her house. She wanted to see what was inside.
Lucy was very brave, so she went to the mailbox. She opened it and found a big red ball. Lucy was so happy! She wanted to play with the ball all day. But, something unexpected happened.
As Lucy played with the ball, it started to rain. The rain made the ball very slippery. Lucy tried to catch the ball, but it slipped from her hands and rolled away. The ball went into a big hole and Lucy could not get it back. She was very sad and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird wanted to fly high in the sky. It flapped its wings and flew up, up, up. It was successful and felt very happy.
As the bird flew, it saw a big tree with lots of leaves. It landed on a branch and rested. The bird was tired and started to yawn. It closed its eyes and fell asleep.
When the bird woke up, it saw that the sun was setting. It knew it was time to go home. So, it flew back to its nest and slept soundly, dreaming of flying high in the sky again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his shiny coins. One day, Timmy was being foolish and started to tear his coins apart. His mom saw what he was doing and said, "Timmy, don't tear your coins! They won't be shiny anymore." Timmy didn't listen and continued to tear his coins. Suddenly, one of the coins fell on the ground and rolled away. Timmy started to cry because he lost his coin. His mom hugged him and said, "It's okay, Timmy. Let's go find your coin together." They searched and searched until they finally found the lost coin. Timmy learned that tearing his coins was not a good idea and promised to take better care of them from then on.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy lived near a big harbor where he loved to watch the boats come in and out. One day, Timmy saw an amazing boat with lots of colors and flags. 
Timmy ran to his mom and said, "Mommy, look at the amazing boat in the harbor!" 
His mom replied, "Yes, Timmy, it is amazing. But be careful not to get too close to the water." 
Suddenly, two seagulls started to quarrel over a piece of bread. Timmy pointed and said, "Mommy, the birds are fighting!" 
His mom said, "Yes, Timmy. Sometimes animals quarrel just like people do. Let's leave them alone and go home for dinner." 
Timmy was sad to leave the harbor, but he knew he would come back soon to see more amazing boats and watch the animals play.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big family with lots of brothers and sisters. One day, they all sat down at the table for dinner. Lily saw that the table was very beautiful with a shiny red tablecloth.
Lily's mom said, "We need to say our prayers before we eat." So, everyone closed their eyes and said a prayer. Then, they started to eat their food. Lily's dad had made spaghetti and meatballs, which was Lily's favorite.
After dinner, Lily helped her mom clean the table. She picked up all the plates and put them in the sink. Then, she wiped the table with a cloth. Lily thought the table still looked beautiful even after dinner.

Once upon a time, there was a tall tree. The tree was very big and strong. It had many green leaves. The tree was in a park with a lot of grass on the ground.
One day, a little bird came to the tree. The bird did not know where to find food. The bird was hungry and sad. The tall tree wanted to help the bird.
The tree told the bird, "I know where to find food. Look on the ground near my roots. You will find bugs and seeds to eat." The bird was happy and thanked the tall tree. The bird ate the food and was not hungry anymore. The bird and the tall tree became good friends.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim was very curious. He loved to take walks with his mom. One day, they went to the beach. Tim saw the big blue sea and the soft sand. He was very happy.
At the beach, Tim saw a small crab. He was curious about it. He wanted to take it home. His mom said, "No, the crab lives at the beach. We can't take it home."
Tim was sad, but he understood. He played with the crab for a little while. Then, he said goodbye to the crab and went back to his mom. They had a fun day at the beach.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was playing with his toy car. He loved to make the car go fast, but he did not behave well. He would push the car into his friends, and it made them miserable.
One day, Tim's mom took him to the gas station. She told him to behave while she went inside the store. Tim saw a big truck and thought it would be fun to make it go fast like his toy car. He tried to push the truck, but it was too heavy.
Tim's mom came back and saw him trying to push the truck. She told him that it was not nice to push things, and it made people feel miserable. Tim learned that he should behave and treat others with kindness, and that made everyone happy.

One day, a boy named Tim went for a visit to his friend, Sam. They wanted to play outside, but it was dark. So, they decided to play in Sam's room.
While they were playing, Tim leaned on a big toy box, and it fell over. All the toys spilled out onto the floor. Sam was not happy. "Look what you did!" he said to Tim.
Tim felt sad and said, "I'm sorry, Sam. Let's pick up the toys together." They both picked up the toys and put them back in the box. After they finished, they were friends again and played happily until it was time for Tim to go home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and run around outside. One day, Lily's mom told her they were going to visit her grandma. Lily was excited because she loved her grandma's house.
When they arrived, Lily's grandma was sitting in her rocking chair. She asked Lily if she wanted to hear a story. Lily nodded her head eagerly. Grandma told her a story about a magic rabbit who could vanish whenever he wanted. Lily thought it was amazing.
But then, Lily's little brother started crying because he was bored. Lily's mom tried to distract him with a toy, but he kept crying. Lily knew the truth - her brother just wanted to play outside. So, she suggested they all go outside and play together. They had so much fun that day, and Lily was happy she could make her brother stop crying.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to a restaurant with her mommy and daddy. When they sat down at the table, the waitress gave them a menu to look at. Lily thought the menu was pretty because it had pictures of food on it.
Lily's mommy asked her what she wanted to eat. Lily said she wanted chicken nuggets and fries. Her mommy ordered it for her, and then they waited for their food to come.
While they waited, Lily's daddy said he was tired and wanted to nap. Lily asked him if he was going to sleep at the table. Her daddy said no, he was going to go to the car and take a nap. Lily said she wanted to go with him, so they both went to the car and took a nap together.
When they woke up, their food was ready. They went back to the restaurant and ate their yummy food. Lily was happy because she got to nap with her daddy and eat her favorite food. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big circle. The circle had many friends. They liked to play together. One day, the circle did a silly dance. All the friends laughed. The circle felt sad.
The circle went to a tree. It cried under the tree. A bird saw the circle. The bird said, "Don't cry, circle. Your friends still love you. They just thought your dance was funny."
The circle went back to its friends. The friends said, "We are sorry, circle. We did not want to hurt you." The circle said, "I forgive you, friends. Let's play together again." And they all played happily ever after.

Sara and her mom went to the shop. They wanted to buy wool. Sara liked to knit with her mom. They made hats and scarves and mittens.
They saw many colors of wool in the shop. Sara liked the red wool. It was bright and soft. She asked her mom, "Can we buy the red wool, please?"
Her mom looked at the price tag. It was very high. She said, "No, Sara, we cannot buy the red wool. It is too expensive. We have to buy cheap wool."
Sara was sad. She did not like the cheap wool. It was dull and rough. She said, "But I don't like the cheap wool. It is ugly and scratchy."
Her mom hugged her. She said, "I know, Sara, but we have to save money. Maybe we can find some cheap wool that is nice and smooth. Let's look around."
They looked around the shop. They found some cheap wool that was blue and green. It was not as bright as the red wool, but it was not as dull as the other cheap wool. It was not as soft as the red wool, but it was not as rough as the other cheap wool. Sara touched it. She said, "This wool is okay. It is pretty and cozy."
Her mom smiled. She said, "Yes, Sara, this wool is okay. It is cheap and good. We can buy this wool and make something beautiful."
They bought the blue and green wool. They went home. They knitted a blanket with the wool. It was warm and colorful. Sara and her mom were happy. They cuddled under the blanket. They said, "We love our wool blanket. It is cheap and good."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play golf with his daddy. One sunny day, they went to the golf course. Timmy wore his favorite yellow shirt.
As they were playing, Timmy saw a bee flying around him. He got scared and started to run. His daddy said, "Don't be afraid, Timmy. Be still and the bee won't hurt you."
But Timmy didn't listen and kept running. Suddenly, the bee landed on his face. Timmy got so scared that he slapped the bee away. His daddy laughed and said, "Good job, Timmy! You protected yourself from the bee!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside and explore. One day, she went on a walk with her mommy and they found a big tree. 
Lily said, "Mommy, can I lean on the tree?" 
Mommy said, "Sure, be careful not to fall." 
Lily leaned on the tree and saw a puddle of water. She said, "Look mommy, water!" 
Mommy said, "Don't touch it, it's dirty." 
Lily was sad, but then she saw a butterfly. She said, "Mommy, look at the perfect butterfly!" 
Suddenly, the butterfly flew away and Lily saw a litter on the ground. She said, "Mommy, we have to pick up the litter so the butterfly can come back." 
Mommy was proud of Lily for wanting to keep the environment clean. They picked up the litter together and Lily felt happy knowing she did something good for the world.

Once upon a time, there was a silly cat named Mittens. Mittens liked to play with a rag. One day, Mittens started to chase the rag around the house. The rag flew up in the air and Mittens jumped to catch it. Mittens was having so much fun playing with the rag that she didn't notice her owner come in. When her owner saw Mittens playing with the rag, she laughed and said, "You're such a silly cat, Mittens!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved playing with his toys and eating cookies. One day, Timmy's mom told him that they were going to visit his grandma. Timmy was happy because he loved his grandma.
But on the way to grandma's house, Timmy saw two birds fighting in the sky. He felt worried because he didn't like seeing animals fighting. When they arrived at grandma's house, Timmy's mom gave him a toy car to play with while she went to send an email. 
Timmy played with his car for a while, but then he heard a loud noise outside. He looked out the window and saw two dogs fighting in the yard. Timmy felt even more worried now. Suddenly, he remembered the birds he saw earlier and realized that fighting was not good.
He decided to be brave and went outside to stop the dogs from fighting. He shouted at them and they stopped. Timmy felt proud of himself for stopping the fight. From that day on, Timmy knew that he could be brave and help others when they needed it.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the park with her mom. They saw a big cherry tree with lots of red cherries on it. Lucy loved cherries, so she asked her mom if she could pick some. Her mom said, "Yes, but be careful."
Lucy picked some cherries and put them in a basket. She saw a little boy named Tim under the tree. Tim said, "I love cherries too! Can I have some?" Lucy said, "Yes, you can have some." They shared the cherries and became friends.
They played and ate cherries all day. Then, they saw a big sign by the tree. The sign said, "Famous Cherry Pie Contest Today!" Lucy and Tim were so happy. They ran to the contest with their cherries. But when they got there, they found out the contest was over. They were sad, but then they had an idea. They went home and made their own cherry pie. They shared it with their families and everyone said it was the best pie ever.

James was eager to find his way back; he was lost in a big field full of sunflowers. He was only three and he was feeling scared. As he started to jitter, a helpful voice called him by his name. It was his mum, who had been running all over the place to find him.
James ran to his mum and hugged her as tears of relief fell from his eyes. His mum told him she was so proud that he had been brave and tried his best. She also told him that since it took them some time to find each other, she had an idea.
She told him to imagine that this field was like a track and the sunflower in the middle of it was the finish line. She said, "Let's see who can jog to the sunflower finish line first!"
James was excited and accepted the challenge. He started to jostle with his feet but his mum said, "Wait! You can only start jogging when I say 'Go!'" James was very eager, but he waited. Finally, his mum said, "Go!"
James put all his little strength into it and managed to reach the sunflower before his mum. He was so proud of himself and was happy that he had been helpful and brave even though he was only three. He hugged his mum and never wanted to leave the field of sunflowers.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Tom. Tom was black and loved to play in the dirt. One day, Tom got very dirty from playing outside. He wanted to get clean, so he went to find water.
Tom saw a big pot of water on the stove. He didn't know that the stove was hot and could burn him. He jumped up to get the water, but something unexpected happened. The pot was too hot, and Tom fell off the stove.
Tom was hurt and still dirty. He felt very sad. His friend, a little bird, saw him and wanted to help. But the bird didn't know what to do. In the end, Tom stayed dirty and learned not to play with hot things.

Once upon a time, there was a popular pig named Pinky. Pinky lived on a farm with many friends. Everyone loved Pinky because she was always happy and kind.
One day, Pinky and her friend, a dog named Spot, went for a walk. They saw a big red ball in the grass. Pinky said, "Look, Spot!" and she pointed at the ball. Spot wagged his tail and barked, "Let's play!"
Pinky and Spot played with the ball all day. They laughed and had so much fun. When the sun went down, they went back to the farm, tired but happy. Pinky and Spot knew they would always be best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her puzzle. One day, it was very cold outside. Lily stayed in her warm house to play with her puzzle.
While playing, Lily lost a piece of her puzzle. She looked and looked, but she could not find it. Lily started to weep. She was very sad because she could not finish her puzzle.
Lily's mom saw her weeping and came to help. Together, they looked for the missing puzzle piece. They found it under the table. Lily was so happy! She hugged her mom, and they finished the puzzle together.

Jill carefully balanced the flute on her tiny fingers. She was only three years old but she was already practicing hard. She wanted to play the flute like the big people did, and dreamed of having the biggest musical show in the world.
Jill's mum watched her with love and smiled. She said "you can do it Jill, I know you can". 
A few days later, Jill was practicing as usual when she realized that it was getting very dark outside. She looked up and noticed that the sun was disappearing in the horizon. She put down the flute and called out to her mum.
But there was no answer. All she heard were the howling of the wind and the chirping of the birds. She looked around but could not find her mum. She was all alone.
Jill began to cry. She wanted her mum to come back and show her the way. But that never happened. The darkness covered the whole world, and Jill was never seen again.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Anna. She was three years old and she loved to play outside. 
One day Anna felt very cool and she wanted to go outside. But it was very cold. Anna said to her mum, "Can I go out side?" Mum said, "No, it's too cold. You would suffer." 
But Anna really wanted to go outside, so she put on her coat and snuck out. When she was outside, Anna felt really cool. She ran and skipped around, but she started to feel cold again after a while.
Then it started to rain. Anna said, "It's raining! I'm wet! I'm cold!" She ran home, but it was too late. Soon she was sick with a cold and had to stay in bed. She suffered with her cold for a long time and she was sad that she had not listened to her mum.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat waffles for breakfast every day. They were her favorite food in the whole wide world. One day, her mommy made her a big, yummy waffle for breakfast. Lily was so happy that she ate it all up very quickly.
Suddenly, her tummy started to feel funny. It became very loud and made strange noises. Lily was confused and didn't know what was happening. Then, something unexpected happened. Lily's tummy became so big that she started to float away like a balloon! She was scared but also excited to fly through the air.
Eventually, Lily's mommy found her and brought her back down to the ground. They both laughed and hugged each other. From that day on, Lily knew that she needed to eat her waffles more slowly so that her tummy wouldn't become loud and big again.

Once upon a time, there was a big farmer. He was very happy because he had lots of special soil. Every day he would look after it and make sure it was healthy.
One day, the farmer received an amazing surprise. Out of the soil had grown a rare flower. It was so beautiful and it made the farmer very happy.
Every day, the farmer and his family would look at the flower. They took turns to take care of it and make sure it stayed strong.
Eventually, it started to bloom. The farmer and his family were so excited because the flower was so lovely.
They decided to name the flower “The Rare Flower of Happiness”. The farmer and his family were very pleased.

Once upon a time, there lived a little girl called Lucy. Lucy had long, blonde hair and bright, blue eyes. Every morning she would wake up and look in the mirror at her lovely hair. 
One day, Lucy started to notice little bumps appearing all over her head. She was very worried, so she decided to tell her mom about it. 
"Mommy," said Lucy, "my head is itching!" 
Her mom looked closely at her head and said, "Ahh, it looks like you have lice! Don't worry, it happens to lots of people. We'll have to be patient, and they will grow out eventually." 
Lucy wasn't too sure, but she knew that if she was patient and listened to her mom, it would all be okay. Sure enough, every day, Lucy's head would itch a bit less and eventually, the lice had all grown out of her hair. Lucy was very happy and she vowed never to ignore itches ever again!

Once upon a time, there was a round ball. The round ball was red and very proud. It loved to bounce and play with the kids in the park. One day, the round ball met a blue square. The blue square was sad because it could not bounce like the round ball.
The round ball said, "Why are you sad, blue square? We can play together!" The blue square replied, "But I cannot bounce like you. I don't belong with the other toys." The round ball thought for a moment and said, "That's okay! We can find a game that we both can play."
So, the round ball and the blue square played together. They found a game where they took turns rolling and sliding. The blue square was very happy and felt like it belonged with the other toys. The round ball was proud to have a new friend. From that day on, the round ball and the blue square played together every day, and they were the best of friends.

One day, a little dog named Max had a big itch on his back. He tried to reach it with his paw, but the itch was too far. Max felt sad and wanted his itch to go away.
Max saw his friend, a gentle cat named Lily. Max said, "Lily, I have an itch on my back. Can you help me?" Lily said, "Yes, Max! I will help you." Lily used her soft paw to scratch Max's itch. Max felt happy and the itch was gone.
Max and Lily played together all day. They ran and jumped in the sun. Max did not have an itch anymore. He was glad to have a gentle friend like Lily who could help him when he needed it.

One day, a small caterpillar named Tim went to visit his friend, a big bear named Ben. Tim crawled slowly on the ground to get to Ben's house. When he got there, Ben was eating honey.
"Hi Ben!" said Tim. "I came to visit you."
"Hi Tim!" said Ben. "I'm happy you came to see me."
While they were talking, a strong wind blew and a big leaf fell on Tim. Ben was scared because he could not see his friend. He thought Tim was gone. But then, Tim pushed the leaf off and crawled out.
"Wow, Tim!" said Ben. "You are small but very strong!"
Tim smiled and said, "Yes, we can all do big things even if we are small."
From that day, Ben learned that small friends can be strong too. And they played together every day, happy to be friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to wear pretty bows in her hair. One day, she saw a messy pile of bows at her friend's house. She thought it would be okay to take one without asking. 
But stealing is not okay. Lily's mother told her that taking something that doesn't belong to you is wrong. Lily felt bad and knew she had to make things right. 
The next day, Lily went to her friend's house and apologized for taking the bow. Her friend forgave her and they played together happily. Lily learned that it's always better to ask before taking something and to be honest when you make a mistake.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very good at playing outside with his friends. One day, a big tornado came to their town. Timmy's mommy told him to come inside, but Timmy didn't listen. He wanted to play outside with his friends.
As Timmy was running around, he slipped on a wet leaf and fell down. His friends laughed and ran away. Timmy was sad and alone. Suddenly, the tornado came closer and closer. Timmy was scared and didn't know what to do. He tried to run, but the tornado was too strong.
In the end, Timmy learned an important lesson. He should have listened to his mommy and stayed inside. It's always better to be safe than sorry.

One day, a cheerful little girl named Lily went to sit on the porch. She had a big cup of juice to drink. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. Lily loved to watch the butterflies fly by as she sat on the porch.
As she sat there, a friendly dog came up to her. "Hello," said the dog. "Can I have some of your drink?" Lily was very surprised! She did not know that dogs could talk. But she was a kind girl, so she said, "Yes, you can have some."
The dog took a sip of the juice, and then, something unexpected happened. The dog turned into a little boy! "Thank you," said the boy. "I was under a spell, and your kindness broke it. Now I can be a boy again!" Lily and the boy became best friends, and they played together on the porch every day.

Once upon a time, there was a small lion. He had big opinions on everything and wasn't afraid to share them. One day, he had an opinion he wanted to share with the world so he tried his best roar. He opened his mouth and it was so quiet that no one heard him. He was determined to make his opinion louder so he tried again, but this time much louder.
Suddenly, the whole forest heard him. The trees, the birds and all the animals were curious and asked the small lion what his opinion was. The small lion proudly spoke up, "My opinion is that the world should be kind!" 
The forest filled with roars of agreement. The small lion was so happy that his opinion was heard. From that day forward, the small lion would always let his roar be heard, when he had something important to say.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat peanuts. One day, her mom gave her a bag of peanuts, but they were cold. Lily didn't like cold peanuts. She yelled at her mom and threw the bag on the ground.
Later that day, Lily's little brother came to play with her. He wanted some peanuts too, but Lily didn't want to share. She yelled at him and told him to go away. Her brother felt sad and went to play by himself.
The next day, Lily woke up feeling sick. Her tummy hurt and she didn't want to eat anything. Her mom took her to the hospital and the doctor said that Lily had eaten bad peanuts. She felt very sorry and wished she had been nicer to her brother and her mom. The moral of the story is to always be kind to others and not to yell when things don't go our way.

Once upon a time, there was a gray bunny. The bunny loved to eat carrots. One day, the bunny went to find a carrot to eat. He hopped and hopped until he found a big carrot in the ground.
The bunny tried to pull the carrot out, but it was too hard. A bird flew by and saw the bunny. The bird said, "Bunny, you look tired. You should rest." The bunny said, "Thank you, bird. I will rest and try again."
After the bunny rested, he tried to pull the carrot again. But, the carrot was still too hard to pull out. The bunny was very sad. He did not get to eat the big carrot.

Once upon a time, there was a fish named Nemo. Nemo loved to swim in the ocean with his fish friends. One Wednesday, Nemo saw something unknown in the water. It was big and scary, and it made Nemo feel afraid. 
Nemo's fish friends didn't believe him when he told them about the unknown thing in the water. They thought Nemo was just being silly. But Nemo knew he had to be careful, so he swam away from the unknown thing as fast as he could. 
Later that day, Nemo's fish friends saw the unknown thing too. It was a big shark! Nemo had been right to be scared. But because Nemo had been brave and swam away, he was safe. Nemo's fish friends realized they should have listened to him and they all swam away together, happy and safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park with her friends. One day, Lily's friend Emma came to the park with a fan. 
Lily asked, "What is that?" 
Emma replied, "It's a fan. It blows air and makes you feel cool." 
Lily said, "Wow, that's cool! Can you bring it closer?" 
Emma brought the fan closer to Lily and they both felt the cool breeze. 
Suddenly, Lily's mom came and said, "Lily, it's time to go home now." 
Lily said, "Okay, Mom. But can we come back tomorrow and play with Emma again?" 
Her mom replied, "Yes, we can. But remember, it's important to be serious and listen to me when it's time to go home." 
Lily nodded and said goodbye to Emma, excited to come back to the park tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was an intelligent little pup called Paddle. She was so smart that she could find a wheel, no matter how big or small the place.
One day, Paddle was playing, running around in the park. But then, all of a sudden, she stopped and started to sneeze! She sneezed and sneezed and sneezed, and all the other puppies laughed at her. She was a bit embarrassed, but then she saw a wheel nearby, and she got an idea!
She hopped onto the wheel, and sneezed once more. Suddenly, the wheel started to move and it rolled away with Paddle! All the other puppies were surprised, and they clapped and cheered for her.
Paddle was so happy that she was able to use her intelligence to get away using the wheel. She kept on rolling around, and the other puppies followed her, running and laughing.
And they all lived happily ever after!

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Bobo. He lived in a big forest with his family. Bobo loved to hug his mom, dad, and his little sister, Lulu. Hugging made Bobo feel happy and safe.
One day, Bobo went to a meeting with all the animals in the forest. At the meeting, they talked about a terrible storm that was coming. The storm would bring lots of rain and wind. All the animals were scared and worried.
Bobo had an idea. He told the animals that they could all hug each other to feel better. So, all the animals hugged each other, and they felt less scared. The terrible storm came, but they were not afraid anymore. They knew that as long as they had each other to hug, they would be okay.

Once there was a happy little girl. She saw a drum in the park. She wanted to play with it. She ran over to the drum and sat down. 
She looked around and noticed that all the other kids were in an organized line. She decided to join them; she got in line and waited.
Soon, it was her turn. She enjoyed banging on the drum and making all sorts of fun sounds. Everyone could hear how much she was enjoying it.
When she was finished, the other kids clapped and smiled. She felt so proud! She walked away smiling, happy that she had seen the drum and played her own special rhythm.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the yard. One day, Timmy saw a rake on the ground. He decided to take it and play with it. 
Timmy started to rake the leaves into a big pile. He thought it was so much fun! But then, he accidentally stepped on the rake and it hit him in the face. Timmy realized that the rake was not a toy and it could hurt him if he wasn't careful.
From that day on, Timmy learned that some things may look ordinary, but they can still be dangerous if not used properly. He promised to always be careful with tools and to ask for help from grown-ups when he needed it.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny was playing with his friends in the forest when they saw a big, scary fox. They all ran away, but Benny was too careless and got caught by the fox.
The fox put Benny in a cage and said, "You can't escape now, little bunny." Benny was very scared and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, he saw his friend, a little bird named Billy, flying towards him.
Billy said, "Don't worry, Benny. I'll help you escape." Billy flew to get more friends to help. They all joined together and flew towards the cage. They used their beaks and claws to break the lock and set Benny free.
Benny was so happy and thanked all his friends. They all hugged and played together. Benny learned that he should be more careful and always stick with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, she found a secret box in her room. She opened it and found a treasure inside! It was a small doll that was very old and looked like it was dead. 
Lily was scared at first, but then she realized that it was just a toy. She started to play with it and had so much fun. She kept it as her secret toy and didn't tell anyone about it. 
Every day, Lily would play with her secret toy and it made her very happy. She knew that it was special and she loved it very much. From that day on, Lily had a new friend to play with and a special secret to keep.

One day, a little girl named Lucy had an interesting idea. She wanted to wrap a big box for her friend, Tom. She thought it would be a fun game to play with him. So, she found a big box and some colorful paper to wrap it.
Lucy worked very hard to wrap the box. When she was done, she called Tom and said, "I have a surprise for you! I wrapped a big box for you to open." Tom was very excited and came over to see the big box.
As Tom started to open the box, something unexpected happened. A little puppy jumped out of the box! Both Lucy and Tom were very surprised. They didn't know where the puppy came from. But they were so happy to have a new friend to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun, and her favorite place to go was the creek. She would spend hours there, splashing in the water and looking for rocks.
One day, Lily's friend Tommy came to play with her. He was a fat little boy with a big smile on his face. "Hi Lily!" he said. "Can I come play at the creek with you?"
"Sure!" said Lily. "We can spend the whole day there!"
So the two friends ran down to the creek and started playing. They found some sticks and pretended they were fishing poles. "I caught a big one!" said Tommy, holding up his stick.
Lily laughed. "That's not a fish, silly. It's just a stick." They played and laughed until the sun started to go down. "I had so much fun today," said Tommy. "Let's come back and spend the whole day here again soon!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went on a plane with her mommy and daddy. The plane was big and loud, but Lily was not scared. She looked out the window and saw the clouds. They looked like fluffy cotton candy.
Suddenly, the plane started to shiver and shake. Lily felt scared and held onto her mommy's hand. But her daddy said it was okay, it was just some turbulence. Lily still felt scared, but she tried to be brave.
After a while, the plane landed and they got off. Lily was happy to be on the ground again. But her daddy was grumpy because their luggage was lost. Lily tried to cheer him up by giving him a hug. And soon, they were all smiling again. The end.

One day there was a little girl who wanted to paint something special. She went and got her box of paints and thoughtfully chose a color. She got some soap from the kitchen and mixed it with the paint. Then she took a brush and started to paint a picture. Soon, the little girl had painted a colorful and beautiful picture. She was so proud of her work, it looked amazing! She showed the picture to her mom and dad, and they were very proud of her and gave her a big hug. 
The little girl was so happy that she painted something so wonderful. She learned that being thoughtful and creative can make something special. Painting with soap was so much fun and it made a unique and beautiful picture.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max who lived in a big house with his family. Max loved to play and run around in the yard, but one day he started to feel very lonely. He didn't have any friends to play with.
One day, Max was outside playing when he saw a flea on his fur. He tried to scratch it off, but it wouldn't go away. Max didn't like the flea because it made him itchy and uncomfortable.
Suddenly, something changed. The flea started to talk to Max! Max was very surprised because he had never heard a flea talk before. The flea said that he was also lonely and wanted to be Max's friend. Max was happy to have a new friend to play with, and he didn't feel lonely anymore. From that day on, Max and the flea played together every day, and Max was never lonely again.

Once upon a time, there was a white cat named Fluffy. Fluffy liked to read books with her friend, a little girl named Sue. Sue and Fluffy would sit under a big tree and read books together every day.
One day, Sue and Fluffy found a new book to read. It was about a happy dog who liked to play in the park. They read the book and smiled. They liked the story very much.
After they finished reading, Sue and Fluffy went to the park to play. They ran, jumped, and laughed. They had so much fun, just like the happy dog in the book. When it was time to go home, Sue and Fluffy walked back to their house with big smiles on their faces.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her yellow hoop. She would roll it around and around, giggling with joy. One day, Lily's big brother came to play with her. He wanted to roll the hoop too. 
Lily was happy to share her hoop with her brother. But, as he rolled the hoop, he accidentally broke it! Lily was sad and didn't know what to do. 
But then, her brother had an idea. He took the broken hoop and twisted it into a new shape. It was no longer a circle, but a funny squiggly shape. Lily was surprised and delighted! She loved her new hoop even more than the old one. 
From that day on, Lily and her brother played with the squiggly hoop together. It was a happy ending to a sad moment, and Lily learned that sometimes good things can come from unexpected surprises.

Once upon a time, there was a polite cat named Tim. Tim liked to play with a tray. He would push the tray all around the house. One day, Tim found a big red ball. He thought it would be fun to put the ball on the tray.
As Tim pushed the tray with the ball, something unexpected happened. The ball started to bounce up and down on the tray. Tim was very surprised. He did not know the ball could bounce like that. So he pushed the tray faster and faster.
Suddenly, the ball bounced off the tray and hit a big button on the wall. The button made the whole house shake. Then, the house began to fly up in the sky! Tim was scared at first, but then he saw how beautiful it was up there. In the end, Tim and the tray had a great adventure in the sky. They made new friends with the birds and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a baby. The mommy was holding a knife. But the baby wanted to play with the knife, so it reached out and tried to grab it.
"No," said the mommy quickly, "that knife is sharp and can break."
The baby stopped, feeling a bit dizzy. She couldn't understand why the mommy and the knife were so important.
Meanwhile, the mommy put the knife away, feeling relieved. As she hugged the baby, she explained that the knife was dangerous and could easily break if it was not handled carefully.
The baby was scared, but eventually she understood. She was encouraged to be careful whenever she saw a knife.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was very enthusiastic about playing dress-up. Lucy loved to wear masks and pretend to be different animals.
One day, Lucy found a mask that looked like a lion. She put it on and went to show her mommy. When she walked into the room, she roared like a big lion. Her mommy was so surprised that she closed her eyes and laughed.
Lucy loved playing with her lion mask. She would wear it all day and pretend to be a lion with her friends. They would all laugh and have fun together. And at the end of the day, Lucy would take off her mask, give it a big hug, and go to sleep.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park to play. She saw a friendly dog and said, "Hello doggy!" The dog wagged its tail and said, "Woof woof!" 
Lily saw a pin on the ground and picked it up. She said, "I found a pin!" The dog barked and said, "Be careful, Lily. Pins are sharp!" 
Lily played with the dog for a while and had fun. When it was time to go home, she said, "Goodbye doggy! See you later!" The dog barked and said, "Goodbye Lily! Have a nice day!" 
Lily went home and told her mom about her new friend. She said, "Mom, I met a friendly dog at the park today. We played together and he said goodbye to me!" Her mom smiled and said, "That sounds like a fun day, Lily."

One day, a bird found a pretty feather on the ground. The bird was happy and showed the feather to his friend, a cat.
"Look, look!" said the bird. "Pretty feather!"
The cat liked the feather too. "Can I have it?" asked the cat.
"Yes, but you have to give me something in return," said the bird.
"I have a shiny toy!" said the cat.
The bird liked the toy, so he gave the feather to the cat and took the toy. But then the cat ran away with the feather and locked it in a box.
The bird was sad and cried. "My pretty feather! Give it back!"
But the cat didn't listen and kept the feather locked away. The bird never saw his pretty feather again.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy who loved music. He played his trumpet every day and dreamed of playing in a big band. One day, Timmy's mom took him to a concert. The band was amazing and Timmy was so happy. 
After the concert, Timmy's mom took him backstage to meet the band. The trumpet player was crazy good and Timmy was in awe. The trumpet player even let Timmy play his trumpet for a minute. Timmy was so excited and couldn't believe it. 
The next day, Timmy's mom surprised him with a new trumpet. Timmy was so happy and couldn't wait to play it. He practiced every day and soon became really good. One day, Timmy was asked to play in a big band. He was so excited and couldn't believe it. The band included the same trumpet player from the concert. Timmy played his heart out and the trumpet player was impressed. Timmy knew that this was just the beginning of his musical journey.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a famous cat. The cat was famous because it could jump very high. Everyone in the town liked to watch the cat jump.
One day, the cat decided to quit jumping. The people in the town were sad. They missed the sight of the cat jumping high in the sky.
A little girl in the town had an idea. She gave the cat a big hug and asked it to jump again. The cat was happy and started jumping again. The people in the town were happy too. They loved the sight of their famous cat jumping high.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to talk and play with her toys. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. 
As they were walking, they saw a man with a grumpy face. He didn't talk to anyone and his body looked tired. Lily's mommy told her to be careful and not to talk to strangers. 
Later that day, Lily and her mommy went to the ice cream shop. As they were waiting in line, the same grumpy man walked in. Lily remembered what her mommy said and didn't talk to him. But then, the man smiled at her and said, "Hello, little girl. What's your favorite ice cream flavor?" Lily was surprised and happy that the grumpy man was actually nice. From that day on, Lily learned that sometimes people might look grumpy, but they can still be friendly and kind.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer. He had a big farm with many animals. The farmer was very restless. He liked to run and play with his animals every day.
One day, the farmer found a big, soft ball. He decided to play with it. He would squeeze the ball with his hands and then throw it high into the sky. The animals liked to watch the ball go up and down.
The farmer and his animals played with the ball all day long. They were very happy. When the sun went down, they all went to sleep. The restless farmer had so much fun, he slept very well that night.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to go on journeys. One day, she went on a journey with her mom and dad. They went deep into the woods where they found a tiny house.
Lily saw a door and said, "Mom, can we unlock the door and see what's inside?" Her mom said, "Okay, let's try." They found a key and unlocked the door. Inside the tiny house, they found a cute little cat.
The cat said, "Thank you for unlocking the door! I was stuck inside for so long." Lily, her mom, and dad were happy to help the cat. They all became friends and continued their journey through the woods, having lots of fun together.

Tim likes to write. He writes on paper, on walls, on books, on anything he can find. He writes his name, his numbers, his shapes, and his stories. He writes with pens, with crayons, with markers, and with paint. He writes every day, all the time.
One day, his mom sees him writing on the sofa. She is not happy. She says, "Tim, stop! You are making a mess. You are wasting the sofa. You cannot write on the sofa. That is not normal. You have to write on paper. Paper is for writing. Sofa is for sitting. Do you understand?"
Tim looks at his mom. He does not understand. He likes to write on the sofa. He thinks it is fun. He thinks it is normal. He says, "But mom, I like to write on the sofa. It is soft. It is big. It is my sofa. I can write on my sofa. Why not?"
His mom sighs. She loves Tim, but she does not like his writing on the sofa. She says, "Tim, I know you like to write, and I am proud of you. But you have to be careful. You have to respect the things you have. You have to use them the right way. Writing on the sofa is not the right way. It is wasting the sofa. It is ruining the sofa. It is making the sofa dirty. It is not normal. People do not write on sofas. They write on paper. Paper is cheap. Paper is easy. Paper is normal. Please, Tim, write on paper. OK?"
Tim thinks for a moment. He does not want to waste the sofa. He does not want to ruin the sofa. He does not want to make the sofa dirty. He does not want to make his mom sad. He wants to be normal. He says, "OK, mom. I will write on paper. I am sorry. I love you."
His mom smiles. She hugs him. She says, "I love you too, Tim. Thank you for listening. Now, let's go and get some paper. And some soap. And some water. And some towels. And let's clean the sofa. OK?"
Tim nods. He follows his mom. He writes on paper. He cleans the sofa. He learns a lesson. He is normal. He is happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved watching cartoons on TV. He would sit on his couch and look at the colorful characters on the screen. One day, Timmy saw a cartoon with a friendly dog. The dog was so cute and Timmy wanted to meet him.
The next day, Timmy went to the park with his mom. As they were walking, Timmy saw a dog that looked just like the one from the cartoon. The dog was wagging his tail and seemed very friendly. Timmy was so excited and ran towards the dog to say hello.
As Timmy got closer, he saw that the dog had a collar with a tag on it. The tag had the dog's name and phone number. Timmy's mom called the number and the dog's owner came to pick him up. The owner was so grateful to Timmy and his mom for finding his lost dog. Timmy felt happy that he was able to help and he knew that he would always look out for his furry friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun with her friends. One day, she found a small seed on the ground and decided to plant it in her backyard. She watered it every day and watched it grow tall and strong. 
One day, the seed became a big palm tree with lots of leaves. Lily loved to sit under the palm tree and read her favorite books. The palm tree was so big that it made a quiet sound when the wind blew through its leaves. 
Lily was very happy that she planted the seed and it became a beautiful palm tree. She knew that with love and care, anything can become big and strong.

One day, a charming little girl named Amy went to the park with her mom. They saw a swing and Amy wanted to play on it. Her mom said, "Amy, look at the swing! Do you want to try it?"
Amy got on the swing and her mom pushed her. She went up and down, laughing and having fun. They saw a boy named Tim who wanted to swing too. Amy said, "Hi Tim! Look, I am on the swing!"
Tim smiled and said, "Hi Amy! Can I swing too?" Amy said yes and they took turns on the swing. They had a great day at the park, playing on the swing and making new friends.

One day, a funny owl was in the tree. The owl saw a cat. The cat was not nice. The owl was scared.
The cat wanted to spray water at the owl. The owl did not like water. The owl tried to fly away, but the cat was fast.
The cat sprayed water at the owl. The owl got wet and sad. The cat laughed. The owl did not have a good day.

Once upon a time, there was an old teddy bear. He was very tired and wanted to sleep. But he couldn't because his battery was low. The teddy bear was sad because he couldn't sleep. 
Then, a little girl found the old teddy bear. She saw that his battery was low and she changed it for him. The teddy bear was happy again and he could sleep. The little girl hugged the teddy bear and they both fell asleep together. 
From that day on, the old teddy bear and the little girl became best friends. They would play together and sleep together every night. The teddy bear was no longer sad because he had a new friend and a new battery.

Once upon a time, there was a smart bird named Benny. Benny was very intelligent. He could do many things that other birds could not do. Benny had a friend named Tommy. Tommy was a little boy who loved to play with Benny.
One day, Tommy found a toy called a missile. It was a long, pointy thing that could fly very fast. Tommy wanted to play with the missile and Benny. He asked his mommy if he could. His mommy said, "I permit you to play with the missile and Benny, but be careful!"
Tommy and Benny went outside to play with the missile. They took turns throwing it into the sky. The missile went up, up, up, and then came back down. Benny was very good at catching it with his beak.
They played with the missile all day long. Benny and Tommy had lots of fun. When it was time to go inside, they were very tired. Benny flew back to his tree, and Tommy went inside to eat dinner with his family. They both knew they would have more fun together the next day.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was a mild boy who liked to help others. One day, while walking to the park, Tim saw a man with a staff. The man looked sad, so Tim went to talk to him.
"Hello, sir," said Tim. "Why are you sad?" The man looked at Tim and replied, "I lost my way to the park. Can you help me?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, I can help you. Follow me."
Tim and the man with the staff walked together to the park. When they got there, Tim saw his friends playing. He wanted to play too, but he knew he had to help the man first. "Here is the park, sir," said Tim. The man looked around and replied, "Thank you, Tim. You are a kind boy."
Suddenly, the man with the staff became mean. He took Tim's hand and said, "Now, you will come with me." Tim was scared and cried for help. His friends heard him and ran to him, but they were too late. The man with the staff took Tim away, and he was never seen again. The town was sad, and they all missed Tim very much.

Once upon a time, there was a big boat in a harbor. It was an original boat, made a long time ago. The boat was very happy in the harbor, but one day it started to tremble. The boat was scared, it didn't know what was happening.
Suddenly, a big storm came and the waves were very high. The boat tried to stay still, but it was too hard. The boat was thrown around and hit a rock. The boat was very sad and thought it was going to sink.
But then, something unexpected happened. A group of dolphins came and pushed the boat out of the harbor and into the open sea. The boat was surprised and happy. It realized that it didn't have to be scared of new things, because sometimes they can be good.

Molly was walking in the park one day. She wanted to go for a zoom, so she ran quickly to the swings. She started to swing high and fast, which made her giggle.
Suddenly, a loud noise made her stop. Molly was a little fearful, so she decided to delay getting out of the swing. But when she looked up, she saw a big grey cloud coming towards her. A heavy rain started to fall!
Molly shouted, "I wish I had left the park sooner!" But the rain didn't stop and Molly had to stay out in the rain. She cried out of fear and sadness, and ran home all wet.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun and pick flowers. One day, she found a delicate butterfly with wings as soft as petals. 
Lily said, "Hello butterfly! Do you want to play with me?" The butterfly didn't say anything, but it nodded its head up and down. 
Lily played with the butterfly all day long. They ran, hopped, and danced together. When the year started to get colder, the butterfly said, "Lily, I have to go now. It's time for me to sleep for the winter." 
Lily was sad to say goodbye to her friend, but she knew the butterfly would come back in the spring. Sure enough, when the year turned to spring, the butterfly returned to play with Lily once again.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Mark. He loved to play outside. One day, he went to the park with his mom. The park was very big and had a wide space to run and play.
At the park, Mark saw a little dog. The dog was a new sight for him. Mark liked the dog very much. He asked his mom if he could pet the dog. His mom said yes, but to be gentle. Mark slowly went near the dog and petted it softly.
Mark and the dog played together in the wide park. They ran, jumped, and laughed. Mark had so much fun with his new friend. When it was time to go home, Mark said goodbye to the dog. He knew he would remember this special day and the new sight of his dog friend forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys, but she didn't like to clean up after herself. Her room was very messy and dusty. 
One day, Lily's mom came into her room and was surprised by how messy it was. She asked Lily to clean up her toys and dust her room. But Lily didn't want to clean up. 
Later that day, Lily was playing with her favorite toy when she heard a loud noise. She became alert and scared. She looked around and saw that her toy was stuck under a pile of dust. She realized that she needed to clean up her room so she could find her toys and not be surprised by any scary noises again. From that day on, Lily made sure to clean up after herself and keep her room tidy.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky liked to play with his friends in the pond. One day, Ducky found a square rock by the pond. He thought it was very cool and wanted to show his friends. 
Ducky tried to pick up the rock with his beak, but it was too heavy. So, he asked his friends to help him. Together, they laid the rock on the grass. Ducky was so happy because he could show his friends the cool square rock.
After they finished playing, Ducky and his friends went back to the pond. Ducky was ready to swim and play some more. But he couldn't stop thinking about the square rock. He was so happy to have found something new and exciting.

One day, a boy named Tim went to spend time with his dad. His dad worked in the navy. They got on a big boat. Tim felt anxious because he had never been on a boat before.
As they sailed, they saw a fish jump out of the water. Tim was so excited! But then, something unexpected happened. The fish started to talk! Tim and his dad looked at each other, surprised.
The talking fish told Tim and his dad that it was lost. Tim and his dad helped the fish find its way home. The fish was very happy. In the end, Tim was not anxious anymore. He had a fun day with his dad and made a new friend.

Once upon a time, a big dinosaur lived in a forest. The dinosaur had rough skin. He liked to help his friends. One day, a bird came to the dinosaur. The bird said, "Can you help me deliver this letter to my friend? She lives far away."
The dinosaur said, "Yes, I can help you." So, the dinosaur took the letter in his mouth and walked a long way to deliver it. He walked and walked until he saw a big tree. The dinosaur looked up and saw a nest. He thought, "This must be where the bird's friend lives."
But when the dinosaur gave the letter to the bird in the nest, the bird said, "I am not the right bird. Your friend is in another tree." The dinosaur was surprised! He looked around and saw many trees with nests. He had to find the right one.
The dinosaur went to each tree and asked if the bird was the right one. He finally found the right tree and gave the letter to the right bird. The bird said, "Thank you for delivering my letter!" The dinosaur was happy to help and went back to his home in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little yellow rabbit. The rabbit lived in a small house near the big woods. The rabbit liked to play with his friends, the birds and the squirrels.
One sunny day, the yellow rabbit saw a big tree with a pretty red apple on it. The rabbit wanted to eat the apple, but it was too high for him to reach. He jumped and jumped, but he could not get the apple.
Then, a kind bird flew down and helped the yellow rabbit. The bird flew up and pushed the apple off the tree. The apple fell down, and the rabbit could reach it now. The rabbit was very happy and said thank you to the bird. They both shared the yummy apple and played together all day long.

One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to play. She was very stubborn. She said to her mom, "I want to go on a tour!"
Her mom said, "Okay, let's imagine a tour in our house." They went to the kitchen and Lucy saw a big cake on the table. She was so happy and said, "Wow! I didn't know we had a big cake!"
Then, they went to the living room. Lucy saw a big toy box. She was very excited and said, "I didn't know we had so many toys!" Her mom laughed and said, "You have always had these toys, you just didn't know."
At the end of the tour, Lucy found a new friend hiding behind the couch. It was a cute little dog! She was so surprised and said, "I didn't know we had a dog!" Her mom smiled and said, "This is our new family member. I hope you like him." Lucy loved her new friend and they played together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot was black and loved to have fun. He lived in a big house with his best friend, a little girl named Emma.
One sunny day, Emma and Spot were playing in the yard. They liked to play catch with a red ball. Emma would throw the ball, and Spot would run very fast to get it. "Spot, you are so fast!" Emma said, laughing. Spot wagged his tail and barked happily.
After playing for a while, Emma and Spot went inside the house to have a snack. Emma's mom gave them both a treat. Spot got a bone, and Emma got a cookie. They sat on the floor, eating and smiling at each other. They were very happy to have each other as friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big cow named Betsy. Betsy loved to eat grass and play with her cow friends. One day, Betsy's mom told her that it was time to decide what she wanted to eat for dinner.
Betsy thought for a moment and said, "I want to eat beef!"
Her mom was surprised and said, "But Betsy, you are beef!"
Betsy was stubborn and said, "I don't care, I want to try it!"
Her mom sighed and said, "Okay, we'll have beef for dinner tonight." But Betsy didn't like the taste of beef and decided she would stick to eating grass from now on.

Once upon a time, there was a big smelly dog. He loved to run and play in the park. One day, a little girl came to the park with her mommy. The little girl saw the dog and pointed at him. The dog wagged his tail and ran over to the little girl. The mommy wrote a note to the little girl's daddy, telling him about the friendly dog. The little girl and the dog became best friends and played together every day.

Lily and Ben were playing with their toys in the living room. They liked to display their toys on the shelf and pretend they were in a museum. Lily had a doll, a teddy bear and a ball. Ben had a car, a train and a robot.
"Look at my robot!" Ben said. "It can move and make noises. It is very cool."
He pressed a button and the robot started to walk and beep. Lily was fearful of the robot. She thought it was scary and loud. She hid behind the couch and hugged her doll.
"Ben, stop it!" Lily said. "Your robot is scary. I don't like it."
Ben laughed and said, "Don't be silly, Lily. It is just a toy. It can't hurt you. Come and see. It is fun."
He picked up the robot and brought it to the couch. He showed Lily how it worked and what it could do. He pointed to its eyes, its arms and its legs.
"See, Lily? It is not scary. It is friendly. It can be your friend too. Do you want to play with it?"
Lily looked at the robot. She saw that it was not scary. It was friendly. It smiled and waved at her. She felt brave and curious. She reached out and touched the robot. It felt smooth and cold.
"Okay, Ben. I will play with it. It is cool. But can we also play with my doll and your train?"
Ben nodded and said, "Sure, Lily. We can play with all our toys. We can display them on the shelf and make a big museum. It will be fun."
Lily and Ben smiled and played with their toys. They were not fearful anymore. They were happy.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big box. They hope it has something fun inside.
They open the box. It is empty. They are sad. They search the park for something else to play with. They find a ball, a kite, and a teddy bear. They are happy.
They play with the ball, the kite, and the teddy bear. The sun is mild. It is not too hot or too cold. They have a lot of fun. They share the toys and take turns.
They hear their moms call them. It is time to go home. They put the toys back in the box. They hope someone else will find them and play with them. They say goodbye to each other and hug. They are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Tim. Tim loved to eat tuna. One day, Tim went to the kitchen to find some tuna. He opened the fridge and saw a can of tuna. Tim was very happy.
"Yummy! Tuna!" said Tim. But when he opened the can, he saw that the tuna was frozen. Tim was sad because he couldn't eat the frozen tuna. So he asked his friend, a dog named Max, for help.
"Max, my tuna is frozen. What should I do?" Tim asked. Max thought for a moment, then said, "Let's put the tuna outside in the sun. The sun will make the tuna warm and not frozen."
Tim and Max put the tuna outside in the sun. They waited and waited. Finally, the tuna was not frozen anymore. Tim was excited to eat the tuna. But when he took a bite, he made a face.
"Ew! This tuna is disgusting!" Tim said. Max laughed and said, "Maybe next time, we can find a better way to unfreeze your tuna." Tim agreed, and they both went to play outside.

Tim and Sue are friends. They like to play on the farm. They see a big pile of wheat. Wheat is yellow and soft. They want to touch it.
"Let's play with the wheat!" Tim says.
"OK!" Sue says.
They run to the pile of wheat. They grab some wheat and throw it in the air. They laugh and have fun.
But the farmer sees them. He is angry. He does not like them to play with his wheat. He needs the wheat for his bread.
"Hey, you two! Stop that!" the farmer shouts. "You are making my wheat dirty!"
Tim and Sue are scared. They drop the wheat and run away.
"Sorry, mister!" Tim says.
"Sorry, mister!" Sue says.
They run back to their house. They are sad. They like the wheat, but they do not want to make the farmer mad.
The next day, the farmer comes to their house. He has a basket in his hand. He knocks on the door.
"Hello, Tim and Sue," he says. "I have something for you."
He gives them the basket. They open it. They see two loaves of bread. The bread is warm and smells good.
"This is for you," the farmer says. "I made it with my wheat. I was angry yesterday, but I am not angry today. I know you were just having fun. But please, do not play with my wheat again. It is very important to me."
Tim and Sue are happy. They receive the bread from the farmer. They say thank you.
"Thank you, mister!" Tim says.
"Thank you, mister!" Sue says.
