They invite the farmer to eat with them. They share the bread and some jam. They are friends. They do not play with the wheat anymore. They play with the cows and the chickens. They have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named Mia. She liked to explore and find new things. One day, she saw a small box in her room. Mia was excited and wanted to see what was inside.
Mia tried to open the box, but her hand did not fit. She was sad, but then she had an idea. She found a little stick and used it to open the box. Inside the box, there was a tiny light. The light was very pretty and bright.
Mia was so happy to find the light. She took it everywhere with her. The light made her feel safe and happy. Mia shared the light with her friends, and they all loved it too. And they all played together, with the curious little girl and her special light.

Once upon a time, there was a good little frog. This frog lived in a small pond. One day, the frog met a big fish. The fish was sad.
"Why are you sad?" asked the frog. The fish said, "I can't find my friend. We were playing, and then we part. I miss my friend."
The good frog wanted to help. They looked everywhere in the pond. Then, they saw a big rock. The frog and fish went to the rock. They found the fish's friend behind the rock! The friend was a tiny bird! The fish and bird were so happy to see each other. The good frog was happy too. They all played together and became best friends.

Jimmy was tired of all the search. He had been looking everywhere for the toy he wanted but no luck. Even the stores had nothing like it. He sadly went back home, defeated, thinking maybe he could still find what he wanted some other day. 
Out of nowhere, he heard a loud noise and he was startled. Something was shooting! He quickly hid, scared of what he might see.
When the noise finally stopped he got out of hiding. Much to his surprise, there was his toy in the grass! Someone had been careless and left it there. Jimmy was amazed and glad. He was excited to take it back home and show it to everyone. 
Jimmy learned his lesson that day. Even when search seemed to have no end, he should never give up. He took the toy and ran home, smiling.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, she accidentally bumped into her friend, Timmy, and he fell down. Timmy hurt his nose and started to cry.
Lily felt guilty and said, "I'm sorry, Timmy. Please don't cry." Timmy wiped his tears and said, "It's okay, Lily. Accidents happen." 
Lily helped Timmy up and they continued playing. They played hide-and-seek and tag. They had so much fun that they forgot about the accident. 
At the end of the day, Lily said goodbye to Timmy and went home. She told her mom about what happened and her mom said, "It's good that you said sorry and helped Timmy. That's what friends do." 
Lily went to bed feeling happy and grateful for her friends. She learned that saying sorry and helping others is important.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Millie. She was three years old and loved to play. One day, she was playing in her living room, when she saw a man come in. She quickly ran over to him, as he sat down on the couch.
The man quickly noticed Millie, and he said to her "I am here to fix the couch. Do you mind if I work?" Millie said "No, but why is it broken?". The man replied "It is suffering because it is old and thick". Millie nodded in understanding.
The man started to work on the couch and after a few hours, the man was finished. But, the couch was still suffering. Millie was very sad and started to cry. The man suggested that maybe he could come back again and try to fix it. Millie smiled and said "That would be great. Please come back soon so I can play on the sofa." 
The man promised to come back and he hugged Millie goodbye. The next day, the man came back and fixed the couch. Now Millie could sit, lay and play on the couch comfortably. She was very happy. The man smiled and said "See, the sofa is not suffering anymore!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat waffles for breakfast every day. Waffles were her favorite food because they were yummy and crunchy. 
One day, Lily's mom made waffles for breakfast, but she burned them. Lily was sad because she couldn't eat her favorite food. 
But then, her dad came home from the store with a surprise. He brought a new waffle maker! Now, Lily could make her own waffles and they would be perfect every time. 
Lily was so happy that she told all her friends at school about her new waffle maker. It became very popular and all her friends wanted to come over for waffles too!

Once upon a time there was a park with lots of unusual things. There were trees and flowers, a pool, a slide and a swing.
One day, two children went to the park. One of them was three-year-old Anny. Anny saw the swing and told her friend to show her how to use it. Her friend smiled and said, "Okay, I'll show you!".
Her friend showed Anny how to sit on the swing and move back and forth. Anny was amazed and laughed a lot as she tried it. She said to her friend, "This is so cool! I can swing like the birds in the sky!"
Anny and her friend continued to play on the swing until it was time to go home. Anny had lots of fun and said goodbye to the park and the unusual swing.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, while she was playing with her toys, a pigeon came and sat next to her. Lily was scared at first, but then she realized that the pigeon was friendly.
The pigeon looked hungry, so Lily decided to give it some of her sandwich. The pigeon ate the sandwich and then flew away. Lily felt happy that she could help the pigeon.
Later that day, Lily's friends came to play with her. They wanted to play with her toys, but they were all messy. Lily wanted her toys to be tidy, but her friends didn't listen. Lily was upset and didn't know what to do. But then, she remembered how happy she felt when she gave the pigeon some of her sandwich. So, she decided to give her friends a chance to help tidy up the toys. Her friends agreed and they all worked together to make the toys tidy. Lily felt happy again, and her friends were happy too.

Sara loved spring. All the flowers started to bloom and it was so beautiful. Today, Sara was very excited. She had a ticket to the flower show. She could not wait to get there and see all of the different blooms.
When Sara arrived at the show, she was amazed. All the colors were so beautiful. She could smell the mild fragrance of the flowers in the air. She quickly ran around the show, admiring all the colors and scents.
Sara especially loved to look at the yellow and pink tulips. They were her favorite and made her smile. She loved to see them bloom in the sun.
After a while, Sara got tired but was so happy that she had gone to the flower show. She was already looking forward to her next ticket and the chance to see more blooms in the spring!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was a youth who liked to play with his ball. One day, he saw a weird bug in his yard. The bug was big and had lots of legs. Tim wanted to show the bug to his friends, so he picked it up and put it in a jar.
Tim went to his friends' house to play. They played with the ball and took turns looking at the weird bug. Then, they played a game of hide and seek. Tim hid the jar with the bug under a bush. But when the game was over, Tim could not find the jar. He looked and looked, but the jar was gone. Tim felt sad because he had lost his weird bug.
As Tim walked home, he saw the weird bug on the ground. He was happy to find it again. But when he picked it up, the bug bit him. Tim's hand got big and red. His mom took him to the doctor, but the doctor could not help. Tim's hand stayed big and red forever. Tim was sad that he lost his ball and his hand was never the same.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside and looking for bugs. One day, she found a spider crawling on her arm. She said, "Hello, little spider. Can I keep you?" 
The spider said, "Yes, if you attach me to a clean stick." 
Lily looked around and found a clean stick. She carefully attached the spider to the stick and said, "Now you can come with me on my adventures!" 
The spider was happy to have a new friend and they went on many adventures together. They climbed trees, explored the garden, and even went on a picnic. Lily always made sure the spider was safe and clean on their adventures.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big box with a wrap on it. The wrap is red and shiny. It has a bow on top.
"Wow, look at that!" Tom says. "Maybe it is a gift for someone."
"Let's open it and see what is inside," Mia says. She runs to the box and pulls the wrap.
"Wait, Mia, don't do that!" Tom says. "It is not ours. It is rude to open other people's gifts."
But Mia does not listen. She tears the wrap and opens the box. She screams. Inside the box, there is a big snake. It is green and scaly. It has sharp teeth and a long tongue. It hisses and jumps out of the box.
Tom and Mia are scared. They try to run away, but the snake is faster. It wraps around them and squeezes them. It stares at them with its deep, black eyes. It opens its mouth and bites them.
Tom and Mia are gone. The snake is full. It crawls back into the box and waits for the next person who will open it.

One day, a big, open box came to Sam's house. Sam was very happy. He knew there was a treat inside. "What could be in the box?" Sam asked his mom.
"Open it and see!" said Mom. Sam opened the box and found a big, red ball. He was so happy. Sam wanted to play with the ball outside, but it was raining. "Can I play with the ball inside?" Sam asked.
"No, we can't play with the ball inside. Let's wait for the rain to stop," Mom said. Sam was sad, but he waited.
The next day, the sun was shining. Sam took his ball outside to play. He threw the ball high in the air. But, the ball fell into a big puddle. The ball was all wet and soaked. Sam was sad.
Just then, a new friend came to play. "Hi, I'm Tim. I have a treat for you!" Tim said. He gave Sam a big towel to dry the ball. Sam was happy again. They played with the ball all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, in a cold winter, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play outside with his friends, but today it was too cold. He looked out the window and saw the scary snowman that he and his friends made.
Tim wanted to play with his toy car, but he couldn't find it. He looked under his bed, in his toy box, and behind the door. Then, he remembered that he left it outside. So, Tim put on his warm coat, hat, and gloves and went outside to get his toy car.
The wind was strong and the snow was deep. Tim had to carry his toy car back to the house. He held it tight in his hands so it wouldn't get lost in the snow. When he got back inside, he was happy to have his toy car and play with it all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet cat named Mittens. Every day, Lily would feed Mittens some yummy cat food. Mittens loved to eat and would always meow loudly when it was time to eat. One day, Lily was playing with her toys and she saw a mirror on the wall. She looked at herself in the mirror and smiled. She thought she looked pretty. The mirror was shiny and reflected everything in the room. Lily liked to look at herself in the mirror and make funny faces. The light was very mild and made everything look soft and cozy. Lily liked to play in the mild light and look at herself in the mirror.

One day, a little dog named Max went for a walk. He liked to exercise and play outside. The sun was shining and the birds were singing. Max felt happy.
As Max walked, he saw a big, red ball. He felt confused. He did not know what it was. Max went closer and sniffed the ball. He decided to chew on it. The ball was very bouncy and fun to play with.
Max played with the ball all day. He chewed it, chased it, and rolled it around. He got lots of exercise and had so much fun. When it was time to go home, Max was tired but happy. He couldn't wait to play with the ball again.

One day, a big aeroplane came to the town. The aeroplane was very happy to be there. It said, "Welcome, friends! I am here to take you on a fun trip!"
A small car saw the aeroplane and felt jealous. The car said, "I can take people to places too! But I cannot fly like you." The aeroplane smiled and said, "That's okay, car. We can be friends and help people together."
The car and the aeroplane became good friends. They took people to many fun places. Everyone in the town was happy because of them. And the car was not jealous anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby little bear named Benny. Benny loved to dance on stage and sing songs with his friends. One day, while dancing, Benny fell and hurt his paw. It made him sad and he couldn't dance anymore.
Benny's friends wanted to help him feel better, so they took him to see a special doctor who could heal his paw. The doctor was very kind and gave Benny some medicine to make him feel better. After a few days, Benny's paw was all better and he could dance on stage again with his friends.
Benny was so happy to be back on stage, singing and dancing with his friends. He knew that he was very lucky to have such good friends who cared about him and helped him heal. From that day on, Benny made sure to be extra careful when he danced so he wouldn't get hurt again.

Once upon a time, a little dog named Max was waiting for his friend, the big cat Tom, to arrive. Max was very excited and kept looking down the road. But Tom was not there yet. Max felt a little dizzy because he was so excited.
Then, Max saw a big box on the road. He walked up to the box and sniffed it. Max thought, "Maybe Tom is in the box!" He barked and barked, but Tom did not come out. Max felt sad and dizzy.
Suddenly, the box started to shake. Max jumped back and watched. The box opened, and out came not Tom, but a big, friendly bear! The bear said, "Hi, Max! I'm Ben, your new friend!" Max was so surprised and happy. He forgot about feeling dizzy. Max and Ben played together until Tom finally arrived. Then, all three friends played together, and they had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine and pick flowers. One day, she found a seed and decided to plant it in the ground. She watered it every day and watched it grow bigger and bigger. 
After a few weeks, a beautiful purple flower bloomed from the seed. Lily was so happy and proud of herself for making it grow. She showed it to all of her friends and they thought it was very pretty too. 
From then on, Lily loved to plant seeds and watch them grow into big, beautiful flowers. She was always amazed at how something so small could turn into something so wonderful.

Once upon a time there was a young girl who wanted to stay young forever. She liked playing games, having fun and feeling young. One day, she asked her mom to never let her turn old. Her mom said she could not make her young forever but she could help her stay young in heart.
The girl was determined to stay young, so she thought and thought until she had an idea. She decided to stay far away from the old people. She didn't want to talk to them, or play with them or even look at them. 
The girl avoided the old people in the village and didn't even turn to look at them. But one day, her mom said it was wrong to be so unkind. She said it was wrong to ignore people just because they were old.
The girl was sad. She knew her mom was right and she turned around to say sorry to the old man. He smiled and told her it was okay. He said the most important thing was to be young in heart and that no one can ever make you old.
From then on, the girl was kind to young and old people alike and she never forgot what the old man had said. She was young in heart and enjoyed each and every day.

Once upon a time, there was a man who had a big fridge. He loved his fridge so much because it kept his food cold and fresh. One day, he decided to sell his fridge because he needed some money. 
He put a sign outside his house that said "Fridge for sale". A lady came to his house and asked about the fridge. The man told her about all the good things the fridge could do. The lady liked the fridge and bought it from the man.
After the lady left, the man felt calm because he got the money he needed. He knew that the fridge would be happy in its new home. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and explore the world around him. One night, he looked up and saw the moon in the sky. It was big and round and smooth-looking.
Timmy wanted to touch the moon, so he tried to jump up and catch it. But the moon was too far away. Timmy felt sad and went to bed.
The next day, Timmy's mom told him that he couldn't always get what he wanted, but that was okay. She said that sometimes we have to work hard and wait patiently for things to come to us. Timmy realized that he couldn't catch the moon, but he could still enjoy looking at it. He returned to his room and gazed out the window at the beautiful, smooth moon.

Once upon a time, there was a squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to find nuts and play with his friends. One day, Sam found a very special nut. It was big and shiny. Sam thought it was an expensive nut.
Sam showed the nut to his friend, Bunny. Bunny said, "Wow! That's a big nut! Where did you find it?" Sam told Bunny he found it near the river. They both went to the river to find more nuts.
At the river, they saw a duck. The duck was bathing in the water. Sam and Bunny asked the duck if he saw any nuts. The duck said, "I saw some nuts in the water. You can have them if you want." Sam and Bunny jumped in the water and played with the duck. They found more nuts and had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to watch cartoons on TV. His favorite cartoon was about a fast car that could climb big hills.
One day, Tim wanted to be like the fast car in his cartoon. He found a big hill in his backyard and decided to climb it. Tim was very excited and started to climb up the hill, just like the fast car.
But Tim was not as fast as the car in the cartoon. He climbed and climbed, but he got tired. Tim slipped and fell down the hill. He was sad and hurt. Tim learned that he should not try to climb big hills like the fast car in his cartoon.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily was getting ready for her birthday party. She wanted to look pretty, so she asked her mom for some makeup. Her mom gave her some lipstick and blush.
Lily tried to put on the makeup, but it didn't look good. She felt miserable and started to cry. Her mom asked her what was wrong, and Lily told her about the makeup.
Her mom recommended that they practice putting on makeup together. They practiced and practiced until Lily got it right. When they were finished, Lily looked beautiful and was very happy. She thanked her mom for her help and they went to the party together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was playing in her room when she saw a little bug. She wanted to catch the bug, so she pinched it with her fingers. "Got you!" she said.
Sue wanted to show the bug to her mom, but first, she needed to find a place to keep it safe. She looked around and found a small closet. The closet was tight, but she thought the bug would be okay in there for a little while. Sue put the bug in the closet and closed the door.
Later, Sue's mom came into the room. "Mom, look what I found!" said Sue. She opened the closet and showed her mom the bug. Her mom smiled and said, "That's a nice bug, Sue. Let's let it go outside so it can be with its friends." Sue agreed, and they let the bug go free.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toy cars. One day, Timmy's favorite car got stuck under the couch. Timmy tried to reach it, but he couldn't. He felt sad.
Suddenly, Timmy's mom came to help him. She lifted the couch and Timmy was able to get his car. Timmy felt happy again. 
But then, Timmy's little sister came and turned off the lights. Timmy was scared of the dark. His mom turned on a powerful flashlight to make Timmy feel better. Timmy felt safe again.
In the end, Timmy realized that even when things go wrong, there's always someone there to help him.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Whiskers. Whiskers loved to sleep all day and never liked to play. One day, Whiskers found a journal and decided to write about all the naps he took. He wrote about how he slept on the couch, under the bed, and even in the laundry basket.
But then something unexpected happened. Whiskers accidentally locked himself in the closet with the journal. He meowed and meowed, but no one heard him. He was scared and didn't know what to do. But then he had an idea. He used his claws to scratch at the door and eventually he was able to open it.
Whiskers was so happy to be free and he learned a lesson. He realized that he shouldn't be lazy and should always be careful when playing with things like locks. From that day on, Whiskers made sure to always be aware of his surroundings and to never let himself get locked in a closet again.

Once upon a time, in a land full of fruit, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy was a sleepy bird who loved to eat grapes. One day, he saw a big bunch of grapes hanging from a tree. Billy wanted to eat them all, but he knew that would be wrong. So, he decided to wait for the right time to have some.
In the same land, there was a sneaky fox named Freddy. Freddy saw the grapes too, and he wanted to steal them. He thought he could take them when no one was looking. Freddy knew that Billy was sleepy, so he waited for Billy to take a nap.
One sunny day, Billy was very sleepy and took a nap under the grape tree. Freddy saw his chance and went to steal the grapes. But as he got close, he stepped on a twig and it made a loud snap! The noise woke up Billy, who saw Freddy trying to take the grapes.
Billy knew he had to stop Freddy. He flew up and started to sing a loud song. The other animals heard the song and came to see what was happening. They saw Freddy trying to steal the grapes and chased him away.
From that day on, Billy and the other animals shared the grapes and made sure no one would try to steal them again. And every time Billy took a nap, he made sure to keep one eye open, just in case Freddy came back.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She received an invitation to a party from her friend, Timmy. She was very excited and couldn't wait to go. 
On the day of the party, Lily put on her favorite dress and went to Timmy's house. They played games and ate cake. But as the night went on, Lily started to feel tired. She tried to stay awake, but she couldn't help but yawn. 
Timmy noticed and said, "Lily, are you tired?" 
Lily nodded her head and said, "Yes, I am. But I don't want to go home yet." 
Timmy smiled and said, "Don't worry, we can have a rough pillow fight to wake you up!" 
Lily giggled and they had a fun pillow fight. After that, Lily felt much better and was able to stay awake for the rest of the party. When she got home, she fell asleep right away, dreaming about the fun she had with her friend Timmy.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was a regular boy who loved to play with his friends. One day, Tim saw a spark in the sky. He was very curious and wanted to know what it was.
Tim ran to his friend, Sam, and said, "Sam, I saw a spark in the sky! What is it?" Sam looked at the sky and said, "I don't know, but let's go find out!" So, Tim and Sam went on an adventure to find the spark.
As they walked, they met a kind man who said, "I know what the spark is! It is a star that fell from the sky. If you accept it, it will give you a wish." Tim and Sam were very excited. They looked for the star and found it on the ground. They accepted the star, and it gave them a wish. Tim and Sam wished to be best friends forever, and they were. They played together every day, and they were very happy.

One day, a girl named Poppy went to the park. She saw a big, round ball. Poppy wanted to play with it. She asked her friend, "Can I roll the ball?"
Her friend said, "Yes, but be careful. It is expensive."
Poppy started to roll the ball. It rolled fast and went far away. Poppy was happy and laughed. She rolled it again and again.
But then, something unexpected happened. The ball hit a tree and broke. Poppy was sad and scared. She did not know what to do.
Her friend came and saw the broken ball. He said, "Do not worry, Poppy. We can fix it." They worked together and fixed the ball. Poppy learned to be more careful with expensive things.

Once upon a time, there was a brave otter named Ollie. Ollie lived in a big pond with his family. He loved to swim and play with his friends all day.
One day, Ollie and his friend, Sam the frog, were playing by the pond. Sam said, "Let's add more water to the pond!" They found a big bucket and started to fill it with water. They were having so much fun adding water to the pond.
But then, a big, mean bird saw them. The bird wanted to eat Ollie and Sam. The bird flew down and tried to catch them. Ollie and Sam were very scared.
Ollie said, "We must be brave!" They tried to run away, but the bird was too fast. The bird caught Sam and flew away. Ollie was very sad and cried for his friend.
From that day on, Ollie was always careful when playing by the pond. He missed his friend Sam and wished they could play together again.

Anna and Ben are brother and sister. They have a lot of stuff in their room. They have toys, books, clothes, and games. But they do not play with all of their stuff. Some of their stuff is old or broken or boring.
One day, their mom says, "You have too much stuff. You should sell some of your stuff and make some money. Then you can buy new stuff or save your money for later."
Anna and Ben are excited. They think selling stuff is fun. They make a sign that says "Stuff for Sale" and put it outside their house. They bring some of their stuff to the front yard and wait for people to come.
Soon, a girl comes by. She sees a doll that Anna is selling. She says, "How much is this doll?"
Anna says, "Five dollars."
The girl says, "That is too much. The doll is dirty and has no hair. I will give you one dollar."
Anna says, "No, thank you. This is my favorite doll. She is very special to me. I do not want to sell her."
The girl leaves. Anna feels sad. She realizes that she does not want to sell her favorite doll. She puts the doll back in her room.
Then, a boy comes by. He sees a puzzle that Ben is selling. He says, "How much is this puzzle?"
Ben says, "Two dollars."
The boy says, "That is a good price. The puzzle looks fun and hard. I will buy it."
Ben says, "OK, here you go. Thank you for buying my puzzle."
The boy leaves. Ben feels happy. He does not like the puzzle. He thinks it is too easy and boring. He is glad to sell it and make some money.
Anna and Ben learn a lesson. They learn that they should only sell the stuff that they do not want or need. They learn that they should keep the stuff that they love and enjoy. They learn that selling stuff is not always fun. They learn that money is not everything. They learn to be happy with what they have.

One day, Johnny wanted to find something sweet. He asked his mom if he could have something sweet and his mom suggested he join them for a special treat.
Johnny was excited and hurried to the kitchen. His mom had moved the chairs from the dining table and placed them in a circle. She then put a spoon on the table. 
Johnny asked "What's this?"
His mom smiled and said: "We are going to have a party. We each have a spoon and we can join together and eat some delicious cream. 
Johnny was happy to join them. He grabbed his spoon and waited for the cream to be put on the table. Once the cream was ready, each of them scooped some cream with their spoons. The cream was so sweet and creamy. Johnny and his family enjoyed the treat and had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat celery. Every day, she would ask her mom for some celery to eat. She liked how it was flexible and could bend.
One day, Lily's friend, Tim, came over to play. They played with toys and had lots of fun. Then, Lily asked her mom, "Mom, can we have some celery, please?" Her mom smiled and said, "Of course, Lily!"
Lily and Tim sat down to eat the celery. Tim had never tried celery before. He took a bite and said, "Wow, I love this! It's so flexible and fun to eat!" Lily was happy that her friend loved celery too. From that day on, they always enjoyed eating celery together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to the beach and looking for seashells. One day, he decided to find some shrimp in the ocean. He walked along the shore and looked in the water, but he couldn't find any shrimp. 
Timmy got sad and decided to go home. When he got home, he saw that his room was a mess. His toys were everywhere and his books were all over the floor. Timmy knew he had to clean up his room, but he didn't want to. 
He went to bed without cleaning his room. The next day, Timmy woke up and saw that his room was still messy. He couldn't find his favorite toy car anywhere. Timmy got angry and started throwing his toys around. Suddenly, he found the toy car under his bed, but it was broken. 
Timmy was very sad that he couldn't find any shrimp and that his toy car was broken. He realized that he should have organized his room and taken better care of his things. From that day on, Timmy made sure to keep his room clean and take good care of his toys.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a long backyard. He liked to play there every day. He had a dog named Spot. Spot liked to play in the backyard too.
One day, Tim and Spot were playing in the backyard. They were playing with a ball. Tim would throw the ball and Spot would run to get it. They were having a lot of fun. The sun was shining and the sky was blue.
Then, Tim saw a big hole in the fence. He called Spot to come back. But Spot did not listen. Spot went through the hole and ran away. Tim was very sad. He looked for Spot, but he could not find him. Tim went home and cried. He missed his friend Spot.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted dog named Spot. Spot could do many things that other dogs could not do. One day, Spot went to the park with his friend, a little boy named Tim. They liked to play ball and run around.
In the park, they saw a big, mean cat. The cat was always taking things from the other animals. The cat had a big plan to put all the animals in a small jail. The animals were scared and did not know what to do. Spot and Tim knew they had to help the animals.
Spot and Tim made a plan to stop the mean cat. They found a big net and put it on the ground. They put some food in the middle of the net. When the mean cat came to take the food, Spot and Tim pulled the net up. The mean cat was caught! They took the cat away from the park, and the animals were safe. The animals cheered for Spot and Tim, and they all played together happily.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a calendar on her wall with pictures of animals. Every day, she would cross off the day with a big red X. Her mommy told her it was important to keep a regular schedule.
Lily loved going to the park with her mommy and daddy. They would swing on the swings and slide down the slide. She also loved playing with her dolls and stuffed animals. But most of all, she loved her mommy and daddy very much.
One day, Lily's mommy had to go away on a trip for work. Lily was sad because she would miss her mommy. But her daddy told her that mommy loved her very much and would be back soon. Lily looked at her calendar and saw that mommy would be home in three days. She crossed off the days and felt happy knowing that mommy would be back on a regular day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw and color. One day, she asked her mommy if she could go up to the attic to find some paper to draw on. 
Her mommy said, "Sure, Lily. But be careful on the stairs." 
Lily climbed up the stairs to the attic and found a big box of paper. She was so happy! She sat down on the floor and started to draw. 
Her mommy came up to check on her and saw her drawing. "Wow, Lily! You are so creative! What are you drawing?" 
Lily looked up and said, "I'm drawing a bird. It will soar in the sky." 
Her mommy smiled and said, "That's wonderful, Lily. Keep being creative and drawing beautiful things."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a nosy cat named Mittens. Mittens always wanted to know what Timmy was doing. One day, Timmy was making a cake and he had a whip to mix the ingredients.
Mittens got too close to the whip and got hit. Mittens didn't understand what had happened and ran away. Timmy looked for Mittens but couldn't find him. Timmy was very sad and cried a lot.
Days went by and Timmy still couldn't find Mittens. Timmy finally understood that Mittens was never coming back. Timmy was very sad and missed his cat very much. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved pears, they were her favorite fruit. One day, Lily went to the store with her mom to buy some pears. Her mom told her they had to find the cheapest pears because they didn't have a lot of money. Lily found the cheapest pears and her mom was happy.
Later that day, Lily wanted to make a pear pie for her family. She had never made a pie before, but she wanted to try. She tried and tried, but it was hard. She almost gave up, but she didn't. She kept trying and trying until she finally succeeded! Her family loved the pear pie and they were so proud of her. From that day on, Lily knew that if she tried her best, she could succeed at anything.

One day, a little boy named Tim wanted to watch a movie. He asked his mom if he could put on a movie. His mom said yes and told him to pick a mild movie, so it would not be too scary for him.
Tim looked through his movies and found one with a funny dog. He thought it would be a good mild movie to watch. He put the movie in the big TV and sat down on the floor with his favorite toy.
As Tim watched the movie, he laughed and clapped his hands. The funny dog did silly things that made Tim smile. When the movie was over, Tim thanked his mom for letting him watch it. Tim's mom was happy that he enjoyed the mild movie and they hugged each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and have fun all day. One day, Lily's mom asked her to clean up her room. Lily didn't want to do it because she thought it was a waste of time.
Her mom got frustrated and said, "Lily, if you don't clean up your room, you won't be able to play with your toys anymore." Lily didn't listen and continued playing. Suddenly, her favorite toy fell on the ground and broke. She was so sad and started to cry.
Then, her mom came in and said, "I'm sorry that happened, but maybe if you had cleaned up your room, it wouldn't have happened." Lily realized her mistake and said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I will clean up my room now." Her mom hugged her and they cleaned up together. From that day on, Lily always cleaned up her room and never felt frustrated again.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted little car named Zoom. Zoom loved to go fast. He would race with his friends and always win.
One day, Zoom found some magic powder. He thought, "I will use this powder to go even faster!" So, Zoom put the powder on his wheels and got ready to race.
Zoom raced with his friends again, and he went so fast! He zoomed past them all, and they cheered for him. Zoom was very happy, and he shared the magic powder with his friends so they could go fast too. They all had fun racing together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy. This boy was very spoiled. He had many toys and did not like to share. One day, the boy went to the park to play.
At the park, the boy saw a big tree. He wanted to climb the tree. The boy waved to his mom and dad to look at him. As he climbed, he found a big, red ball stuck in the tree.
The boy took the ball and played with it. A small girl came and asked if she could play too. The boy did not want to share, but then he saw the girl had a toy he wanted. So, the boy waved to the girl and said, "Let's trade!" They traded toys and played together. The boy learned that sharing can be fun, and he was not so spoiled anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big race in a small town. Many cars came to win the race. One car was an ambulance. It was not fast, but it wanted to try. The other cars were fast and noisy. The ambulance felt a little scared but wanted to be brave.
The race started, and all the cars went very fast. The ambulance was not as fast, but it kept going. Far away, they could hear a distant cry for help. Someone was hurt and needed the ambulance. The other cars did not care, they just wanted to win the race.
The ambulance left the race to help the person who was hurt. It took them to the doctor, and they got better. The other cars finished the race, but they did not win anything. The ambulance did not win the race, but it won something better: it helped someone in need and was the real winner.

Once upon a time, there was a big rock. This rock had a special mineral inside. Everyone in the town wanted the mineral. They said it could make them happy. One day, a boy named Tim went to the rock. He wanted the mineral too.
Tim tried to pull the mineral out of the rock. He pulled and pulled, but it did not come out. He felt terrible. He thought he was not strong enough. Then, a big man came to help Tim. The big man pulled and pulled, but the mineral did not come out.
Then, something unexpected happened. The rock started to shake. It was mad because people were trying to take its mineral. The rock grew bigger and bigger. It chased Tim, the big man, and everyone in the town. The rock caught them all and put them inside it. Now, no one could have the mineral, and they all felt terrible.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little boy named Tim. He loved to play with his toy car. One day, he saw a big box in his room. Tim wondered what was inside.
Tim asked his mom, "Mom, can I shake the box?" His mom said, "No, Tim. It's not a toy. It's a big glass jar for your dad's work. It can break." But Tim didn't listen. He wanted to know what was inside the box.
When his mom went to cook, Tim shook the box. The glass jar broke into many small pieces. Tim felt bad. His mom came back and saw the broken jar. She was sad and said, "Tim, you didn't use your brain. Now the jar is broken, and your dad will be upset."
Tim's dad came home and saw the broken jar. He was very angry. Tim knew he made a big mistake. He said sorry, but his dad was still upset.
From that day, Tim learned to listen to his mom and use his brain before doing something.

Jack was walking home from school when he saw a graceful bird sitting in the tree. Jack approached it so he could get a better look.
Jack: "Hello Bird! What are you doing?"
The bird stopped moving and looked at Jack.
Bird: "I'm resting. I want to fly away but I can't because I'm stuck here."
Jack glanced at the bird's feet and noticed a thin tie tied around them.
Jack: "Don't worry Bird! I can help you. I'm sure I can cut off the tie."
The bird was relieved and Jack carefully snipped the tie with his scissors. Then the beautiful bird gracefully fluttered its wings and flew away.
Jack: "Goodbye, Bird!" 
The bird waved goodbye with its tiny wing before disappearing out of sight. Jack smiled and went on his way.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to skip everywhere she went. One day, she met a frog who was hopping along the path. "Hello, little frog," said Lily politely. "Would you like to skip with me?"
The frog replied, "I would love to skip with you, but I can't. I ate some poison berries and now my legs hurt too much to skip."
Lily felt sad for the frog and asked, "Is there anything I can do to help?"
The frog replied, "Actually, there is. If you follow this path, you'll find a field of flowers. There's a special flower there that can heal me. Can you please bring it to me?"
Lily agreed to help and skipped off to the field of flowers. She searched and searched until she found the special flower. She brought it back to the frog who ate it and felt much better. "Thank you so much, Lily," said the frog. "You're a very kind and polite little girl."
From that day on, Lily and the frog became good friends and skipped together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a girl who had a modest bracelet. She wore the bracelet everyday and she loved it very much. 
One day, the girl decided to go on an adventure. She went far and wide and saw lots of exciting things. 
As the girl was walking, she heard a voice calling from the bottom of a tree. The voice said "Would you like a special surprise?". The girl was curious and said yes. 
From the bottom of the tree, the girl found an even more modest bracelet than the one she was wearing. She put it on and realized it was magical. 
The magical bracelet had the power to show the girl things she didn't know before. As the days went on, the girl started to realize that she now had the power to do anything she wanted. 
The magical bracelet was the girl's secret weapon. With it, she could do anything she set her heart on. From that day forward, the girl was never the same again.

One day, a little girl named Sue found an old lamp in her house. It was very dusty. Sue thought it was special. She showed it to her mom. "Look, Mom! I found an old lamp," she said. Her mom smiled and said, "That lamp was my grandma's. I remember she used to tell me stories about it. Maybe it has a secret."
Sue wanted to know the secret. She cleaned the lamp and found a button. She pushed the button, and the lamp made a bright light. Sue was very happy. She ran to her mom and said, "Mom, the lamp can make light! Is that the secret?" Her mom laughed and said, "Yes, Sue, that's the secret. My grandma used to say that the light from the lamp can make your dreams come true."
That night, Sue put the old lamp by her bed. She turned on the light and made a wish. She wished for a new friend to play with. The next day, a new girl named Lily moved in next door. Sue and Lily became best friends, and they played together every day. Sue knew that the old lamp made her wish come true.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go to the shop with her mom. They would buy toys, food, and clothes. Lily was always grateful for the fun things they got.
One day, Lily found a magic toy at the shop. It was a wand that could make things shrink. She showed her mom and said, "Look, Mom! I want this toy, please!" Her mom said, "Okay, Lily. You can have it."
Lily played with her magic wand all day. She would point it at her toys and say, "Shrink!" The toys became very small. She was so happy. But then, she pointed the wand at her mom by mistake. Her mom started to shrink too!
Lily was scared. She didn't want her mom to be small. She thought and thought. Then, she pointed the wand at her mom again and said, "Grow!" Her mom grew back to her normal size. They both were grateful that everything was okay again. From that day on, Lily was more careful with her magic wand.

Anna liked her red wagon very much. She used it to carry her toys, her books and her snacks. She also liked to polish her wagon every day, to make it shiny and clean. She had a soft cloth and a bottle of water that she used to polish her wagon.
One day, Anna wanted to polish her wagon, but she could not find her cloth. She looked in her room, in the kitchen, in the living room, but she could not find it. She asked her mom, "Mom, where is my cloth? I want to polish my wagon."
Her mom said, "I don't know, Anna. Maybe you left it outside, or in the car, or in the laundry basket. Why don't you look there?"
Anna was persistent. She did not give up. She went outside, and looked in the yard, but she did not find her cloth. She went to the car, and looked in the seats, but she did not find her cloth. She went to the laundry basket, and looked in the clothes, but she did not find her cloth.
She was sad. She wanted to polish her wagon, but she had no cloth. She sat on the floor, and hugged her wagon. She said, "I'm sorry, wagon. I can't polish you today. I lost my cloth."
Then, she heard a bark. She looked up, and saw her dog, Spot. Spot had something in his mouth. It was her cloth! Spot had taken her cloth, and played with it. He was wagging his tail, and looked happy.
Anna smiled. She said, "Spot, you found my cloth! Thank you, Spot! You are a good dog!" She took her cloth from Spot, and gave him a hug. Then, she went to polish her wagon, and made it shiny and clean. She was happy, and so was Spot. They played together with the wagon, and had fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to pretend she was an astronaut and explore space. One day, she put on her soft astronaut suit and went to her backyard.
Lily looked up at the sky and saw the stars shining bright. She said, "Wow, space is so big and pretty!" Then, she saw her little brother playing with his toys. "Do you want to play space with me?" she asked.
Her brother said, "Yes, I want to be a space alien!" Lily pretended to be a spaceship and they both flew around the backyard. They saw planets and stars, and even met some friendly space aliens. It was a fun day in space for Lily and her brother.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Blue. Blue was very lonely because he didn't have any friends to play with. One day, he saw a big grill and decided to go check it out. When he got there, he saw a little mouse named Max who was cooking cheese on the grill.
Blue said, "Hi, Max! Can I have some cheese please?"
Max replied, "No, sorry. I only have enough for me."
Blue felt sad and said, "But I'm so lonely and hungry. Can't you share with me?"
Max thought for a moment and said, "Okay, I'll share with you. But first, let's stretch our wings and fly around together!"
Blue was so happy to have a new friend and they both enjoyed their cheese while watching the sunset together. From that day on, Blue and Max were the best of friends and always shared their food and adventures.

Once upon a time, there was a giant. He was very big and strong. He liked to play in the forest with his animal friends. One day, he got lost in the woods and couldn't find his way back home.
Luckily, a helpful girl found him and asked if he needed help. The giant nodded his head and the girl took him to her house. She gave him some food and a warm blanket to sleep with.
The next day, the girl helped the giant dress in some new clothes. He was so happy to have a new outfit! From that day on, the giant and the girl became good friends and had many adventures together in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy. His name was John and he was three years old. John wanted to make something special for his mom, so he looked around the kitchen for ideas.
John found a box of powder on the shelf. He wasn't sure what it was, but it smelled so good! He asked his mom if he could use some of the powder to make his special surprise. 
"I'm sorry, John," his mom answered, "I don't think I can permit you to use that powder."
John thought for a moment. "Will you let me use a little bit?" he asked.
His mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can have a little powder. Just don't use it all."
John thanked his mom and quickly used the powder to make his surprise. He smiled when it was done - it was perfect! His mom was so happy when she saw it. 
John learned that day that even a little powder can go a long way.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside, but today the weather was very rainy. She looked outside and said, "Mommy, can we play inside today?"
Her mommy replied, "Of course, Lily! Let's celebrate the rain by making some cookies together."
Lily was happy and helped her mommy make some yummy cookies. As they were baking, her mommy said, "Lily, you are so wise for a little girl. You always know how to make the best of any situation."
Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, mommy! I love spending time with you, even when it's raining outside." And they continued to celebrate the rainy day by enjoying their delicious cookies together.

Once upon a time, there was a big, reliable dog named Max. Max was very good at helping his family. One day, Max's family had a party in their backyard. They had a grill to cook food for everyone. Max loved to watch the grill, because it smelled so good.
Max's friend, a little bird named Lily, flew down to talk to him. "Max," she said, "why don't you quit watching the grill and come play with me?" Max looked at Lily and said, "I want to help my family with the grill. But I will play with you later."
Lily understood and flew away to play with her other friends. Max stayed by the grill, making sure it was safe for his family. The party was a big success, and everyone was happy. Later, Max played with Lily and her friends, and they all had a great time. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to stare at the stars at night. She would lay on her back and look up at the sky. One night, she had an incredible dream that she was flying in the sky with the stars. She felt so happy and free.
The next day, Lily told her mom about her dream. Her mom smiled and said, "That sounds like an incredible dream, Lily. Maybe one day you can be an astronaut and fly in the sky for real!" Lily's eyes lit up with excitement.
From that day on, Lily would stare at the stars every night, dreaming of one day flying among them. She knew that anything was possible if she believed in herself and worked hard. And who knows, maybe one day she will make her incredible dream come true.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a bright smile and loved to play with her toys. One day, Lily's mommy asked her if she wanted to own her own desk. 
Lily was very excited and said, "Yes, please!" Her mommy took her to the store and they picked out a desk that was the perfect size for Lily. It was bright pink and had a special spot for her crayons and paper. 
Lily loved her new desk and spent lots of time drawing and coloring. One day, her friend Emma came over to play. Emma saw Lily's desk and said, "Wow, that's a cool desk. I wish I had my own desk." 
Lily smiled and said, "You can have your own desk too! Let's go to the store and find one for you." Emma was very happy and they went to the store to pick out a desk just for her. From that day on, Lily and Emma had their own desks to play and create at.

Once there was a boy named Joe. He liked to play all the time. But one day his mom said that it was time for bed. Joe groaned and said no. He wanted to keep playing, but his mom was very quiet.
Joe's mom said, "Joe, it's time to be quiet. You need to go to bed now." Joe was unhappy, but he stopped playing and went to the bedroom. His mom gave him one last hug and said, "Goodnight, Joe."
Joe picked up his special number blocks and started counting them. One, two, three, four... he loved the numbers. He was getting sleepy, so he put the blocks away and closed his eyes.
Suddenly, amazing things started happening! Joe opened his eyes to see a magical world with amazing colors and shapes, where he could play forever! Joe was so excited and he totally forgot it was bedtime!
But, the magical world didn't last long. As soon as the last number was said, it all vanished. Joe was so sad and he cried and cried. His mom came in to see what was wrong and he explained what had happened.
She told him that it wasn't real and it was time for bed. Joe was so sad, but he knew his mom was right. He went to bed and never saw the amazing world again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to fish with his dad. They would go to the lake and Timmy would gaze into the water, looking for fish. One day, Timmy's dad gave him a hook to use. Timmy was so excited to catch a fish with his very own hook.
Timmy cast his line into the water and waited patiently. Suddenly, he felt a tug on the line. He pulled and pulled until he finally caught a fish. Timmy was so happy and proud of himself. He put the fish in a tidy bucket and showed his dad.
But then, something terrible happened. Timmy accidentally dropped the bucket and the fish flopped onto the ground. The fish couldn't breathe and it died. Timmy was so sad and cried for a long time. He learned that even though fishing can be fun, it's important to be careful and take care of the fish.

Once upon a time, there was a little raven. He was very shy and never talked to other birds. One day, he decided to try to be brave, and so he flew over to the nearby pond. He took a deep breath and said hello, but nobody answered. He was embarrassed and flew away. 
The next day the little raven was feeling bold and he ventured out to the pond again. He called out to the other birds, but again nobody came. He wanted to make friends, but it seemed too hard. He felt lonely and sad.
That night, a storm moved in and the little raven went to hide in a tree. When the storm was over, he noticed something strange. All of the birds had vanished! He was so worried and upset. He didn't know where his new friends had gone. 
The little raven wondered for days without discovering what had happened to the birds. Then one day he heard a familiar voice calling him. It was one of his bird friends, telling him that they had all flown away when the storm had scared them. The little raven was relieved and happy to hear his friend's voice. He promised his friend that he wouldn't be embarrassed next time they met. 
The little raven and his friends are still good friends today, and they never forget to say hello when they pass by the pond.

Lily liked to look at the stars at night. She had a big window in her room and she could see many bright dots in the sky. Sometimes she saw a big white ball that was the moon. She wondered what was on the moon and if anyone lived there.
One night, she heard a sound outside her window. It was a soft hoot, hoot, hoot. She got out of her bed and went to the window. She saw a big bird with round eyes and a sharp beak. It was an owl. The owl looked at her and hooted again. Lily smiled and waved at the owl. She wanted to be friends with it.
She opened the window and whispered, "Hello, owl. Do you want to come in?" The owl nodded and flew into her room. It landed on her bed and looked around. Lily showed the owl her toys and books and pictures. The owl liked them and hooted happily. Lily asked the owl, "Do you live on the moon?" The owl shook its head and pointed to a big tree outside. "That is your home?" Lily asked. The owl nodded and hooted again.
Lily said, "I like your home. It is very high and green. But it is also very dark. Do you like the dark?" The owl said, "Yes, I like the dark. I can see well in the dark. And I can find food in the dark. I eat mice and bugs and worms. Do you like them?" Lily made a face and said, "No, I don't like them. I like bread and cheese and fruit. Do you want to try some?" The owl said, "Yes, I want to try some."
Lily went to the kitchen and got some bread and cheese and fruit. She brought them to her room and shared them with the owl. The owl tasted them and liked them. He said, "They are very good. Thank you, Lily." Lily said, "You are welcome, owl. I am glad you like them." They ate and talked and laughed. They became good friends.
But soon it was time for Lily to go to sleep. She said, "Owl, I have to sleep now. Do you want to sleep with me?" The owl said, "No, I don't want to sleep now. I want to fly and hunt and hoot. But I will come back tomorrow night. Will you be here?" Lily said, "Yes, I will be here. I want to see you again. But you have to be quiet and clean. My mom and dad don't like noise and mess." The owl said, "I will be quiet and clean. I promise. Good night, Lily." Lily said, "Good night, owl. See you tomorrow." She hugged the owl and kissed him. The owl hugged her and kissed her. He flew out of the window and hooted goodbye. Lily closed the window and went to bed. She was very happy. She had a new friend. She had an owl.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a puzzle in his toy box. It was a tight fit, but he pulled it out. He wanted to play with it. He asked his friend, Max, to help him. Max did not want to play. He wanted to watch TV. Max said, "No, Tim. I don't want to play with the puzzle."
Tim was sad. He tried to put the puzzle together by himself. It was hard. The pieces did not fit. He asked Max again, "Please help me, Max." Max ignored him. He kept watching TV.
Tim was upset. He took the puzzle to his mom. She helped him put it together. They had fun. Max saw them and felt bad. He turned off the TV and joined them. They all played with the puzzle together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to eat jam on his bread. One day, he went to the kitchen to make a jam sandwich. The room was dark, but Tim could see the jam jar on the table.
As Tim tried to use the jam, he found it was very hard. He pushed and pushed, but the jam would not spread. Tim was sad and confused. He called his mom for help. 
Mom came and turned on the light. She looked at the jar and laughed. It was not jam at all! It was a jar of clay! Tim and his mom laughed together. Then, they found the real jam and made a yummy sandwich.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to travel with her family, especially when they went to the beach. One day, they went to the beach and a terrible hurricane came. The wind was so strong that it blew away their umbrella and toys. They had to go back to their hotel and wait for the hurricane to pass. Lily was scared but her parents hugged her and told her everything would be okay. After the hurricane, they went back to the beach and saw that it was very different. There were lots of shells and seaweed everywhere. Lily picked up some shells and put them in her bucket. She was happy to have a souvenir from their trip.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, Lily found a stick on the ground and she picked it up. Her friend, Timmy, saw the stick and asked if he could borrow it. Lily said yes and gave him the stick.
Later that day, Lily saw Timmy playing with the stick and she became confused. She thought the stick was hers, but she had given it to Timmy. She went to Timmy and asked for the stick back. Timmy gave it back to her and said sorry.
Lily learned that it's important to share and borrow things, but also to remember what belongs to you. From that day on, Lily and Timmy played together and shared their toys. They both felt happy and had fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the garden with her toys. One sunny day, she went outside to play but she saw that her garden was not the same. The soil was tough and hard to dig.
Lily tried to dig with her shovel but it was too hard. She looked around and saw a big rock in the middle of the garden. She thought that maybe the rock was making the soil tough. She tried to move the rock but it was too heavy for her.
Lily was sad because she couldn't play in her garden. She asked her dad for help and he came to the garden. He saw the tough soil and the big rock. He moved the rock and the soil became soft again. Lily was happy and she could play in her garden again.

Once upon a time, there was a little baby named Timmy. Timmy loved to drink milk from his bottle. One day, his mommy gave him a crazy looking bottle with a funny face on it. Timmy giggled and held the bottle tight. 
As he drank his milk, he felt sleepy and wanted to lay down. His mommy laid him gently on his soft bed and covered him with a cozy blanket. Timmy closed his eyes and dreamed of his crazy bottle. 
When he woke up, he saw his mommy holding the bottle. She smiled and said, "Did you like your crazy bottle, Timmy?" Timmy smiled and nodded his head. He couldn't wait to drink milk from it again.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park. She saw an adorable cat playing with a belt. The cat was very happy. Amy wanted to play with the cat too.
Amy tried to take the belt from the cat, but the cat did not want to share. The cat hissed and held onto the belt tight. Amy was sad because she wanted to play with the cat and the belt.
Amy had an idea. She found a stick and started to play with it. The cat saw Amy playing and wanted to play too. The cat let go of the belt and played with Amy and the stick. Now, Amy and the cat were both happy and played together at the park.

One day, a little dog named Spot was very hungry. He wanted a snack. He looked all around the house, but he could not find any. So, he went outside to look for some food. Spot started to worry because he could not find any snacks.
Spot saw a big cat and said, "Can you help me find a snack? I am very hungry." The cat said, "I will help you, but first you must help me. My toy is stuck in the tree. Can you get it for me?" Spot agreed to help the cat.
Spot climbed the tree and got the toy for the cat. The cat was happy and said, "Thank you, Spot. Now, let's find you a snack." They looked around and found a safe place with lots of snacks. Spot and the cat ate the snacks together. They were both happy and not worried anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a kind boy named Tim. He loved to watch parades with his family. One day, Tim went to see a parade with his mom and dad. He saw many floats and people dancing. Suddenly, a big wind came and blew all the decorations away. 
Tim was sad because he thought the parade was over. But then something unexpected happened. The people in the parade became very creative and made new decorations with the things around them. Tim was amazed by their quick thinking and how they made the parade even better than before. 
From that day on, Tim learned that even when things don't go as planned, people can become very resourceful and make something great out of it. He was happy to have seen such a wonderful parade and couldn't wait to see what surprises the next one would bring.

Once upon a time, there was a big, red apple. It was sitting on a tree. One day, it fell off the tree. The apple was heavy. It made a loud sound when it hit the ground.
A little boy saw the apple. He wanted to eat it. But he thought, "I will wait for tomorrow. Then, I will eat the apple." He left the apple on the ground and went to play.
The next day, the boy came back to eat the apple. But, oh no! The apple was not red anymore. It was brown and yucky. It had started to rot. The boy felt sad. He learned that sometimes, it is better to eat the apple right away, or else it can become disgusting.

One day, a little cat named Lucy was trying to escape from an angry dog. She ran and ran, but the dog was right behind her. Lucy saw a big tree and thought, "I can climb up there to be safe!"
As Lucy climbed up the tree, she heard a voice. "Who are you?" the voice asked. Lucy looked around and saw a little bird. "I'm Lucy, and I'm trying to escape from the angry dog," she said. The bird said, "I can help you, but you have to give me a price." Lucy didn't have anything, but she promised to help the bird find food later.
Just then, the angry dog found the tree and started to bark. The bird had an idea. The bird flew down and started to peck at the dog's tail. The dog got scared and ran away, leaving Lucy safe. The unexpected help from the bird saved Lucy. They both became good friends and helped each other find food every day.

Once upon a time, there was a big deep forest. In the forest, there lived a kangaroo. The kangaroo was very happy because the forest provided him with lots of food to eat. 
One day, the kangaroo met a little bird who was lost. The bird was very sad because he didn't know how to find his way back home. The kind kangaroo offered to help the bird and provided him with a ride in his pouch. 
The kangaroo hopped and hopped, taking the little bird through the deep forest until they finally found the bird's home. The bird was very grateful to the kangaroo for providing him with a safe ride home. From that day on, the kangaroo and the bird became good friends and would often play together in the forest.

One day, a weird bug found a big ring in the ash. The bug was very happy. He wanted to show his friends the big ring. He picked it up and started to walk.
On the way, the bug met his friend, the bird. The bird saw the big ring and said, "Wow, that's a big ring! Can I see it?" The bug said yes, and they looked at the ring together. The bird thought it was very pretty.
Then, the bug and the bird went to show the ring to their friend, the cat. The cat liked the ring too. They all played with the ring and had a fun day. At the end of the day, they put the ring back in the ash and went home. They were very happy to have found the weird big ring.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly little girl named Mia. Mia had a big love for blueberries. She would eat them every day. Her mom would put them in a bowl, and Mia would have a big smile on her face.
One sunny day, Mia's mom had a great idea. She made a yummy snack with bread, butter, and blueberries. She spread the butter on the bread and put the blueberries on top. Mia was so happy to see her favorite snack.
Mia took her jolly blueberry snack outside. She sat under a big tree and shared her snack with her best friend, a cute bunny. They both enjoyed the yummy blueberry treat. And from that day on, Mia and the bunny would have jolly blueberry picnics under the big tree.

There was a small bird who wanted to make a home. He flew around looking for the perfect spot. He wanted to build a safe place for him to rest and hide.
The little bird searched for days until he found a tree with a big branch. He was happy that he had found a place for his home. He wanted to make sure it was safe and snug, so he went to look for some string.
The bird found a long piece of string. He started to wrap it around the branch. It was hard work but he was persistent and he wouldn't give up.
Finally, after all his hard work, the little bird had a sturdy, safe home. He was so proud and happy. He hopped around singing and flapping his wings. He was so grateful for his new home and he hoped that it would last forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Tim. Tim loved to jump all day long. He jumped in the grass, in the water, and even in the mud.
One day, Tim jumped into a house through an open window. He found himself in a big kitchen. There were pots and pans, and a big fridge. Tim saw a big bowl of fruit on the table. He jumped on the table to take a closer look.
Some of the fruit was spoiled. Tim did not like spoiled fruit. He wanted to help. So, he jumped on the good fruit and pushed the spoiled fruit off the table. Tim felt happy that he could help. He jumped out of the kitchen and went back to his home in the pond.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy fell down and hurt his knee. It hurt a lot and he couldn't walk.
Timmy's mom took him to the doctor. The doctor said, "Don't worry, Timmy. We can heal your knee." The doctor gave Timmy a massage on his knee and it felt better.
After the massage, Timmy stood up and was surprised. His knee felt unique! It was different than before. Timmy was happy and ran outside to play with his friends again.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird was fearful. It did not like to fly high. One day, the bird saw a vine. The vine was long and strong. The bird thought it could help it fly.
The bird held the vine with its feet. It tried to fly. But the vine was too heavy. The bird could not fly high. It was sad. The bird wanted to fly like other birds.
A big cat saw the bird. The cat wanted to catch the bird. The bird was scared. It tried to fly away. But the vine was heavy. The cat caught the bird. The bird was very sad. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and gaze at the stars at night. One day, she found some glue while playing in her backyard. She decided to make a pretty picture with it. She glued some flowers and butterflies onto a piece of paper. Her mommy was so proud of her artwork that she hung it on the fridge for everyone to see. Lily was very happy and continued to gaze at her picture every day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to watch TV. His TV was very big and expensive. One day, Timmy's mom told him they had to hurry to the store to buy some milk. Timmy didn't want to leave his TV, but he knew they had to go quickly. 
At the store, Timmy's mom let him pick out a toy. Timmy saw a toy car he really liked, but it was too expensive. He felt sad, but then he saw a cheaper toy that was just as fun. Timmy and his mom paid for the milk and the toy and hurried back home. 
When they got home, Timmy played with his new toy while his mom made dinner. After dinner, they watched TV together. Timmy was happy he got a new toy and didn't mind leaving his TV for a little while.

One day, a boy named Tom went for a jog. He put on his tight shoes and ran down the road. The sun was shining, and Tom was happy. He liked to jog and feel the wind in his hair.
As Tom jogged, he saw a big dog. The dog was barking and running after him. Tom was scared. He said, "Please, dog, don't chase me!" But the dog did not listen.
Tom ran faster, and so did the dog. They ran down the road together. Then, Tom saw a tall man. The man said, "Stop, dog!" The dog stopped and went back home. Tom was safe. He thanked the man and went back to his jog.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear who lived in a large cave in the forest. Every day, he would go out to find food and come back to his cave to rest. One day, he decided he wanted to prepare a luxury meal for himself.
He went out into the forest and gathered all kinds of berries, nuts, and fruits. He even caught a fish from the nearby river. When he returned to his cave, he started to cook up a storm.
As he was cooking, he heard a loud noise outside his cave. He peeked out and saw a group of smaller animals coming toward his cave. The bear got scared and thought they might want to take his luxury meal away from him.
But then he remembered that he was a big and strong bear, and he didn't need to be afraid. He calmly welcomed the smaller animals into his cave and shared his delicious meal with them. From that day on, the bear and the smaller animals became good friends and would often share meals together.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim all day long. One day, while swimming, he saw a big dishwasher. The dishwasher was very clean.
Fin swam closer to the dishwasher and saw a girl named Sue. Sue looked at Fin and said, "Hello, little fish! Do you want to be my friend?" Fin was happy and wanted to be friends with Sue.
Sue put Fin in the dishwasher to play. But, oh no! Sue forgot that the dishwasher was for washing dishes. She closed the door and turned it on. Fin couldn't swim in the dishwasher, and he didn't feel good. In the end, Fin didn't have a good time, and he was very sad.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play games with her friends. One day, they decided to play a game of hide-and-seek. Lily found the perfect hiding spot behind a tree. She waited and waited, but nobody came to find her.
Suddenly, she felt something strange happening. She looked down and realized that she was shrinking! She became very small and could no longer see over the grass. She was scared, but she knew she had to find her friends.
She searched and searched until she finally found them. They were surprised to see her so small, but they were happy to have found her. They all played together and had a perfect day, even though Lily was still tiny.

Once upon a time, there was a tiny red ant. He lived in a small house. He wished his house was bigger and he set off to find a way to make his house bigger.
He asked all of the animals he met on the way, but none of them could help him. Then he saw a big red sauce bottle. He thought he could use the sauce to increase the size of his house!
He asked a fox if he could have the sauce. The fox replied, "No, little ant, you cannot have the sauce. You must find your own solution".
The tiny ant thought very hard and soon he found a way to increase the size of his house. He followed the fox's advice and used his own creativity and intelligence to find a way to make it bigger.
The moral of the story is that with a little hard work and an open mind, any problem can be solved.

One day, a duck named Dolly went to the pond to play. She loved to splash in the water. The sun was shining, and the water was cool. Dolly was happy.
Dolly saw her friend, Froggy the frog. "Hi, Froggy," Dolly said. "Come splash with me!" Froggy jumped into the water. They splashed and played together.
After playing, Dolly and Froggy went to see their friend, Bunny. Bunny was very gentle. She gave Dolly and Froggy a nice massage. They felt so good and relaxed. They thanked Bunny and went back to play some more.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweety. Tweety loved to fly and sing all day long. One day, Tweety saw a big firework in the sky. Tweety felt happy and excited. But then, something bad happened. The firework exploded and scared Tweety. Tweety started to panic and flew away as fast as possible.
Tweety felt angry at the firework for scaring him. But then, Tweety thought about what happened and realized that he shouldn't have been too excited and should have been more careful. Tweety learned that sometimes, things that seem fun can be dangerous. From that day on, Tweety promised to always be careful and not panic when something scary happens.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird loved to sing and fly. One day, while the little bird was flying, it hit a weak line. The line was holding a kite that a little boy was playing with. 
The little bird fell and hurt its wing. The little boy saw the bird and wanted to help. He tried to repair the bird's wing, but it was too weak. The little bird couldn't fly anymore. 
The little boy was sad because he couldn't help the little bird. The little bird was sad because it couldn't sing and fly anymore. The end.

Billy and his mom were walking along the beach. They saw a small boat stuck in the sand.
"Look Billy! It's a ship!", said his mom.
Billy opened the ship's door and got inside.
"I feel so lucky!", Billy said.
He looked around and saw a big treasure chest in the corner. He opened it, and found a big pile of golden coins inside.
Billy grabbed one of the coins and held it up. He wanted to show his mom.
But before she could see it, a giant wave crashed into the boat and filled it with water.
Billy scrambled to the door, but he couldn't open it.
He was trapped inside the ship, and the water was quickly getting higher. Billy was never seen again.

Once upon a time there were two best friends, Jack and Jill. They were in the park playing together. Jack was holding a tray full of blocks.
Suddenly, the wind blew strong and the blocks all fell to the ground. Jack began to cry and became very upset. 
Jill noticed that Jack was feeling sad and came up to him. She asked, "What's wrong?".
Jack replied, "the wind blew and all my blocks fell out of my tray. Now I don't know how to sort them all out again."
Jill smiled and said, "It's ok Jack. Don't worry. Let's work together to sort them out."
So, Jack and Jill sorted the blocks together. Soon enough, the blocks were all put back into the tray, and Jack was feeling better.
The moral of this story is that working together with a friend always makes things easier. Even if things seem too hard to do alone, together you can find a way to sort it all out.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to run and play. He liked to exercise and have fun. Max was very happy when he could play with his friends.
One sunny day, Max went to the park. He saw that his friends were not there. Max was sad because he wanted to play. But then, Max saw a big sign. The sign said, "Relax and have fun here!" Max thought this was a good idea.
Max went to the place with the sign. There, he found many toys and games available. Max started to play with the toys and games. He had a lot of fun. Then, Max's friends came to the place too! They all played together and had a great time. The unexpected thing was that Max and his friends found a new place to have fun and relax.

One day, a boy named Tim went to his friend Sue's house to play. Sue's mom was very generous and made a yummy dessert for them. It was a big, sweet cake. They were so happy and excited to eat it.
But while they were playing, they accidentally hit the table and the cake fell on the floor. "Oh no! We broke the cake!" said Tim. "What do we do now?" asked Sue. They were sad because they had been looking forward to the dessert.
Tim had an idea. "Let's put the cake back together!" So, they tried their best to fix the cake. When Sue's mom saw them, she smiled and said, "You two are so sweet for trying to fix the cake. Don't worry, I can make another one. Just be careful next time." Tim and Sue were happy again, and they promised to be more careful while playing near the dessert.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat spicy food, but his mommy didn't like it. One day, Timmy's mommy made spaghetti with a spicy sauce. Timmy ate it all up, but his mommy didn't like it. She told Timmy to ignore the spicy taste and eat his dinner.
After dinner, Timmy went to play with his toys. He saw a belt on the floor and picked it up. Timmy didn't know what a belt was for, so he put it around his waist like a superhero. He pretended to fly around the house with his belt on.
Later that night, Timmy's mommy tucked him into bed. She gave him a big hug and told him she loved him. Timmy smiled and fell asleep, dreaming of spicy food and superhero belts.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl named Lily. She had a big tooth that was a little bit wobbly. One day, Lily went out to play with her friend Tom. They both loved to sort their toys by color and size.
"Tom, I have a wobbly tooth," Lily said. "What should I do?" Tom thought for a moment and said, "Let's ask my mom. She knows what to do." So they went to Tom's mom and told her about Lily's tooth.
Tom's mom smiled and said, "Lily, a wobbly tooth means that you will lose it soon. But don't worry, a new tooth will grow in its place." Lily and Tom were excited about the news. They played all day, waiting for Lily's tooth to fall out.
