Suddenly, a man appeared and said, "Don't worry, I will protect you." The man was the dog's owner and he put a leash on the dog and took him away. Timmy was happy and thanked the man for protecting him.
After the scary moment, Timmy continued playing his game. He was having so much fun that he didn't notice the sun was getting hot. His mom came and said, "It's too hot outside, let's go home." Timmy was sad because he wanted to play more, but he knew his mom was right. 
As they were walking home, they saw a big ice cream truck. Timmy was so excited because he loved ice cream. But when they got closer, they saw that the ice cream truck was out of ice cream! Timmy was disappointed, but his mom said, "Don't worry, we can make our own ice cream at home." Timmy was happy again and they went home to make some delicious ice cream.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and cuddle with her teddy bear. One night, she fell asleep in front of the fireplace.
While she was sleeping, Lily started to dream. She dreamed that she was a princess and had a big castle. But then, something unexpected happened. A dragon came and breathed fire all over her castle! Lily was scared and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, she woke up and realized that the fireplace had caught on fire. Her parents had left it burning and were being careless. Lily quickly woke them up and they put out the fire. From that day on, they always made sure to be careful with the fireplace.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim was very excited because today was his birthday. He was going to have a big party with all his friends.
During the party, Tim saw a new girl named Sue. She looked sad because she didn't know anyone. Tim went to Sue and said, "Hi, I'm Tim. Do you want to play with us?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, thank you!" They played games and ate cake together.
At the end of the day, everyone in the town was happy. Tim learned that being kind and including others made his birthday even more special. And Sue was thankful to have made a new friend. The moral of the story is that being kind and saying "thank you" can make everyone feel happy and loved.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved when her daddy came home from work. He always brought her surprises in a big, bright bag. One day, Lily's daddy came home with a big bag and told her to help him unpack it. Inside the bag, there was a new toy for Lily to play with. She was so happy and hugged her daddy tightly. From that day on, Lily knew that her daddy always brought her something special when he came home.

One day, a happy boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw his friend, Sam, and they decided to play together. They played with a ball, ran around, and laughed a lot. They were having so much fun.
Then, Sam said, "Hey Tim, did you hear about the big wolf?" Tim looked at Sam and asked, "What wolf?" Sam told him that he heard someone mention a big, scary wolf that lived in the woods. Tim and Sam decided to go on an adventure to find the wolf.
As they walked through the woods, they saw a big, fluffy animal. It was the wolf! But, the wolf was not scary at all. It was just a friendly dog named Max. Max wagged his tail and licked their faces. The boys laughed and played with Max. The big, scary wolf was just a happy dog, and they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a poor neighbor who had a big cat. The cat was very fat and heavy, so the neighbor wanted to weigh it. She took the cat to the store where they had a big scale. She put the cat on the scale and saw that it weighed 20 pounds! 
The neighbor was very surprised because the cat was so heavy. She decided to put the cat on a diet so it could lose weight. She gave the cat less food and more exercise, like playing with toys. 
After a few weeks, the cat lost some weight and the neighbor was very happy. She weighed the cat again and saw that it now weighed 15 pounds. The cat was much healthier and happier, and the neighbor was proud of herself for helping her furry friend.

One day, a cat and a dog were in a room. The cat was on the couch, and the dog was on the floor. The cat said, "I like this couch. It is soft and warm." The dog said, "I want to sit on the couch too, but I am too big."
The cat thought of a silly plan. "I know! I will close my eyes and count to ten. When I open them, you try to sit on the couch." The dog was excited and waited for the cat to close its eyes.
The cat closed its eyes and started to count. The dog tried to jump on the couch but could not. The cat opened its eyes and saw a big pillow on the floor. The dog had knocked the pillow off the couch. The cat said, "You may not fit on the couch, but now we can both sit on something soft and warm!" They both laughed and enjoyed their new spots in the room.

Mama and Daddy had the best news! They invited the whole family to their home for a big picnic. Everyone was so excited!
The family lived in a house in the woods. Mama took out the picnic blanket and set it up in the backyard. She brought out a big basket of food too.
When everyone arrived, Mama showed them all her secret. She brought out a huge cake covered in pale pastel colors. Everyone cheered!
Mama made a big promise. She told everyone that if the cake went untouched, she would take them all to the empty pond. Everyone was very curious - what did it look like?
One by one, the family tried a slice of the cake. Soon, there was nothing left. Everyone shouted with excitement and they watched as Mama opened the gate to the empty pond. Everyone gasped when they saw the pond sparkling with sunlight!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the grocery store with her mommy. They needed to buy some food for dinner. Lily saw some yummy cookies and she wanted them. She said to her mommy, "Can we get cookies, please?" Her mommy said, "Not now, we need to get some fruits and vegetables first." 
Lily and her mommy walked around the store fast. They reached for some apples, bananas, and carrots. Lily said, "I like carrots, they are crunchy." Her mommy said, "Yes, they are good for you too." 
After they finished shopping, they went to the cashier to pay. Lily said to the cashier, "We got fruits and vegetables, no cookies today." The cashier smiled and said, "Good job, you made a healthy choice." Lily felt proud of herself for making a good decision.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the fields. One day, he found a mysterious corn field. The corn was very tall and Timmy wondered what was inside. 
He asked his friend Billy, "What's inside the corn field?" 
Billy replied, "I don't know, let's go see!" 
So, they went into the corn field and Timmy saw a big corn stalk. He said, "I want to cut it down!" 
Billy said, "No, we shouldn't cut it down. It's not nice to cut things without permission." 
Timmy agreed and they left the mysterious corn field, wondering what was inside.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to the zoo with her mom. They saw lots of animals like elephants, monkeys, and birds. Lily's favorite animal was the tiger. She loved the tiger's gray and black stripes.
As they were leaving the zoo, Lily saw a toy store. She asked her mom if they could go inside. Her mom said yes and they went in. Lily saw a big stuffed tiger and asked her mom if she could have it. Her mom said they would come back later to buy it.
The next day, Lily woke up and saw the stuffed tiger on her bed. Her mom had bought it for her! Lily was so happy and hugged the tiger tightly. She remembered seeing the real tiger at the zoo and knew she would always love her gray and black striped friend.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big open space where kids were playing. Tim was very excited to play with them. But Tim was a bit weak and felt scared to join the big kids.
Tim's mom said, "Go play, Tim! You can do it!" Tim took a deep breath and went to join the kids. They were playing a game where they had to pinch a ball and throw it to each other. Tim tried to pinch the ball, but it was hard for him.
At first, the kids laughed at Tim. But then, one kind girl named Sue came to help him. She showed Tim how to pinch the ball better. Tim practiced and practiced. Soon, he could pinch and throw the ball just like the big kids. Tim and Sue became good friends, and they played together all day. In the end, Tim learned that even if he was weak, he could still have fun and make friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she was playing in the park with her friends when she suddenly sneezed. "Achoo!" she said, as she covered her nose with her hand. Her friends giggled and asked if she was okay.
Suddenly, they heard some loud sirens and saw some police cars driving by. Lily's friends got scared and wanted to run away, but Lily was curious and wanted to see what was happening. She walked towards the police cars and saw that they were chasing a thief.
The thief ran right past Lily and her friends, and the police officers followed closely behind. Lily felt embarrassed because she didn't know what to do. She wanted to help the police catch the thief, but she didn't know how. Her friends told her not to worry and that they should just keep playing.
After a while, the police caught the thief and everything went back to normal. Lily and her friends continued playing, and Lily felt happy that she was able to witness something exciting, even though she felt a little embarrassed earlier.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to have picnics with her friends. One day, Lily and her friends were having a picnic in the park when a big, loud dog came running up and disturbed their peaceful picnic. The dog barked and jumped around, knocking over their food and drinks.
Lily's friend, Emily, got jealous of the attention the dog was getting and started to cry. Lily tried to calm her down, but Emily was too upset. Suddenly, the dog ran off and knocked over the basket of food, making a big mess.
Lily and her friends were sad and upset that their picnic was ruined. They decided to go home and try again another day. As they walked away, Lily said, "I don't like it when things disturb our fun. I wish that dog didn't come and ruin our picnic."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very excited because it was his birthday. He hoped to get a big present from his parents. 
His parents gave him a big box wrapped in shiny paper. Timmy was so anxious to open it that he couldn't wait to finish breakfast. He ran to his room and began to tear the paper off the box. 
Suddenly, something unexpected happened. Instead of a toy or a game, there was a little puppy inside the box! Timmy was so happy to have a new pet. He hugged the puppy and said, "Thank you, Mom and Dad! This is the best present ever!"

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went for a jog in the park. She ran and ran until she felt very tired. Suddenly, she saw two boys quarrel over a toy. They were shouting and pushing each other.
Lily felt scared and didn't know what to do. She decided to go closer and ask them to stop. She said, "Please don't fight, it's not nice. Let's share the toy and play together."
The boys stopped quarrelling and looked at Lily. They smiled and said, "Okay, we will share the toy with you too." So, they all played together and had lots of fun. From that day on, Lily made new friends and went for a jog in the park every day.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. The park was big and modern. There were slides, swings, and a sand area to play in. Tim was very happy to be there.
As Tim played, a girl named Sue entered the park. Sue wanted to play with Tim, but she was shy. Tim saw her and said, "Hi! Do you want to play with me?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, I would like that."
They played together all day, sharing the swings and slides. They learned that playing together was more fun than playing alone. The moral of the story is to always be kind and make friends.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was a naughty boy who did not like to listen. One day, Tim found a big red button with the word "print" on it. He wanted to push it, but his mom said, "No, Tim! I do not allow you to push that button."
Tim was sad, but he waited until his mom was not looking. Then, he pushed the button anyway. Suddenly, lots of toys started to come out! Tim was so happy and thought he did a good thing.
But then, something unexpected happened. The toys kept coming out and did not stop. They filled the whole room and Tim could not move. His mom came in and saw the mess. She was not happy with Tim. The plot twist was that the button was not for toys, but for a test to see if Tim would listen. Tim learned that being naughty is not good and he should listen to his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Benny. Benny had a task to do, which was to find honey for his family. He went into the forest to look for honey. The forest was very thick with lots of trees and bushes.
Benny searched and searched but couldn't find any honey. Suddenly, he heard a buzzing sound. He looked up and saw a beehive in a tree. Benny climbed up the tree to get the honey. However, the bees were angry and started chasing him. Benny had to escape from the bees quickly!
Benny ran as fast as he could and finally escaped from the bees. He was very happy because he found honey for his family. When he got back home, he said to his mom, "I found honey, but I had to escape from the bees!" His mom was proud of him for completing his task.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim loved to play in the sand. He took his toy shovel and started to dig a big hole. He wanted to bury his arm in the sand. Tim's mom watched him play and smiled.
As Tim was playing, he found a small, bitter fruit in the sand. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. She had never seen a fruit like this before. Tim wanted to eat it, but his mom said no. She told him to put it back in the sand and cover it up.
Tim did what his mom said and buried the bitter fruit. Suddenly, something unexpected happened! A big, colorful tree started to grow from the spot where he buried the fruit. The tree grew so fast, and it was full of sweet fruits. Tim and his mom were very surprised and happy. They picked some of the sweet fruits and shared them with their friends.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a pet cat named Mittens. Mittens was an amazing cat, with soft fur and big green eyes. 
One day, Timmy noticed that Mittens was missing. He looked everywhere, but couldn't find her. Timmy was very sad because he loved his pet cat very much. 
Timmy decided to solve the mystery of where Mittens had gone. He searched and searched until he found her hiding under the bed. Timmy was so happy to have found his amazing pet cat, Mittens.

The sun was shining and a little girl named Lisa was playing with her football in the park. She was having lots of fun, running around and kicking it. Suddenly, a big dog came running towards her and started barking. Lisa screamed in fear and the dog growled. 
Just then, her dad ran up and screamed "No!" He was really kind and he ran to Lisa and waved his arms until the dog ran away.
Lisa hugged her dad and said, "Thank you daddy."
Her dad smiled and patted her head. "It's ok," he said. "That was a scary dog, but you were so brave. Let's go home now." 
They both held hands and walked away, leaving the football behind.

Once upon a time, there was a big bird called an ostrich. The ostrich was very fast and could run with great speed. One day, the ostrich met a bossy lion who wanted to be friends. The ostrich didn't like the bossy lion and decided to run away as fast as it could. 
As the ostrich was running, it saw a group of animals playing together. The ostrich wanted to join in, but it was too scared to ask. Suddenly, the bossy lion appeared and tried to scare the other animals away. The ostrich didn't like this and used its speed to run towards the lion and chase it away. 
From that day on, the ostrich was known as a brave bird who stood up to bullies. The other animals loved playing with the ostrich and they all became great friends. The bossy lion never bothered them again and the ostrich felt happy knowing it had made a difference.

Rex was a big dog who loved to sing. He sang when he was happy, he sang when he was sad, he sang when he was bored. He sang loud and proud, and did not care what anyone thought.
One day, he found a big bone in the park. He was very happy, and he sang a song about his bone. He sang, "I have a bone, a big and tasty bone, it is the best bone in the world, and it is all for me!"
But Spot, a small dog who was nearby, heard Rex's song. He was very envious of Rex's bone. He wanted the bone for himself. He did not like Rex's singing. He thought Rex was too noisy and too boastful. He decided to trick Rex and take his bone.
He went to Rex and said, "Hello, Rex. You have a very nice bone. But can you sing a different song? Your song is too loud and too boring. I know a better song, a more fun song. Do you want to learn it?"
Rex was curious. He liked to learn new songs. He said, "Sure, Spot. What is your song?"
Spot said, "My song is like this: I have no bone, no bone at all, I do not need a bone to be happy, I can play and run and have fun without a bone!"
Rex thought that was a strange song. He did not understand why Spot would sing that. But he wanted to be polite and friendly. He said, "OK, Spot. I will try your song."
He put his bone down and sang with Spot. He sang, "I have no bone, no bone at all, I do not need a bone to be happy, I can play and run and have fun without a bone!"
But as he sang, Spot quickly grabbed Rex's bone and ran away. He laughed and said, "Ha ha, Rex! You are so silly and so foolish! You gave me your bone, and now you have nothing! I have your bone, your big and tasty bone, it is the best bone in the world, and it is all for me!"
Rex was shocked and angry. He realized that Spot had tricked him and stolen his bone. He felt very sad and very foolish. He wished he had not listened to Spot. He wished he had kept his bone and his song. He learned a hard lesson: not everyone is nice and honest, and sometimes it is better to be careful and smart.

One day, Tim and his mom were in the kitchen. Tim saw the refrigerator and wanted a snack. He asked his mom, "Can I have a snack, please?" His mom said, "Not now, Tim. We will eat soon." But Tim did not listen. He decided to ignore his mom.
When his mom was not looking, Tim opened the refrigerator. He found a green and disgusting snack. He thought it was a funny color, but he still wanted to eat it. Tim took a big bite and made a yucky face. "Ew, this is not good!" he said.
His mom heard Tim and came to see what was wrong. She saw the disgusting snack in his hand and laughed. "That's not a snack, Tim. That's a green pepper! We use it to cook food." Tim felt silly and learned to listen to his mom. From that day on, he never ignored her again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a big box with a prize inside. Lucy wanted to open the box, but it was hard. She tried and tried, but the box did not open. Lucy felt frustrated.
Lucy asked her friend, Tom, to help her open the box. Tom was strong. He tried to open the box too, but it still did not open. Now, both Lucy and Tom were frustrated.
Finally, Lucy and Tom asked a grown-up for help. The grown-up helped them open the box. Inside the box was a big, shiny prize. Lucy and Tom were so happy. They played with the prize all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to sit in his armchair and read books. One day, Timmy's mom said they had to go to the store. Timmy didn't want to go, he wanted to remain in his armchair and read. But his mom said they had to go.
At the store, Timmy saw a small puppy. The puppy was so cute! Timmy wanted to take the puppy home with him. But his mom said no, they couldn't have a puppy. Timmy was sad, but he knew he had to listen to his mom.
When they got home, Timmy ran to his armchair. He was happy to be back in his cozy spot. He knew he couldn't have a puppy, but he remained hopeful that one day he would.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a nervous boy who was scared to ask his friend, Sam, to borrow a toy. One day, Tim went to Sam's house to play. They played with Sam's toys, but Tim really wanted to play with Sam's red ball.
Tim said, "Sam, can I borrow your red ball?" Sam looked at Tim and said, "Yes, you can borrow it, but you must tell me the truth if something happens to it." Tim was happy and promised to tell the truth. They played with the red ball all day long.
Suddenly, the red ball bounced away and fell into a big hole. Tim got scared and didn't know what to do. He thought Sam would be mad at him. But he remembered his promise to tell the truth. So, Tim told Sam what happened. Sam was not mad. He said, "It's okay, Tim. I have a secret. The red ball can fly!" Sam clapped his hands, and the red ball flew out of the hole. Tim and Sam laughed and played with the flying red ball for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time, there was a helpful dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to help his friends. One day, Buddy's friend, a little bird, was sick. The bird needed medicine to feel better.
Buddy went to find the medicine. He found a big bottle with the word "medicine" on it. Buddy did not know how much medicine to give the bird. So, he gave the bird some medicine and waited. The bird still felt sick, so Buddy gave the bird more medicine. He did this many times, repeating it over and over again.
But Buddy did not know that too much medicine can be bad. The bird got very sick from having too much medicine. Buddy was sad because he wanted to help, but he did not know the right way. The moral of the story is to always ask for help when you don't know what to do.

One day, two friends, Tom and Tim, had a quarrel. They were very mad at each other. Tom said, "You are not fun!" Tim said, "You are not nice!"
That night, Tom had a bad dream. It was a nightmare. In the dream, he and Tim were not friends anymore. This made Tom very sad.
The next day, Tom saw something interesting. It was a big, shiny ball. He wanted to share it with Tim. Tom went to Tim and said, "I am sorry for our quarrel. Let's be friends again." Tim smiled and said, "I am sorry too. Let's play with the interesting ball together!" They played all day and were happy friends again.

Once upon a time, there was an egg. The egg was all alone and it was an unknown egg. Nobody knew where it had come from or why it was there.
The egg had a great adventure, but it needed to be tested first. So the egg went to the farmer. The farmer tested the egg and it was a good egg.
The farmer put the egg in a cart with other eggs and took it to a market. At the market, the egg met many other eggs, some square and some round. The egg became friends with all the eggs.
The unknown egg was very happy and it was glad it had passed the test. It enjoyed its time with the other eggs and even went on a few more adventures with them. The end.

Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play in the park. Today, they see a big pond with ducks and fish. They want to feed them.
"Look, I have some bread for the ducks!" Tom says. He breaks the bread into small pieces and throws them into the water. The ducks swim and quack and eat the bread.
"I have some celery for the fish!" Sue says. She holds a long green stick of celery. She bites off a small piece and drops it into the water. The fish swim and nibble and eat the celery.
"Celery is rare for fish. They like it!" Sue says. She smiles and bites off another piece.
Tom and Sue watch the ducks and the fish. They are happy. They want to have more fun.
"Let's splash the water!" Tom says. He takes off his shoes and socks and runs to the edge of the pond. He jumps and splashes the water with his feet.
"Let's splash the water!" Sue says. She takes off her shoes and socks and runs to the edge of the pond. She jumps and splashes the water with her feet.
Tom and Sue splash the water. They laugh and shout. The water is cold and wet. The ducks and the fish swim away. They are scared.
"Stop! Stop!" a voice says. It is the park keeper. He is angry. He runs to Tom and Sue. He tells them to stop splashing the water. He tells them to put on their shoes and socks. He tells them to go away.
Tom and Sue are sad. They did not mean to scare the ducks and the fish. They did not mean to make the park keeper angry. They put on their shoes and socks. They say sorry to the park keeper. They say goodbye to the ducks and the fish. They go away.
They walk to the playground. They see a slide and a swing and a sandbox. They want to play again.
"Let's play on the slide!" Tom says.
"Let's play on the swing!" Sue says.
They run to the playground. They play on the slide and the swing and the sandbox. They have fun. They are friends.

One day, a big dog named Max saw a pretty coat. It was red and shiny. Max wanted the coat, but it was too small for him. He let out a big sigh. "I wish I could wear that coat," he said.
Max saw his friend, a little cat named Lily. She was wearing the pretty coat. Max was envious. He said to Lily, "Your coat is so nice. I want one too." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Max. I like my coat too."
Just then, a strong wind blew. The coat flew off Lily and landed on Max. It was not small anymore. It was big and fit Max perfectly. Max was so happy, and Lily was happy for him too. They both laughed and played, wearing the pretty coat together.

Once upon a time, there was a little alligator named Ally. Ally had a broken toy that she loved very much. She wanted to fix her toy, so she went to her friend, a big bird named Ben.
"Ben, can you help me fix my broken toy?" Ally asked. Ben looked at the toy and said, "Yes, I can help you. We need some glue to fix it."
So, Ally and Ben went to find glue. They found some glue near a big tree. But there was a problem. The glue was stuck in a small hole. Ally tried to get the glue out, but her nose was too big. Ben tried to get the glue out, but his beak was too long.
Then, a tiny ant named Andy came by. He saw Ally and Ben looking sad. "What's wrong?" Andy asked. Ally told him about the broken toy and the glue. Andy said, "I can help you!" Andy used his small legs to pinch the glue out of the hole.
Ally and Ben thanked Andy for his help. They used the glue to fix Ally's broken toy. From that day on, Ally, Ben, and Andy became the best of friends. They played together every day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a kind and generous girl named Lily. She always shared her toys and snacks with her friends. One day, she went to the store with her mom to buy some candy. She saw her friend, Timmy, who didn't have any money to buy candy. 
Lily decided to pay for Timmy's candy with her own money. Timmy was very happy and thanked Lily. They walked back to their homes together, enjoying their candy. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. They saw a big truck had crashed into a tree. 
Lily and Timmy ran towards the truck to help. They saw that the driver was hurt and needed an ambulance. Lily quickly called 911 and Timmy stayed with the driver to keep him company in silence. The ambulance arrived and took the driver to the hospital. 
Lily learned that being generous and helping others can make a big difference. Timmy learned that sometimes unexpected things can happen and it's important to be brave and help others in need.

Once there was a little girl who wanted to have fun. She wanted to run and play in the park. But her friends were too selfish to play with her. They all wanted to play games without the little girl.
So she got sad and looked around the park. Suddenly, she saw a tall structure. It had steps all around it which she could climb. She was so excited! She started to climb.
The little girl kept climbing until she suddenly slipped. She started to fall down, but luckily, she caught the edge of the structure. She held on tight until she could climb again and reach the top. 
Once she reached the top, she was so proud of herself. She had scored a hundred! She was very happy and started to shout for joy. 
From then on, the little girl was no longer selfish. She shared the fun with everyone and everyone was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to eat candy and cookies. One day, her mommy took her to the shop to buy some treats. Lily saw a big bag of candy and asked her mommy if she could have it. Her mommy said no because Lily had already eaten too much candy that day.
Lily was sad and her face turned pale. She decided to take the candy anyway and eat it secretly. But the candy was too much for her little tummy and she got sick. She had to go to the hospital and her mommy was very upset. From that day on, Lily learned that it's not good to eat too much candy and to always listen to her mommy. The end.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big bunch of grapes on a table. They are hungry and want to eat some.
"Look, grapes!" Tom says. "Let's get some."
"OK, but be careful. They are not ours." Mia says.
They run to the table and each take a grape. They are sweet and juicy. They want more. They take another grape and another.
"Stop, Tom! That's enough!" Mia says. "Someone will see us."
But Tom does not listen. He takes a big handful of grapes and puts them in his mouth. He looks happy.
Suddenly, a man comes out of the house. He sees Tom and Mia. He is angry. He shouts at them.
"Hey, you! What are you doing? Those are my grapes! Get away from there!"
Tom and Mia are scared. They drop the grapes and run. But Tom has too many grapes in his mouth. He cannot run fast. He trips and falls. The grapes fly out of his mouth. They hit the man in the face.
"Ow! Ow! Ow!" The man says. "You crazy kids! You hurt me!"
Mia stops and looks back. She sees Tom on the ground and the man with grapes on his face. She laughs. She thinks it is funny.
"Come on, Tom! Get up!" She says. "Let's go!"
Tom gets up. He spits out the last grape. He is sorry. He did not mean to hurt the man. He says sorry.
"Sorry, mister. Sorry for the grapes."
The man is still angry. He does not accept Tom's sorry. He pushes Tom. Tom falls again.
"Hey, don't push him!" Mia says. "That's not nice!"
She runs to Tom and helps him up. She pushes the man back. The man is surprised. He does not expect Mia to push him. He loses his balance and falls on the table. The table breaks. The rest of the grapes fall on him.
"Ow! Ow! Ow!" The man says again. "You crazy kids! You broke my table!"
Tom and Mia are shocked. They did not mean to break the table. They say sorry again.
"Sorry, mister. Sorry for the table."
But the man does not hear them. He is too busy getting the grapes off him. He is very mad. He wants to catch them.
"Come here, you! I'll teach you a lesson!"
Tom and Mia are afraid. They run away as fast as they can. They do not look back. They do not want to see the man again. They do not want to eat grapes again. They learned their lesson. They will not take things that are not theirs. They will not be crazy. They will be good.

The rich girl had a very special handle. She loved it very much. But one day, she lost the handle and began to cry. 
"What's wrong with you, my dear?" asked the girl's mother.
The girl sniffled and said, "I lost my handle". 
"Don't worry," said the mother with a smile, "I'm sure we'll find it." So, the mother and daughter searched the room together and eventually, the girl found her handle.
The little girl was so happy that she started to laugh, and the mother laughed too. With the handle in her hand, the rich girl felt like nothing could stop her.  She smiled and waved goodbye, happy for the handle that she had found.

Once upon a time, there was a tall tree named Tim. Tim was very flexible. He could bend and sway in the wind. One day, Tim saw a little bird named Bob. Bob was standing on a branch. He was sad because he could not fly.
Tim wanted to help Bob. He thought for a minute. He had an idea. Tim bent down and picked up Bob with his branch. He swung Bob up high into the sky.
Bob was happy. He felt like he was flying. Tim and Bob became good friends. They played together every day. And that is how the flexible tree and the little bird became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up and would often go to her wardrobe to pick out her favorite outfits. One day, as she was searching through her wardrobe, she found a pair of flexible pants that she had never seen before. 
Excitedly, she put on the pants and showed her mom. "Look, Mommy! These pants are so stretchy and flexible!" she exclaimed. Her mom smiled and said, "Those are great pants, Lily. You can wear them to play and move around easily." 
Later that day, Lily went outside to play with her friends. As they were playing, they noticed the sun starting to rise in the sky. "Look, the sun is rising!" Lily exclaimed. Her friends looked up and saw the beautiful colors of the sunrise. "Wow, it's so pretty," they said. 
Lily was happy to have found her new favorite pants and enjoyed playing with her friends as the sun continued to rise higher in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a long bird with pretty colors. The bird loved to fly in the sky and sing happy songs. One day, the bird saw a little girl playing in the park. The bird flew down to say hello.
"Hi, little girl!" the bird said. "I am a long bird who can glow in the dark. Would you like to play with me?" The little girl looked at the bird and smiled. "Yes, I would love to play with you!" she said. They played together all day, running and jumping in the park.
As the sun went down, the bird started to glow. The little girl was amazed. "Wow, you really do glow!" she said. The bird and the little girl played until it was time to go home. They said goodbye, and the bird flew back into the sky. From that day on, the little girl and the long bird were best friends, and they played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat spaghetti. One day, Timmy spilled spaghetti all over his bright shirt. His mommy said, "Oh no, your shirt is dirty. We need to wash it." 
But when they tried to wash it, they saw a hole in the shirt. Timmy's mommy said, "We need to repair it." So, they took the shirt to the store and a nice lady fixed the hole. 
Now, Timmy's shirt was clean and bright again. He was happy and he ate his spaghetti without spilling it again. The end.

One day, a big alligator went for a walk. The alligator saw a little bird. The little bird was sad. The alligator wanted to make the bird smile.
The alligator did an incredible dance. The bird started to smile. But then, a big wind came. The wind took the bird up, up, up in the sky. The alligator was sad now.
But the alligator did not give up. The alligator climbed a big tree. The alligator got the bird from the sky. The bird was happy. The alligator was happy too. They both smiled and played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to play and run around in the park. One day, Max was playing with his bone when he heard a loud noise. He looked up and saw a big, gloomy cloud in the sky. 
Max got scared and ran to his owner, a little girl named Lily. "Lily, Lily, there's a big cloud in the sky!" Max barked. "Don't worry, Max," Lily said, "It's just a storm. We'll go inside and wait it out." 
As they walked home, Max was still scared. Suddenly, Lily had an idea. "Let's surprise Mom and Dad by making them a cake!" she said. Max's tail started wagging and he forgot all about the gloomy cloud. 
They went to the kitchen and started baking. Max helped by licking the spoon. When they were done, they surprised their parents with a delicious cake. Everyone was happy and the gloomy cloud outside didn't seem so scary anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and her friends. One day, Lily's friend Emma came over to play. Lily was so excited to see her friend and they started to play together.
While they were playing, Emma asked Lily if she wanted to come over to her house to play tomorrow. Lily got so excited and promised her friend that she would come over. "I promise I will come over tomorrow to play with you," said Lily.
The next day, Lily went over to Emma's house and they played all day long. They played with dolls, blocks, and even went outside to play on the swings. They had so much fun together.
As the sun started to set, Lily's mom came to pick her up. Lily was sad to leave her friend but promised Emma that they would play together again soon. "I promise we will play together again soon," said Lily as she hugged her friend goodbye.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate boy named Tim. He loved to play outside and enjoy the sun. One day, he found a small pebble near the big tree. He thought it was special, so he kept it in his pocket.
Tim showed the pebble to his best friend, Lily. Together, they played with the pebble all day. They threw it, rolled it, and even made a little bed for it. It was so much fun! But then, something unexpected happened.
As they were playing, the pebble began to grow bigger and bigger! Tim and Lily were very surprised. The pebble was not just a pebble, it was a magic rock! They played with the big rock and had even more fun. They knew they had found something very special.

Once upon a time, there was a thin bird. The thin bird had a feather. The feather was very special to the bird. One day, a big wind came and blew the feather away. The thin bird was very sad.
The thin bird went to look for the feather. The bird met a cat. The cat said, "I saw your feather. I will help you find it." The thin bird and the cat went to look for the feather together.
They found the feather near a big tree. The thin bird was very happy. The bird said, "Thank you, cat. Now I can hold my feather again." But the cat wanted the feather too. The cat took the feather and ran away. The thin bird was sad and never saw the feather again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside with his wagon. His wagon was big and red, and it could carry lots of things. Timmy's wagon was very reliable, which means it never broke and always worked well.
One day, Timmy was playing with his wagon in the park. He was having so much fun that he didn't notice a big rock in his way. When his wagon hit the rock, it made a loud noise and a part of the wagon broke off. Timmy was sad because he loved his wagon so much.
But Timmy's dad was very handy, which means he was good at fixing things. He took the broken part of the wagon and fixed it, so it was as good as new. Timmy was happy again because his reliable wagon was fixed and he could play with it again. The end.

Once upon a time, in a big house, there lived a wealthy man. He had many things, like toys and nice clothes. One day, he saw a spark in the sky. He was very curious and wanted to see what it was.
The wealthy man went outside to find the spark. He walked and walked, and then he saw a little boy. The boy was playing with a ball. The wealthy man asked the boy if he saw the spark. The boy said yes, and he wanted to find it too.
So, they walked together to find the spark. They passed many trees and flowers. Then, they saw the spark again. But this time, it was on the ground. They went closer, and the spark was a shiny rock. The wealthy man and the boy were very happy to find it. But the twist was, the rock was not worth any money. It was just a pretty rock. The wealthy man learned that not all things need to be worth money to be special.

One day, Timmy and Sally went to the park. They played on the swings and the slide. Timmy found a penny on the ground and showed it to Sally. Sally was envious and wanted a penny too.
As they were playing, a man came up to them and asked if they wanted some candy. Timmy said no, but Sally said yes. The man gave Sally some candy and left.
Later that day, Sally got sick and had to go to the hospital. The doctor said the candy made her very sick. Timmy was sad and wished he could have provided better protection for Sally.

Once upon a time, there was a big airplane. It was so large that it could carry lots of people. One day, the airplane took off and flew high in the sky. A little girl named Lily was on the airplane.
Lily looked out the window and saw the clouds. She asked her mommy, "When will we turn and land?" Her mommy said, "We will turn soon and land in a big city."
Suddenly, Lily felt the airplane turn and she got a little scared. But her mommy held her hand and said, "It's okay, we're just turning. We'll be on the ground soon." And sure enough, a few minutes later, the airplane landed safely on the ground. Lily was so happy to be in the big city and see all the tall buildings!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with clay. He made many fun shapes with the clay. He made a dog, a cat, and a big sun. Tim thought his clay shapes were very important.
One day, Tim's friend, Sue, came to play. Sue saw the clay shapes and said, "Wow! I value your clay shapes, Tim. They are so pretty!" Tim was happy that Sue liked his clay shapes, too.
Tim and Sue played with the clay all day. They made more important shapes together. They made a house, a tree, and a car. They had so much fun playing with the clay. Tim and Sue knew that their friendship was also very important.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mommy. They saw a big, brown dog running around. The dog was so happy and it made Lily smile. 
Suddenly, Lily's mommy said they had to rush home because they were late for dinner. Lily got sad because she wanted to stay and play with the dog. 
As they walked home, Lily saw a strip of green grass and decided to pick some flowers for her mommy. She ran over to the strip and picked some pretty flowers. 
When they got home, Lily's daddy was watching TV. But he couldn't hear them because he was deaf. So, they waved and smiled at him instead. They had a yummy dinner together and Lily went to bed happy, dreaming about the fun she had at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big, brown dog named Max. Max loved to play outside on Sunday. He would run and jump and bark at the birds. One day, Max saw a bone in his neighbor's yard. It looked so yummy! But Max knew it wasn't his bone. He didn't want to steal it. 
Later that day, Max's neighbor came over to play. They ran and jumped and had so much fun! But Max's neighbor was sad. She said her ice cream was bitter. Max didn't like to see his friend sad. He ran to his house and got his favorite toy. He gave it to his neighbor to make her feel better. 
Max learned that it's not nice to steal and that friends help each other when they're sad. From that day on, Max and his neighbor had even more fun on Sundays!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her ball and roll it around the garden. One day, she met a friendly bird who spoke a different language than her. Lily tried to talk to the bird, but she couldn't understand what it was saying.
The bird noticed Lily's confusion and said, "Don't worry, little one. I can teach you my language if you're gentle with me."
Lily was so excited to learn a new language and promised to be gentle with the bird. The bird taught her how to say "hello" and "thank you" in its language.
Days passed, and Lily was rolling her ball in the garden when she heard a familiar voice. It was the bird, and it said, "Hello, Lily! Thank you for being gentle with me."
Lily was so happy that she could understand the bird's language. From that day on, Lily and the bird became good friends and would spend hours rolling around the garden together, chatting in their own special language.

Once upon a time, there was an empty pond. It was so big, and the sun sparkled on top. One day, a little fish named Tom wanted to swim in the pond. He looked for a way to get in, but he couldn't find any. He tried and tried, but he could not get in.
Then he thought of a plan. He saw a big scale on the edge of the pond, and he decided to jump on top of it. Tom jumped and jumped until he was on the scale. He used it as his ladder and slowly climbed down into the empty pond. Tom was so excited!
He started to swim around, enjoying the cool water. He was having so much fun. Then he heard a voice call out: 
"Tom the Fish, it is time to come out of the water." It was the voice of his mother! 
Tom swam out of the water and said goodbye to the empty pond. He was happy he got to swim, even if it was just for a little while.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with blocks. He would stack them up high and then knock them down. One day, Timmy went to his friend's house to play. His friend had a new toy, but Timmy didn't like it. He wanted to play with the blocks instead. 
His friend said, "Timmy, please accept my toy. It's fun too!" But Timmy didn't want to. He only wanted to play with blocks. His friend was sad, but Timmy didn't know why. Then Timmy realized that he wasn't being a good friend. He decided to accept his friend's toy and they played together happily. They even used the blocks to build a big tower! From that day on, Timmy learned that it's important to accept others and try new things.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, but her room was always messy. One day, her mom said, "Lily, let's tidy up your room. It's time to put your toys away." 
Lily didn't want to clean up, but her mom said, "If you clean up, I'll show you a surprise." So, Lily started to put away her toys. She put her dolls on the shelf and her blocks in the bin. 
As she was cleaning, Lily found a pin on the floor. She picked it up and asked her mom, "What's this?" Her mom said, "That's a pin. It's sharp and can hurt you. Let me take it." 
After Lily finished cleaning, her mom said, "Now, close your eyes. I have a surprise for you." Lily closed her eyes and her mom showed her a new toy. Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, Mommy!" From that day on, Lily always kept her room tidy so she could have more surprises.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom loved to count. He would count everything he saw. One day, Tom found a box with a game called chess. It did not look like an ordinary game.
Tom wanted to play chess, but his sister Sue said, "No, you are too little." This made Tom sad. He wanted to show Sue that he could play chess too. So, Tom started to count all the chess pieces. He counted 16 white ones and 16 black ones.
Tom told Sue how many pieces there were. Sue was surprised. She said, "Okay, let's play chess together." They played and played. Tom learned how to play chess very well. The moral of the story is: never think someone is too little to do something. Everyone can learn if they try.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved flowers a lot. One day, she found a rough-looking flower in her garden. She picked it up and showed it to her mom. Her mom introduced her to the flower and told her its name.
Lily loved the rough flower and took care of it every day. She watered it and gave it sunlight. But one day, a big storm came and destroyed the flower. Lily was very sad and cried a lot. She learned that even though we love something very much, bad things can still happen.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside, even when it was dark. One night, he decided to go on an adventure with his flashlight. He walked down the street, shining his light on everything he saw.
Suddenly, he heard a noise. "Who's there?" he asked. "It's me, your friend Billy," a voice replied. Billy was Timmy's best friend from school. He had also come outside to play with his flashlight.
As they walked together, Timmy saw something shiny in the distance. "What's that?" he asked. "Let's go see," Billy suggested. They ran towards it and found a big, icy puddle. They leaned over to touch it, but it was too slippery.
Just then, Timmy slipped and fell into the puddle. "Help!" he cried. Billy tried to pull him out, but he slipped too. They were both stuck in the icy water, shivering and scared. No one was around to hear their cries for help.
Sadly, the night ended with the two friends getting very sick from the cold water. They learned that sometimes, it's better to stay inside and wait for the daylight.

Once upon a time there lived a weird lion. He was the only lion in the land who loved to roar in round circles. Every day he went around the jungle making these round circles with his roars. No one knew why he did this, but it was so fun!
One day something very strange happened. As the lion was roaring in a circle, a little monkey appeared from the trees. This was really weird because the little monkey was talking back. He said, "Hey, why do you roar in round circles?" The lion was surprised and a bit confused. He thought for a moment then answered, "I don't know why I do it either. I just think it's fun!"
The little monkey smiled. "I think I know what you need!" he said. He jumped away, and the lion watched him disappear back in the trees. The lion was very curious but he thought nothing more of it.
The next day, when the lion was roaring in a circle, the little monkey showed up again, but this time he was not alone. He had a round ball with him! The monkey said, "It's for you, try it out!"
The lion smiled. He knew what the little monkey meant and quickly began to play with the round ball. He roared and rolled with it, making bigger and bigger circles. Everyone in the jungle was amazed, and the lion and the monkey continued to play like this for hours

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a big room full of stuff. She loved her toys very much. Her favorite toy was a soft bear named Ben. Every day, Amy would hug Ben and play with him.
One day, Amy's mom was very busy. She was cleaning the house and cooking food. Amy wanted to help her mom, so she picked up her toys and put them away. She gave Ben a big hug and put him on her bed.
After helping her mom, Amy felt happy. She went to her room and saw Ben on her bed. Amy hugged Ben again and said, "Thank you, Ben, for being my friend." They played together until it was time for bed. That night, Amy hugged Ben tight and they both had sweet dreams.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim found an orange box. Inside the box, he discovered an old photo. The photo showed a big tree with a swing. Tim wanted to find this tree.
Tim showed the photo to his friend, Sally. "Look what I found!" he said. "Let's go find the tree and play on the swing!" Sally agreed, and they went on a walk to find the tree.
As they walked, they saw the tree from the photo. But there was a twist! The swing was not a swing at all. It was a big, friendly dragon. The dragon said, "Hello, I am Dara. I can be your swing!" Tim and Sally were surprised but happy. They played with Dara the dragon all day.

Once upon a time, there was a fine little boy who loved to add things. He wanted to add many things to his room, so he asked his mom for a table. His mom said yes, and soon there was a new table in the room.
The boy was very happy, and he spent the morning adding things to the table. He added his teddy bear, his blocks, and his favorite doll. He was so pleased with what he had added, he decided to add a cup of juice and a snack.
Once everything was added, the boy smiled and said, "This is a very fine table!" He was so proud of himself for creating such a wonderful place for all his things.
The boy enjoyed his table every day, and soon his mom and dad added things to it as well. They added books, plants, and toys to make it even more special. The boy was very pleased, and he felt so happy every time he looked at the table.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved the color pink and had a pink dress that she wore every day. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. She played on the swings and the slide and had so much fun.
Suddenly, Lily heard a quiet sound. It was her mom's phone ringing. Her mom answered the phone and talked for a little while. Lily got bored and decided to play on the slide again.
But when she got to the top of the slide, something unexpected happened. The slide started to reverse and she went down backwards! Lily was scared at first, but then she started to laugh. When she got to the bottom, she told her mom what happened. "That was so much fun!" she said.
From that day on, Lily loved going down the slide backwards. And she learned that sometimes, unexpected things can be really fun.

Once upon a time, there was an old lady who loved to drink tea. She was very old and her hair was white. She lived in a small house with her cat. One day, a little girl came to her house and asked for some tea. The old lady was happy to share her tea and they sat down to drink it. 
But then, the little girl accidentally spilled the tea on the old lady's dress. The old lady got very upset and said, "Oh no! My dress is ruined!" The little girl felt very sorry and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to spill it." 
The old lady looked at the little girl and saw how sad she was. She realized that it was just an accident and that the little girl didn't mean to do it. So, the old lady smiled and said, "It's okay, accidents happen. Let's clean it up together." They cleaned up the spilled tea and the old lady and the little girl became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. One day, while he was playing in his backyard, he found a beetle. The beetle was small and black, with shiny wings that sparkled in the sun.
Timmy picked up the beetle and showed it to his mom. "Look, Mommy! I found a beetle!" he said excitedly. His mom smiled and said, "That's nice, Timmy. Just be careful not to hurt it."
Timmy played with the beetle for a while, adding sticks and leaves to its little home. But then, something bad happened. Timmy accidentally stepped on the beetle, crushing it under his foot. He felt terrible and started to cry.
His mom came over and hugged him. "It's okay, Timmy. Accidents happen," she said. But Timmy couldn't stop crying. He had learned a hard lesson that day about being careful with the things he loved.

Once upon a time, there was a thin cat and a big dog. They lived in a small house. They were good friends. One day, they had a fight over a toy. They could not agree who should have it. So, they decided to go to a lawyer, Mr. Owl, to help them.
Mr. Owl, the lawyer, listened to the cat and dog. He said, "Let's separate the toy in two parts. Each of you can have half." The cat and dog thought it was a good idea. They thanked Mr. Owl and went back to their small house.
When they got home, the cat and dog were happy to share the toy. They learned that sharing is good. They became better friends. From that day on, they shared everything and played together all the time. The moral of the story is to always share and be kind to your friends.

Once upon a time, there was a bossy sun. Every day, it would rise up in the sky and tell all the other things what to do. The sun would say to the birds, "Wake up and sing!" It would tell the flowers, "Open up and look pretty!" The sun was in charge of everything.
One day, the sun saw a little girl named Sue making a print with her hands. The sun thought it was pretty, so it wanted to make a print too. It tried to touch the ground, but it couldn't because it was too high up in the sky. The sun asked Sue, "Can you help me make a print?"
Sue thought about it for a moment, and then she had an idea. She took a big mirror and held it up to the sun. The sun's light bounced off the mirror and made a bright print on the ground. The sun was so happy to see its print, it stopped being bossy. From that day on, the sun learned to be kind and let the other things do what they wanted.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run around. One day, she saw her mom jogging in the park.
"Mommy, can I jog with you?" Lily asked.
"Of course, sweetie," her mom replied.
As they were jogging, Lily saw a magazine on the ground. "Look, mommy! A magazine!" she said.
"Be careful, Lily. Sometimes magazines can have fake stories in them," her mom warned.
But Lily didn't listen and picked up the magazine. Suddenly, she tripped and fell.
"Ouch! My leg hurts," Lily cried.
Her mom rushed her to the hospital, but unfortunately, Lily had broken her leg. From then on, Lily always remembered to be careful and listen to her mom's advice.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a desk in her room where she liked to draw and color. One day, her big sister came in and said, "Lily, can you draw a picture for me?" Lily said, "Sure, what do you want me to draw?" Her sister said, "I want you to draw a princess with a big pink dress." 
Lily started drawing and her sister watched. After a few minutes, her sister got bored and started to yawn. Lily asked, "Are you tired?" Her sister said, "No, I'm just bored. Can you hurry up and finish the picture?" Lily didn't like her sister being bossy, so she said, "I'll finish when I'm done. You can wait or leave." Her sister decided to leave and Lily finished the picture of the princess with the big pink dress.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a little girl named Amy. Amy was going to a party with her friends. She was very happy and excited. The party had balloons, cake, and games. Everyone was having a lot of fun.
During the party, Amy saw a small, harmless bug. She wanted to play with the bug, but her friend Tom disagreed. He said, "No, Amy, bugs are yucky. Let's play with the balloons instead." But Amy liked the bug and thought it was cute.
Then, something unexpected happened. The bug started to grow bigger and bigger. It turned into a big, friendly, and colorful butterfly. All the kids at the party were amazed and wanted to play with it. Even Tom changed his mind and thought the butterfly was wonderful. They all played together and had the best time at the party.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a card on the floor. The card had a picture of two people fighting. Tim did not like to see people fight, so he felt sad. He showed the card to his friend, Sue.
"Look, Sue! I found this card with people fighting. I don't like it," said Tim. Sue looked at the card and had an idea. "Let's change the card so they are not fighting anymore," she said.
Tim and Sue drew on the card to make the people look like they were helping each other. Now, the card showed two people who were not fighting but helping a helpless cat out of a tree. Tim and Sue felt happy with their new card. They did not expect that they could change the picture on the card and make it better. Now, they knew that they could always find a way to turn something sad into something happy.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside with his dog, Spot. They would run and jump all day long. One day, Tim found a big sheet in his room. He had an idea.
Tim took the sheet outside and said to Spot, "Let's play save the day!" He tied the sheet around his neck like a cape. Tim and Spot ran around, pretending to save their friends from danger.
As they played, a little girl named Sue came over. She was sad because her cat was stuck in a tree. "Can you save my cat, Tim?" Sue asked. Tim and Spot looked up at the tree and saw the cat. With the sheet still tied around his neck, Tim climbed the tree and saved the cat. Sue was so happy and thanked Tim and Spot. From that day on, Tim, Spot, and Sue became best friends and played together every day.

Nina was lying in the grass when she heard a noise. She looked up, and saw a little red bug. She looked closer and saw it had six legs. As it crawled on the grass, she reached out to touch it. 
"Hi Bug," she said.
The bug stopped and looked at her with its buggy eyes. Nina smiled.
Then something funny happened. The bug flexed its little red muscle and jumped into the air. 
"Wow!" said Nina. 
The bug landed and scurried away. Nina watched it until it was out of sight. 
She sat and thought about the little red bug and its funny muscle. She reached out to touch the grass and smiled, remembering how the bug had jumped so high.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Sarah who lived in a tidy house. One day, Sarah went for a walk outside. It was misty and the ground felt soft under her feet.
As she wandered through the mist, Sarah saw a tree. She decided to climb up the tree. She carefully balanced on each branch, and soon she was so high that she couldn't see the ground.
Sarah could see lots of different things from the tree. In the mist, she could see animals and trees, until the whole world was hidden away.
Soon, Sarah started to get tired, and she decided to come back down the tree. She held tightly onto the branches and carefully balanced her way back to the ground.
Sarah walked safely back home with a happy smile on her face. She had had a fun and tidy adventure in the mist.

Once upon a time, there was a good cat and a good dog. They lived in a house with a big tree. The cat and the dog liked to play together. One day, they saw a big grape under the tree. The cat and the dog both wanted the grape.
The cat and the dog started to fight. They both wanted the big grape. They pushed and pulled, but the grape did not move. The cat and the dog were very tired. They sat down and looked at the grape.
Then, something unexpected happened. A little bird flew down from the tree. The bird picked up the big grape in its beak. The cat and the dog looked at the bird. They stopped fighting. The bird flew away with the grape. The cat and the dog were surprised. They learned that fighting was not good. From that day, they shared everything and played together happily.

One day, a little girl named Lily went outside to play in the rain. She loved to jump in puddles and make splashes. She saw a boy standing near a big puddle and said, "Hi, what are you doing?"
The boy replied, "I'm trying to make the puddle go away, it's not nice to have it here."
Lily thought for a moment and said, "But the puddle is nice, it's fun to jump in and make splashes. Maybe we can make the puddle smaller by jumping in it together."
The boy smiled and they both jumped in the puddle, making it smaller and smaller. They had so much fun playing in the rain and making the puddle disappear.
The moral of the story is that sometimes things that we think are not nice can actually be fun and enjoyable. It's important to try new things and see the good in everything.

Once there was a girl named Jane who loved to play with circles. She made them out of string and tied them together. She was so happy when she was done! The circles were so light and pretty. 
Jane made lots of circles and liked to see how high she could hang them in her room. She started to tie them to the door and covered it in circles. The circles were so light that the door easily opened and closed.
Jane liked to play with her circles. She threw them up in the sky and watched as they came down. She even clapped when they landed on the grass. 
At the end of the day Jane's mom came in and saw all of the circles. She told Jane that she did a wonderful job and hugged her for being so creative. Jane smiled and felt so happy to have made something beautiful.

Once upon a time, there was a little lively dog named Dare. He lived in a small house with his best friend, a girl named Lily. They liked to play in the yard and have fun all day.
One day, while they were playing, they saw a small flame in the woods. "Oh no!" said Lily, "we need to put the flame out!" Dare barked and wagged his tail, ready to help Lily. They ran to the woods with a big bucket of water.
When they got to the woods, Lily threw the water on the flame. The flame went out and they were happy. "Good job, Dare!" said Lily. Dare barked and jumped around, happy to have helped his friend. They went back home and played more games, knowing they had done a good thing.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a gray bucket by the sea. He was so happy. He wanted to play with it. He picked up the bucket and ran to the water.
Tim filled the gray bucket with water and said, "I will make a big splash!" He threw the water up in the air. But, the water did not come down. Tim was very surprised.
A big cloud came and said, "Thank you, Tim! I was so thirsty. You helped me!" Tim smiled and said, "You're welcome, cloud!" From that day on, Tim and the cloud were best friends. They played with the gray bucket every day by the sea.

Ben and Mia are friends. They like to play outside. Today, they see some snow on the ground. They want to make a snowman.
They put on their hats and gloves and go out. They find a big ball of snow. They roll it on the ground. It gets bigger and bigger. They make another ball and put it on top. They find a carrot and some stones. They make a nose and eyes and a mouth for the snowman.
"Look, our snowman is done!" Ben says. "He is very big and smooth."
"Yes, he is!" Mia says. "But he is also very cold. Let's give him a scarf and a hat to keep him warm."
They run to the house and get a scarf and a hat. They put them on the snowman. They hug him and say hello.
"Hello, snowman!" Ben says. "We are your friends. What is your name?"
The snowman does not say anything. He just smiles.
"Maybe he does not know how to talk," Mia says. "Maybe we can teach him. Let's start with numbers. Do you know what numbers are, snowman?"
The snowman shakes his head.
"Numbers are what we use to count things," Ben says. "Like one, two, three, four, five. Can you say them with us, snowman?"
Ben and Mia start to count. They point to their fingers and the snowman's buttons. They hope the snowman will join them.
But the snowman does not say anything. He just smiles. He likes to listen to his friends. He thinks they are very smart and kind. He is happy to have them. He does not need to know numbers. He just needs to know love.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very happy because he was going to have a party. He wanted to invite all his friends to come and play with him. So, he went to his friend's house and said, "Hey, do you want to come to my party?"
His friend said, "Yes, I want to come to your party!" 
Timmy was so excited that he ran home to tell his mom. But when he got home, he saw his dad's pistol on the table. He picked it up and started playing with it. Suddenly, the gun went off and Timmy's friend was hit. 
Timmy was very sorry and cried a lot. His mom called the doctor, but it was too late. Timmy's friend had died. Timmy learned a very important lesson that day. He should never play with guns and always be careful with his toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy mine that she loved to play with. The mine was made of fake gems and stones. Lily liked to pretend that she was digging for treasure.
One day, Lily took her mine to the park. She met a boy named Tim. Tim wanted to play with the mine too. Lily said, "Okay, but you have to repeat after me. This is a fake mine with fake gems." Tim repeated her words and they both played together.
They dug and dug, finding more fake gems in the mine. They laughed and had fun. They took turns repeating, "This is a fake mine with fake gems." After a while, they were tired but happy. Lily and Tim became good friends and played with the mine every day.

Once, there was a little girl named Rose. Rose was only 3, but she was very clever. 
One day she was walking by the river and she saw something shiny and sparkling in the water. Rose was curious and she reached out to pick it up, but the shiny thing slipped and dropped into the water.
Rose was sad, but she decided to look around and see what else she could find. Then, she saw a smelly old apple on the ground. She picked it up, and she was about to take a bite of it when her mother rushed over and stopped her.
Rose's mother told her it was important not to drop things into the river and also not to eat any smelly old apples. She said it was bad to not look after the river and it was also not healthy to eat bad old apples.
Rose listened carefully to her mother's words and from then on, she always made sure to look after the river and never, ever eat smelly old apples. She remembered that bad old apples did not taste good.
The moral of the story is that it is important to look after your environment and also to make sure you only eat foods that are healthy and tasty.

One day, a girl named Sue found a sock. The sock was all alone. Sue loved the sock, so she put it on her hand. It was like a puppet. Sue said, "Hello, Mr. Sock!" The sock said, "Hello, Sue!"
Sue took Mr. Sock to the park. They saw a big tree. Sue and Mr. Sock wanted to see the top. They climbed the tree. They looked far away. They saw a distant place. "Wow!" said Sue. "Look at that, Mr. Sock!" Mr. Sock said, "I want to go there!"
They walked and walked. They found a big sock house. Sue was surprised. "I did not know that socks have houses!" she said. Mr. Sock said, "This is my family!" Sue was happy for Mr. Sock. She said, "Now you are not alone." Sue and Mr. Sock played with the sock family all day.

Tom and Mia are playing in the sand. They have a green flag and a bucket. They want to make a castle.
"Look, Mia, I dig a big hole!" Tom says. He uses his hands and a shovel.
"Good, Tom, I fill the bucket with sand!" Mia says. She uses a spoon and a cup.
They work hard and have fun. They make a big castle with a tower and a wall. They put the green flag on top of the tower.
"Wow, our castle is great!" Tom says. He claps his hands.
"Yes, it is!" Mia says. She smiles.
They run around the castle and pretend to be kings and queens. They sing and dance.
But then, a big dog comes. The dog is brown and furry. He likes to play too. He sees the castle and the flag. He runs to them and barks.
"Hey, dog, go away!" Tom says. He waves his arms.
"No, dog, leave our castle alone!" Mia says. She stamps her feet.
But the dog does not listen. He jumps on the castle and knocks it down. He grabs the flag and runs away.
"Oh no, our castle!" Tom says. He is sad.
"Oh no, our flag!" Mia says. She is mad.
They chase the dog, but he is too fast. He digs a hole and buries the flag. He wags his tail and licks his nose.
"Bad dog, bad dog!" Tom and Mia say. They cry.
The dog does not care. He is happy. He has a new toy. He lies down and sleeps.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a big cabinet in her room where she kept all her toys. One day, her friend came to visit and wanted to play with her toys. Lily was happy to lend her friend some toys. But when her friend opened the cabinet, they found a big spider inside. 
Lily's friend was scared of spiders and felt uncomfortable. They quickly closed the cabinet and didn't want to play anymore. Lily felt sad that her friend didn't want to play with her toys. But then, she had an idea. She went to the kitchen and got a big jar. She carefully caught the spider and put it in the jar. 
She showed her friend the jar with the spider inside and her friend was amazed. They forgot about being scared and started to look at the spider. Lily's friend said it was the most interesting thing she had ever seen. They played with the spider for hours and had so much fun. Lily was happy that she could lend her friend something unexpected and make her happy.

"Billy and mummy were walking by the lake one day. They stopped to admire the beautiful lake, so calm and still. Suddenly, a loud noise echoed through the sky.
`What is that?` asked Billy.
`That is a powerful crane`, mummy said. `It lifts heavy things with its long, strong arms.`
Then a small boy appeared from behind the trees. He said, `I hate cranes! Whenever I see one, it scares me.`.
Mummy comforted him, `Don't be scared, Billy. Cranes are powerful, but they are very gentle. They don't mean to frighten you. In fact, they can be quite helpful.`
The boy smiled and waved goodbye to Billy and mummy. Billy was happy to hear that cranes weren't so bad after all. He smiled back and waved goodbye too.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play catch with his friends. They would throw a big, red ball to each other. Tim felt safe when he played catch because he was good at it.
One day, Tim saw a little girl named Sue sitting alone. He asked her, "Do you want to play catch with me?" Sue said, "Yes, I would like that." So they started to play catch together. Sue was not very good at first, but Tim helped her learn.
As they played catch, Tim and Sue made many happy memories. They laughed and had fun in the sun. Soon, they became best friends. Tim and Sue knew that they would always remember the day they played catch and became friends. They felt safe and happy together.

Once upon a time, a loyal dog named Max lived with his family. Max loved to wear his soft bathrobe after a warm bath. One day, Max and his family went to the park to play ball.
At the park, Max saw a big dog with a ball. Max wanted to play too. He asked the big dog to pass the ball. The big dog passed the ball to Max, and they played and played. Max was happy to make a new friend.
Then, something unexpected happened. The big dog took off his hat, and it was Max's dad! Max's dad was playing a trick on him. Max laughed and laughed. He knew his dad was the best friend he could ever have. They all went home, and Max wore his bathrobe, feeling happy and loved.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, he was playing with his favorite truck when he noticed one of the screws was missing. He looked all over, but he couldn't find it.
Timmy's big sister, Sarah, saw him looking sad and asked what was wrong. Timmy told her about the missing screw and insisted that he needed it to fix his truck. Sarah helped him look for it, but they still couldn't find it.
Feeling sad, Timmy decided to play with his other toys. But then he noticed something strange about his toy robot. It looked fake! Timmy told Sarah about the fake robot and insisted that he didn't want to play with it anymore.
Sarah told Timmy that it was okay and that they could go to the toy store to find a new screw for his truck and a new robot that wasn't fake. Timmy was so happy and thanked his sister for helping him. They went to the store and found everything they needed. Timmy was so excited to play with his toys again and everything was good. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a fat cat named Kitty. Kitty liked to play with her toy mouse. One day, Kitty saw a door with a handle. She wanted to see what was behind the door.
Kitty jumped up and pushed the handle down. The door opened and she saw a big yard. Kitty saw a dog named Buddy in the yard. Buddy was happy to see Kitty. He said, "Hi Kitty, do you want to play with me?"
Kitty was scared of dogs, so she shouted, "No!" and ran back into the house. But Buddy was nice and just wanted to be friends. He followed Kitty into the house. When Kitty saw that Buddy was not mean, she stopped being scared. They played with the toy mouse together and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a lively dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his toys. His favorite toy was a long cable. He liked to match the cable with other toys.
One day, Spot was playing with his cable in the yard. He saw a big ball. Spot thought the big ball would be fun to play with too. He tried to match the big ball with his cable.
But, the big ball was not a ball at all! It was a turtle! The turtle said, "Hi, I am Tim. I am not a ball, but I can play with you!" Spot was happy and surprised. Spot and Tim played with the cable together. They became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the garden. One day, she found a tiny seed and decided to plant it in the ground. She watered it every day and watched it grow taller and taller.
One day, Lily's mom asked her to help with dinner. She needed to add some salt to the soup. Lily tried to pour the salt into the pot, but it was too loud and made a big mess. Her mom laughed and said, "It's okay, Lily. You'll learn how to do it quietly next time."
As they sat down to eat, Lily's dad noticed the plant she had grown. "Wow, Lily! Your plant has grown so much!" he exclaimed. Lily smiled proudly and said, "I made it grow big and strong with water and love."

Once upon a time, there was a pretty duck named Daisy. Daisy loved to play with her friends in the pond. They liked to make different shapes with their bodies while they swam.
One day, Daisy and her friends decided to have a fun game. They wanted to see who could make the best shape while they swam. Daisy tried very hard and made a big circle with her body. Her friends clapped and cheered for her.
After the game, Daisy and her friends were very dirty. They needed to bathe to get clean. So, they splashed and played in the water to wash off the dirt. Daisy felt so happy and clean after her bath. She knew that she and her friends had a great day playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her blue ball. One day, Lily and her mommy went to a big temple. The temple was very beautiful and had many colors.
Lily saw a big statue of a dragon in the temple. She wanted to touch it, but her mommy said, "No, Lily. We can't touch the statue. It's very important."
Later, Lily and her mommy went to a room with many blue plates. Lily wanted to take one, but her mommy said, "No, Lily. We can't take the plates. They belong here."
Finally, they went to a room with a big curtain. Lily wanted to see what was behind it, but her mommy said, "No, Lily. We can't look behind the curtain. It's a secret."
After they left the temple, Lily asked her mommy why they couldn't touch the statue or take the plates or look behind the curtain. Her mommy said, "We have to respect the things inside the temple. They are separate from us. We can look, but we can't touch."
Lily understood and promised to always respect the temple.

Once upon a time, in a modest little house, there lived a girl named Lily and her cat named Match. They were the best of friends and did everything together. One day, Lily and Match were playing in their backyard when they found a big box.
"Match, let's open the box and see what's inside!" said Lily. Match meowed in agreement. Inside the box, they found many colorful balls. They decided to separate the balls by color. Lily picked up the red balls and Match picked up the blue balls.
As they played, a strong wind blew through the yard. It picked up the balls and carried them high into the sky. Lily and Match watched as the balls floated away. "Oh no, our balls are gone!" cried Lily. Match looked sad too.
