"Oops. We are sorry," Lily and Ben said.
They helped Mom and Dad clean up the kitchen and catch the frog. They put the frog in a bowl with some water and some frog food. They said sorry to the frog and promised not to open the jar again. They learned their lesson and decided not to dare each other to do silly things.

Once upon a time, there was a big girl named Lucy. She loved to bake yummy cakes. One day, Lucy made a huge cake. It was so big and pretty!
Lucy had a friend named Tom. Tom liked Lucy a lot. They played and laughed together. One day, Tom asked Lucy to be in a marriage. Lucy said yes, and they were very happy.
They had a big party to celebrate their marriage. All their friends came to play and eat the huge cake Lucy baked. Everyone was happy and had a fun time. And Lucy and Tom lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a little bird named Lucky. Lucky was a happy bird who loved to sing and play with his friends. One day, Lucky was flying high in the sky when he saw a big, scary cat.
The cat wanted to catch Lucky, but Lucky was too fast. The cat jumped and tried to grab him, but Lucky flew higher and higher. The cat was very mad. Lucky used his strong lungs to scream, "Help! Help!" His friends heard him and came to see what was wrong.
Lucky's friends, a squirrel and a rabbit, saw the cat and knew they had to help. The squirrel threw nuts at the cat and the rabbit hopped on the cat's tail. The cat was so surprised, it ran away! Lucky was safe and very thankful for his friends. They all played and laughed together, knowing they were lucky to have each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved chocolate very much. One day, she went to her mom and said, "Mommy, can I have some chocolate please? I want to measure how tasty it is."
Her mom smiled and said, "Sure, Lily. Here's a piece of chocolate. You can measure how tasty it is by taking a small bite and see how it tastes."
Lily took a small bite of the chocolate and closed her eyes. "Mmm, this chocolate is very tasty," she said. "I think I want another piece to measure how tasty it is."
Her mom laughed and said, "Okay, Lily. But remember, you can't eat too much chocolate. It's not good for your tummy."

Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Nutty. Nutty loved to collect nuts and hide them in her tree. She was very clever and always found the best nuts to store.
One day, Nutty was searching for nuts when she saw her friend, Bunny. Bunny was hopping around and looked very happy. "What are you doing, Bunny?" Nutty asked. "I'm trying to find a carrot for my dinner," Bunny replied.
Nutty saw a big nut on the ground and picked it up. "I think this is a special nut," Nutty said. "I guess it will make your carrot taste even better." Bunny was grateful and took the nut to her burrow. Later that night, Bunny ate her carrot and was surprised at how delicious it tasted. She remembered the clever Nutty and thanked her for the special nut.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom loved to play in the big thick forest near his home. One day, Tom went too far into the forest and got lost. He started to panic, not knowing what to do.
Tom found a small chamber inside a big tree. He went inside to hide, hoping someone would come and find him. While he was waiting, a little bird came to the chamber. The bird saw Tom was scared and said, "Don't panic, Tom. I will help you find your way home."
The bird led Tom out of the forest and back to his home. Tom was so happy to be home and thanked the little bird for helping him. From that day on, Tom learned to never go too far into the forest alone. And the moral of the story is to always be careful when exploring new places and to ask for help when you need it.

Once upon a time, there was a big boat. It had a sail that was very tall. The boat was on the water and it moved when the wind blew. 
On the boat, there was a playful dog. He liked to run around and jump. One day, the dog saw a fish in the water. He barked and wagged his tail. 
A man was on the boat too. He saw the dog and said, "What are you barking at?" 
The dog said, "Fish! Fish!" 
The man said, "Oh, you like fish. Do you want to talk to them?" 
The dog barked again and wagged his tail. The man laughed and said, "Okay, let's sail closer to the fish so you can talk to them." 
The boat sailed closer and the dog barked at the fish. They swam away, but the dog was happy he got to talk to them.

Once upon a time, there was an ancient tree. It was very big and tall. Near the tree, there lived a little boy named Tom. He loved to play with his toy mug under the tree.
One day, Tom met a squirrel. The squirrel said, "I want to measure how tall this tree is, but I don't know how." Tom thought for a moment and said, "Let's use my toy mug to measure the tree!"
Tom and the squirrel put the toy mug on the ground, one after another, to measure the tree. They counted each time they moved the mug. They measured and measured until they reached the top of the tree.
When they finished, Tom said, "Wow! The tree is very tall!" The squirrel was happy too. "Thank you for helping me measure the tree," said the squirrel. From that day on, Tom and the squirrel became the best of friends and played under the ancient tree every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go to the store with her mommy and push the cart. One day, they went to the store and the cart was empty. "Mommy, why is the cart empty?" asked Lily. "We need to fill it up with food for dinner," replied her mommy.
As they walked through the store, Lily saw a big bag of candy. "Can we get this, mommy?" she asked. "No, Lily. Candy will spoil your dinner," her mommy said. Lily was sad but understood.
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. They turned around and saw that the cart had tipped over! All of the food had fallen out and was now on the floor. "Oh no!" cried Lily. But then, something unexpected happened. The store manager came over and said, "Don't worry, we will give you all of the food for free!" Lily was so happy and couldn't believe it. They filled up the cart and went home with lots of food for dinner. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to walk with her mommy to the mailbox every day. The mailbox was pink and it made her happy. 
One day, as they were walking, Lily saw a butterfly and she wanted to catch it. She stepped off the path and ran after the butterfly. 
Suddenly, Lily saw something unexpected. There was a little bird stuck in the mailbox! "Mommy, mommy!" she shouted. "There's a birdie in the mailbox!" 
Her mommy came over and looked inside. "Oh no!" she said. "We need to help the birdie." They carefully took the bird out of the mailbox and set it free. Lily was so happy that they could help the little birdie.

The little boy was happy. He was swinging at the park. He swung high and wide, feeling the wind in his hair.
Suddenly, he heard a chamber. It was coming from inside the park. He looked around, but couldn't see where it was coming from.
He spotted a swing near the playground. It was a slow swing, going up and down, up and down.
The little boy jumped off his swing and ran over to take a closer look.
Suddenly, he heard a little voice coming from the slow swing. It said, "Hello? Is anyone there?"
The little boy looked around, confused. He took a deep breath and said, "Hello? Who is it?" 
A little girl with pigtails peeked out from behind the slow swing. She said, "It's me! I've been stuck in this chamber for hours. Can you please help me get out?"
The little boy smiled and said, "Don't worry, I'll get you out!" He quickly got to work and soon the little girl was able to swing and play just like the little boy. 
They both laughed and smiled as they talked and swung, happy to have a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Mop. Mop was very enthusiastic. He loved to run, jump, and play all day long. His favorite thing to do was to bite his toys. Mop had a lot of fun with his friends.
One day, Mop saw a big red ball. He was so excited to play with it. He ran and jumped and tried to bite the ball. But the ball was too big for him. Mop tried very hard, but he could not bite the ball.
Mop was sad. He wanted to bite the big red ball so much. He tried one more time. He jumped very high and bit the ball. But the ball was not a toy. It was a big balloon. The balloon popped and made a loud noise. Mop was scared and ran away. He did not have fun that day.

Once upon a time, there was a very intelligent bunny. He liked to bounce around in the park. One day, he heard an emergency whistle blowing. He stopped bouncing and looked around to see what was happening. 
He saw a little girl who was lost. She had been running in the park, chasing a butterfly, and now she had no idea how to get home. The little bunny hopped over to her and said, "Hi there! Are you okay?"
The little girl was so nervous, she could hardly speak. But the bunny spoke calmly and gently to her, and soon she calmed down. He asked her where she lived, and she told him. The bunny said, "No problem! I will bounce you home. Follow me!"
The bunny and the girl started bouncing all the way home. Before long, they were back in front of the girl's house. The bunny said, "You are all safe now. I am so glad I could help. Have a nice day!"
The little girl waved goodbye to the bunny, thanked him for his help, and ran inside to her mom. The bunny bounced off into the park, happy that he had been able to help in an emergency.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play games with his friends. One day, they decided to play a game where they had to fill a bucket with balls. The one who filled the bucket first would win.
Tim and his friends started the game. They ran and picked up the balls to put them in the bucket. Tim was very fast, and he was close to winning. He had a big score. But then, he tripped and fell. All the balls in his bucket rolled away. Tim felt upset.
His friends saw that Tim was upset and stopped the game. They helped him up and filled his bucket with balls again. Tim smiled, and they all continued to play. In the end, they all had fun, and no one cared about the score.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy and his friends went on a walk in the woods. Timmy's friend, Billy, said "Follow me, I know a shortcut!" Timmy was glad to follow Billy.
As they walked, they found a big squash on the ground. Timmy picked it up and said "Look at this big squash!" Billy said "Let's take it home and make soup!" Timmy was glad to help make soup.
When they got home, Timmy's mom asked "What did you find in the woods?" Timmy said "We found a big squash!" Billy said "We're going to make soup!" Timmy's mom was glad to hear that they found something to cook for dinner.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to collect rocks. He would go outside every day and look for new rocks to add to his collection. One day, while looking for rocks, he saw a big sign. The sign had a picture of a rock on it. Tim was very eager to find out what the sign meant.
Tim asked his mom, "What does the sign say, Mommy?" His mom read the sign and said, "It says there is a rock show today, Tim. People will bring their rock collections to show everyone." Tim was so excited! He wanted to go to the rock show and see all the rocks.
At the rock show, Tim saw a big, shiny rock that he had never seen before. He wanted it for his collection. But then, something unexpected happened. The shiny rock started to move! It wasn't a rock at all. It was a little turtle! Tim laughed and said, "Silly turtle, you're not a rock!" And from that day on, Tim had a new friend to collect rocks with, his turtle buddy.

Lily and Max were twins who liked to play in the kitchen. They saw a big bowl of cake batter on the table. It looked yummy and fun.
"Let's stir the batter!" Lily said. "Maybe we can make a cake!"
Max nodded. He grabbed a big spoon and Lily grabbed a fork. They climbed on the chairs and started to stir the batter. They stirred and stirred and stirred.
But they stirred too hard and too fast. The batter splashed out of the bowl and onto the table, the chairs, the floor, and their clothes. It was a big mess.
"Oh no!" Lily said. "We are in trouble!"
Just then, Mom came into the kitchen. She saw the mess and was very frustrated. She was not happy at all.
"What did you do?" Mom asked. "Why did you stir the batter so much?"
"We wanted to make a cake!" Max said.
"But you didn't ask me first!" Mom said. "You made a big mess and wasted the batter. Now we can't make a cake at all!"
Lily and Max felt sorry. They knew they did something bad. They wanted to make Mom happy again.
"We are sorry, Mom!" Lily said. "We won't stir the batter again without asking you!"
"We will help you clean up the mess!" Max said.
Mom sighed. She was still frustrated, but she also loved her twins. She gave them a hug and a kiss.
"Thank you, Lily and Max," Mom said. "I appreciate your help. But next time, please ask me before you play with the batter. Stirring is fun, but it can also make trouble. Do you understand?"
Lily and Max nodded. They learned their lesson. They helped Mom clean up the mess and then they played with their toys. They decided to wait for Mom to make a cake with them another day.

Once upon a time, there was a big sun. The sun was very hot. It could melt things. There was also a laser. The laser was a toy. It was easy to use.
One day, a boy named Tom found the laser. He played with it outside. Tom pointed the laser at the sun. He thought the sun would melt the laser because it was so hot. But then, something unexpected happened.
Instead of the sun melting the laser, the laser made the sun cold! The sun was not hot anymore. Everyone was surprised. They had never seen a cold sun before. Tom learned that the laser was not just a toy, but a magic tool. He promised to be careful with it from now on.

Molly was feeling so happy. She was playing in the garden, running and hopping on the grass. Suddenly, she saw something brown flying across the sky. She rushed over and saw it was a butterfly. It was so beautiful and Molly wanted to catch it. 
She ran after it, but it flew faster than she could run. Molly wanted to catch it so much and she kept on trying. Finally, after a while, she managed to catch the tip of its wing with her finger. 
The butterfly sat on Molly's finger and Molly said to it, "You are so pretty. Will you come and visit me tomorrow?" The butterfly fluttered its wings and flew away. 
Molly watched it fly away until it disappeared. She was so happy that she had caught the butterfly and that it had agreed to come visit her again.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max had a small body and was very persistent. Every day, Max would remind his owner, Lisa, to feed him by barking and wagging his tail.
One day, Max and Lisa went to the park. Max saw a big ball and wanted to play. He barked at the ball and said, "Woof, woof!" Lisa laughed and said, "Okay, Max, let's play with the ball!" They played for a long time and had a lot of fun.
As the sun went down, Max started to feel tired. He reminded Lisa it was time to go home by pulling on her leg. Lisa smiled and said, "You're right, Max. Let's go home." They walked back home, happy and tired from their fun day at the park.

Ben and Lily liked to play with their toy cars. They had many cars of different colors and sizes. They made roads and bridges with blocks and books. They pretended to drive their cars to different places.
One day, they decided to drive to a village. They put some of their cars in a big box and carried it to the backyard. They found a spot under a tree where they could make their village. They used sticks, stones, leaves and flowers to build houses, shops, a school and a park. They put some of their cars in the village and some outside.
"Look, Lily, this is our village!" Ben said. "We can drive our cars here and have fun!"
"Yes, Ben, this is a nice village!" Lily said. "It is calm and pretty. We can visit our friends and play games!"
They drove their cars around the village, making sounds and stories. They stopped at the bakery to buy bread, at the library to borrow books, at the playground to slide and swing, and at the pond to feed the ducks. They had a lot of fun in their village.
They played until their mom called them for lunch. They put their cars back in the box and said goodbye to their village.
"Can we play here again tomorrow, Ben?" Lily asked.
"Of course, Lily!" Ben said. "This is our village, and we can drive here anytime we want!"

One day, a messy dog named Spot went outside to play. Spot loved to roll in the mud and get dirty. His fur was always messy and dirty. He saw a bottle of shampoo and wanted to examine it. So, Spot went closer to look at it.
Spot's friend, a little girl named Lily, saw him looking at the shampoo. She said, "Spot, you are so messy! Let's use this shampoo to clean you up!" Spot wagged his tail and barked happily. He wanted to be clean.
Lily and Spot went to the big tub of water. Lily poured the shampoo on Spot and started to scrub his messy fur. The bubbles were big and white. Spot wagged his tail and splashed in the water. After they finished, Spot was clean and shiny. He barked, "Thank you, Lily!" They both laughed and played together, happy that Spot was no longer messy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and stuffed animals. One day, she found an old necklace in her toy box. It was very dirty and dull. 
Lily wanted to make the necklace shiny and pretty again. So, she asked her mom for a cloth and some polish. She rubbed the necklace with the cloth and the polish until it sparkled like new. 
The next day, Lily had an exam at school. She was nervous because she wanted to do well. But her mom told her not to worry because she had studied hard and was safe in her knowledge. Lily felt better and went to school with confidence. She did great on her exam and was very happy.

Ben liked to eat potatoes. He liked them mashed, fried, baked, or boiled. He liked them with butter, cheese, ketchup, or gravy. He liked them for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. He liked them so much that he sometimes pretended to be a potato. He would curl up on the couch, cover himself with a blanket, and say "I'm a potato, I'm a potato".
One day, Ben's mom took him to the park. She packed some sandwiches and some potatoes for their picnic. Ben was happy. He ran around the playground, slid down the slide, and swung on the swings. He saw some other kids playing tag. He wanted to join them. He ran up to them and said "Hi, I'm Ben. Can I play with you?"
The other kids looked at him. They saw his brown shirt, his brown pants, and his brown shoes. They saw his round face, his round nose, and his round eyes. They thought he looked like a potato. They laughed and said "No, you can't play with us. You're a potato, you're a potato".
Ben felt sad. He felt embarrassed. He didn't want to be a potato. He wanted to be a boy. He wanted to have friends. He ran back to his mom and cried. His mom hugged him and said "Don't listen to them, Ben. You're not a potato. You're a wonderful, smart, kind boy. And you're very unusual. You have a special gift. You can make anything you want with your imagination. You can be a potato, or a superhero, or a dinosaur, or anything you like. And that's amazing".
Ben smiled. He felt better. He realized his mom was right. He was unusual, but in a good way. He liked to be a potato, but he also liked to be other things. He liked to have fun with his imagination. He said "Thank you, mom. I love you. And I love potatoes". He ate his sandwich and his potato. He felt happy. He saw a girl sitting on a bench. She had a red hat, a red dress, and a red balloon. She looked lonely. He decided to share his potato with her. He walked up to her and said "Hi, I'm Ben. Do you like potatoes?"

Once upon a time, there was a small ant. The ant worked very hard every day to gather food for the winter. One day, the ant met a snail who was walking slowly.
"Hello, snail!" said the ant. "Why are you walking so slowly?"
"I am just a slow walker," replied the snail.
The ant continued to work hard, and soon winter came. The ant had enough food to survive, but the snail did not. The ant remembered the snail and decided to share some of its food.
"Here, snail," said the ant. "Take some of my food. You can't walk fast, but you still need to eat."
The snail was grateful and thanked the ant. From that day on, the ant and the snail became friends. The moral of the story is that even small acts of kindness can make a big difference in someone's life.

Once upon a time, there was a snake named Sam. Sam was a dependable snake. He liked to help others. One day, Sam met a bird named Betty. Betty was sad. She lost her food.
"Betty, I will provide you food," said Sam. "I am a dependable snake, and I want to help you." Betty was happy. She thanked Sam. Sam and Betty went to find food together.
Sam and Betty found some yummy worms. They shared the worms. Betty was not sad anymore. She had a new dependable friend, Sam the snake. They played together every day. And they lived happily ever after.

The little girl was so excited! Today she was getting a new wheel for her toy car. She was travelling with her parents to the shop. When they arrived, she ran inside and saw lots of wheels. She looked around until she found one that was just perfect - it was cheap, with colourful shapes all around it. She decided to take it home.
The little girl was so happy that she ran out to the car with the wheel in her hand. She couldn’t wait to show it to her friends.
But when she arrived home, the little girl was surprised to find out that her wheel was the wrong one! It was not the one she wanted. She was so sad.
Her parents hugged her and told her not to worry. They took her back to the shop to return the wheel, and this time they got the right one. The little girl was so excited when they took it home! She couldn’t wait to show it to her friends.

Once upon a time, there was a shy bird named Tim. Tim was scared to fly high in the sky. He would watch the other birds soar up and down, but he stayed close to the earth.
One day, Tim met a kind bird named Sue. Sue asked Tim, "Why don't you fly with us?" Tim said, "I am too shy to fly high. I am scared." Sue smiled and said, "Don't worry, I will help you."
Sue showed Tim how to flap his wings and soar high in the sky. Tim was scared at first, but soon he was flying up and down, just like the other birds. Tim was happy and thanked Sue for her help. Now, Tim was no longer a shy bird, and he loved to soar high above the earth with his new friend Sue.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and her teddy bear. One day, Lily's uncle came to visit her. He was a tall man with a big smile.
"Hello, Lily! How are you?" asked her uncle.
"I'm good, thank you," replied Lily.
Her uncle looked at her with a mild surprise. "You can talk so well now!" he said.
Lily smiled proudly. "Yes, I can talk very well now," she said.
Suddenly, Lily's teddy bear started to move on its own! Lily couldn't believe her eyes. "Look, Uncle! My teddy bear is moving by itself!" she said.
Her uncle looked at the teddy bear and smiled. "I believe you, Lily. Sometimes, toys can do unexpected things," he said.
From that day on, Lily loved to play with her teddy bear even more, because she knew it was special. And whenever her uncle came to visit, she would tell him all about the fun adventures she had with her magical teddy bear.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the festival with her family. There were lots of bright lights, yummy food, and happy music. Lily loved to dance and sing along.
One day, while walking around the festival, Lily saw a cute little puppy. She ran over to pet the puppy, but her mommy reminded her to pause and ask the owner first. The owner said it was okay, and Lily pet the puppy gently. The puppy was harmless and wagged its tail happily.
As the night went on, Lily got tired and her family decided it was time to go home. She said goodbye to the puppy and went to bed with happy memories of the festival in her mind.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful bird. The bird liked to play with his friends. They liked to fly high and sing songs.
One day, the bird saw a wrap. The wrap was on a tree. The bird thought it would be fun to play with the wrap. So, the bird took the wrap and put it on.
But then, something unexpected happened. The sun was very hot, and the wrap started to feel warm. The bird did not like it. The wrap got hotter and hotter. It felt like it was going to burn!
The bird was scared. He thought the wrap would burn him. But then, his friend the wind came and blew the wrap off. The bird was safe and happy. He learned that some things are not good to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, but she always wanted more. One day, her mom gave her a package. Lily was so excited to see what was inside.
When she opened the package, she saw a modest toy. It wasn't big or fancy, but Lily was still happy. Her mom told her that sometimes the best things come in small packages.
Lily played with her new toy for hours. She realized that it was more fun to have a few good toys than a lot of toys that weren't as good. The moral of the story is that sometimes the best things include the simplest things.

One day, a big, scary hippo lived in a pond. He liked to play and splash in the water. All the little animals were scared of the hippo because he was so big and scary.
One little bird flew to the pond and saw the hippo. The bird said, "Mr. Hippo, can you please yield and let us play in the pond too?" The hippo looked at the bird and thought for a moment.
The hippo said, "Okay, I will yield and let you all play with me." So, the little bird and all the other animals came to the pond. They all played and splashed in the water together. The scary hippo was not so scary anymore. They all became friends and had fun at the pond.

Lily and Ben were twins who loved to swim. They went to the pool with their mom every week. They had fun splashing, diving and racing each other. They also liked to play with the toys in the water, like balls, rings and cones.
One day, they saw a new toy in the pool. It was a big cone that looked very old and had strange marks on it. Lily and Ben were curious and wanted to touch it. They swam towards it, but their mom stopped them.
"Wait, children, don't touch that cone. It is ancient and belongs to the museum. They are going to take it away soon. It is very rare and valuable. You might break it or hurt yourself," their mom said.
"But mom, we just want to see it. It looks so cool and different. Please, can we touch it for a little bit?" Lily and Ben begged.
"No, children, you have to respect the cone and leave it alone. It is not a toy. It is a piece of history. You can look at it from a distance, but don't go near it. There are many other toys you can play with in the pool," their mom said.
Lily and Ben were disappointed, but they listened to their mom. They realized that the cone was not for them, and that they should be careful with things that are ancient and precious. They swam away and found another cone that was colorful and soft. They played with it and had fun. They learned to appreciate what they had and to respect what they didn't.

One day, a little girl named Lily was playing in her room. She wore her favorite bathrobe, which was soft and warm. Her mom called her from downstairs, "Lily, put on your shoes! We're going to the store!" Lily felt silly in her bathrobe, but she didn't want to change.
At the store, Lily saw her friend, Tim. Tim laughed when he saw Lily in her bathrobe. "Why are you wearing that silly bathrobe?" he asked. Lily felt a little sad, but she knew her bathrobe was special. "It's my favorite, and it supports me when I'm cold," she said.
Later, it started to rain outside. Tim was cold and wet, but Lily was warm and dry in her bathrobe. Tim realized that Lily's bathrobe was not so silly after all. "You were right, Lily," Tim said. "Your bathrobe is great. I wish I had one too."

Once upon a time, there was a blue bird named Bluey. Bluey loved to fly high in the sky and sing songs. One day, Bluey saw a beautiful queen walking in the garden. Bluey wanted to say hello to the queen, so he flew down to her.
"Hello, queen! I am Bluey. What is your name?" asked Bluey.
"My name is Queenie. Nice to meet you, Bluey," replied the queen.
Suddenly, a big gust of wind came and blew Queenie's crown away. Bluey quickly grabbed the crown with his beak and gave it back to Queenie.
"Thank you so much, Bluey! You are very kind," said Queenie.
Bluey felt happy that he could help the queen. From that day on, Bluey and Queenie became good friends and would often sing songs together in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a pale boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy cars. One day, he saw a long cable on the floor. Tim thought it would be fun to race his cars on the cable.
Tim put his cars on the cable and started to play. He didn't know that the cable was very important. His mom saw him playing and said, "Tim, you must stop playing with the cable. It is not a toy." But Tim didn't listen.
Later, Tim's dad came home. He saw the cable on the floor and tripped over it. Tim's dad fell down and his toy cars went flying. Tim felt sad. He remembered his mom telling him to stop playing with the cable. Now, Tim knew that he should always listen to his mom.

One day, a girl named Lily went to play outside. She wore her favorite skirt. It was a sunny day, and she saw a harmless bug. She wanted to show her friend, Tim.
Lily ran to Tim and said, "Look, I found a bug!" But as she ran, she did not see the water on the ground. She slipped and fell. Her skirt got dirty. Lily was sad.
Tim helped Lily stand up. He said, "It's okay, Lily. We can clean your skirt. Next time, be careful when you run." They went inside and cleaned the skirt. Lily learned to be more careful when she played outside. The moral value of the story is to be careful and watch where you are going.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named True. True loved to chew on things. One day, True saw a big red ball in the yard. He wanted to chew on it, so he ran to the ball and started to chew.
A little girl named Sue saw True chewing on her ball. She was sad and said, "No, True! That is my ball!" True felt ashamed. He did not want to make Sue sad. He stopped chewing the ball and looked at Sue.
Just then, a big wind came and blew the ball high into the sky. True and Sue looked up and saw a big bird catch the ball. The bird flew away with the ball. True and Sue were surprised, but they became friends and played together in the yard.

One day, a big aeroplane was flying in the clear sky. It saw a little boy named Tim. Tim was trying to step on a high rock, but he was too small.
The aeroplane saw Tim and said, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim looked up and said, "I want to step on the high rock, but I am too small, and I can't do it."
The aeroplane wanted to help Tim. So, it flew down and said, "Step on my wing, Tim. I will help you." Tim was happy and stepped on the aeroplane's wing. The aeroplane flew up, and Tim was able to step on the high rock.
Now, Tim was very happy. He said, "Thank you, aeroplane, for helping me step on the high rock!" The aeroplane smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tim. I am happy to help you."
From that day on, Tim and the aeroplane became good friends. They played together in the clear sky, and Tim always remembered how the aeroplane helped him step on the high rock.

Once upon a time, there was a monkey who lived in a jungle. The monkey loved to play and swing from tree to tree. One day, while playing, the monkey slipped and fell on a banana peel. The monkey was not hurt, but he felt silly.
Later that day, the monkey found a stick that was very useful. He used it to reach some delicious fruits that were high up in the trees. The monkey was very happy and shared the fruits with his friends. They all thought the stick was very cool.
From then on, the monkey always carried the stick with him when he played in the jungle. He never slipped again and always found new ways to use his useful stick. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy who loved to play with his toys. One day, he was playing with his blocks when his friend Billy came over. Billy had a new toy truck that he wanted to show Timmy.
Timmy was excited to see the new truck. "Wow, that's a cool truck!" he said. "Can I play with it?"
"Sure!" said Billy. "But first, let's add some blocks to make a big ramp for the truck to drive on."
Timmy and Billy worked together to add more blocks to the ramp. They were having so much fun that they didn't notice the dark clouds outside. Suddenly, there was a loud noise and the room shook. Timmy and Billy looked out the window and saw that it was raining really hard. 
They were surprised when they saw that the rain was gray instead of clear. "That's strange," said Timmy. "I've never seen gray rain before."
Just then, they heard a knock on the door. It was Timmy's mom, who told them that the gray rain was actually ash from a nearby volcano that had erupted. Timmy and Billy were amazed and a little scared, but they were happy to be safe inside together.

Once upon a time, there was a big red automobile. It loved to go fast and hurry down the street. The people inside the car were very patient. They always waited for the car to start and never got mad.
One day, the red automobile was in a hurry to go to the park. It went very fast down the street. But, something unexpected happened. A big blue ball bounced in front of the car. The automobile stopped fast so it would not hit the ball.
The people inside the car were surprised. They looked out the window and saw a little dog with the big blue ball. The dog was very happy to see the red automobile. The people got out of the car and played with the dog at the park. The red automobile was not in a hurry anymore. It was happy to wait for the people and the dog to have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a happy sun in the sky. The sun shone brightly every day, making the flowers grow and the birds sing. One day, a foolish cloud came along and covered the sun. The sun was sad because it couldn't spread its warm rays anymore.
The cloud didn't realize that it was making the sun sad, so it stayed there for a long time. But then, a strong wind came and blew the cloud away. The sun was happy again and spread its rays all over the land. The flowers and the birds were happy too.
From that day on, the sun knew that it had to shine every day and not let any foolish clouds get in its way. And the sun continued to spread its warmth and light for everyone to enjoy.

One day, a polite cat named Kitty went to school. She was very happy because it was her first day. When she got to the classroom, she saw a big blackboard. She knew she would learn many new things.
Kitty's teacher, Mr. Owl, said, "Welcome to school, Kitty! Today, we will learn how to write our names on the blackboard." Kitty was excited and listened carefully to Mr. Owl. She knew that learning to write her name would be important later.
At the end of the day, Mr. Owl asked all the students to write their names on the blackboard. Kitty was ready. She walked up to the blackboard and wrote her name just like Mr. Owl had taught her. All her friends clapped for her. Kitty was very proud and knew that being polite and listening to her teacher had helped her learn something new.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly tree. The tree had many roots. The roots were big and strong. One day, a little bird came to the tree. The bird said, "Hello, tree! Can I be your friend?"
The tree was happy to have a new friend. They talked and played every day. One day, the bird said, "Let's celebrate! It's my birthday!" The tree was excited. They invited all their friends to come and have fun.
But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew the bird away! The tree was sad. But the bird was smart. The bird held on to one of the tree's roots and did not fly away. The wind stopped, and the bird was safe. The tree and the bird were so happy. They celebrated the bird's birthday together with all their friends.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big fly. It was very unusual. The fly was big and had many colors. Tim and his mom were very surprised.
"Mom, can we keep the fly?" asked Tim. "It is so pretty and unusual." His mom said, "Okay, but we must be kind to it." So, they took the fly home and gave it food and water.
The next day, the fly grew even bigger! It was now as big as Tim. Tim and his mom were scared. They did not know what to do. Then, the big fly spoke, "Thank you for being kind to me. I am not a real fly. I am a magic friend. Because you were nice to me, I will grant you one wish." Tim and his mom were very happy. They wished for more love and happiness in their home. The unusual fly turned back into a magic friend and stayed with them forever.
The moral of the story is to be kind to all living things, no matter how unusual they may seem.

Once upon a time, a little green bug named Buggy went to the park to play. Buggy loved to eat cherries. He found a big cherry tree in the park. The cherries were red and yummy. Buggy was very happy.
But then, a big bird named Birdy came to the tree. Birdy also liked cherries. Birdy and Buggy both wanted the same cherry. They did not want to share. They were not happy.
Buggy had an idea. He said, "Let's take a nap. When we wake up, we can find more cherries." Birdy agreed. They both took a nap under the cherry tree. When they woke up, they found more cherries to eat. Buggy and Birdy shared the cherries and became good friends.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with crayons and paper. They make pictures of animals and flowers. Lily likes yellow. She makes a picture of a yellow sun and a yellow duck. Ben likes blue. He makes a picture of a blue sky and a blue fish.
"Look at my picture!" Lily says to Ben. "It is very yellow. Do you like it?"
"Yes, I like it. It is very bright and happy." Ben says to Lily. "Look at my picture! It is very blue. Do you like it?"
"Yes, I like it. It is very cool and calm." Lily says to Ben. "But I think your picture needs something more. Can I help you?"
"OK, how can you help me?" Ben asks Lily.
"Maybe you can add some green. Green is good for grass and trees and frogs. Do you have a green crayon?" Lily suggests.
"Yes, I have a green crayon. Here, you can use it." Ben gives Lily the green crayon.
"Thank you. I will help you make your picture more beautiful." Lily takes the green crayon and draws some green things on Ben's picture. She draws some grass under the fish, some trees in the sky, and a frog next to the fish.
"Wow, that looks great! Thank you, Lily. You are a good helper and a good friend." Ben says to Lily.
"You are welcome, Ben. You are a good friend too. I like your picture and you like mine. We are both happy." Lily says to Ben.
They smile and hug. They are proud of their pictures. They show them to their teacher and their parents. Everyone likes their pictures. They say they are very colorful and creative. Lily and Ben are happy. They help each other and have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play with her ball and take long naps in the sun. One day, Fluffy saw a big box with a bow on it. It was a present for her friend, Bunny.
Fluffy wanted to give the present to Bunny right away, but she had to delay. She had to wait for Bunny's birthday party. So, Fluffy hid the present under her bed and went to play with her ball.
The day of Bunny's birthday party came. Fluffy took the present from under her bed and went to the party. Bunny was so happy to see Fluffy and the present. They opened the present together, and inside was a soft, pretty blanket. Bunny and Fluffy played and had fun all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweet. Tweet was very graceful and loved to fly high in the sky. One day, while flying, Tweet saw a sad little bunny. The bunny had lost his calendar and didn't know what day it was.
Tweet wanted to help the bunny, so she flew down and comforted him. She told him that it didn't matter what day it was, as long as he was happy and healthy. The bunny felt much better after talking to Tweet.
From that day on, Tweet and the bunny became good friends. They would play together and comfort each other when they were feeling sad. Tweet learned that it's important to be kind and help others, even if it's just by being there to comfort them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very excited because her grandparents were coming to visit. Lily's parents told her that they would arrive in the evening. 
For dinner, Lily's mom made her favorite food - spaghetti! It was very yummy and she ate it all up. 
When her grandparents arrived, Lily was so happy to see them. She showed them her toys and they played together. Lily's grandparents brought her a modern toy that she had never seen before. It was very cool! 
They spent the whole evening together, laughing and having fun. Lily was sad when it was time for her grandparents to leave, but they promised to come back soon. She went to bed feeling happy and loved.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. He was very eager to become a big helper on his family's ranch. Every day, he would wake up early to help his mom and dad with the animals.
One sunny day, Tom went to the barn to feed the cows. But when he opened the door, he found a big surprise. There were no cows inside! Tom was so scared. He ran to tell his mom and dad about the missing cows.
Mom and dad laughed and told Tom not to worry. They had a secret to share. The cows had become magical cows that could fly! They were flying high in the sky, happy and free. Tom was so excited and couldn't wait to see the flying cows every day at the ranch.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots but he didn't like the spicy ones. One day, Benny was hopping in the forest when he saw a big, orange carrot. He got excited and went to take a bite. But, it was too spicy for him! 
Suddenly, Benny saw his friend, a squirrel named Sam, passing by. Benny asked Sam if he wanted the spicy carrot. Sam said yes and took the carrot from Benny's paws. Sam took a bite and loved it! He said, "This is the best carrot I have ever had!" 
Benny was happy that Sam liked the spicy carrot. From that day on, Benny always looked for spicy carrots to pass to his friends. He was happy to share his love for carrots with everyone. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little red ball. The red ball was round like a circle. It liked to roll around and play with the other toys.
One day, the red ball met a big blue square. The blue square liked to admire the red ball. The blue square said, "You are so round and pretty!" The red ball was very happy to hear this.
The red ball and the blue square became best friends. They played together every day. They rolled and jumped and had so much fun. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a shy cat named Kitty. Kitty lived in a small house with her friend, Doggy. One day, Kitty wanted to play with her toy mouse. But, she could not find it anywhere. Kitty was sad.
Kitty asked Doggy for help. "Can you help me find my toy mouse?" Doggy said, "Sure! Let's look together." They looked all around the house. They looked under the bed and in the closet. They even looked in the kitchen. But, they could not find the toy mouse.
Then, Doggy had an idea. "Let's pass the welcome mat and look outside," he said. So, Kitty and Doggy went outside. They looked in the garden and under the big tree. Finally, they found the toy mouse near the fence. Kitty was so happy, and she thanked Doggy for his help. They played together all day and became even better friends.

Once upon a time, there was a queen who lived in a big castle. She was not a regular queen. She was very kind and liked to help everyone. The queen had many friends who loved her.
One day, the queen went for a walk in the forest. She saw a small bird who was sad. The bird had lost its way and could not find its friends. The queen wanted to help the bird. She picked up the bird and put it on her shoulder.
Together, they walked through the forest, looking for the bird's friends. The queen and the bird found the bird's friends, and they were all very happy. The bird thanked the queen for her help. From that day on, the queen and the bird were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and go on adventures. One day, she found a shiny diamond in her backyard. It was very expensive and she was very happy.
But then, her friend Timmy came over and saw the diamond. He wanted it for himself and they started to argue. They both wanted the diamond and didn't want to share it.
Suddenly, a bird flew down and took the diamond away! Lily and Timmy were both surprised. They realized that they should have worked together and united to keep the diamond safe. From that day on, they promised to share their treasures and be good friends.

One day, a big and strong dog named Max met a smooth cat named Luna. Max liked to run and play, but Luna was quick and quiet. Max wanted to be friends with Luna, so he said, "Let's play together!"
Luna agreed, and they started to play. Max and Luna ran around and had lots of fun. But then, Max saw a big tower made of blocks. Max wanted to destroy it, but Luna wanted to keep it safe. Max said, "I want to knock it down!" Luna said, "No, we should protect it!"
Just then, a little bird flew by and dropped a shiny key on the ground. Max and Luna stopped fighting and looked at the key. They decided to work together to find out what the key opened. They searched and found a little box hidden under a bush. They used the key to open the box and inside they found a treasure! It was filled with shiny stones and pretty things.
Max and Luna were so happy that they found the treasure together. They forgot about the tower and became the best of friends. From that day on, they always played together and protected each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She wanted to go to the park to play on the swings. Her mom said she needed a license to drive her toy car there. So, they went to get a license at the store. 
When they got to the park, Lily saw a boy being rude to his sister. She didn't like that, so she went over to tell him to be nice. Suddenly, a giant bird swooped down and took Lily's toy car away! 
Lily was sad, but then the boy she had helped came over and said he had an extra toy car she could use. They became friends and played together all afternoon. Lily learned that sometimes, unexpected things happen, but they can lead to good things too.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his ball of yarn. He would roll it around and around, and sometimes he would drop it. But he always picked it up again.
One day, Timmy was playing with his yarn when his ignorant cat came into the room. The cat didn't know that yarn was special to Timmy. The cat started to play with the yarn too, and he accidentally pulled it too hard. The ball of yarn fell to the ground and rolled away.
Timmy was very sad. He didn't know where his yarn had gone. He looked and looked, but he couldn't find it. He was so sad that he cried himself to sleep that night. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big cat named Tom. Tom was a very messy cat. He lived in a small house with his friend, a little mouse named Jerry. Tom and Jerry liked to play all day.
One day, Tom and Jerry decided to serve some food to their friends. They made a big mess in the kitchen. The food was all over the floor and it was disgusting. Tom and Jerry did not clean up the mess. They went to sleep on their mattress.
The next day, their friends came over to eat. They saw the disgusting mess in the kitchen. They did not want to eat the food. Tom and Jerry felt sad. They learned that they should always clean up their mess before serving food. From that day on, they promised to keep their house clean and tidy.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tim went to visit a lawyer. The lawyer had a long table in his big room. Tim liked the lawyer because he was nice and friendly.
One day, the lawyer had a big box for Tim. Tim was very happy and excited. He thought it was a gift for him. He wanted to open the box and see what was inside.
But when Tim opened the box, a big frog jumped out. The frog was not nice. It scared Tim and made him cry. The lawyer did not know the frog was in the box. Tim did not like the frog, and he was sad. The visit to the lawyer was not fun anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a sweet tooth and loved to eat candy all day long. One day, her mom said, "Lily, you can't eat candy all the time. It's not good for your teeth."
Lily replied, "But candy is so sweet and yummy. I don't want to quit eating it."
Her mom said, "I understand that candy has a lot of value to you, but it's important to eat healthy food too. How about we make a deal? You can have one piece of candy after you finish your veggies."
Lily thought about it for a minute and then said, "Okay, Mommy. I will eat my veggies first and then have one piece of candy. Thank you for helping me be healthy."

Once upon a time, there was a chubby girl named Lily. She loved to dress up in her pretty clothes. Every day, she would put on her favorite dress and go outside to play.
One sunny day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. They played on the swings and the slide. They were all having lots of fun. Lily was very happy.
But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew Lily's dress away! She tried to catch it, but it flew too high. Lily was sad and her friends were sad too. They all went home and could not play anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big boat on the water. The boat was moving slow, and the people on it were getting bored. Suddenly, they saw a dolphin jumping in the water! The people were so happy and they started to rush to the side of the boat to see the dolphin. 
The dolphin was swimming fast and jumping high! The people on the boat were amazed and they started to cheer. The boat started to go faster, chasing the dolphin. The people felt like they were flying! 
After a while, the dolphin swam away and the boat slowed down again. But the people on the boat were still happy because they had seen something amazing. They talked about the dolphin and how it made them feel. And they knew that even though the boat was slow, they could still have fun and see amazing things. The end.

One day, a little bird was very happy. It was flying in the sky and singing a song. The bird saw a big tree and thought it would be a good place to rest. But there was a problem. A big cat was sitting under the tree. The bird was scared of the cat.
The happy bird had a question. It thought, "How can I sit on the tree without the cat getting me?" The bird flew around and saw a ball. It had an idea. The bird picked up the ball with its beak and dropped it near the cat.
When the ball bounced, the cat was surprised. It jumped up and started to chase the ball. The happy bird quickly flew to the tree and sat on a branch. Now the bird was safe and could rest. The cat was busy playing with the ball and forgot about the bird. The happy bird had outsmarted the cat and was safe in the tree.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved the color pink. She had a pink dress, pink shoes, and a pink hat. One day, Mia went outside to play with her friends.
Mia and her friends wanted to gather flowers. They found many pretty flowers in the park. Mia found a big pink flower. She was very happy. Mia's friends also found nice flowers.
Mia had an idea. She ran inside to get a cup. She put the pink flower in the cup. Her friends put their flowers in the cup too. They had a beautiful cup of flowers. Mia and her friends smiled and played with their flower cup all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little bug. The bug was very dirty. He liked to play in the mud. One day, the bug wanted to enter a big house. The big house had a door that was one inch open. The bug was happy and went in.
Inside the house, there was a little girl. The little girl did not like dirty bugs. She saw the bug and said, "No, no, dirty bug! You cannot be in my house!" The little girl tried to make the bug leave. The bug was sad but did not want to go.
The dirty bug had an idea. He went back outside and jumped in a puddle. The water made the bug clean. Then, the bug went back to the house. The little girl saw the bug again. This time, she said, "You are not dirty now. You can stay in my house." The bug and the little girl became friends and played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little brown dog named Max. Max loved to play in the park and chase after squirrels. One day, Max found a bone buried in the ground. He dug and dug until he finally uncovered the bone. 
Max was so happy with his new treasure that he ran over to his friend, a little girl named Lily. "Look what I found buried in the ground!" Max barked. 
Lily looked at the bone and smiled. "That's so cool, Max! What do you want to do with it?" she asked. 
Max thought for a moment and then said, "Let's go to the opera and show it to everyone!" So, Max and Lily went to the opera and showed off the bone to all of their friends. Everyone was impressed with Max's discovery and they all had a great time together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside with her friends, but one day while they were playing, a big storm came. The wind was blowing really hard and the rain was pouring down. Lily's mommy told her to come inside, but she didn't want to stop playing.
Suddenly, the storm got very serious and the wind knocked over a big tree. Everyone was scared and ran inside. Lily's mommy hugged her and said, "I'm so glad you're safe. Storms can be very dangerous."
Lily was surprised and didn't know that storms could be so scary. From that day on, she always listened to her mommy and stopped playing outside when there was a storm.

Ben and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to slide, swing and run. They saw a big bench with a sign. The sign had a puzzle on it. It said, "Solve this puzzle and win a prize!"
Ben and Lily wanted to win the prize. They looked at the puzzle. It had four pictures: a dog, a cat, a fish and a bird. Under each picture, there was a word. The words were: bark, meow, swim and fly.
Ben and Lily tried to match the words with the pictures. They knew that dogs bark and cats meow. They pointed to the dog and said, "Bark!" They pointed to the cat and said, "Meow!" They were right.
They looked at the fish and the bird. They thought hard. They remembered that fish swim in the water and birds fly in the sky. They pointed to the fish and said, "Swim!" They pointed to the bird and said, "Fly!" They were right again.
They solved the puzzle. They were very happy. They heard a beep. A drawer opened under the bench. Inside the drawer, there were two cupcakes. One was chocolate and one was vanilla. They looked delicious.
Ben and Lily took the cupcakes. They thanked the bench and the sign. They shared the cupcakes. They ate them and smiled. They were very yummy. Ben and Lily had a fun day in the park. They liked to solve puzzles and win prizes.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the shop with her mom. Amy was very tired, but she wanted to help her mom buy food. They walked to the shop and went inside. Amy saw a big, red ball and wanted to play with it. But her mom said, "No, we need to get food first."
Amy was sad and began to cry. She wanted the red ball so much. Her mom said, "If you stop crying, I will buy the ball for you after we get the food." Amy stopped crying and they got the food.
When they were done, Amy's mom went to get the red ball. But the ball was gone! Amy was sad again and wanted to cry. Just then, a nice man who worked at the shop came over with the red ball. He had hidden it so no one else would take it. Amy was so happy and hugged the nice man. She got the red ball and they went home.

Once upon a time, there was a big hippo. The hippo was very original. He had a big sack. The sack was full of toys.
One day, the hippo went to the park with his sack. He wanted to play with the toys. But the sack was too heavy. The hippo was very sad.
In the end, the hippo could not play with the toys. The sack was too heavy for him. The hippo was very sad and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to sing songs all day long. Her favorite song was about a little star that twinkled in the sky. 
One day, Lily's mommy gave her an important job to do. She had to test the cookies they baked to make sure they were yummy. Lily was so happy to help her mommy. She took a big bite of the cookie and smiled. "It's delicious!" she said. 
After they finished testing the cookies, Lily's mommy asked her to sing her favorite song. Lily sang it loud and proud. Her mommy clapped and said, "You have such a beautiful voice!" Lily felt so happy and proud. From that day on, she knew that helping her mommy and singing her favorite song were both very important things to do.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and run around outside. But every night, he would go to his bedroom to sleep.
One night, Timmy's mommy came to tuck him in. "Goodnight Timmy," she said. "Sleep tight."
But Timmy didn't want to go to sleep. "I miss playing," he said.
"I know it's tough," said his mommy. "But you need your rest."
Timmy thought about it for a moment. "Okay mommy," he said. "Goodnight."
And with that, Timmy fell asleep in his cozy bedroom, dreaming of all the fun he would have when he woke up.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play his trumpet every day. He played it loud and proud, but his neighbor, Mrs. Smith, didn't like the noise. She wanted it to be quiet.
One day, Mrs. Smith went to Timmy's house and asked him to stop playing his trumpet so loudly. Timmy didn't understand why she was upset, but he said sorry anyway. He decided to play his trumpet quietly from then on.
But Timmy was sad because he loved playing his trumpet loudly. He didn't know what to do. Then, he had an idea. He went to Mrs. Smith's house and played a quiet song on his trumpet. Mrs. Smith was surprised and thanked Timmy for being so considerate. From then on, Timmy played his trumpet quietly and Mrs. Smith was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big white cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play with cardboard boxes. One day, Fluffy found a very big cardboard box in the yard. It was so big that Fluffy could fit inside it.
Fluffy's friend, a small brown dog named Buddy, came over to play. Buddy saw Fluffy in the big cardboard box and said, "Fluffy, that box is so big! Can I play in it too?" Fluffy smiled and said, "Yes, Buddy! Come in and play with me."
As they played in the cardboard box, Fluffy and Buddy started to weigh it down. The box began to break. "Oh no!" said Buddy. "The box is breaking!" Fluffy laughed and said, "It's okay, Buddy. We can find a new cardboard box to play in." And they did. Fluffy and Buddy found another big cardboard box and played in it all day long.

One day, a big dog named Max was very anxious. He wanted to go to the park and play with his friends. But first, he had to prepare his fun bag. Max's fun bag was wide and had many toys inside. He loved to share his toys with his friends.
Max went to his friend Lily, a small cat. "Lily, are you ready to play at the park?" he asked. "Yes, Max! I am so excited!" she said. They both walked to the park, happy and ready to play.
At the park, Max and Lily played with the wide fun bag. They took out the toys and shared them with their friends. They were not anxious anymore. They had a great time playing and laughing together.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny. It was white and fluffy, and it loved running around in the spring. One day, the bunny was hopping along when it saw a big, green patch of mint in a field.
The bunny was delighted! It hopped over and started to eat the mint. Delicious! The bunny ate and ate until it was so full that its tummy looked like a big, round ball.
When the bunny was finished, it felt so happy and bouncy - it couldn't help but start to jump and spring all over the place. It hopped and skipped around the field, trying to find a place to hide and nap, when it came upon a long, dark tunnel.
The bunny hopped inside and the tunnel went on and on and on. When the bunny finally came out the other end, it was still spring - even though it felt like it had been in the tunnel for so long! 
Relieved, the bunny darted away, skipping and springing through the meadow - back to its home, where it had a big, warm bed to curl up in.
The bunny was never happier. From that day forwards, it went back to the same big, green patch of mint to eat every spring - and sometimes it even hopped through the long, dark tunnel just for fun!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with puzzles. One day, she saw an enormous puzzle at the store. She wanted it so much, but her mommy said no.
Lily went to her room and cried. Her mommy came in and said, "Lily, why are you crying?" Lily said, "I want the enormous puzzle, but you said no."
Mommy said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I can't buy it for you." Lily was sad, but she decided to pick a different puzzle to play with. 
The next day, Lily saw the enormous puzzle at her friend's house. She asked if she could play with it, and her friend said yes. Lily was so happy. But then, she accidentally broke the puzzle into pieces. Her friend was very upset, and Lily felt terrible. 
From that day on, Lily learned that it's not always good to want something so much that you forget to be careful.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a toy, a ball, that she loved to play with. One day, she threw the ball too hard, and it went very far away. Mia could see the ball in a distant place, but she could not reach it.
Mia's dad saw her sad face and wanted to help. He went to the garage and got a big ladder. He called Mia to come outside. "Mia, I have a ladder to help you get your ball back!" he said. Mia was so happy and excited.
Mia and her dad put the ladder near the distant place where the ball was. They climbed up the ladder together. Mia reached out and grabbed her ball. She was so happy to have her favorite toy back. They climbed down the ladder, and Mia hugged her dad. They played with the ball together, laughing and having fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play hide-and-seek. One sunny day, she was playing in her backyard when she saw something shiny peeking out from under a bush. It was a silver key!
Lily picked up the key and wondered what it opened. She searched all around the yard, but couldn't find a lock that fit the key. She decided to keep the key safe in her pocket.
That night, Lily had a brilliant idea. She remembered her mom's jewelry box had a lock, and maybe the silver key would fit! She snuck into her mom's room and tried the key in the lock. It fit perfectly! She opened the box and saw a beautiful necklace with a brilliant diamond. Lily knew she shouldn't take it without asking, so she closed the box and went back to bed.
The next day, Lily asked her mom if she could wear the necklace. Her mom was surprised, but happy to see her daughter so responsible. From that day on, Lily always remembered to ask before taking something that didn't belong to her.

Lily liked to play with her doll, Penny. Penny had long hair, a pink dress and a hat. Lily liked to brush Penny's hair and dress her up. Lily was very kind to Penny.
But Lily's brother, Max, was not kind to Penny. Max liked to take Penny away from Lily and make her do silly things. He liked to call Penny names, like "ugly" and "stupid". He liked to be bossy and tell Penny what to do. Max was very mean to Penny.
One day, Lily had enough of Max's teasing. She decided to stand up for Penny. She said to Max, "Stop it! Penny is my doll, not yours. You can't call her names or be bossy. Penny is pretty and smart and nice. You are being rude and mean. Give Penny back to me, now!"
Max was surprised by Lily's words. He did not expect her to be so brave and angry. He felt a little scared and sorry. He said to Lily, "Okay, okay, I'm sorry. Here is Penny. I won't call her names or be bossy anymore. I was just having fun, but I guess I went too far. Can we still play together?"
Lily looked at Max and saw that he was sincere. She said to Max, "Thank you for saying sorry. I forgive you. Yes, we can still play together, but you have to be nice to Penny and me. And you have to ask before you take Penny. Do you understand?"
Max nodded and said, "I understand. I will be nice and ask. Can I play with Penny for a little while, please?"
Lily smiled and said, "Yes, you can. But be gentle and careful. And don't forget to share."
Max smiled and said, "I won't. Thank you, Lily. You are a good sister. And Penny is a good doll."
Lily hugged Max and said, "You are welcome, Max. You are a good brother. And Penny is happy to have both of us."

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play outside. One day, he saw a small, harmless bug. The bug was green and had wings. Spot wanted to be friends with the bug.
Spot and the bug played all day. They ran, they jumped, and they had fun. Spot's mom called him for a snack. Spot wanted to share the snack with his new friend. They ate yummy treats together.
When it was time to go home, Spot had a surprise for the bug. He gave the bug a big, soft leaf to sleep on. The bug was very happy. Spot and the bug became best friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the light of the sun. One day, she saw her friend Max at the park. She ran up to give him a hug, but Max didn't want to hug her back. Lily felt embarrassed and sad. 
She went to her mom and told her what happened. Mom hugged her tight and said, "Don't worry, Lily. Max is probably just having a bad day." Mom took Lily back to the park and they played together. Max saw how much fun they were having and came over to join them. Lily gave Max a big hug, and this time he hugged her back. They all played together until the sun went down. 
From that day on, Lily knew that hugs and playing with friends always make the light shine brighter in her heart.

Once upon a time, there was an old man. He had a flute that he loved to play. One day, he went for a walk and found a little bird with a broken wing. The old man felt sad for the bird and decided to carry it home. 
When they arrived, the old man played his flute for the bird. The bird loved the music and started to feel better. Every day, the old man would carry the bird outside so it could feel the sun and fresh air. 
As time passed, the bird's wing healed, and it was able to fly away. The old man was happy to see the bird fly high in the sky. He continued to play his flute every day, hoping the bird would hear it and come back to visit.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the world around her and ask lots of questions. One day, she went to the beach with her mommy and daddy. She saw a seal swimming in the water and wanted to get closer to it.
"Mommy, can I go see the seal?" asked Lily.
"I don't know, sweetie. Let's ask Daddy," replied her mommy.
"Daddy, can I go see the seal?" asked Lily.
"Yes, I permit you to go see the seal, but be careful and stay close to us," said Daddy.
Lily was so happy and ran to the water to see the seal up close. She watched it swim and play in the waves. It was the best day ever!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and her dog, Max. One day, Lily went to the bathroom to wash her hands. She turned on the faucet, but the water was coming out very slow. She didn't like it, so she started to quarrel with the faucet. 
Max heard her and came to see what was happening. He saw Lily talking to the faucet and he started to bark. Lily told Max that the faucet was too slow and she didn't like it. Max didn't understand, so he just wagged his tail and licked her face. 
Lily decided to go ask her dad to fix the faucet. She told him that it was too slow and she didn't like it. Her dad smiled and said he would take a look. He fixed the faucet and the water started to come out faster. Lily was happy and thanked her dad. She went back to play with Max, and they were both happy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat hot dogs and burgers that his dad would cook on the grill outside. One day, Timmy wanted to help his dad cook on the grill. He felt excited to help and put on his chef hat.
But when Timmy got outside, he saw a scary spider on the grill! He felt scared and didn't want to go near the grill. His dad saw how scared Timmy was and helped him feel better by showing him that the spider was gone. Timmy felt happy and helped his dad cook the hot dogs and burgers. They were the best ones yet!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to talk to everyone she met. One day, she went to a park and saw a beautiful frame on the ground. It was the prettiest frame she had ever seen. She picked it up and decided to take it home.
On her way home, Lily met a kind lady who asked her where she got the frame. Lily told the lady that she found it in the park. The lady warned Lily that sometimes people leave things in the park on purpose, hoping to trick someone into taking it. But Lily didn't listen and kept the frame.
When Lily got home, she hung the frame on the wall. But as soon as she did, something strange happened. The frame started to shake and rattle, and suddenly a monster jumped out of it! The monster was very scary and Lily didn't know what to do. She wished she had listened to the kind lady at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big yacht. It was a sunny day, and the yacht was in a peaceful sea. The people on the yacht were happy. They were having fun in the sun. They were also drying their wet clothes in the sun.
One day, while the people were playing, they saw a big fish jump out of the water. The fish was very close to the yacht. They all stopped playing and looked at the fish. The fish was very big and very pretty. The people on the yacht were very surprised.
Then, the big fish started to talk! The people on the yacht were even more surprised. The fish said, "Hello, friends! I am a magic fish. I can make your yacht go very fast." The people were excited. They said, "Yes, please, Mr. Fish! Make our yacht go fast!" The magic fish swam around the yacht, and suddenly, the yacht started to go very fast. The people on the yacht laughed and clapped. They had a fun and surprising day with the magic fish.

Lily and Ben liked to play with their toys. They had a big box of toys with dolls, cars, balls and a dragon. The dragon was green and soft and had wings and a tail. Lily and Ben liked to hug the dragon and make it fly.
One day, they were playing with the dragon in the garden. Lily wanted to throw the dragon in the air and catch it. She said to Ben, "Let me throw the dragon. It is fun."
But Ben wanted to keep the dragon. He said, "No, it is my turn. I want to hug the dragon."
They started to pull the dragon from each other. They were angry and loud. They did not share.
Then, a big dog came into the garden. The dog saw the dragon and wanted to play with it too. The dog ran to Lily and Ben and barked. Lily and Ben were scared and let go of the dragon. The dog grabbed the dragon in its mouth and ran away.
Lily and Ben cried. They lost their dragon. They were sad and sorry. They wished they had shared. They learned a lesson. But it was too late. The dog had their dragon. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She walked down the hall of her house and saw a mysterious door. She opened it and stepped inside. She saw a big room with lots of toys. She played and had fun, but then it was time to go. She stepped back into the hall and closed the mysterious door. She couldn't wait to go back and play again!

Tim and Mia are playing with magnets. They have a big magnet and some small magnets. They stick the small magnets to the big magnet and make shapes. They are having fun.
But Sam, the cat, is nosy. He wants to see what they are doing. He jumps on the table and sniffs the magnets. He sees the big magnet and thinks it is a toy. He tries to grab it with his paw.
"Meow!" Sam says. He feels a pull on his paw. The big magnet is stuck to his paw. He tries to shake it off, but it does not work. He is scared.
"Sam, no!" Tim and Mia say. They see Sam with the big magnet. They want to help him. They get off their chairs and follow Sam.
Sam runs away from the table. He runs around the room. He bumps into things. The small magnets fall off the big magnet. They stick to other things. They stick to the lamp, the fridge, the door, and the TV.
"Sam, stop!" Tim and Mia say. They chase Sam. They try to catch him. They want to take the big magnet off his paw.
But Sam is too fast. He runs out of the room. He runs down the hall. He runs to the garden. He sees a car. He thinks it is a hiding place. He runs to the car.
"Sam, wait!" Tim and Mia say. They run after Sam. They see him go to the car. They see the big magnet stick to the car. They hear a loud beep.
"Uh-oh!" Tim and Mia say. They see the car owner. He is angry. He sees Sam and the big magnet. He sees the small magnets on his car. He does not like it.
"Who did this?" he says. He looks at Tim and Mia. They look at Sam. They look at the magnets. They look at the car owner. They are sorry.
"We did," they say. "We are sorry. We were playing with magnets. Sam was nosy. He took the big magnet. We followed him. We did not mean to make trouble."
The car owner sighs. He sees Tim and Mia are sad. He sees Sam is scared. He is not so angry. He likes children and cats.
"It's okay," he says. "I know you did not mean it. But you have to be careful with magnets. They are not toys. They can be dangerous. And you have to watch Sam. He is too nosy. He can get into trouble."
He takes the big magnet off Sam's paw. He takes the small magnets off his car. He gives them back to Tim and Mia. He pets Sam.
"Thank you," Tim and Mia say. They take the magnets. They hug Sam. They are happy.
They go back to their room. They put the magnets away. They play with something else. They are careful. They are not nosy. They do not follow Sam. They do not make trouble. They are good.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends, but one day his mommy told him that he had to wear a mask when he went outside. Timmy didn't like the mask because it made him feel hot and uncomfortable. 
Timmy demanded that he didn't have to wear the mask, but his mommy said it was very important to keep him safe from germs. Timmy didn't understand why germs were bad, but he trusted his mommy. 
So, Timmy put on his mask and went outside to play with his friends. Even though he felt a little uncomfortable, he knew that he was doing the right thing to stay healthy. After a while, he even forgot that he was wearing a mask and had fun playing with his friends. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her pillow, which was soft and fluffy. One day, Lily decided to pretend that her pillow was a fierce dragon. She roared and stomped around the room, pretending to be a brave knight fighting the dragon.
As she played, Lily's mom came in and asked what she was doing. Lily proudly told her that she was fighting a fierce dragon. Her mom smiled and said that Lily was very brave. Lily felt happy and proud, knowing that she was a brave knight.
After a while, Lily got tired and snuggled up with her pillow. It was so cozy and comfortable, she felt like she was floating on a cloud. She closed her eyes and drifted off to sleep, dreaming of all the adventures she would have as a brave knight.

Once upon a time, there was a pale cat named Luna. Luna loved to play with her red ball of thread. One day, the thread got all tangled up. Luna was sad because she could not play with her thread anymore.
Luna's friend, a dog named Max, saw her being sad. Max wanted to help Luna solve her problem. Max was good at solving things. He used his paws to untangle the thread for Luna.
Luna was very happy that Max helped her. Now she could play with her red ball of thread again. Luna and Max played together with the thread all day. They were both very happy and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane who liked to play in the park. When it was time to go home, Jane decided to stay and play. Suddenly, an old man appeared and said in a rude voice, "It is time to go home, young lady!" Jane felt cross and wanted to stay, so she grabbed her favorite whistle and ran away.
Jane ran to a nearby tree and started to climb it. The rude old man shouted, "Come down!" but Jane didn't want to listen. Suddenly, the old man started to climb the tree to try and take the whistle. Jane shouted, "No!" and grabbed the whistle.
The old man was now very mad and said, "That whistle is mine. You stole it!" Jane wanted to keep her whistle and didn't want to give it back. Little did she know, the old man could whistle beautifully, so he decided to give Jane a deal. He said, "If you give me the whistle, I will teach you how to whistle too!"
Jane thought about it and agreed. The old man taught her the secret of whistling and Jane was delighted. The old man said goodbye and left with a smile on his face. Jane enjoyed learning a new skill and from then on she never had to steal whistles again!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved her folder very much. She kept all her drawings safe in her folder. One day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. They had a lot of fun playing in the park.
Then, something unexpected happened. The wind began to rise. The wind blew Sue's folder away! Sue was sad and scared. She didn't want to lose her drawings. Sue's mom and dad told her not to worry. They would help her find the folder.
Sue, her mom, and her dad ran after the folder. It was flying high in the sky. Then, a big bird saw the folder. The bird caught the folder in its beak. Sue thought the bird would take her folder away. But the bird was nice. It saw Sue and her mom and dad running. The bird flew down and gave the folder back to Sue. Sue was so happy! Her drawings were safe again. The wind stopped rising, and they all went home with big smiles on their faces.
