"Lila, Ben, what's going on?" Mom says. She hugs Lila and looks at Ben. She sees that he is having fun, but he is also being rude.
"Mom, Lila is being a baby. She doesn't want to play with me. She only wants to go home. She is boring," Ben says. He stops swinging and jumps off. He crosses his arms and pouts.
"Ben, Lila is not being a baby. She is sick. She needs to rest. She doesn't feel well. You should be nice to her. You should care about her. She is your sister," Mom says. She wipes Lila's tears and nose. She smiles and kisses her cheek.
"Mom, I'm sorry. I didn't know Lila was sick. I thought she was just lazy. I wanted to have fun with her. I love her," Ben says. He feels sorry and ashamed. He walks to the bench and sits next to Lila. He hugs her and says, "Lila, I'm sorry. I love you. Do you want to hear my song?"
Lila looks at Ben and sees that he is sorry. She feels happy and loved. She nods and says, "Yes, Ben, I want to hear your song. I love you too."
Ben sings his song for Lila. It is a silly song about a frog and a fly. Lila laughs and claps. Mom smiles and joins in. They all sing and have fun. Lila feels better. Ben feels better. They are happy. They are twins. They are friends.

One day, a big dog named Max went for a jog. He liked to run very fast. On his jog, he saw a little boy named Tim. Tim was eating a spicy chip. Max wanted to try the spicy chip too.
"Can I have a spicy chip?" Max asked Tim. Tim said, "Okay, but be careful. It's very spicy!" Max took a bite of the spicy chip, and it was very hot in his mouth. He didn't like it.
Max wanted to destroy the spicy chip, so he ran fast and jumped on it. But when he jumped, he knocked over a big bowl of water. The water spilled everywhere, and the spicy chip was gone. Max and Tim looked at each other and laughed. They were happy because the spicy chip was destroyed, and they had fun on their jog.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a charming station. The station was very pretty and colorful. Every day, many people came to the station to ride the big train.
One sunny day, the town had a fun race. All the kids wanted to win. They ran very fast, laughing and playing. Everyone was happy and excited.
At the end of the race, a little boy named Tom won. He was so happy! His friends clapped and cheered for him. After the race, they all went to the charming station to ride the big train. They had a great time, and it was a day they would always remember.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to take baths with her rubber ducky and play with soap bubbles. One day, Lily decided to perform a special trick for her mommy and daddy. She filled up the bathtub with warm water and added some bubbles. Then, she stood on the edge of the tub and jumped in, making a big splash!
After her performance, Lily felt very calm and relaxed. She washed herself with soap and made sure to get behind her ears. She loved the smell of the soap and how it made her skin feel soft. Lily's mommy and daddy were very proud of her for performing such a brave trick and for being so calm and clean afterwards. They gave her a big hug and told her how much they loved her. The end.

Once upon a time, in a distant land, there was a big structure. It was a tall house where a kind family lived. They had a small dog named Tiny. Tiny loved to play and run around the house.
One sunny day, the family decided to bathe Tiny. They filled a tub with water and bubbles. Tiny was very happy and jumped into the tub. He splashed and played in the water.
While Tiny was having his bath, something unexpected happened. A big wind blew through the house and pushed the tub outside! Tiny was surprised but kept playing in the water. The wind carried the tub and Tiny far away from the house. But don't worry, Tiny was safe and soon found his way back home to his loving family.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to write a letter to his friend. He was confused about what to write. He thought and thought, but he could not find the right words. He felt sad and asked his mom for help. His mom told him to think about how his friend makes him feel and write that down.
Tim started to write, but his little sister, Sue, saw him and wanted to play. She made a lot of motion, jumping and running around. Tim got mad and yelled at Sue. Sue cried and ran away. Tim felt bad for yelling at her, but he kept writing his letter.
After he finished the letter, he went to find Sue to say sorry. But Sue was still very sad and did not want to play with Tim anymore. Tim felt bad and knew he should not have yelled at her. The moral of the story is to be kind to others and not let your anger hurt the ones you love.

Once upon a time, there was a big mouse named Tom. Tom was a friendly mouse who lived in a small house. He had a job to deliver cheese to all his mouse friends.
One day, Tom went to the cheese store to pick up the cheese for his friends. But when he got there, he found a disgusting cheese. It was green and smelly. Tom did not want to give this cheese to his friends, but he had no other choice.
Tom put the disgusting cheese in his little cart and started to deliver it to his friends. When his friends saw the cheese, they were surprised. They did not want to eat it either. So, they all decided to go back to the cheese store and ask for a better cheese. The store gave them a new, yummy cheese, and they were all happy. From that day on, Tom always made sure to deliver only the best cheese to his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and always kept them organized on her chair. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. She left her toys at home but told her mom to make sure they were still on her chair when she got back.
When Lily returned home, she saw that her toys were not on her chair. She looked around and couldn't find them anywhere. She started to feel sad and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, her mom came out with a big surprise. She had organized all of Lily's toys into a special box. Lily was so happy and couldn't believe it. She hugged her mom and said, "I accept this surprise! Thank you for organizing my toys!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One sunny day, they decided to have a picnic. They brought sandwiches with jam and juice to drink. It was amazing!
After they ate, they went to play near the pond. Lily saw some ducks swimming and wanted to join them. She jumped into the pond and started to splash around. Suddenly, she felt something slimy on her foot. It was a big fish! She was surprised but also happy to have made a new friend. From that day on, Lily and the fish played together every time she went to the park.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a boy named Tim and his mom. Tim was a serious boy who loved to help his mom. One day, his mom asked him to bring her a big bag that was left in the kitchen.
Tim went to the kitchen and saw the big bag on the table. He picked it up and brought it to his mom. "Here you go, Mom!" Tim said with a big smile. His mom was very happy and thanked him.
Later, Tim's friend, Ben, came over to play. Ben saw the big bag and asked, "What's in the bag, Tim?" Tim replied, "My mom asked me to bring it to her. I don't know what's inside, but it was left in the kitchen." They both were curious and went to ask Tim's mom. She told them it was a surprise for later. Tim and Ben played all day, excited for the surprise that was in the big bag.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys but one day, her favorite toy car broke. She asked her mommy if she could fix it but her mommy said she didn't know how. 
So, Lily went to her daddy and asked him if he could fix it. Her daddy said he wasn't a mechanic but he would try. He took the car and went to his messy toolbox. He looked for the right tool and started to fix the car. 
After a few minutes, Lily's daddy called her and said, "Look, Lily! The car is fixed!" Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, daddy! You're the best!" Lily played with her car all day and made sure to stay away from anything that could break it again.

Once upon a time, there was a human named Tom. Tom had a big box. Inside the box were many things. Tom liked to attach things from the box to his clothes. One day, he found a clear button in the box. He thought it was very pretty.
Tom wanted to show his friend, Sam, the clear button. He attached it to his shirt and went outside. But when Tom walked to Sam's house, something unexpected happened. The clear button on his shirt started to glow.
Tom was surprised. He touched the glowing button, and suddenly, he became invisible! Now, no one could see Tom. He went to Sam's house and knocked on the door. Sam opened the door, but he could not see Tom. Tom laughed and said, "It's me, Tom! The clear button made me invisible!"
Sam was amazed. Together, they played invisible games all day. In the end, Tom took off the clear button and became visible again. He and Sam put the button in the box and decided to keep it as their secret. They knew they would have many more fun days with the magic clear button.

Once upon a time, a little fish named Finny lived in a big pond. Finny loved to swim and play with his friends all day. He had a big smile on his face every time he saw his friends.
One day, while Finny was playing, he saw a big, dangerous fish. The dangerous fish looked very mean. Finny was scared, but he wanted to be brave. So, he swam up to the big fish and said, "Hello, I am Finny. Do you want to be my friend?"
The big, dangerous fish looked at Finny and then, to Finny's surprise, the big fish smiled. "I am not dangerous," said the big fish. "My name is Gilly, and I would love to be your friend." Finny and Gilly became the best of friends and played together every day. From that day on, Finny learned that sometimes, even the most dangerous-looking fish can have a big, friendly smile.

Tom and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. But Tom saw a big thing in the corner. It was red and shiny and had four wheels. He wanted to touch it.
"Look, Lily, a big thing!" he said. "Let's go and see it."
Lily shook her head. "No, Tom, we can't. Mom said to stay away from big things. They are not for us. They are for grown-ups."
But Tom did not listen. He felt an urge to go to the big thing. He ran to it and climbed on it. He felt happy and proud. He pretended to drive it and make noises.
Lily followed him. She was scared. She saw a man coming to the big thing. He looked angry. He had a key in his hand.
"Tom, get down!" she cried. "The man is coming! He will be mad at you!"
But Tom did not hear her. He was too busy playing. He did not see the man until he was right behind him. The man grabbed him and pulled him off the big thing. He yelled at him and scolded him. He said Tom was a bad boy and he could have hurt himself or the big thing.
Tom was scared and sorry. He cried and said he was sorry. He wished he had listened to Lily. He wished he had stayed away from the big thing.
Lily ran to him and hugged him. She said it was okay. She said they should go back to their mom. She said their mom would make them feel better.
They walked back to their mom. They were tired and sad. Their mom saw them and smiled. She said she was glad they were safe. She said she loved them. She said they could have a snack and a nap.
Tom and Lily felt better. They said they loved their mom too. They said they learned their lesson. They said they would never go to big things again. They ate their snack and had their nap. They dreamed of nice things.

Lily and Ben liked to play near the mill. The mill was a big house with a wheel that turned in the water. The mill made flour from wheat. The miller was a kind man who sometimes gave them bread and honey.
One day, Lily and Ben saw a big orange cat near the mill. The cat was hungry and cold. It looked at them with sad eyes. Lily and Ben wanted to help the cat. They asked the miller if they could give the cat some bread and honey.
The miller smiled and said yes. He said the cat could provide a good service for the mill. The cat could catch the mice that ate the wheat and the flour. The miller said he would make a warm bed for the cat in the mill.
Lily and Ben were happy. They gave the cat some bread and honey. The cat purred and licked their hands. They named the cat Millie. Millie followed them to the mill and snuggled in the bed. The miller thanked Lily and Ben for their kindness.
Lily and Ben visited Millie every day. They played with her and brought her more bread and honey. Millie was a good cat. She caught the mice and kept the mill clean. She also provided joy and friendship for Lily, Ben and the miller. They all loved Millie very much.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very happy because her family was going on a big vacation to the beach. The beach was huge and had lots of sand and water to play in.
One day, Lily went into the water and she started to shiver. She was cold! Her mom wrapped her up in a towel and they went to get some hot chocolate. The hot chocolate was warm and made Lily feel better.
After that, Lily played in the sand and built a big castle. She was so happy to be on vacation with her family. Even though she got cold in the water, she knew she could always warm up with some hot chocolate.

Once upon a time, there was a thoughtful little bird. The bird lived in a big tree. One day, the bird went to look for food.
The bird saw a pebble on the ground. The pebble was very sharp. The bird thought it was food. The bird tried to eat the pebble, but it hurt. The bird was sad.
Then, something unexpected happened. The sharp pebble broke into many small pieces. The pieces turned into yummy seeds. The bird was happy and ate the seeds. The thoughtful bird learned that sometimes, good things come from bad things.

Once upon a time, there was a little spider. The spider was very small and liked to play. It would crawl around the house and look for fun things to do.
One day, the spider saw a big person. The person looked at the spider and began to panic. They were scared of the spider, even though it was just a tiny, friendly spider. The person yelled and jumped up and down.
The person was so scared that they stomped on the spider. The spider was now dead. The person felt bad, but it was too late. The little spider could not play anymore.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a big drawer in his room. He opened the drawer and saw many cups and plates. Tim wanted to play with them. So, he took the cups and plates out of the drawer and put them on the floor.
Tim's mom walked into the room and saw the mess. She looked at Tim and asked, "Did you make this mess?" Tim felt guilty because he knew it was wrong. He looked down and said, "Yes, Mom. I'm sorry."
Tim's mom smiled and said, "It's okay. Let's clean up together." They put the cups and plates back in the drawer. Then, Tim's mom showed him how to pour water into a cup. Tim was happy and learned how to pour water. From that day on, Tim always asked for help when he wanted to play with things in the drawer.

Once upon a time, there was a funny little dog named Bobo. Bobo had a weird toy that he loved to play with. It was a big, red bottle. Bobo would push the bottle around the yard and laugh as it rolled and bounced.
One day, while Bobo was playing with his bottle, a small bird flew down to see what was going on. The bird saw the weird bottle and started to laugh too. Bobo and the bird laughed and played with the bottle all day long.
As the sun went down, Bobo and the bird were tired but happy. They had so much fun playing with the weird bottle and laughing together. The bird flew away, and Bobo took his bottle back to his dog house. He knew that he would have more fun days with his weird bottle and new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play with her toys and sing songs. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. She saw some ducks swimming in the water and wanted to go play with them, but her mom said it was too deep.
Lily was sad and bored. She sat on a bench and started to cry. Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't cry, I will comfort you." She gave Lily a bottle of water to drink and they sat together, watching the ducks. Lily felt happy again and said, "I love you, Mom." They went home and had dinner together. The end.

Tommy was walking in the park. He looked around and saw a tall, thin tree. He went over to it and started looking closely at the leaves. On one of the leaves he saw a strange label. He had never seen something like this before. He wanted to know what it was so he ran over to his mom.
"Mom, what is this?" he asked, holding the leaf up.
His mom smiled and looked at the label.
"That is a very special label," she said. "It tells us what type of tree this is."
Tommy was so surprised and excited! He jumped up and down.
"Can I take it home with me and show it to my friends?" he asked eagerly.
His mom nodded and said, "Yes, you can take it home with you. Now let's get going."
Tommy grabbed the thin label and held it tightly in his hand as they started walking. He was so proud of his new discovery. He now knew the answer to his own question!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Emma. Emma had a soft teddy bear named Mr. Bear. She loved to squeeze Mr. Bear when she was happy. They played together every day.
One sunny day, Emma and Mr. Bear were playing outside. They played hide and seek. Mr. Bear hid under a big tree. Emma looked and looked for Mr. Bear. She finally found him under the tree. Emma was so proud that she found him.
Emma gave Mr. Bear a big squeeze. She said, "I love you, Mr. Bear!" Mr. Bear was proud too. They played together all day long. Emma and Mr. Bear were the best of friends.

Once there was a little cub named Sam. He was a furry brown bear with a love for adventure. One day, he journeyed deep into the forest. 
As he was exploring, Sam stumbled upon a big log, which he wanted to balance on! He jumped up and managed to balance on top of it. He tried and failed repeatedly, but he wouldn't give up. 
Suddenly, a fierce wolf – the forest keeper – appeared from the shadows. He said to Sam, "You must learn how to balance before you continue your journey." 
Sam was afraid, but he kept trying until he mastered the art of balancing on the log. When he achieved this, the wolf nodded with approval and said, "Good! That was brave of you to keep on trying. The moral of this story is that if you are brave and don't give up, you can reach your goals!" 
Sam thanked the wolf and happily returned to his cave with this newfound lesson. He has never forgotten the wolf's words and reminds himself of them whenever he is faced with a challenge.

Once upon a time, there was a baby. The baby was very small and cute. The baby's name was Lily. Lily's family loved her very much.
One day, Lily's family decided to celebrate her birthday. They invited all their friends and family to come and have cake and ice cream. Lily was so happy to see everyone.
Lily's grandma said, "Lily, you are such an honest baby. You always tell the truth and never lie." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Grandma!"
Lily's cousin came up to her and said, "Happy birthday, Lily! You are the best infant ever!" Lily giggled and said, "Thank you, cousin!" They all had a great time celebrating Lily's special day.

Lily and Tom were playing with their cars in the living room. They liked to make noises and pretend they were driving fast. Lily had a red car and Tom had a blue car. They were having fun.
But then Tom saw a huge balloon on the table. It was shiny and green and had gas inside. Tom wanted to play with the balloon. He left his car and ran to the table. He grabbed the balloon and smiled.
"Look, Lily, I have a balloon!" he said. "It is big and pretty!"
Lily was not happy. She wanted the balloon too. She left her car and ran to the table. She tried to take the balloon from Tom. But Tom did not want to share. He held the balloon tight and said, "No, it is mine!"
They started to fight over the balloon. They pulled and pushed and shouted. They did not listen to their mom, who told them to stop and be nice. They were very naughty.
Then Lily had a bad idea. She decided to pinch the balloon. She thought that would make Tom let go. She pinched the balloon hard with her fingers. But she did not know what would happen next.
The balloon popped with a loud bang. The gas came out and made a funny sound. The balloon was gone. Tom and Lily were shocked and scared. They dropped the pieces of the balloon and covered their ears. They started to cry.
Their mom came to see what was wrong. She saw the mess and the tears. She was angry and sad. She said, "What did you do? You broke the balloon! It was a gift from your grandma! She wanted you to enjoy it together! You were selfish and mean! You hurt the balloon and each other! You are in big trouble!"
Tom and Lily felt sorry and ashamed. They wished they had shared the balloon and played nicely. They learned a hard lesson. They said, "We are sorry, mom. We are sorry, grandma. We are sorry, balloon. We will not do it again."
The moral of the story is: Do not be greedy and rude. Share and care. Do not pinch things that can pop. You might lose them and make a lot of noise.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the green grass. One day, she found a pretty butterfly and wanted to keep it forever. 
Lily asked her mommy, "Can I keep the butterfly?" 
Her mommy replied, "Sure, but you have to attach it to something so it doesn't fly away." 
Lily thought for a moment and decided to attach the butterfly to her shirt. She was so happy to have the butterfly with her all the time. 
But something unexpected happened! The butterfly wasn't calm and started flapping its wings really fast. Suddenly, it turned into a fairy and flew away, leaving Lily amazed and happy. From that day on, Lily knew that anything was possible in the magical world.

One day, a kind girl named Lily found a pretty bracelet on the ground. It was shiny and had many colors. She wore it on her wrist and went to find her friend Tom.
"Look, Tom!" said Lily, showing her new bracelet. "I found it near the big tree. Isn't it pretty?" Tom liked the bracelet too and wanted to wear it. Lily was kind and let Tom wear the bracelet for a while.
While Tom was playing with the bracelet, a small dog came by. The dog saw the shiny bracelet and wanted to play too. The dog jumped up and tried to bite the bracelet. But Tom was quick and moved his hand away.
"Hey, doggy! Don't bite my bracelet!" Tom said. The dog wagged its tail and stopped trying to bite. Tom and Lily laughed and played with the dog. They all had a fun day together, and Lily shared her pretty bracelet with Tom and the dog.

Once upon a time, a tiger lived in the jungle. The tiger was big and strong, but also graceful when it moved. One day, the tiger saw a small bird and wanted to catch it. The bird was scared and tried to fly away, but the tiger was too fast. 
Just then, a little boy came walking in the jungle. He saw the tiger and the bird and knew he had to do something. He bravely went up to the tiger and said, "Please don't hurt the bird. It's not nice." The tiger looked at the boy and thought for a moment. 
Then, the tiger shut its eyes and took a deep breath. When it opened its eyes again, it saw that the bird had flown away. The tiger realized that it didn't need to hurt others to be strong. From that day on, the tiger and the boy became friends and played together in the jungle.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots and cauliflower. One day, Benny was hopping through the forest when he saw a beautiful flower. He hopped closer to it, but then he saw something unexpected. The flower was actually a trap! Benny's foot got caught and he couldn't move. He tried to stretch his leg, but it hurt too much. Just when Benny thought he would be stuck forever, a kind squirrel came to his rescue. The squirrel chewed through the trap and set Benny free. From that day on, Benny was more careful when he hopped through the forest.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play together. They had many toys, but their favorite was a big puzzle of a farm. They liked to find the pieces with animals and put them in the right place. Sometimes they would pretend to be the animals and make noises.
One evening, their grandma came to visit. She was elderly and kind, and she brought them a gift. It was a new puzzle of a castle. Lily and Ben were very happy and thanked their grandma. They wanted to try the new puzzle right away, but their grandma said they had to finish their dinner first.
After dinner, Lily and Ben ran to their room and opened the puzzle box. They poured out the pieces on the floor and started to look for the edges. But they soon realized that the puzzle was very hard. There were many pieces that looked the same, and they did not know where to put them. They started to argue and blame each other for making mistakes.
Their grandma heard them and came to their room. She saw the mess and the angry faces. She said, "Lily and Ben, why are you fighting? You are twins, you should help each other. This puzzle is too difficult for you to do alone, but if you unite, you can do it together. Let me show you how."
She sat down with them and explained how to sort the pieces by color and shape. She helped them find the corners and the sides. She praised them when they found a match and encouraged them when they got stuck. She told them stories about the castle and the people who lived there. She made them laugh and smile.
Soon, Lily and Ben were working as a team. They forgot their anger and enjoyed the puzzle. They united the pieces and made the castle. They were very proud and happy. They hugged their grandma and thanked her for the gift and the help. They said, "Grandma, you are the best. You taught us how to unite and have fun. We love you." Their grandma smiled and said, "I love you too, my sweet twins. You made my evening."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his toy boat. He would play with it in the sink, filling it with water and pretending it was sailing on the sea.
One day, Timmy's little sister came into the room and wanted to play with the toy boat too. But Timmy didn't want to share his toy, so he cried and said no. His sister got sad and started to cry too.
Timmy realized that it wasn't nice to not share with others and that it made his sister feel dull. So he gave her the toy boat and they played together happily. Timmy learned that sharing is important and that it's better to make others happy than to make them cry.

Davey was on his way to the store. His mommy had given him some money and told him to go buy some ice cream. Davey was a little nervous; he had never been to a building so big and serious looking before. But with a smile on his face, he walked up the steps of the store.
The inside of the store was even bigger and more serious than the outside. There were so many colorful things for sale that Davey could barely take it all in. He was about to ask his mom where the ice cream was when an old man standing nearby said "over there, young man." Davey followed the old man's finger and saw the ice cream refrigerator in the corner of the store.
The old man smiled and said, "Go ahead and get yourself some. I'll be right here waiting."
Davey was so happy, he ran to the refrigerator and chose his favorite flavor. He didn't understand why the old man seemed so happy, but he figured he was just being nice.
When Davey got back to his mom, she was surprised to see the old man. He told her that he'd seen Davey in the store, and had offered him some help because he saw how nervous Davey was. Davey was so excited to tell his mom the story of how the old man helped him find the ice cream. 
Davey learned that day that being serious isn't always

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a crazy toy rabbit named Hoppy. Hoppy had big ears that Tim liked to hold. Tim and Hoppy were best friends. They played together every day.
One sunny day, Tim and Hoppy went to the park. Tim saw a big tree with lots of branches. He thought it would be fun to climb the tree. Tim said to Hoppy, "I will hold your ear, and you can help me climb." Hoppy was happy to help.
Tim held Hoppy's ear and began to climb the tree. He went up and up until he reached a big branch. Tim sat down and looked around. He could see the whole park from up there. Suddenly, Tim heard a meow. He looked around and saw a little cat stuck on a branch. Tim knew he had to help the cat. Holding Hoppy's ear, he carefully moved to the cat and picked it up. Tim and Hoppy saved the cat and climbed down the tree. The cat was so happy, it purred and rubbed against Tim's leg. Tim felt proud, and he knew that holding Hoppy's ear had brought them good luck.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Emma. Emma had a big jug. She loved her jug very much. It was her favorite toy.
One day, Emma was playing with her jug. She was very happy. But, she was also very persistent. She wanted to see how high she could drop her jug without it breaking.
Emma dropped her jug from her hands. It did not break. She was very happy. Then, she dropped her jug from her chair. It still did not break. She was even happier.
Finally, Emma dropped her jug from the top of the stairs. This time, the jug broke. Emma was sad. But, she learned that sometimes it is better to be careful with the things we love.

Once upon a time there was a mom and a baby. They were very excited. They put on their fancy dress and went to the park. When they got there they saw a big face. It was so fancy, it made them both very excited. They liked how it looked and were even more excited to go closer. They jumped and laughed when they saw it. Mom and baby hugged and kissed and had lots of fun together. They stayed until the sun went down. Even then, they were still excited about the fancy face they saw. They went home with big smiles on their faces, and they knew tomorrow would be even more fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, Lily's mommy gave her an old phone to play with. Lily loved the phone so much that she carried it with her everywhere she went.
One day, Lily went to visit her grandma who was deaf. Lily didn't know what "deaf" meant, but she saw that her grandma couldn't hear her when she spoke. So, Lily decided to play a game with her grandma. She would show her grandma pictures on her phone and her grandma would try to guess what they were.
Lily and her grandma played the game for hours and had so much fun together. From that day on, Lily always brought her phone to play with when she went to visit her grandma.

Once upon a time, there was a tall tree. The tall tree had a big idea. It wanted to decide what to do today. The tree thought and thought. Then, it said, "I will make a new friend today."
The tall tree saw a little boy walking by. The tree thought the little boy would be a good friend. The tree bent down and said, "Hello, little boy. Do you want to be my friend?" The little boy looked up and smiled. He said, "Yes, I want to be your friend, tall tree."
But then, something unexpected happened. The tall tree and the little boy heard a loud noise. They saw a big bird coming down from the sky. The big bird was sad. The tall tree and the little boy decided to help the big bird. They all became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to school and playing with her friends. One day, her best friend, Sarah, was sick and couldn't come to school. Lily felt lonely without her friend.
During recess, Lily sat on a bench and looked up at the sun. She saw it glow in the sky and thought about how much she missed Sarah. Suddenly, she heard a voice behind her.
"Hi, Lily! Why are you sitting here all by yourself?" It was her teacher, Mrs. Smith.
"I miss Sarah. She's sick today," Lily said sadly.
"I'm sorry to hear that. But you know what? You can still have fun at school even when your friend is absent. Why don't you play with some other kids?"
Lily thought about it and decided to join a game of tag with some classmates. She had so much fun that she forgot all about feeling lonely. And when she went home, she told her mom all about her day at school.

Tim and Sam are friends. They like to play with trucks in the yard. Tim has a big red truck. Sam has a small blue truck. They make roads and bridges with dirt and rocks.
One day, Tim sees a new truck in the store. It is shiny and clean. It has lights and sounds. Tim wants the new truck. He asks his mom to buy it for him. His mom says no. She says he has enough trucks. Tim is sad and angry.
The next day, Tim goes to Sam's house. He sees Sam playing with his small blue truck. Tim has an idea. He says to Sam, "Hey, Sam, do you want to trade trucks? My big red truck is faster and stronger than your small blue truck. You can have it if you give me your small blue truck."
Sam likes Tim's big red truck. He thinks it is cool. He says, "OK, Tim, let's trade trucks. But only for today. Tomorrow we trade back, OK?"
Tim says, "Sure, sure, only for today." But he is lying. He plans to keep Sam's small blue truck and hide it in his room. He thinks Sam will forget about it.
They trade trucks and play for a while. Then Tim says he has to go home. He takes Sam's small blue truck and runs to his house. He does not say goodbye to Sam.
Sam is confused. He thinks Tim is rude. He looks at Tim's big red truck. He does not like it as much as his small blue truck. He wants his small blue truck back. He runs after Tim.
Tim hears Sam behind him. He looks back and sees Sam chasing him. He is scared. He runs faster. He does not see the banana peel on the sidewalk. He steps on it and slips. He falls down and hurts his knee. He drops Sam's small blue truck. It breaks into pieces.
Sam catches up with Tim. He sees his small blue truck broken. He is sad and angry. He says to Tim, "You are a bad friend, Tim! You lied to me and broke my truck! I don't want to play with you anymore!"
Tim cries. He says he is sorry. He says he will buy Sam a new truck. But Sam does not listen. He takes Tim's big red truck and leaves. He does not want to be friends with Tim anymore.
Tim is alone. He has no truck and no friend. He wishes he did not trade trucks with Sam. He wishes he did not want the new truck in the store. He wishes he was happy with what he had. He learns a hard lesson.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate girl named Lily. She loved to drive her toy car around the house. One day, she saw a pretty flower in the yard. She wanted to give it to her mom.
Lily went outside to pick the flower. She was very happy. But, she forgot to close the door. Her toy car was still inside.
While she was outside, a big wind came. It blew her toy car away. Lily came back inside with the flower for her mom. She looked for her toy car, but it was gone.
Lily was very sad. She gave the flower to her mom, but she missed her toy car. The wind had taken it away, and she could not play with it anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She was very independent and liked to do things on her own. One day, her mom asked her to sort her toys.
Anna had many toys, like dolls, cars, and blocks. She said "yes" and started to sort them. She put the dolls in one pile, the cars in another, and the blocks in a third pile. Anna felt happy that she was doing a good job.
But there was one toy Anna hadn't sorted yet. It was a small, blue ball. She didn't know where to put it. Anna thought for a moment, then she had an idea. She made a new pile for balls. Anna's mom was proud of her independent little girl for sorting all her toys.

Once upon a time, there was a big, comfortable tree. A wise, old bird lived in the tree. The bird liked to teach the little birds how to fly.
One day, a little bird with a crack in his wing came to the old bird. The little bird was sad because he could not fly. The wise bird wanted to help the little bird.
The old bird taught the little bird to fly, even with the crack in his wing. The little bird was very happy. He learned that even if you have a crack, you can still do big things. The wise bird was proud of the little bird.
The other little birds saw the little bird with the crack in his wing fly. They learned to never give up, even when things are hard. They all became friends and lived happily in the big, comfortable tree.
The moral of the story is to always try your best and never give up, even when things are not perfect.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the bright sun. One day, she was playing with her toys when she saw a pirate coming towards her. The pirate had a big hat and a big sword. 
Lily was scared of the pirate and ran to her mom. "Mommy, mommy, there is a pirate outside!" she said. Her mom looked outside and saw the pirate too. "Don't worry, Lily," her mom said. "I will scare the pirate away." 
Her mom went outside and talked to the pirate. "You can't scare me," the pirate said. "I am not scared of anything." But then, he saw how brave Lily's mom was and he got scared. He ran away and Lily was safe again. From that day on, Lily knew that her mom was the bravest person she knew.

Sara liked to fold paper. She learned how to make birds and flowers and stars. She had a big box of paper in many colors. She wanted to make a gift for her mom.
She saw a picture of a wild lion in a book. She liked the lion's mane and tail. She thought her mom would like a paper lion too. She took a yellow paper and tried to fold it like the lion. But it was hard. She could not make the ears or the nose. She got angry and tore the paper.
She tried again with another paper. But she still could not make the lion. She tore the paper again. She did this many times. She made a big mess of paper on the floor. She was sad and frustrated.
She heard her mom coming home. She wanted to hide the mess. She quickly folded all the paper into a big ball. She put the ball in the box and closed the lid. She hoped her mom would not see it.
Her mom came in and hugged her. She said, "I have a surprise for you, Sara. I found a new book for you at the library. It has stories and pictures of wild animals. Do you want to read it with me?"
Sara nodded. She was curious and happy. She opened the book and saw the first page. It was a picture of a lion. But not a yellow lion. A white lion. A rare and independent lion. Sara gasped. She said, "Mom, look! It's a paper lion!"
Her mom smiled. She said, "Yes, it is. How did you know?"
Sara said, "I tried to make one for you. But I could not. I folded all the paper into a ball and hid it in the box. I'm sorry, Mom. I wanted to make you a nice gift."
Her mom hugged her again. She said, "You don't have to be sorry, Sara. You are very creative and independent. You tried something new and difficult. That's a wonderful gift. And you know what? I have another surprise for you. I found some paper that is perfect for making paper lions. Do you want to try again with me?"
Sara nodded. She was excited and grateful. She said, "Yes, Mom. Thank you, Mom. I love you, Mom."
Her mom said, "I love you too, Sara. Let's go and fold some paper lions together."

Once upon a time, there was a lovely flower named Fifi. Fifi lived in a big garden with her flower friends. They all loved the sun and liked to play in the warm light.
One day, the sun was hiding behind the clouds. Fifi and her friends felt sad because they missed the sun. Fifi had an idea. She said, "Let's encourage the sun to come out and play!" All the flowers started to sing and dance to make the sun happy.
As they sang and danced, something unexpected happened. A big butterfly joined them and started to sing and dance too! The butterfly was so happy that it started to flap its wings faster and faster. Suddenly, the clouds went away, and the sun came out to play with Fifi and her friends. The flowers and the butterfly were very happy. They learned that when they work together and encourage each other, they can make good things happen.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved popcorn, especially the kind that his mommy made on the stove. One day, Timmy went to the store with his mommy and saw a big sack of popcorn.
"Mommy, can we get that popcorn?" Timmy asked.
"Sorry, Timmy. That popcorn is fake. It's not real popcorn," his mommy replied.
Timmy was sad, but then he saw a real sack of popcorn on the shelf. "Look, mommy! Real popcorn!" he exclaimed.
His mommy smiled and they bought the real popcorn. When they got home, Timmy's mommy made the popcorn and they snuggled up on the couch to watch a movie. "This is the best popcorn ever," Timmy said with a smile.

Little Bo was outside in the rain with her mom. They had gone to the park together and mom had brought them both umbrellas. Bo's umbrella was pink and she loved it. She kept spinning around and looking at the rain drops as they fell. 
Suddenly, Bo heard a funny noise coming from the bush near her. She blinked and saw a small furry thing poking out. She squealed with excitement and ran over to it. 
"Mom!" Bo giggled, "Look what I found!" 
Mom smiled and peeked out from under her umbrella. She asked, "What is it?" 
"It's a wet bunny!" Bo giggled. The bunny shook its head to shake off the water droplets. Bo smiled and picked it up in her arms. "Can I keep it mom?" 
Mom smiled and nodded, "I think it needs a warm home. Let's get it inside and get it some food." 
Bo was so happy. She had made a new friend!

Anna and Ben like to play games. They have a lot of games in their room. They have cards, puzzles, blocks, and a big board with colors and shapes. They like to take turns and see who can win.
One day, they decide to play with the board. They have to match the colors and shapes on the board with the cards in their hand. Anna has a red circle, a blue square, a yellow star, and a white heart. Ben has a green triangle, a purple oval, a orange diamond, and a white moon.
They start to play. Anna puts her red circle on the board. Ben puts his green triangle on the board. Anna puts her blue square on the board. Ben puts his purple oval on the board. Anna puts her yellow star on the board. Ben puts his orange diamond on the board.
They both have one card left. They both have a white card. They look at the board. There is only one spot left. It is a white spot. It is a heart shape. Anna smiles. She has a white heart. She can win. She puts her white heart on the board.
"Yay! I win!" Anna says. She is happy. She gives Ben a hug. "You did amazing, Ben. You almost win. You are a good player."
Ben smiles. He is not sad. He is proud of Anna. He gives her a hug back. "You did amazing, Anna. You win. You are a good player too."
They are happy. They like to play games. They like to win. They like to be amazing. They like to be friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, she met an old lady sitting on a bench. The lady had a kind face and Lily felt happy to talk to her.
"Hi, what's your name?" asked Lily.
"I'm an angel," said the old lady with a smile.
Lily thought it was funny. "You're not an angel, you're a person!" she joked.
The old lady laughed. "You're right, I'm not really an angel. But I am very old. In fact, I'm ancient!"
Lily was amazed. She had never met anyone who was ancient before. "Wow, that's really cool!" she said.
The old lady and Lily talked for a while longer, and Lily learned a lot from her new friend. She realized that even though the old lady wasn't really an angel, she was still very special. And Lily felt happy to have made a new friend.

Once there was a little boy named Tom. Tom was helpless and all alone. He was lost in a big field of hay. Everywhere Tom looked all he saw was hay and he didn't know what to do. 
Suddenly Tom started to sneeze, the hay was tickling his nose! He sneezed and sneezed until his nose felt better. That's when Tom noticed he wasn't helpless after all. He was surrounded by hay, he could use it to build a house! 
Tom started to make a house of hay and it wasn't long until he finished. He had made a perfect little house for him to live in. From then on he stayed in his house of hay and was never lost or helpless again.

One day, Jack and his mum went to the market to buy some food. 
Jack was very excited to see all the different types of fruit and vegetables there. He was looking at the onions when his mum suddenly shouted at him. 
Jack's mum said: "Jack, stop! Don't touch that onion. It looks bad."
Jack was confused. He asked: "What do you mean, mum?" 
Mum replied: "If you touch it, it will reverse the good feeling you get when you touch it."
Jack still didn't understand. 
Mum explained: "It will make you feel really bad. So, don't touch it."
Jack felt sad. He really wanted to touch the onion, but he didn't want to feel bad either. 
Mum saw how sad he looked, so she said: "It's alright, I'll let you touch it this one time, but only if you promise never to do it again. Okay?" 
Jack nodded. He carefully touched the onion and he felt his mood suddenly change. It felt both strange and bad at the same time.
Jack quickly decided that he wouldn't touch the onion again. He knew it was for the best. 
The two of them continued their shopping, and Jack was happy to know that he had learned an important lesson to never reverse the good feeling he gets when touching something.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to explore the forest. One day, as she was walking, she saw a hidden pond. She got excited and ran towards it. 
When she reached the pond, she saw a frog jumping around. Lily was happy to see the frog and tried to catch it, but the frog was too quick for her. Suddenly, the frog spoke and said, "If you catch me, I will grant you three wishes!" 
Lily was surprised to hear the frog talk and quickly caught it. She made her wishes, and the frog disappeared. Lily was excited to see her wishes come true, and she ran back home to tell her family about her adventure. From that day on, Lily always remembered the hidden pond and the magical frog that made her dreams come true.

Once there was a brave girl called Lucy. She loved to explore. One day she asked her mum if she could go on a special trip.
Mum said: “A trip? That’s a serious decision. Where do you want to go?”
Lucy said: “I want to find a secret place.”
Mum said: “That’s very serious. Are you sure you want to go?”
Lucy said: “Yes, I will be very careful. Please let me go.”
Mum said: “Okay, but you must promise to be back before dark.”
 So Lucy packed her bag and set off on her trip. She walked and walked until she found a secret place. There was a beautiful tree, with a tire swing hanging from it. Lucy climbed onto the swing and smiled. She felt happy and free. She knew she had made a brave serious decision to go on an adventure.

One day, a boy named Tim went to visit a safari with his mom and dad. They saw many incredible animals. There were big lions, tall giraffes, and funny monkeys. Tim was very happy.
Then, Tim saw a little lost monkey. The monkey said, "I can't find my mom. Can you help me?" Tim wanted to help, but he didn't know how. He was scared that the big lions might get the little monkey.
Tim had an idea. He asked the tall giraffes to help. The giraffes used their long necks to look for the monkey's mom. They found her! The little monkey was so happy to be with his mom again.
In the end, Tim and his family had an amazing day at the safari. They went home with a big smile on their faces. Tim learned that even a small boy can do big things to help others.

One day, a thin boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big fountain with water. The water went up and down. Tim liked to watch the water. He was very happy.
Tim had a toy boat. He wanted to sail the boat on the fountain. He put the boat in the water. The boat sailed around and around. Tim clapped and laughed.
Tim played with his boat all day. The sun went down and it was time to go home. Tim took his boat and said bye to the fountain. He couldn't wait to come back and sail his boat again.

Once upon a time there was a troubled girl. She wanted to find a way to be happy, but no matter what she tried, she just couldn't seem to find her way.
One day, she decided to take a walk through the garden. She loved the smell of the grass, the bright colors of the flowers, and the sound of the leaves rustling in the wind.
As she looked around, she noticed a small bird hopping around, looking for food. She decided to question the bird, to see if it could help her find what she was looking for. 
The bird stopped and looked at her. It seemed to be thinking and the girl was hopeful that maybe the bird had the answer. 
Suddenly, the bird said "Follow me!" and flew away.
The girl was excited and followed the bird deep into the garden, her heart pounding with anticipation. Eventually she came to a small pond, with a beautiful glow coming from within. 
The bird told the girl that she could find what she was looking for in the pond. It turns out the pond had a magical healing power, and within it was a way to cure her troubled heart. 
The girl was overjoyed and thanked the bird for helping her understand the power of the garden. She left a happier person, looking forward to a more peaceful life.

One day, a little girl named Mia and her best friend, a cat named Tom, decided to play restaurant. Mia was a flexible girl, she could bend and twist like a noodle. Tom was a very smart cat who loved to pretend.
Mia said, "Tom, you will be the cook and I will be the server!" Tom agreed with a happy "meow!" They set up a table and chairs, and Mia put on her apron. Tom put on a little chef hat.
As they played, a real chef walked by and saw them. He was surprised and said, "Wow, what a fun restaurant!" The chef wanted to join them, so he asked, "Can I play too?" Mia and Tom looked at each other, excited by the unexpected visitor. They said, "Yes, come play with us!"
The chef cooked up some pretend food for Mia to serve. They all had a great time playing together. In the end, Mia and Tom made a new friend, and their restaurant was a big success.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and stuffed animals. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. They were having so much fun until they realized they forgot to bring snacks.
Lily's friend, Sarah, said, "Oh no! We forgot to bring snacks. What are we going to do?"
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I can supply some snacks. I have some crackers and juice in my bag."
Sarah's face lit up and she said, "That's great! Thank you, Lily."
Lily handed out the snacks and everyone was happy again. But then, Lily noticed that her favorite doll was missing. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. She started to feel pale and sad.
Sarah noticed and asked, "What's wrong, Lily?"
Lily replied, "My doll is missing. I can't find it anywhere."
Sarah said, "Don't worry. I'll help you find it. Let's go back to where we were playing and point out all the places we went."
Together, they searched and searched until they finally found the doll hiding behind a bush. Lily was so happy and grateful to have her doll back. She hugged Sarah and said, "Thank you for helping me. You're the best friend ever."

Once upon a time, there was a big red truck. The truck was very strong and could carry lots of things. One day, the truck was driving down the road when it saw a little bird on the ground. The bird was hurt and couldn't fly.
The truck felt compassionate and wanted to help the little bird. It stopped and the driver got out to see if the bird was okay. The driver saw that the bird's wing was broken.
The driver knew he had to protect the little bird, so he carefully picked it up and put it in the back of the truck. He drove the bird to a special place where it could get better. When they arrived, the driver was surprised to see that there were lots of other animals there too! The little bird was happy to be with its new animal friends and the truck was happy to have helped protect the little bird.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear who lived in the forest. He liked to walk around and sniff things with his nosy nose. One day, he found a shiny box and he wanted to see what was inside. He tried to open it, but he couldn't. 
Suddenly, a little girl appeared. She asked the bear what he was doing. The bear said he wanted to see what was inside the box. The little girl said she could help him. She took the box and wrapped it in a pretty paper. 
The bear was happy and thanked the little girl. He took the box and walked away. But when he opened the box, he found out that it was empty! The little girl had played a trick on him. The bear felt sad, but then he realized that it was just a joke and he laughed. From that day on, the bear and the little girl became friends and they had many more adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a honest sausage. The sausage was stuck in a tree, and was too far away for the sausage to get down. But then, one day, a brave rescue man came. He had a ladder and a big net. The rescue man climbed to the top and put the net around the sausage. He carefully lifted it down to the ground. Everyone was so happy that the honest sausage was rescued! The end.

One day, a big cat and a little cat were in the kitchen. The big cat wanted to make a cake. The little cat wanted to help. They found a white bowl and put all the cake stuff in it.
"Let's mix it!" said the big cat. They used a thin stick to mix everything together. The little cat was very happy to help. They mixed and mixed until the cake stuff was ready.
They put the cake in the oven and waited. But when they opened the oven, the cake was not a cake! It was a big, funny hat! The big cat and the little cat were very surprised. They laughed and laughed. Then, they put the hat on and danced around the kitchen.

Miss Brown lived in a cheerful yellow house and had a lovely garden with lots of flowers. Every morning she would sit on her porch and watch the birds in the trees.
One morning, she saw a little bird tapping on the windowsill. "Hello there!" Miss Brown said to the bird. She asked, "What can I do for you?" 
The bird chirped and flew around Miss Brown. She thought for a moment and knew just what to do. She went into her kitchen and came out with a brown nut. She held it out to the bird, who hopped closer and took it gratefully.
Miss Brown smiled, happy that she could help the little bird. "You're welcome," she said.
The bird chirped again and flew off, carrying the nut in its beak. Miss Brown waved goodbye and sat back on the porch to watch the bird fly away.

Once upon a time, there was a little lamb named Wooly. Wooly loved to play in the fields with his friends. One day, Wooly's mommy told him it was getting cold outside and recommended he wear a warm sweater made of wool. Wooly didn't know what wool was, but his mommy showed him the soft and fluffy material that came from sheep. 
Wooly tried on his new wool sweater and found it very useful. It kept him warm and cozy all day long. His friends noticed how warm he was and asked where he got his sweater. Wooly recommended they all get one too. 
So, Wooly and his friends went to the store and picked out their own wool sweaters. They were all so happy and warm, and they played in the fields without feeling cold. From then on, Wooly always remembered how useful wool was and recommended it to all his animal friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Lucy liked to be independent and do things by herself. One day, she saw a lemon tree in the yard. She wanted to pick a lemon all by herself.
Lucy asked her mom if she could pick a lemon. Her mom said, "Yes, but you must promise to be careful." Lucy promised to be careful. She went outside and looked at the lemon tree. She saw a big, yellow lemon hanging on a branch. Lucy reached up and picked the lemon.
Lucy was very happy. She brought the lemon to her mom and said, "Look, I picked a lemon all by myself!" Her mom was proud of her independent little girl. They made lemonade together and drank it on a sunny day. Lucy felt happy and proud that she had kept her promise.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. One day, Timmy was playing in the park and he fell into a big puddle. His clothes got all wet and he felt very cold. Timmy's mommy saw him and she took him home to dry him off. 
When they got home, Timmy's mommy put him in warm clothes and wrapped him in a cozy blanket. She turned on the heater to make the room warm and dry. Timmy felt much better and he was happy again.
Later that day, Timmy's mommy had an emergency at work and she had to leave. Timmy felt frustrated because he wanted to play with his mommy. But his mommy told him that she would be back soon and they would have fun together. Timmy waited patiently and when his mommy came back, they played together and had lots of fun. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to pick flowers in the garden. One day, she saw a big, generous sunflower and decided to pick it for her mommy. 
"Look, mommy! I picked this flower for you!" said Lily.
"Oh, thank you, sweetie! What a lovely present for our holiday," replied mommy.
Lily smiled and felt happy that she could make her mommy smile. She loved picking flowers and giving them to people she loved.

One day, a little caterpillar was playing in the sun. It was very hot, and the caterpillar was thirsty. He saw a big leaf and thought it would be a good place to rest.
The caterpillar did not know that the leaf was dead and could burn easily. When he sat on the leaf, it started to burn. The caterpillar was scared and did not know what to do.
A kind bird saw the caterpillar in trouble. The bird quickly flew down and picked up the caterpillar. The bird moved the caterpillar to a safe, green leaf. The caterpillar was happy and thanked the bird for saving him.

Once upon a time, there was a nice little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy cars. He had a red car, a blue car, and a yellow car. He liked to make them go with a lot of speed.
One day, Tim wanted to pour water on his toy cars to make them clean. He went to the kitchen and filled a cup with water. Then, he went outside to where his cars were.
Tim said, "Now, I will pour water on you and make you clean." He poured the water on the red car, the blue car, and the yellow car. The cars looked very nice and shiny.
Tim's mom saw him and said, "Good job, Tim! Your cars look so nice now." Tim was very happy and played with his clean cars all day long.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Max and Sammy. 
Max said to Sammy, "What can I give you?" 
Sammy smiled and said, "I want a rare ant!" 
Max said, "That's easy!" He found a rare ant, happily handed it over to Sammy and they chuckled mischievously. 
Suddenly, out of nowhere, the ant bit Sammy's finger. Sammy began to down with pain. 
Max had warned him that the ant was rare and that he should be careful, but Sammy had not listened. 
Sammy ran back home, holding his finger in pain. That day, he learned a valuable lesson - that you should always listen to warnings, even when the rewards seem tempting.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was honest and always told the truth. One day, Sue's mom asked her to go to bed early. Sue did not want to go to bed early, but she knew it was important to listen to her mom.
Sue's mom said, "Sue, it's time for bed. You need to sleep so you can grow big and strong!" Sue nodded and went to her bed. She felt sad because she wanted to stay up and play.
In her bed, Sue met a new friend. It was a small, happy bird. The bird said, "Hi Sue! I'm here to encourage you. Going to bed early is good for you. When you wake up, you can play again!" Sue smiled and felt better. She closed her eyes and went to sleep.

One day, a dog named Max wanted to travel far away. He wanted to see new things and meet new friends. Max said bye to his mom and dad and started to walk. The sun was hot, so Max took a nap under a big tree. When he woke up, he saw a cat named Luna.
Luna was not happy. She was hungry and could not find any tasty food. Max wanted to help Luna, so they looked for food together. They found a big red apple on the ground. Luna took a bite and smiled. The apple was very tasty!
But then, something unexpected happened. The apple started to talk! It said, "Thank you for taking a bite! Now I am a magic apple and can grant you one wish." Max and Luna looked at each other and wished to be best friends forever. The magic apple made their wish come true, and Max and Luna traveled back home together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy was very dirty, so his mom said, "Timmy, go wash your hands." Timmy went to the sink and washed his hands with soap and water.
One day, Timmy was playing with matches. He accidentally started a fire in the yard. His mom saw the fire and yelled, "Timmy, that was stupid! You could have gotten hurt!" Timmy felt bad and promised to never play with matches again.
From that day on, Timmy was very careful with fire and always listened to his mom. He made sure to wash his hands every time before eating, so he wouldn't get sick. Timmy learned that it's important to be safe and clean.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play at the park. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. They saw a big slide and Lily wanted to slide down it.
"Mommy, can I slide down the big slide?" Lily asked.
"Of course, but be careful," her mommy said.
Lily climbed up the ladder and slid down the slide. It was so much fun! After she slid down, she saw something shiny on the ground. It was a gold coin! Lily picked it up and showed it to her mommy.
"Look, mommy! I found gold!" Lily said.
"That's so cool, Lily! But remember, don't take things that don't belong to you," her mommy said.
"It's okay, mommy. It was just lying there. It's harmless," Lily said.
Her mommy smiled and they continued to play at the park. It was a fun day for Lily and she couldn't wait to come back and slide down the big slide again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys, but he always wanted more. One day, he saw an expensive toy in the shop. He asked his mom, "Can I have that toy, please?" His mom looked at the toy and said, "No, Tim. That toy is too expensive."
Tim was sad and refused to leave the shop without the toy. His mom had an idea. She took Tim to the park, where they saw a big tree. Under the tree, there was a lot of ash from a fire. Tim's mom said, "Let's play a game. We can use the ash to draw and make our own toys."
Tim thought it was a great idea. He began to draw a big toy car in the ash. His mom helped him and they had a lot of fun. Tim forgot all about the expensive toy in the shop. From that day on, Tim learned that you don't need expensive toys to have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Amy. Amy loved to play with her toys and dig in the dirt. One day, she found a shiny mineral while digging in her backyard.
Amy ran to her mom and said, "Look, Mom! I found a pretty rock!" Her mom smiled and said, "That is a special mineral, Amy. We should clean it and put it in your room."
Amy and her mom cleaned the mineral with soap and water. It sparkled and shined even more. They put it on a shelf in Amy's room, and it made her room look magical.
That night, Amy's dad came home and saw the mineral. He said, "Wow, Amy, you are so clever for finding that beautiful mineral!"
Amy felt proud and happy. She loved her new mineral and knew it would always remind her of how clever she was.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird in a cage. The bird was sad because it could not fly. It wanted to be free and play with its friends outside. The cage door was shut tight, and the bird did not know how to open it.
One day, a kind girl named Lily saw the bird. She felt bad for the bird and wanted to help. Lily said, "Don't worry, bird, I will help you." She tried to open the cage door, but it was not easy. She had to pull very hard. Lily was slow and careful, so she did not hurt the bird.
Finally, the cage door opened. The bird was so happy! It flew out of the cage and said, "Thank you, Lily! You are my friend!" The bird and Lily played together all day. They were very happy, and the bird was never in a cage again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to wander around his backyard and explore. One day, he saw a big black rocket in the sky. It was flying very fast and looked very cool.
Timmy called out to his mom, "Mommy, look at the rocket! It's so big and black!"
His mom came outside and saw the rocket too. "Wow, that's amazing! I wonder where it's going," she said.
Timmy replied, "Maybe it's going to space! I wish I could go on a rocket too and explore like an astronaut." 
His mom smiled and said, "Maybe one day you will, Timmy. But for now, let's just enjoy watching it fly by." And so they sat together and watched the rocket wander across the sky until it disappeared from sight.

Once upon a time, there was a strong bear named Ben. He lived in a big forest with many trees. Ben loved to play with his friends, the small birds and the fast rabbits.
One day, Ben felt pain in his big foot. He did not know what to do. He sat down and said, "Ouch! My foot has pain. I cannot play with my friends now."
A little bird heard Ben and flew to him. The bird said, "Don't worry, Ben. I will help you." The bird found a big leaf and put it on Ben's foot. The pain went away, and Ben felt better.
Ben said, "Thank you, little bird. You are a good friend." They played together all day, and Ben loved his new friend. From that day on, Ben knew that even a small bird could be very strong.

Once upon a time, there was a big red sack. It was so heavy that nobody could lift it. One day, a little girl found the sack and opened it. Inside, she found many toys! She was so happy and comfortable playing with them.
The little girl played with the toys for a whole year. But then, it was time to put them back in the sack. She was sad because she didn't want to say goodbye to her toys. But she knew that they needed to rest in the sack until next year.
The next year came and the little girl opened the sack again. She was excited to play with her toys once more. And so, every year, the little girl would find the sack and play with her toys. It became her favorite thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. While they were playing, Lily saw a pretty flower and wanted to pick it. Her mommy said, "Be careful, Lily. Only pick flowers that are safe to touch."
Lily promised her mommy that she would only pick safe flowers. She looked around and saw a beautiful red rose. She asked her mommy, "Is this flower safe to pick?" Her mommy replied, "Yes, that flower is safe to pick."
Lily picked the red rose and held it close to her nose. She smelled the sweet scent and said, "Thank you, mommy. I promise to always pick safe flowers from now on." Her mommy smiled and said, "You're welcome, Lily. Always remember to keep your promise."

Once upon a time, there was a smooth round rock named Rocky. Rocky lived by a big tree in a small park. Every day, kids would come to the park to play and have fun. Rocky loved to watch the kids play and hoped to join them one day.
One sunny day, a little girl named Emma came to the park. She saw Rocky and picked him up. "Hello, Rocky! Do you want to play with me?" she asked. Rocky was so happy and hoped this would be his chance to have fun with a friend.
But Rocky had a worry. He was afraid that he might not be good at playing games. Emma saw the worry on Rocky's face and said, "Don't worry, Rocky! We can play a simple game of catch." Emma threw Rocky gently in the air and caught him. Rocky felt so happy and had lots of fun playing with Emma. From that day on, Rocky and Emma played together every day, and Rocky's worry went away.

Once upon a time, there was a wise owl. She had a big purse where she kept all her shiny things. One day, she went to the park and saw a little girl spinning around. The owl thought it looked like so much fun, so she joined in and started to spin too. The little girl saw the owl spinning and giggled with delight. From that day on, the owl and the little girl became the best of friends, and they would often spin together in the park while the wise owl kept her purse close by.

One day, a boy named Tim and his mom went to the zoo. Tim was very excited. He saw a lot of animals like lions, bears, and monkeys. He wanted to see them all.
Tim's mom said, "We need to pack our lunch before we go." So, they packed sandwiches, apples, and juice. When they got to the zoo, they found a nice spot under a tree to eat their lunch. Tim was very serious about eating his sandwich, because he wanted to have energy to see all the animals.
After lunch, they walked around the zoo. Tim saw a big elephant and said, "Wow, look at the big elephant!" His mom said, "Yes, it's very big!" They had a fun day at the zoo, and when it was time to go home, Tim was tired but happy.

One day, a funny dog and a funny cat were playing near a little hut. They liked to shout and play games together. The sun was bright and they were very happy.
The dog said to the cat, "Let's play hide and seek!" The cat said, "Okay! I will hide first." The dog closed his eyes and began to count. The cat ran and hid in the little hut.
As the dog finished counting, he started to look for the cat. He looked under a big tree and behind some rocks, but he could not find the cat. Then, he heard a small shout from the little hut. The dog ran to the hut and opened the door.
Inside the hut, the dog found the cat and a big group of funny animals having a party! There were balloons, cake, and games. The cat said, "Surprise! We wanted to make you happy!" The dog was so happy and they all played together at the party. The funny dog and the funny cat had the best day ever with their new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a strong desire to see the stars at night. One day, she asked her mom, "Can we sit outside and look at the night sky?" Her mom replied, "Of course, we can sit outside and see the stars tonight."
That night, they sat outside on a blanket and looked up at the sky. Lily saw a shooting star and exclaimed, "Wow, did you see that shooting star? It was so strong!" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, I saw it too. It was beautiful." They sat outside for a while longer, enjoying the peaceful night and the twinkling stars above them.
As they were getting ready to go back inside, Lily said, "I love sitting outside at night and seeing the stars. Can we do it again tomorrow?" Her mom replied, "Sure, we can sit outside every night and look at the stars together." Lily smiled and went to bed, dreaming of the next night when she could sit outside and see the stars again.

Once upon a time, there was a playful puppy named Max. Max loved to run and jump and play with his toys. He lived with his owner, a kind lady named Mrs. Smith. 
One day, Mrs. Smith took Max for a walk in the park. Max was so excited to explore all the new smells and sights. But as they were walking, Max saw a squirrel and ran after it. Mrs. Smith called for Max to come back, but he didn't listen. 
Suddenly, Max saw a car coming towards him. He tried to run back to Mrs. Smith, but it was too late. The car hit Max and he was hurt. Mrs. Smith rushed him to the vet, but the vet said that Max's leg was broken and he couldn't play like he used to. 
But one day, something amazing happened. Max's leg started to reverse and heal! Mrs. Smith was so happy that Max could play again. From then on, Max always listened to his owner and never ran into danger again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play and be lively all day. One day, her mom asked her to clean up her room. But Lily refused and said, "No, I don't want to clean my room."
Her mom was not happy with her, so she said, "If you don't clean your room, you won't be able to find your favorite dress. It's on a hanger somewhere in your messy room."
Lily didn't want to lose her favorite dress, so she decided to clean her room. She picked up all her toys and put them in their places. She hung her dress on a hanger and put it in her closet. When her mom saw her clean room, she said, "Good job, Lily! You're such a good helper." And Lily felt happy that she listened to her mom.

Lily and Tom are playing in the park. They see a big rock. They want to climb on it. They run to the rock and take turns to go up and down. They have fun.
But then they hear a noise. It is a loud bark. It is a big dog. The dog is running to the rock. Lily and Tom are scared. They do not like big dogs. They look for a place to hide.
They see a hole under the rock. It is dark and small. They crawl into the hole. They hope the dog will not find them. They hold each other and wait.
The dog comes to the rock. He smells the hole. He tries to dig with his paws. He makes a lot of dirt. He wants to get Lily and Tom. He barks and growls.
But then he hears a whistle. It is his owner. He calls his name. It is Rex. Rex stops digging. He looks at his owner. He runs to him. He is happy.
Lily and Tom peek out of the hole. They see Rex and his owner. They are leaving the park. They are safe. They sigh with relief. They crawl out of the hole. They are dirty and tired.
They look at each other and laugh. They think Rex is a silly dog. They do not want to play with him. They want to play with their own dog. He is small and friendly. He is Spot. They love Spot.
They go to find Spot. He is waiting for them. He wags his tail. He licks their faces. He is happy. They hug him. They are happy too.
They go home with Spot. They wash their hands and faces. They tell their mom and dad about their adventure. They say they are brave. They say they are smart. They say they are lucky.
They have a snack. They have a nap. They dream of the rock, the hole, and the silly dog. They smile in their sleep. They are happy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a strong wind. It blew through the trees and made the leaves dance. The wind liked to play with the leaves and make them spin around.
One day, the wind saw some little birds who were sad. They had lost their way and could not find their friends. The wind wanted to help them. It had an idea to unite the birds with their friends.
The wind blew and carried the little birds high up in the sky. It took them to their friends who were waiting in a big tree. The birds were happy to be together again. They thanked the strong wind for helping them unite with their friends. From that day on, the birds and the wind became best friends, and they played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a clean cat named Tom. Tom loved to throw a ball. He would throw it all day long. One day, Tom saw a patient dog named Max sitting by a tree. Max was waiting for his friend, a little bird named Tim.
Tom wanted to play with Max, but Max was too patient to play. Tom had an idea. He would throw the ball and hit the tree. Then, Max would want to play with him. So, Tom threw the ball very hard at the tree.
But something unexpected happened. Instead of hitting the tree, the ball hit Tim, the little bird. Tim fell down and Max was very sad. Tom felt bad and said sorry to Max and Tim. Then, they all became friends and played together. From that day on, Tom learned to be patient and careful when playing with others.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was very loyal to his owner, a kind lady named Sarah. Max loved to play with Sarah in the park, chasing after balls and sticks. 
One day, while they were playing, Max felt something itching on his fur. It was a flea! Sarah quickly picked the flea off of Max and they continued playing. 
Later that day, Sarah and Max went for a walk. They came across a big hill and Sarah decided to let Max off his leash. Max ran up the hill and had so much fun! But when it was time to go home, Max didn't want to leave. Sarah had to reverse her steps and call Max to come back down the hill.

Once upon a time, there was a musician named Tom. He loved to play his guitar and sing songs. One day, he decided to have a concert in the park.
As he was setting up, it started to rain. "Oh no!" cried Tom. "I can't play in the rain. My guitar will get wet."
A little girl came up to him and said, "Don't worry, mister. My umbrella is open. You can play under it."
Tom was so happy and started to play his music. The little girl danced and sang along. But then, lightning struck the umbrella and they both got hurt.
The little girl's mother came running over and said, "Why did you play in the rain? It's dangerous!"
Tom felt so bad and said, "I'm sorry. I just wanted to play my music."
From that day on, Tom never played in the rain again.

Once upon a time, there was a strong boy. He wanted to go to the sea. So one day he asked his mum, "Can I go to the sea?" His mum said, "Yes, you can go to the sea."
The boy was very excited! So he went to the beach and saw the sea. It was so big and strong. He was happy and had lots of fun. He collected some seashells and then he splashed in the waves. 
Suddenly, he noticed something far away in the sea. It was a big boat! He was so excited. He shouted to his mum, "Look mum! I can see a big boat!" His mum came to see and said, "Yes, that is a strong boat." 
The boy was very happy to go to the sea and see the strong boat. He said to himself, "I will come back to the sea soon." 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Timmy's mom gave him a pair of sunglasses to wear. Timmy put them on fast and said, "Wow, these are cool!"
Timmy went outside to play and saw his friend Billy. Billy said, "Hey Timmy, what are you wearing on your face?" Timmy said, "They're sunglasses! They help me see better in the sun." Billy said, "Can I try them on?" Timmy said, "Sure, but be careful not to hang them on anything."
Billy put on the sunglasses and said, "Wow, these are great! I can see everything!" But then, Billy accidentally hung the sunglasses on a tree branch and they fell and broke. Timmy was sad, but he said, "It's okay, accidents happen. Let's go play!" And they played together all day long. The end.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the store with her mom. They were looking for candy. There were many different types of candy. Amy liked the red candy best.
"Mom, can I have some red candy, please?" Amy asked. Her mom said yes and helped her pick the candy. They were both very happy.
As they walked home, a little boy came up to them. He was sad because he had no candy. Amy wanted to help him. She gave him some of her red candy. The boy was very happy.
