Then, something unexpected happened. The boy turned into a big, friendly dog! He had been a dog all along, but he just looked like a boy. Amy and her mom laughed and played with the dog. They all went home and shared the candy together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to explore the world around him. One day, he went for a walk in the forest with his mom. They saw many trees and animals, but Timmy wanted to discover something new.
Suddenly, he saw a little bird sitting on a branch. Timmy asked his mom if he could touch the bird, but his mom said no because the bird might fly away. Timmy was sad, but he understood.
As they continued walking, they saw a small stream. Timmy wanted to touch the water, but his mom said it was too cold. Timmy was disappointed, but he was happy to discover the stream.
Finally, they arrived at a modest little cabin. Timmy knocked on the door and an old man answered. The old man was very kind and showed Timmy and his mom around his garden. Timmy was so happy to discover the beautiful flowers and vegetables. He thanked the old man and said, "I had a great day!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and teddy bears. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. There, she saw a little boy playing with a ball.
Lily went up to the boy and asked, "Can I play with you?" The boy looked at her and demanded, "No, this is my ball. Go away!" Lily felt sad and walked away quietly.
She went back to her mommy and asked a question, "Why did that boy not want to play with me?" Her mommy replied, "Some people are not kind, but we should always be kind to others."
Lily felt better and went back to playing with her dolls. But she never forgot how the boy was mean to her. The next day, she went back to the park and saw the boy again. This time, she demanded, "Give me your ball!" The boy refused and pushed her. Lily fell and hurt herself.
She went back to her mommy crying. Her mommy asked what happened and Lily told her everything. Her mommy hugged her and said, "I'm sorry that happened to you. But remember, we should never demand things from others or be mean to them."
Lily learned her lesson and always tried to be kind to others from then on.

Once upon a time, there was a brown person named Jack. Jack was a kind man who liked to help others. One day, Jack went to the park to play. He saw a little girl who was crying. Jack asked, "What's wrong?"
The little girl said, "I lost my teddy bear. Can you help me find it?"
Jack said, "Of course, I'll help you find it. Let's look around the park together."
They searched for the teddy bear but couldn't find it. As they were about to leave, Jack saw a man with a brown coat walking away from them. Jack had a feeling that the man had taken the teddy bear. But he didn't say anything to the little girl.
The next day, Jack saw the little girl again. She was happy because she found her teddy bear. But Jack felt bad because he didn't tell her about the man in the brown coat. He wished he had let her know.

Once upon a time, there was a little otter who loved to play in the river. One day, he saw a big sack floating in the water. He swam over to it and climbed on top. "What's inside?" he wondered.
Suddenly, a friendly voice called out, "Hello there, little otter! What are you doing on my sack?" It was a kind old man who had been fishing nearby.
"I was just curious," said the otter. "What's in the sack?"
"It's full of sweet treats," replied the man. "I'm taking them to my grandchildren."
The otter's eyes widened. "Can I have one?"
"Of course!" said the man, reaching into the sack and giving the otter a delicious cookie. "But be careful not to eat them all at once!"
The otter happily munched on his sweet treat and waved goodbye to the old man. He couldn't wait to tell his friends about his exciting adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max loved to play with his ball. One day, Max saw a man play golf. Max wanted to play golf too.
Max found a golf ball and a stick. He hit the ball with the stick. The ball went far away. Max was happy to play golf. He played all day long.
At the end of the day, Max was dirty from playing. Max's mom said, "It's time to wash up!" Max went into the bath and washed himself. Max was clean again. He went to bed and dreamed about playing golf.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a squirrel named Tim. Tim loved to find nuts and play with his friends. One day, Tim found a nut that looked different from the others. It was bigger and had a funny shape. Tim was excited and wanted to show his friends.
Tim called all his friends to celebrate his new nut. They played games and had a lot of fun. They took turns trying to open the big nut, but it was too hard for them. Then, a strong bird named Sam came to help. Sam used his beak to crack the nut open.
Inside the nut, they found a sweet and tasty treat. All the animals shared the treat and enjoyed their time together. They were happy to have found a different nut and to celebrate with their friend Tim. From that day on, Tim and his friends always looked for new and different nuts to share with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to dance and twirl around, but she wasn't very good at it. She often stumbled and fell down.
One day, Lily saw a ballerina on TV and thought she was so pretty and graceful. She wanted to become a ballerina too. So, she asked her mom to take her to a dance class.
At first, Lily struggled to keep up with the other girls. She couldn't remember the steps and kept tripping over her own feet. But with practice and determination, Lily started to improve. She worked hard every day and eventually became more graceful.
During a big recital, Lily was nervous but excited to show off her new skills. As she danced across the stage, she suddenly felt a sharp pain in her foot. She had stepped on a pin! Lily didn't let the pain stop her, though. She kept dancing and finished her performance with a big smile on her face.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Jack. Jack loved dessert. One day, Jack went to the bakery to buy a cake. He asked the baker, "Do you have any chocolate cake?" The baker replied, "Yes, we do. Would you like to try a slice?" Jack nodded his head and said, "Yes, please."
After Jack finished his cake, he went back to the bakery and said, "I want to repeat my order from yesterday. I want another slice of chocolate cake." The baker smiled and gave Jack another slice. Jack was very happy and said, "This cake is so delicious. I love dessert!"

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Tiny. Tiny was very independent. He liked to play and run all by himself. One day, Tiny's family had a party. There were many people, food, and games. Tiny was very excited.
At the party, Tiny saw a big cake. He wanted to take a bite. Tiny's mom said, "No, Tiny! That cake is not for you." Tiny was sad, but he still wanted to taste the cake. He thought, "I am an independent dog. I can take a bite when no one is looking."
When everyone was busy, Tiny jumped and took a big bite of the cake. But, oh no! Tiny's mom saw him. She was not happy. "Tiny, I told you not to bite the cake!" she said. Tiny felt bad. He knew he should listen to his mom.
In the end, Tiny learned that being independent is good, but he should also listen to his mom. Tiny said sorry to his mom, and they had a great time at the party.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved wearing her favorite pink socks every day. One day, she lost one of her socks while playing outside. She searched and searched but couldn't find it. 
Lily's mom told her that sometimes things grow and change. Just like flowers grow, people grow too. Lily didn't understand what her mom meant until she realized that her feet had grown bigger and her old socks didn't fit anymore. 
Lily learned that it's okay to let go of things that don't fit anymore. She also learned that it's important to keep track of her belongings so she doesn't lose them. And most importantly, she learned that growing up can be a little cold and scary, but it's a part of life that we all go through.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They played on the swings and slides. Tim loved the park. While playing, Tim saw something on the ground. He discovered a wallet. It was brown and had a lot of cards inside.
Tim showed the wallet to his mom. She said, "We need to find the person who lost this wallet." They looked around the park and saw a man looking sad. Tim thought the man might be the owner of the wallet. The man looked ashamed because he lost his wallet.
Tim and his mom went to the man and showed him the wallet. The man was so happy to see it! He said, "Thank you for finding my wallet!" Tim felt good that he could help the man. From that day on, Tim learned the importance of helping others.

Once upon a time, there was a cricket. The cricket lived in a big, wealthy house. The house had many rooms to play in.
One day, the cricket found a twisty toy. He wanted to play with the twisty toy. He jumped and twisted the toy with his legs. The cricket was very happy.
The cricket played with the twisty toy all day long. He showed the twisty toy to his friends. They all played together. They twisted the toy and laughed. The cricket and his friends were very happy in the big, wealthy house.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little dog named Tiny. Tiny was a brave dog who liked to play all day. One day, Tiny heard a knock on the door. He opened the door and saw a big cat standing there. The cat said, "Hello, can I come in?" Tiny said, "Yes, welcome to my home."
As they played together, the cat started to worry. "What if Tiny doesn't like me?" the cat asked. Tiny saw the worry and said, "Don't worry, I like you. You are my new friend." The cat felt happy and they played some more.
Suddenly, there was a loud noise outside. Tiny and the cat were scared. They looked out the window and saw a big truck. The truck was full of toys! The driver came to the door and said, "I have a surprise for you!" Tiny and the cat were so excited. They got lots of new toys and played all day long.

One day, a figure flew into town. It was graceful and sparkly in the sky. Children stared in amazement. The figure flew around in circles. It dipped and dived with ease. Everyone wanted to fly too, just like the figure!
Soon it was time to go home, but the figure kept flying. People waved goodbye to the figure and shouted encouragement. One little girl wanted to get closer to the figure. She started to run, but the figure was too quick.
Before long, the figure was gone. But everyone had seen how graceful and special it had been. They all knew there was something special about this figure that could fly. They'd never forget that magical day!

Once upon a time, there was a pig who loved to travel. One day, the pig went on a walk to find a dry place. He walked and walked until he saw a big tree.
Under the tree, the pig met a bird. The bird said, "Hi pig! What are you doing?" The pig replied, "I am trying to travel to a dry place. Can you help me?" The bird nodded and said, "Yes, I know a dry place. Follow me!"
So the pig and the bird traveled together. They walked and walked until they found a dry hill. The pig was very happy and said, "Thank you, bird! This is a great dry place!" They played and had fun all day. From that day on, the pig and the bird were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had long, blonde hair and big, blue eyes. She lived in a nice house, with her parents and her pet dog.
One day, the little girl wanted to go outside and play. She asked her parents if she could go. Her parents said it was up to her to decide.
The little girl was full of excitement, so she decided to go out. She grabbed a soft blanket, and a bright flag, and headed out the door.
When she arrived outside, the little girl noticed a big hill. She had never been so brave before, but this time, she was determined. She waved her flag and started running to the top of the hill.
As she reached the hill's peak, the little girl stopped and looked around. She saw a big, beautiful rainbow in the sky. She knew then that her decision to go out and explore was the right one.  She felt so proud of herself and held her flag up high.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a long motorcycle on the street. He was very excited and wanted to ride it. He asked his mom, "Can I ride the motorcycle, please?"
His mom said, "No, Tim. It is not safe for you to ride a motorcycle. You can look at it, but do not touch."
Tim was sad, but he listened to his mom. He looked at the motorcycle from far away. While he was looking at it, he did not see a rock on the ground. Tim stumbled on the rock and fell down.
His mom ran to help him. She hugged him and said, "Be careful, Tim. Always watch where you are going." Tim said sorry to his mom and promised to be more careful. They walked home together, holding hands.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. One day, Timmy's mom took him to the hospital for an operation. Timmy was scared, but he knew he had to be brave. 
The operation was to fix Timmy's broken arm. The doctor told Timmy that he had to complete the operation so his arm could heal. Timmy closed his eyes and took a deep breath. He was very brave, and the operation was over before he knew it. 
After the operation, Timmy had a cast on his arm. He couldn't play outside or explore for a little while, but he knew it was important to let his arm heal. Timmy was proud of himself for being so brave during the operation, and he couldn't wait to go back outside and play again.

Lily and Sam were bored. They wanted to play outside, but it was too cold. The snow was icy and hard. They could not make a snowman or a snow angel. They looked at the television, but there was nothing fun to watch. They only saw people talking and talking.
They decided to play a game. They took some pillows and blankets from their beds. They made a big pile on the floor. They pretended it was a mountain. They took turns to climb the mountain. They had to be careful not to fall. They said, "Step, step, step, I am on top of the mountain!"
They had fun for a while, but then they got tired. They wanted to rest on the mountain. They lay down on the pillows and blankets. They covered themselves with a big blanket. They pretended it was a cave. They said, "We are safe and warm in our cave. We can watch the stars from here."
They looked at the ceiling. They saw some stickers that looked like stars. They imagined they were in the sky. They pointed at the stickers and named them. They said, "That is the moon, that is the sun, that is a star, that is another star."
They felt sleepy. They closed their eyes. They dreamed of flying in the sky. They did not hear their mom calling them for dinner. They did not see their dad turning off the television. They did not feel their dog jumping on the bed. They were happy and cozy in their cave.

Once upon a time, there was a small dog named Spot. Spot was playing in the rain and got very wet. He felt cold and helpless. He ran to his friend, a big cat named Fluffy.
"Fluffy, I am wet and cold. Can you help me get dry?" asked Spot. Fluffy nodded and they went inside the house. Fluffy found a big towel and helped Spot get dry. Spot felt warm and happy again.
One day, Spot saw Fluffy was not feeling well. Fluffy was sick and needed medicine. Spot wanted to help his friend. He brought the medicine to Fluffy. "Here, take this medicine. It will make you feel better," said Spot. Fluffy took the medicine and soon felt better. They played and laughed together, happy to help each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to climb trees, and he climbed higher and higher every day. One day, Timmy saw a big flood coming towards his house. The water was very deep and it scared him.
Timmy climbed up a tall tree to stay safe from the flood. He watched as the water got higher and higher, and he felt very scared. But then, the tree started to shake and Timmy fell into the deep water. He tried to swim, but the water was too strong and he couldn't get back to the tree.
Sadly, Timmy was swept away by the flood and never seen again. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park to play. She saw a lovely butterfly and wanted to catch it. She tried to catch it with her hands, but it was too fast.
Then, she saw her friend Timmy. Timmy had a toy car and a toy truck. Lily asked Timmy, "Can I choose one toy to play with?" Timmy said, "Sure, you can choose the car." 
But then, they got into a fight because Lily wanted to keep the car and Timmy wanted to play with it too. They were yelling and pushing each other. Suddenly, the butterfly flew between them. They stopped fighting and watched the butterfly fly away. Lily said, "That was so pretty. Let's be friends and play together." Timmy said, "Okay, that sounds like a good idea." And they both played with the toy car together.

Lily liked to design things. She had many crayons and papers. She made pictures of flowers, animals, and houses. She was very happy when she showed her designs to her mom and dad.
One day, Lily saw a bald man walking on the street. He had no hair on his head. He looked sad and angry. Lily wanted to make him happy. She had an idea. She took her yellow crayon and ran after the bald man.
She caught up with him and said, "Hello, I want to give you a gift. I can design something for you." She grabbed his head and started to draw on it with her yellow crayon. She made a big smiley face on his bald head.
The bald man was very shocked and mad. He yelled, "What are you doing, you little brat? Get off me! You ruined my head!" He pushed Lily away and ran to find a mirror. He saw the yellow smiley face on his head and felt more sad and angry.
Lily was scared and hurt. She dropped her yellow crayon and cried. She did not understand why the bald man was so mean. She thought she was being nice. She ran back to her mom and dad and hugged them. They tried to comfort her, but she felt very bad. She did not want to design anything anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a small house with a big chimney. Every day, he would play near the chimney and look up at the sky.
One day, Tim saw a small bird stuck in the chimney. The bird was very scared and ashamed. Tim wanted to help the bird. He asked his mom and dad for help. His mom and dad told him that it was not nice to demand things. They said that asking nicely was better.
Tim listened to his mom and dad. He asked them nicely to help the bird. They all worked together to free the bird from the chimney. The bird was very happy and flew away. Tim learned that asking nicely was better than demanding. And everyone lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and teddy bears in her room. One night, Lily saw a ghost in her closet. She was scared but her mommy came to her and said, "Don't worry, there are no ghosts here. You have to resist your fear." 
Lily asked her mommy, "What is a ghost?" Her mommy explained, "A ghost is a unique kind of creature that some people believe in. But they are not real, they are just in our imagination." 
Lily felt better and went back to playing with her dolls. The next day, Lily told her friend Timmy about the ghost she saw. Timmy said, "I don't believe in ghosts, they are not real." Lily said, "My mommy said they are unique creatures but not real. I will resist being scared of them." 
From that day on, Lily was not afraid of ghosts anymore. She knew they were not real and that she could resist her fear.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily and her mom went to the park to play. They saw a big slide and Lily wanted to try it. 
Mom said, "Be careful, Lily. The slide is very quick and you might get hurt." 
Lily said, "I want to use the slide, Mommy!" 
So, Lily climbed up the ladder and slid down the slide. It was so much fun! But when she got to the bottom, she slipped on some icy snow and fell down. 
Mom ran over to help and asked, "Are you okay, Lily?" 
Lily said, "Yes, Mommy. I'm okay. That was fun, but I won't go on the icy slide again." 
From that day on, Lily learned to be careful and always looked out for icy spots.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the park with his friends. One day, Timmy's mommy bought him a magazine with lots of pictures of animals inside. Timmy was so happy and he looked at the magazine every day.
But one day, Timmy forgot where he put his magazine. He looked everywhere in his room, but he couldn't find it. He asked his mommy and daddy if they had seen it, but they hadn't. Timmy was sad because he loved his magazine so much.
The next day, Timmy's friend came over to play. Timmy showed his friend his room and they looked for the magazine together. Timmy's friend found the magazine under Timmy's bed! Timmy was so happy and he gave his friend a big hug for helping him find it. From then on, Timmy never forgot where he put his magazine.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anna. She was very enthusiastic and loved to play in the garden with her friends.
One day, Anna noticed a big circle in the garden. She asked her friends, "What is that?"
One of them replied, "It's a game! If you nod your head, the circle will move."
Anna was so excited! She nodded her head, and the circle started to move. The more Anna nodded, the faster the circle moved. All of Anna's friends cheered for her, clapping and smiling.
Anna was having so much fun that she didn't want to stop. She kept nodding her head and the circle kept moving until it was bedtime.
Anna said goodbye to her friends and went inside, eager to play the game with them again tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved her daddy very much because he was very smart. One day, they went for a ride in the car. Daddy drove the car and Lily sat in the back seat. They went to the park and played on the swings. Daddy pushed Lily on the swing and she laughed and had so much fun. After playing, they went back home and had dinner together. Lily was happy to have such an intelligent daddy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He lived in a small village with his family and friends. One day, Timmy went for a walk in the forest to meet his new friend, a turkey he had seen before.
As he walked, he saw many animals like rabbits and squirrels. Suddenly, he saw a big and scary bear in front of him. Timmy was scared and thought the bear would harm him. But, to his surprise, the bear was harmless and just wanted to play with him.
Timmy and the bear played together for a while, and then the turkey came along. The turkey was surprised to see Timmy playing with the bear, but Timmy introduced them to each other. The turkey was happy to meet the bear and they all became friends. From that day on, Timmy had two new friends to play with in the forest.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big tree with tight branches. Tim's mom said, "Let's play a game. I will show you how to climb the tree."
Tim was excited and watched as his mom showed him how to climb. He tried to climb the tree too, but it was hard. Tim's mom said, "Don't worry, you will get better."
After playing, they sat down to rest. Tim's mom gave him a piece of gum to chew. Tim liked the gum because it was sweet and fun to chew. They had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a cute bunny named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots and cauliflower. One day, Benny went to the garden to get some cauliflower, but he found that there was none left. Benny was sad because he really wanted to eat some cauliflower.
Suddenly, Benny saw his friend, a squirrel named Sammy, who had some cauliflower in his paws. Benny asked Sammy if he could have some cauliflower, but Sammy said no. Benny was upset because he really wanted some cauliflower.
But then, Sammy had an idea. He decided to part the cauliflower in half and share it with Benny. Benny was happy because he got to eat some cauliflower and he was glad that Sammy was his friend. From that day on, Benny and Sammy always shared their food with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she saw a big, round, deep hole in the ground. She wanted to know what was inside, so she called out, "Hello? Is anyone there?"
Suddenly, a little voice answered back, "Yes, I'm here. Who are you?"
"I'm Lily. What are you doing down there?" she asked.
"I'm gathering some shiny rocks. Do you want to come down and see them?" the little voice said.
Excited to see the shiny rocks, Lily climbed down the hole. But when she got to the bottom, she saw that the little voice belonged to a mean troll. The troll snatched Lily's toy and said, "This is mine now! You can't have it back!"
Lily was sad and scared. She didn't know what to do. But then, she remembered her mom's advice to always be kind and to share. So, she offered the troll some of her snacks. The troll was surprised and happy, and he gave Lily back her toy.
Lily climbed out of the hole and ran back to her house. She was happy to have her toy back, but she also learned an important lesson about kindness.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Lucy. She was a curious little girl and wanted to explore the world. One day she found something weird - a loop! Lucy loved loops and wanted to carry it around with her all the time. She put the loop in her pocket and carried it everywhere she went. The loop was so weird, but Lucy wanted to keep it.
Whenever she had free time, Lucy would take the loop out of her pocket and play with it. She created shapes and designs with the loop. She also liked to carry it in a toy car and see how far it could go. Lucy couldn't get enough of her loop!
One day, Lucy decided to carry the loop to school. She was so happy to show her friends her weird loop. Unfortunately, the loop got stuck in the school door and Lucy couldn't get it out. She was really sad, but luckily her teacher was able to help her and she was able to carry her loop back home.
Since then, Lucy made sure to take good care of her loop and never tried to carry it anywhere too dangerous. She was happy to have found this weird loop and was happy that she could carry it around with her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she saw a vine growing on the fence. She asked her mom, "What is that, Mommy?" Her mom said, "That's a vine, sweetie. It grows and climbs up things."
Lily wanted to touch the vine, but it was too high. Her mom said, "Let's get a ladder and you can touch it." Lily was excited and said, "Yay, let's go!" When they got the ladder, Lily climbed up and touched the vine. It felt warm in the sun.
After a while, Lily wanted to play with her toys. She had a lot of toys, but they were all mixed up. She said, "Mommy, can you help me sort my toys?" Her mom said, "Sure, sweetie. Let's put the dolls in one pile and the cars in another pile." They sorted all the toys and Lily was happy to play with them again.

Once upon a time there was a serious skeleton. He wanted to go on a big adventure but he didn't know how.
Then, one day a magical owl arrived and told him it could send him on a journey. The owl said it had special powers and could send the skeleton anywhere he wanted to go.
The skeleton thought this was really exciting and so he asked the owl to send him to a tropical island. The owl waved its wings and with a puff the skeleton was on his way.
He arrived at the tropical island and had lots of fun exploring its hot beaches. After a few days he decided it was time to go home, so he asked the owl to send him back. The owl waved its wings and the skeleton was back home in no time.
The skeleton had lots of stories to tell his friends about his wonderful adventure and was very happy.

Lily and Tom were friends. They liked to play together. One day, they went to the park with their moms. They saw a big slide. They wanted to go on the slide.
"Can we go on the slide, mom?" Lily asked.
"Yes, but be careful. The slide is hot from the sun. Wait for your turn and don't push," Lily's mom said.
"OK, mom," Lily said. She and Tom ran to the slide. They saw a line of kids waiting. They waited too.
Soon, it was Lily's turn. She climbed up the ladder and sat on the slide. She felt the slide was hot on her legs. She slid down fast. She was happy. She clapped her hands.
"Yay, Lily!" Tom said. He clapped his hands too.
Then, it was Tom's turn. He climbed up the ladder and sat on the slide. He felt the slide was hot on his legs too. He slid down fast. He was happy. He clapped his hands.
"Yay, Tom!" Lily said. She clapped her hands too.
They wanted to go on the slide again. But they saw a new kid in the line. The new kid was smaller than them. He looked scared. He held a bag of rice in his hand.
"Hi, what's your name?" Lily asked the new kid.
"I'm Sam. I'm new here. I brought some rice for lunch. Do you want some?" Sam said.
"Sure, thank you. We like rice. But why are you scared?" Tom asked.
"I'm scared of the slide. It's too big and too hot. I don't want to go on it," Sam said.
"That's OK. You don't have to go on it if you don't want to. But we can show you how fun it is. Maybe you will like it too," Lily said.
"Really? You will help me?" Sam said.
"Yes, we will. We are friends. Come on, let's go together," Tom said.
They took Sam by the hand and walked to the slide. They let him go first. They helped him climb up the ladder and sit on the slide. They told him to hold on tight and have fun. They slid down with him. Sam felt the slide was hot on his legs, but he also felt the wind on his face. He smiled. He clapped his hands.
"Wow, that was fun! Thank you, Lily and Tom. You are very nice. Can we go again?" Sam said.
"Of course, we can. We are glad you liked it. You are very brave. Can we have some rice now? We are hungry," Lily and Tom said.
"Sure, you can. I have enough for all of us. Let's go to the shade and eat. The rice is still warm. It's yummy," Sam said.
They went to the shade and ate the rice. They shared and talked. They became friends. They learned to try new things and to be kind to others. They had a good day at the park.

Once upon a time, in a jolly land, there lived a big red ball. The big red ball had a friend named Tiny. Tiny was a small blue ball. They liked to play and roll all day.
One day, Tiny said, "I heard a mention of a big wonder in the park. Let's go see it!" The big red ball agreed, and they rolled to the park together. They saw many kids playing, but they did not see the wonder.
As they kept rolling, they found a big box. "Is this the wonder?" asked the big red ball. "Let's open it and see!" said Tiny. They pushed the box, and it opened. Inside, they found a very big bouncy castle. They were so happy and excited.
The big red ball and Tiny rolled into the bouncy castle. They bounced higher and higher. Then, the big red ball bounced too high and got stuck on the top of the castle. "Help me!" cried the big red ball. Tiny had a smart idea. He called all the kids in the park to come and bounce. With everyone bouncing together, the big red ball was free again. The big red ball and Tiny had a great day with their new friends. And that was the big wonder they had heard about.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the rain. He liked to jump in puddles and splash around.
One day, Timmy saw his friend Billy riding his bike really fast. Timmy wanted to ride fast too, but he didn't know how. Billy said, "Just pedal really fast and you'll go fast too!"
So Timmy got on his bike and pedaled as fast as he could. He felt the wind in his hair and he loved it. But then he saw a big puddle in front of him and he didn't want to get wet. He tried to slow down, but he was going too fast. He hit the puddle and splashed water all over himself.
Timmy was so mad. He thought, "That was so stupid of me to go so fast!" He went home and changed his clothes, but he was still a little mad. The next day, he went back outside and played in the rain again, but he didn't try to speed around on his bike anymore.

Once upon a time, in a colorful land, there was a big event. All the animals came to have fun. The sun was shining and the sky was blue.
At the event, there was a big table with lots of food. The rabbit spread jam on bread for everyone. The animals ate and played games. They were all very happy.
As the day went on, the animals danced and sang. They made new friends and shared their food. At the end of the event, they all went home with big smiles on their faces.

Once upon a time, in a young forest, there lived a lime tree. The lime tree had many green limes on its branches. One day, a little girl named Lisa came to the young forest.
Lisa saw the lime tree and said, "Hello, lime tree! Can you give me a lime, please?" The lime tree shook its branches, and a lime fell down. Lisa picked up the lime and said, "Thank you, lime tree!"
Lisa took the lime home and showed it to her mom. Her mom said, "Wow, Lisa! You found a nice lime. Let's make lime juice together." They squeezed the lime and made yummy lime juice. Lisa and her mom were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to wear his red coat when it was cold outside. One day, Timmy's mom told him they were going to a jolly party at his friend's house. Timmy was excited and couldn't wait to go.
As they walked to the party, Timmy's mom noticed that the sky was getting dark and cloudy. She said, "I hope it doesn't rain." Timmy looked up and saw the clouds too. He said, "I don't want to get my coat wet."
When they arrived at the party, Timmy saw all his friends playing and having fun. He took off his coat and joined in the fun. They played games and ate yummy snacks. But suddenly, they heard a loud noise outside. Timmy's mom looked out the window and saw that it was raining hard. She said, "Good thing we brought your coat. Let's go home before we get too wet."
Timmy put on his red coat and they ran home in the rain. When they arrived, Timmy's mom took off his wet coat and hung it up to dry. Timmy was happy that his coat kept him dry and warm. He said, "Thank you, coat!" And he went to bed, dreaming of the jolly party he had just been to.

Bob was a charming little boy who loved the feeling of sleeping in his cozy bed. Each morning, he would wake up with joy and excitement. But one day, something different happened.
Bob woke up to find his zipper stuck and he couldn't unzip his jumpsuit. He tugged and pulled but nothing worked. He started to feel scared and frustrated.
Suddenly, his bed opened up and a monster appeared! It was loud and scary and had big sharp teeth. Bob screamed out for help, but no one could hear him. He felt helpless.
The monster grabbed Bob's zipper and yanked it so hard that it broke. Bob knew he was in big trouble. He was never seen again. Poor Bob!

Once upon a time, there was a charming girl named Jenny. She loved to go on adventures and have fun.
One day, she saw a big, colourful balloon. It was so bright and happy looking that she couldn't help but smile. She wanted to join the balloon in the sky.
So with one giant leap she held onto the balloon and flew high up into the sky. Up and up she went, until she reached the sky.
The view was beautiful. The sun was setting and the sky was filled with stars. Jenny felt like she could stay up there forever.
She let go of the balloon and watched as it flew away. She knew she would never forget the experience of flying with the balloon.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the big, wide field near his house. He loved to run and jump and play with his friends. One day, Timmy saw a big, dark cloud in the sky. He knew that meant a storm was coming.
Timmy's mom told him to come inside, but Timmy wanted to watch the storm. He stood by the window and watched as the lightning lit up the sky. Suddenly, the power went out. Timmy was scared and lonely in the dark.
He remembered that his neighbor had a flashlight. Timmy decided to go ask to borrow it. But as he walked across the field, a bolt of lightning struck him. Timmy didn't make it to his neighbor's house. His mom was very sad and missed him very much.

Once upon a time there was a brave ant who lived in a garden. Her name was Jo. Jo was always very careful of her surroundings.
One day, Jo decided to make a nest. She worked hard, collecting lots of twigs and leaves and piled them up carefully.
She was making great progress when suddenly, a big wind came and blew away everything Jo had made. She looked around and saw her hard work gone.
Jo was upset and frustrated, but she decided to try again. She shouted "I will make a nest no matter what!"
Jo started gathering materials again and worked hard, but this time she was also more careful. She made sure to secure the materials with her mouth, so that no wind could blow them away.
After a few hours of hard work, Jo finally managed to make a beautiful downy nest, where she could keep warm and safe. Jo was very proud of her work. She smiled contentedly and went to sleep.

Once upon a time there was a brave mouse. He was tiny, but he was very brave. One day he decided to explore a big house. He was so brave and so small, nothing scared him. 
But when he reached the kitchen something made him scared. There was a big cat. It looked like the cat wanted to eat the mouse! He was so scared and wanted to run away.
Then the mouse had an idea. He remembered he was brave! He held his head high, and walked up to the cat. The cat was so surprised it didn't know what to do. 
The mouse said, "Don't be scared, I'm just exploring. I'm brave and I just want to be friends." The cat said, "I'm brave too! Let's be friends." 
The brave mouse and the brave cat became the best of friends and lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a sailor named Jack. He loved to sail on his boat and explore the big blue sea. One day, he met a little girl named Lily. She was hiding behind a tree and watching Jack sail on his boat.
Lily said, "Hi sailor! Can I come on your boat?"
Jack replied, "Of course you can, but be careful not to pinch yourself on the ropes."
Lily climbed aboard and they sailed together. They saw dolphins jumping and colorful fish swimming. Lily was so happy and she said, "This is so fun! I wish I could sail with you every day."
Jack smiled and said, "You can come with me anytime you want. The sea is big and there's always a hidden treasure waiting to be found."

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Kitty. Kitty was playing with her friend, a dog named Buddy. They were having lots of fun together. But then, Kitty did something that made Buddy embarrass. Kitty laughed at Buddy because he could not catch his tail.
Buddy felt hurt by Kitty's laugh. He said, "Kitty, it is not nice to laugh at me. It makes me feel bad." Kitty did not listen and kept laughing at Buddy. This made Buddy very sad and not want to play with Kitty anymore.
The moral of the story is to always be kind to your friends and not to embarrass them. If you are not nice, you may lose your friends and end up alone, just like Kitty.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat yummy food. One day, her mommy made her a tasty sandwich. Lily ate it all up and her tummy was happy. 
Later that day, Lily went to the park to play. She met a new friend named Timmy. Timmy had a cool body because he could climb really high. Lily was impressed and wanted to speak to him. She said, "Hi Timmy, you have a cool body. Do you want to play with me?" Timmy said yes and they had lots of fun together. 
At the end of the day, Lily went home and told her mommy about her new friend. She also told her mommy about the tasty sandwich she had for lunch. Her mommy was happy that Lily had a fun day and enjoyed her food. The end.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a small, frightened rabbit. The rabbit was scared of everything. One day, the rabbit found a big stone in the forest. The stone was very old and wise.
The stone saw the frightened rabbit and wanted to help. The stone started to talk to the rabbit. It said, "Don't be scared, little rabbit. I will encourage you to be brave."
The rabbit listened to the stone and started to feel braver. The stone encouraged the rabbit to try new things. The rabbit played with other animals and even climbed a tree. The frightened rabbit became a brave rabbit, all thanks to the wise stone.

Ben and Sam are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a big tree that they call their fort. The tree has many roots that stick out of the ground. They use the roots to hide and climb.
One day, they see a man with a big truck. The man has a saw and a rope. He wants to cut down the tree. Ben and Sam are scared and sad. They love their fort. They do not want to lose it.
They run to the man and ask him to stop. They tell him that the tree is their fort and their friend. They say that the tree gives them shade and air and fun. They say that the tree is loyal to them and they are loyal to the tree.
The man listens to them. He sees that they care about the tree. He thinks for a while. He says that he is sorry, but he has to cut down the tree. He says that he has a job to do. He says that he has to supply wood for the people who need it.
Ben and Sam are very sad. They hug the tree and say goodbye. They ask the man if he can leave them a piece of the tree. They want to keep a part of their fort and their friend. The man nods and smiles. He cuts a big root and gives it to them. He says that they can use it as a bench or a table or a toy. He says that he hopes they will find a new fort and a new friend.
Ben and Sam thank the man. They take the root and go to another part of the park. They look for a new tree to play with. They still miss their old tree, but they are happy to have the root. They say that the root will always remind them of their loyal friend. They say that they will always be loyal to each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park with her friends. One day, Lily and her friends found a lost puppy. They wanted to keep it, but they knew they had to ask their parents first.
Lily went home and asked her mom if they could keep the puppy. Her mom said yes, but only if they could keep the puppy in order. This meant they had to take care of the puppy and make sure it didn't make a mess.
Lily and her friends were so excited to keep the puppy. They played with it all day long, but they also knew that they had to be careful. The puppy was very small and could get hurt easily. They didn't want anything dangerous to happen to their new friend.
As the sun started to set, Lily's mom came to check on them. She was happy to see that they were taking good care of the puppy and keeping everything in order. Lily and her friends were so proud of themselves for being responsible and taking care of their new pet.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to carry her teddy bear everywhere she went. One day, her family went to visit a big temple. Lily was excited to see all the pretty decorations and the big statue of the Buddha. But then, she got worried because she couldn't find her teddy bear. She looked everywhere but couldn't see it. 
Lily's mom saw that she was worried and asked her what was wrong. Lily told her that she couldn't find her teddy bear. Her mom said not to worry and that they would look for it together. They searched and searched and finally, they found the teddy bear hiding behind a big pot. Lily was so happy to have her teddy bear back and she carried it with her as they explored the temple.

Once upon a time, there was a small house. In the house, there lived a girl named Amy. She liked to play with her toys and have fun.
One day, Amy saw a door she had not seen before. She wanted to enter the door, but it had a lock. "Mom, can you open the lock?" she asked. Her mom came and used a key to open it.
Inside the room, Amy found unknown toys. She was very happy. She played with the toys all day and said, "Thank you, Mom, for opening the door!"

One sunny day, a group of kids went to the mall. They wanted to play and have fun. They saw a big toy store and ran inside. In the store, they found a toy soldier that could march. They were very excited and wanted to play with it.
"Look at the toy soldier!" said one kid. "Let's make him march!" The kids took the toy soldier out of the box and made him march around the mall. The toy soldier marched up and down, left and right. The kids laughed and clapped as they watched the toy soldier march.
As they played, they saw a lazy cat lying on the floor. The cat was big and fluffy. It did not want to move. The kids thought it was funny. They made the toy soldier march near the lazy cat. The cat looked at the toy soldier and then slowly got up. It stretched and walked away, leaving the kids to continue playing with their new toy soldier friend.

Ben and Lily were twins who liked to play in the park. They had a big ball that they kicked with their feet. Sometimes they kicked it to each other, and sometimes they kicked it to the sky.
One day, a mean boy came and took their ball. He said it was his ball and he would not give it back. Ben and Lily were sad and angry. They wanted their ball back.
They ran after the mean boy and tried to get their ball. But the mean boy was fast and strong. He pushed them away and laughed at them. He said they were too small and weak to get their ball.
Ben and Lily felt bad. They did not know what to do. Then they had an idea. They decided to unite and work together. They whispered to each other and made a plan.
They waited until the mean boy was not looking. Then they ran to him from different sides. Ben grabbed his legs and Lily grabbed his arms. They pulled him down and made him fall. The ball rolled out of his hands. Ben and Lily got their ball back.
They cheered and hugged each other. They were happy and proud. They had used their feet and their brains to beat the mean boy. They were mighty twins. They ran away with their ball and played in the park. They did not see the mean boy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was enthusiastic about pizza. He loved to eat pizza every day. One day, his mom said they would change and have something new for dinner. Tim was sad.
That night, Tim's mom made a big surprise for him. She made a pizza, but it looked different. It was not round like a pizza. It was shaped like a big star! Tim was so happy and excited. He had never seen a star pizza before.
Tim started to eat the star pizza. But then, something unexpected happened. The pizza changed into a real star! It began to shine and float up in the air. Tim and his mom were amazed. They knew this was a magical pizza. From that day on, Tim loved all kinds of food, not just pizza.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, she found a toy dragon on the ground. She picked it up and held it in her hand. The dragon was green and had big wings. 
Lily showed the dragon to her mom and said, "Look! I found a dragon!" Her mom said, "That's fine, Lily. You can keep it." So, Lily took the dragon home and played with it every day. She held it in her arms and made it fly around the room. 
One day, Lily's little brother wanted to play with the dragon too. Lily said, "Okay, but you have to be careful and hold it gently." Her brother smiled and held the dragon in his hands. They played together and had so much fun. From that day on, Lily and her brother shared the dragon and took turns holding it.

Once upon a time, in a busy little town, there lived a girl named Lily. She loved to smile and play outside. One day, Lily saw dark clouds in the sky. She knew something fun was going to happen soon.
The rain started to fall, and everyone ran inside their homes. But Lily stayed outside, smiling and laughing. She danced in the rain, splashing in puddles. She knew that after the rain, something beautiful would come.
And she was right! As the rain stopped, a bright and colorful rainbow appeared in the sky. Lily's smile grew even bigger. She knew that her fun day in the rain had led to this wonderful surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to play with her violin. One day, Sue's violin got dirty. Sue's mom said, "Sue, you need to bathe your violin to make it clean again."
Sue took her violin to the bath. She put it in the water and started to wash it. But then, the violin started to hurt. The water was too hot! Sue's violin cried, "Ouch! The water is too hot, Sue! Please take me out!"
Sue was scared. She didn't want her violin to be hurt. She quickly took the violin out of the bath and dried it with a soft towel. Then, they both said sorry to each other. Sue promised to be more careful next time, and her violin promised to stay clean. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big brother named Max who loved to read books. One day, Max wanted to read a book that was very special and rare. But he didn't have it at home. 
So Max asked his sister Lily if he could borrow her bike to go to the library. Lily said yes and Max rode to the library. When he got there, he saw that the gate was closed. But Max didn't give up. He found another way to get inside and borrow the special book. 
Max was so happy to have the rare book in his hands. He rode back home on Lily's bike and thanked her for letting him borrow it. Max spent the whole day reading the special book and he loved it. From that day on, Max knew that if he ever needed something, he could always count on his little sister Lily.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a blue house. In the blue house, there lived a kind man named Tom. Tom liked to serve food to his friends. One day, Tom's friend, Sam, came to visit.
"Hi, Sam!" said Tom. "I will serve you some yummy food." Sam was very happy. They sat down to eat in front of a big screen. The screen showed a fun movie for them to watch.
As they ate and watched the movie, they talked and laughed. After they finished eating, Sam said, "Thank you, Tom, for serving me food and watching the movie with me."
Tom smiled and said, "You're welcome, Sam. Sharing is caring."
Sam learned that sharing with friends is important and makes everyone happy. From that day on, Sam always shared his things with others, too.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily and a boy named Tom. They were friends who liked to joke and play together. One day, they were playing near the big tree when Lily had an idea. "Let's have a pretend marriage!" she said. Tom agreed and they started to plan their pretend marriage.
They invited their friends, the birds, and the squirrels to be their guests. They all gathered around the big tree and began the pretend marriage. The birds sang a happy song and the squirrels danced around. Lily and Tom laughed and joked as they pretended to be married.
But then, something unexpected happened. A sad little kitten came to the big tree. It was lost and crying. Lily and Tom stopped their pretend marriage to help the sad kitten. They asked their friends, the birds and squirrels, to help find the kitten's home. Together, they searched and found the kitten's family.
The kitten was happy and thanked Lily, Tom, and their friends. Then, they all continued the pretend marriage. They laughed, joked, and played until the sun went down. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted rabbit named Bob. He was very good at finding food to eat. One day, Bob went out to spend time looking for food. He hopped and hopped until he found something yummy.
Bob found a big bunch of celery! He was so happy because he loved to eat celery. He picked it up with his strong teeth and carried it back to his home. He was excited to share it with his family.
When Bob got home, he shared the celery with his family. They were all very happy and thanked Bob for his help. They ate the celery together and had a great time. Bob was proud to be a gifted rabbit who could help his family.

One day, an elderly lady named Sue lived in a small house. She loved to cook and always wore a pretty apron. She had a big cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with Sue's apron strings.
One sunny day, Sue was cooking in the kitchen. Tom saw the apron strings and wanted to play. He jumped and pulled the apron. Sue did not like this. She yelled, "No, Tom! Don't do that!" Tom felt sad and went outside.
Tom sat outside and saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was lost and scared. Tom remembered Sue yelling and thought he could help. He yelled, "Sue! Help!" Sue heard Tom and came outside. She saw Lily and helped her find her way home. Sue was happy that Tom yelled. They both learned that sometimes yelling can be helpful.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to watch the birds fly in the sky. One day, Timmy saw a bird with a shiny track on its leg. 
He asked his mom, "Mommy, what is that shiny thing on the bird's leg?" 
His mom replied, "That's called a track. It helps people who study birds to know where they go." 
Timmy thought that was very intelligent. He wanted to learn more about birds with tracks. 
So, his mom took him to the library where they found a book about birds. They read about all the different kinds of birds and their tracks. Timmy was so excited to learn more about these intelligent creatures.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a broken faucet in his yard. The water was coming out very fast. Tim wanted to stop the water, so he tried to cover the faucet with his hands. But the water still came out.
Tim called his friend, Lily. "Lily, can you help me cover the broken faucet?" he asked. Lily came to help Tim. They both tried to cover the faucet with their hands, but the water still came out.
Then, Tim's dad saw them trying to stop the water. He came and fixed the broken faucet. The water stopped coming out. Tim and Lily were happy. They thanked Tim's dad and went to play in the yard again.

Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named Lily. She loved to wear her yellow dress because it made her feel like a sunshine. One day, Lily went for a walk in the park with her mom. They saw a big tree with a useful ladder leaning against it.
Lily's mom said, "Let's climb up and see what we can find." So, Lily climbed up the ladder with her mom. When they got to the top, they saw a surprise! There was a yellow bird's nest with three little eggs inside.
Lily and her mom watched the eggs until they hatched into baby birds. They were so happy to see the little birds chirping and flapping their wings. Lily knew that wearing her yellow dress was lucky because it helped her find the bird's nest.

Sara and Tom are friends. They like to play with boats. They have a big box full of boats. Some boats are red, some boats are blue, some boats are yellow. Sara and Tom pick their favorite boats and go to the pond.
The pond is near their house. It has water and ducks and fish. Sara and Tom put their boats in the water and make them sail. They blow on them and watch them go. They laugh and clap and say, "Look at our boats! They are so fast and fun!"
But then, a big wind comes. It makes the water move and the boats shake. Sara and Tom are scared. They try to catch their boats, but they are too far. The wind pushes the boats to the other side of the pond, where there is a big pipe. The pipe is an exit for the water. The boats go into the pipe and disappear.
Sara and Tom are sad. They cry and hug each other. They say, "We lost our boats! We love our boats! How can we get them back?"
A duck hears them. The duck is nice and smart. He swims to them and says, "Quack, quack, don't cry. I know where your boats are. They are in the pipe, but they are not gone. The pipe leads to another pond, where there are more ducks and fish and water. If you follow me, I can show you the way. Come on, quack, quack, let's go!"
Sara and Tom are surprised and happy. They say, "Thank you, duck! You are so kind and helpful! Can we go with you and see our boats?" The duck nods and says, "Of course, quack, quack, follow me!" He leads them to the other pond, where they see their boats again. They are safe and sound. They sail and spin and shine. Sara and Tom smile and cheer and say, "There are our boats! They are still fast and fun! And look, they have new friends! They are playing with the other boats and the ducks and the fish!"
The duck says, "Quack, quack, you are welcome. I'm glad you found your boats. They are sweet and pretty. Do you want to stay and play with us?" Sara and Tom say, "Yes, please, duck! We would love to stay and play with you! You are our new friend, too! Thank you for showing us the way!" They stay and play with the duck and the boats and the other animals. They have a lot of fun and forget about the wind and the pipe. They are happy and grateful. They have a good day.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable little girl. She had a special pillow that she loved to cuddle whenever she felt scared or anxious. She would hug it close and feel brave and safe. 
One day, however, the little girl's pillow got lost. She searched everywhere, but could not find it. Everyone in the family was sad and worried. 
The girl knew that she must be brave. She decided to separate herself and her pillow. She realized that she could feel brave and safe without a pillow, because she had something else inside her that was dependable: her courage. 
Soon after, the little girl's pillow was returned to her. She hugged it tight and gasped with joy. She knew she didn't need a pillow to be brave, but was still grateful to have it with her again. 
The moral of this story is that we can all be brave and dependable, even if things get lost and we feel scared.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to draw and design things. One day, he wanted to make a map of his house.
Tim started to draw the map, but his little sister, Sue, came over and said, "That looks stupid!" Tim felt sad, but he didn't give up. He knew he could make a better map.
So, Tim tried again and made a new map. This time, it was better. Sue looked at it and said, "Wow, that's a good map!" Tim was happy and proud of his work. They used the map to play a fun game of hide and seek. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl. She wanted to create something special. She went outside and found some gold glitter. She gathered the golden glitter in her hands, and sprinkled it into the sky.
The tiny bits of glitter sparkled as they flew through the air. This made the little girl smile. She then noticed a small pond nearby, so she threw some of the gold glitter in it.
The pond was soon filled up with golden sparkles, and the small girl was so happy! She created something so beautiful, she wanted it to stay forever. So she thought for a long time and decided to make a wish.
The little girl took a deep breath and blew all of the golden sparkles from her hands. She closed her eyes and wished for the gold glitter to stay in the pond and make it beautiful forever. 
And it worked! The golden glitter stayed put, and the small girl was so happy. Each time she visited the pond, she was excited to see her creation. She knew that her special wish had come true.

Once upon a time, there was a playful puppy named Spot. Spot was very happy and loved to play with his toys. One day, Spot saw a black cat in his yard. 
Spot barked, "Who are you?" 
The cat replied, "My name is Mittens. I came to say hello." 
Spot was curious and wagged his tail. Mittens started to bow and playfully swatted at Spot's nose. 
Spot laughed and said, "You're silly, Mittens. Let's play together!" 
From that day on, Spot and Mittens became friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. One day, he went on an adventure in the forest. He saw a tree with a branch that he could hang from. He hung from the branch and felt like he was flying.
Suddenly, he heard a voice behind him. It was his friend, Billy. Billy was holding a weapon that looked scary. Timmy was scared because he didn't know what the weapon was or what it could do.
"What is that?" Timmy asked, pointing to the weapon.
"It's an unknown weapon," Billy replied. "I found it on the ground. I don't know what it does either."
Timmy and Billy decided to leave the weapon in the forest and go back home. They didn't want to play with something that could hurt them. From that day on, they made sure to always be careful and never play with unknown things.

Once upon a time, there was a wide store that had many toys. In this store, there was a model car that was very pretty. The model car was red and had four wheels. It could go very fast when kids played with it. The car lived on a shelf with other toys, and they were all friends.
One day, a little girl came to the wide store with her mom. The little girl saw the model car on the shelf and wanted to play with it. She asked her mom if she could have the car. Her mom said yes, and they took the model car home.
The model car was very happy in its new home. The little girl played with the car every day, and they became best friends. The car would zoom around the room, and the girl would laugh and clap her hands. They had lots of fun together, and the model car was glad it had left the wide store to be with the little girl.

Tom and Lily were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big cave. They wanted to see what was inside.
"Let's go in the cave," Tom said.
"OK, but be careful," Lily said.
They walked into the cave. It was dark and cold. They heard strange noises. They were scared.
"Tom, I don't like this cave. Let's go back," Lily said.
But Tom did not hear her. He went deeper into the cave. He saw a shiny rock. He wanted to touch it.
"Tom, where are you?" Lily called.
Lily tried to find Tom. She could not see him. She was alone. She cried.
"Help, help!" she shouted.
Tom heard Lily. He ran back to her. He saw her crying. He felt sorry.
"Lily, I'm here. I'm sorry. I should have stayed with you," Tom said.
He hugged Lily. Lily hugged him back. They were happy to see each other.
"Let's go out of the cave. It's not fun here," Tom said.
"OK, let's go. And let's not go in the cave again," Lily said.
They walked out of the cave. They saw the sun and the grass. They smiled.
They were friends. They were united.

One day, a thoughtful cat named Tim saw a big red ball in the yard. He wanted to play with it but he did not recognize it. Tim was curious and went closer to the ball. The sun was shining and it was hot outside.
Tim said, "Hello, red ball! Do you want to play with me?" The ball did not answer. Tim thought it was a shy ball. He decided to push the ball with his paw. But as he touched the ball, he felt heat. "Ouch! You are hot, red ball!" said Tim.
Just then, a friendly dog named Max came over. He saw Tim and the red ball. Max said, "Silly cat, that's not a ball! That's a hot air balloon!" Tim was surprised. He never thought the red ball was a hot air balloon. Tim and Max laughed and played together in the yard, waiting for the hot air balloon to cool down.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run fast. One day, she saw her mom spreading peanut butter on bread.
Lily asked, "What are you doing, Mommy?"
"I am spreading peanut butter on bread to make a yummy sandwich," her mom replied.
Lily said, "I want to help. Can I spread the peanut butter too?"
"Of course, sweetie! You can spread the peanut butter on your own bread," her mom said.
Lily spread the peanut butter on her bread very fast and was so happy to make her own sandwich. She took a bite and said, "Mmm, this sandwich is so good! I made it myself!"
From that day on, Lily loved to spread peanut butter on her bread and make her own sandwiches. She even gave her sandwich a special name - "Lily's Yummy Peanut Butter Sandwich."

Once upon a time, there was a big gift. It was wrap in pretty paper. A little girl named Sally saw the gift. She wanted to open it. But, the gift was not for her.
Sally went to play outside. She saw a filthy dog. The dog looked sad. Sally had an idea. She went to get the gift. She thought the dog would like it.
Sally gave the gift to the dog. The dog was happy. The dog was not sad anymore. The gift was a soft bed for the dog. Sally learned to share. She felt good inside. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Hop. Hop was very cute and fluffy. One day, Hop saw an unusual switch in the forest. The switch was big and shiny. Hop wanted to touch it, but was scared. 
Suddenly, a friendly squirrel came by and said, "Hello, Hop! What are you looking at?" Hop pointed to the unusual switch and asked, "What is that?" The squirrel replied, "That is a switch. It turns things on and off." Hop was curious and asked, "Can I touch it?" The squirrel said, "Sure, but be careful!" 
Hop hopped over to the switch and touched it with his little paw. Suddenly, the switch turned on and the forest lit up with beautiful lights. Hop was so happy and thanked the squirrel for showing him the unusual switch. From that day on, Hop loved to hop over to the switch and turn on the lights in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack. Jack loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Jack's mom told him to put on his pants before going outside. Jack didn't want to wear pants, but he listened to his mom and put them on anyway.
Jack and his friends played for hours outside. They ran, jumped, and laughed. When it was time to go home, Jack's pants were wet from playing in the sprinklers. Jack's mom told him to take off his wet pants and put on some dry ones.
But Jack didn't want to take off his wet pants. He shrugged his shoulders and said he didn't want to change. So, Jack went to bed with his wet pants still on.
The next morning, Jack woke up feeling sick. His wet pants had given him a cold. Jack learned that it's important to listen to his mom and change into dry pants. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a jar full of pretty rocks that she found outside. One day, she showed her jar to her friend Jack.
Jack said, "That's an interesting jar. Can I see it?"
Lily said, "Sure, but be careful."
Jack took the jar and accidentally dropped it. The jar broke into many pieces and the rocks spilled out. Lily was very sad and said, "Why did you do that? Now my rocks are gone."
Jack felt bad and said, "I'm sorry. Let's try to fix it together."
They sat down and tried to put the pieces back together. It was hard work, but they finally fixed the jar. Lily was happy again and said, "Thank you for helping me. Now we can go find more interesting rocks together."

One day, a girl named Sue went to the forest. She was excited to explore the trees and the animals. She wanted to record all the different creatures she saw on her phone.
After walking through the woods for a while, Sue heard a noise. It was a funny noise and she wanted to record it. She ran towards it, but quickly became tired. She sat on a big rock and decided to take a break.
After Sue rested for a few minutes, she went looking for the noise again. Eventually she found the source—two chipmunks were playing and chirping. She pulled out her phone and recorded the animals. As she watched the chipmunks play, she smiled and felt happy.
When Sue was finished recording, she looked around and noticed how dark it had gotten — it was time to go home. She was glad she had explored the forest and was a bit tired, but satisfied that she had recorded the chipmunks.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her big yellow ball. One day, Lily was playing with her ball in the park when a boy came up to her.
"Wow, that's a big ball! I want to play with it," said the boy.
Lily didn't want to share her ball because she valued it so much. She said, "No, this is my ball. I don't want to share."
The boy started to cry and ran away. Lily continued to play with her ball, but suddenly it popped! She was so sad and didn't know what to do. She realized that she should have shared her ball with the boy because it was just a toy and not worth as much as her friendship.
From that day on, Lily learned that sharing is important and that friendships are more valuable than things.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to walk in the park with her mommy. One day, they saw a graceful bird with colorful feathers. Lily asked her mommy, "Can we use bread to feed the bird?" Her mommy said yes and they gave the bird some bread. The bird was very happy and chirped a thank you to Lily. 
As they continued their walk, they saw a group of children playing with a ball. One of the children accidentally kicked the ball too hard and it went into the bushes. Lily's mommy said, "Let's help them find the ball." They searched and searched until they found it. The children were so happy and thanked Lily and her mommy. 
After their walk, Lily and her mommy went to get ice cream. Lily said, "I had so much fun today. I love walking with you mommy." Her mommy replied, "I love walking with you too, Lily. You are such a good helper."

Once upon a time, there was a big bear named Brownie. Brownie lived in a forest with his friends, a rabbit and a squirrel. One day, Brownie and the rabbit were playing when they heard a loud noise. They went to see what it was and found a fox trying to steal their food.
The rabbit said, "Hey fox, why are you being so mean? We can share our food with you." But the fox just growled and said, "No, I want it all for myself!"
Brownie and the rabbit didn't want to fight, but they knew they had to protect their food. So, they stood up to the fox and said, "No way! You can't have it all. We worked hard to get it."
The fox tried to be sneaky and quiet, but Brownie and the rabbit were too great of friends to let that happen. They fought off the fox and saved their food. From that day on, they made sure to keep a watchful eye on their food so no one would try to steal it again.

Tim and Jen are playing in the park. They see a big bird on a tree. The bird is not moving.
"Look, a bird!" Tim says.
"Is it dead?" Jen asks.
Tim shakes his head. "No, it is sleeping."
They go closer to the bird. They want to touch it. The bird opens one eye. It looks at them.
"Hello, bird!" Tim says.
The bird does not say anything. It closes its eye again.
"Maybe it is sick," Jen says.
Tim nods. "Maybe. We should help it."
They look around. They see some bread on a bench. They take some bread and break it into pieces. They put the pieces on the ground near the bird.
"Here, bird. Eat some bread. It will make you feel better," Tim says.
The bird opens both eyes. It sees the bread. It hops down from the tree. It pecks at the bread. It makes a happy sound.
"Wow, it likes the bread!" Jen says.
The bird looks at them. It flaps its wings. It flies away.
"Bye, bird!" Tim and Jen say.
They smile at each other. They feel a surprise in their hearts. They helped the bird. They made a new friend.

One night, Mama was making something special. It was something spicy. She put all the ingredients into a big bowl. As she stirred the bowl with a spoon, it started to slip. Mama tried hard to keep a hold of the bowl but it was too slippery. The bowl went whoosh and it fell to the floor. 
Mama quickly cleaned up the mess. She picked up the bowl and put the ingredients back inside. Then, she put it onto the table. This time, she held the bowl tight while she stirred. 
Mama tasted the special food. She said it was the spiciest dish she had ever made! She was so excited that she invited all the family to come try it. 
Everyone loved the food! They said it was the tastiest thing they had ever eaten. Even Papa said it was amazing. 
Mama beamed with pride. She was so glad that she had kept a good hold of the bowl!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy who loved to play outside. One day, he saw a little insect crawling on the ground. It was a ladybug with black spots on its red body. "Hello little ladybug, would you like to play with me?" Timmy asked. But the ladybug didn't answer and kept crawling away.
Timmy followed the ladybug, trying to catch it, but it was too stubborn to be caught. "Please, little ladybug, come play with me," Timmy begged. But the ladybug just kept crawling. Suddenly, the ladybug flew away and Timmy was sad.
But then, something unexpected happened. The ladybug came back with all its friends, and they flew around Timmy's head, making him laugh and smile. From that day on, Timmy knew that even if someone or something is stubborn, with a little bit of patience and kindness, they might surprise you in the end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside and climb trees. One day, she found a big, heavy rock and decided to take it home with her.
When Lily got home, she asked her mom if she could keep the rock. Her mom said yes, but only if Lily promised to wash her hair with shampoo before dinner.
Lily agreed and went to take a bath. As she was washing her hair with the shampoo, she realized that the rock was too heavy for her to carry. She lied to her mom and said that she left the rock outside.
Later that night, Lily's mom went outside and saw the rock sitting by the front door. She knew that Lily had lied to her. The next day, Lily had to apologize for lying and promised to always tell the truth. From then on, Lily learned that honesty is always the best policy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to ride his scooter around the park. He would go really fast and pretend he was racing with his friends.
One day, Timmy's scooter broke and he was sad because he couldn't ride it anymore. But then, his mom told him that there was a new scooter available at the store. Timmy was so happy! 
He went to the store with his mom and picked out the coolest scooter he had ever seen. It was red and had big wheels. Timmy couldn't wait to race it around the park with his friends. From that day on, Timmy and his new scooter were unstoppable!

Once upon a time, there was a big game. Two teams were playing. One team was wearing blue and the other team was wearing red. The blue team was very fierce. They wanted to win very much. The red team was not as fierce, but they still wanted to win.
The game started and the blue team rushed to get the ball. They ran very fast and kicked the ball. But the red team was very good too. They kicked the ball and got closer to the blue team's goal. The blue team tried to stop them, but the red team was too fast.
In the end, the red team won the game. They were very happy and celebrated together. Even though they were not as fierce as the blue team, they worked very well as a team and that is why they won.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved ice cream very much. One day, she went to the ice cream shop with her mom. She asked the man behind the counter for a scoop of chocolate ice cream. The man gave her a big scoop and she was very happy. 
Lily's mom reminded her to eat the ice cream carefully so she wouldn't get dirty. Lily ate the ice cream slowly and kept her face clean. Suddenly, she received a phone call from her grandma. "Hello, Lily! How are you?" said her grandma. "I'm good, grandma! I just received a big scoop of chocolate ice cream!" replied Lily. 
Her grandma laughed and said, "That sounds delicious! Don't forget to clean your face after you finish." Lily smiled and told her grandma she would. She finished her ice cream and cleaned her face. She felt very happy and excited to tell her grandma all about her day at the ice cream shop.

Tom and Anna are friends. They like to play in Anna's room. Anna has a tall bookcase with many books and toys. Tom likes to joke with Anna and make her laugh.
One day, Tom has a new joke. He hides behind the bookcase and waits for Anna to come in. He hears Anna open the door and say, "Tom, where are you? I want to play with you." Tom smiles and thinks, "This will be funny."
He jumps out from behind the bookcase and shouts, "Boo!" Anna is surprised and screams. Then she sees Tom and laughs. "You scared me, Tom! That was a good joke." Tom laughs too and says, "I'm sorry, Anna. I just wanted to make you laugh. Do you want to see my new toy?"
Anna nods and says, "Yes, please. What is it?" Tom shows her his toy car. It is red and shiny. Anna likes it and says, "Wow, that is a nice car. Can I play with it too?" Tom says, "Of course, Anna. You are my friend. We can share it."
They play with the toy car on the floor. They make vroom-vroom noises and pretend to drive around. They have fun and forget about the bookcase. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat vegetables, especially carrots and broccoli. One day, her mom took her to the grocery store to buy some more veggies. While they were there, they saw a man who was being rude to the cashier. 
Lily's mom told her that it's not nice to be rude to other people. She said that we should always be kind and respectful to everyone. Lily agreed and decided to pray for the man to be nicer to others.
When they got home, Lily helped her mom wash the vegetables and they cooked them for dinner. They prayed together before eating, thanking God for the food and asking for the man at the store to be kinder to others. 
After dinner, Lily's mom read her a bedtime story and they talked about how important it is to be kind to others. Lily fell asleep feeling happy and grateful for her veggies and for the chance to pray for someone who needed to be kinder.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to cook with her mommy. One day, they went to the store to buy some broccoli. Lily's mommy said, "We need to make sure we get real broccoli, not fake broccoli." Lily didn't know what fake broccoli was, but she nodded her head anyway.
When they got home, Lily helped her mommy wash the broccoli and cut it into little pieces. Her mommy put the broccoli in a pot and cooked it on the stove. Lily watched as the broccoli turned from green to bright green. It smelled delicious.
Later that night, Lily's mommy served the broccoli with some chicken. Lily took a bite and said, "This broccoli is yummy!" Her mommy smiled and said, "That's because it's real broccoli, not fake broccoli." Lily giggled and ate more broccoli. From that day on, Lily knew the difference between real and fake broccoli.

Once upon a time, there was a little yellow bird named Sunny. Sunny loved to fly and sing all day long. One day, while Sunny was playing in the park, she found a big tree with a hole in it. She thought it would be a great place to rest.
