As Sunny went inside the hole, she met a small squirrel named Squeaky. Squeaky was very shy and only liked to whisper. "Hi, I'm Squeaky," he whispered to Sunny. "Hello, I'm Sunny," she replied with a big smile. They became friends and started to play together.
Sunny and Squeaky loved to play games like hide and seek. One day, while they were playing, Squeaky found a soft leaf. He gave Sunny a gentle rub with the leaf, and they both laughed. They played and laughed until the sun went down. From that day on, Sunny and Squeaky were the best of friends, always playing and having fun in their special tree.

Once upon a time, a yellow dog named Max lived in a big house. Max had a shiny collar that he wore every day. He loved to relax in the warm sun and play with his friends.
One day, Max saw a little cat named Lily. Lily was playing with Max's shiny collar. Max did not like this. He said, "Lily, please give me back my collar. It is mine, not yours."
Lily did not want to give the collar back. She said, "No, Max. I like your collar. It is pretty and I want to wear it." Max was sad and did not know what to do.
Max went to his friend, a wise old owl named Oliver. He told Oliver about the problem with Lily and his collar. Oliver said, "Max, you and Lily can both wear the collar. You can share it and be friends." Max liked this idea.
Max went back to Lily and said, "Lily, we can share my collar. We can both wear it and be friends." Lily smiled and agreed. From that day on, Max and Lily shared the shiny collar and played together in the warm sun. They learned that sharing was a good thing and they became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a bookcase in her room that was full of books. One day, Lily wanted to read her favorite book, but it was on the bottom shelf and the bookcase was very tall. She tried to reach it, but she couldn't. 
Lily felt sad because she really wanted to read her book. She looked at the bookcase and noticed that it was very dirty. She decided to clean it first so that she could reach her book easily. 
She got a cloth and some water and started cleaning the bookcase. It took her a long time, but she finally finished. Now the bookcase was clean and Lily could easily reach her book. She felt happy and read her book all afternoon. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly cat named Mittens. Mittens liked to play with the other animals in the forest. One day, Mittens found a scary poem in the woods. The poem was about a big monster that scared everyone. Mittens got scared and ran away.
Mittens didn't want to be scared anymore, so she went to her friend, the wise owl. The owl said that sometimes scary things can be fun, like a rollercoaster ride. Mittens thought about it and decided to go back to the poem. She read it again and this time it didn't scare her as much.
Mittens realized that sometimes things that scare us can be interesting and fun. She decided to share the scary poem with her friends, and they all read it together. They laughed and played, and Mittens was happy that she didn't let her fear stop her from having fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. She had a special spot in her garden where she liked to go and see the pretty flowers. One day, she noticed a beautiful red poppy. It was so rare and special that she had never seen one like it before.
Lily loved the poppy so much that she wanted to pick it and take it home with her. But her mommy told her that it was better to leave it in the ground so that everyone could enjoy it. Lily was sad, but she listened to her mommy.
As the days went by, Lily kept going back to see the poppy. She loved it more and more each time she saw it. But one day, she noticed that the flower was starting to fall over. She knew that it was going to die soon.
Lily was very sad, but then she remembered what her mommy had said. She decided to leave the poppy in the ground so that it could make more beautiful flowers for everyone to enjoy. And sure enough, the next year, there were more rare and beautiful poppies growing in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a big pumpkin. It was very round and orange. It lived in a tight little garden with many other pumpkins. They all liked to grow and play in the sun.
One day, the pumpkin rolled away from the tight garden. It rolled down the hill and saw many new things. It saw a dog and a cat. They were playing together. The pumpkin wanted to play too, but it was too big to move fast.
At the end of the day, the pumpkin was tired. It missed its tight garden and the other pumpkins. A kind girl saw the pumpkin and helped it. She rolled it back up the hill to the tight garden. The pumpkin was so happy to be home. It thanked the girl and they became friends. The pumpkin and the girl played together in the garden until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys in her big backyard. One day, she found a mysterious box buried in the ground. She dug it out and opened it up. Inside, she found a very old book. It was the history book of her town!
Lily was very curious and wanted to learn more about her town's history. She asked her mom to read the book to her. Her mom said they could read it together after lunch. Lily was so excited that she couldn't wait.
After lunch, Lily and her mom sat down to read the history book. They learned about how the town used to be different a long time ago. Lily was amazed by all the different things she learned. She wanted to know more. Suddenly, she remembered the mysterious box she found. She pushed it open and found more treasures inside. From that day on, Lily loved to learn about history and explore the world around her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a big, heavy ball that she liked to play with. One day, she decided to roll the ball up a hill in her backyard.
Lucy pushed and pushed the heavy ball up the hill. It was hard work, but she did not give up. She knew that if she kept trying, she would have success. When she finally got the ball to the top of the hill, she was very happy.
Her mom and dad saw her do this and they were so proud. They clapped their hands for Lucy, which means they did applaud. Lucy knew that she had done a great job and felt good about her success.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the park with her mom and dad. One day, they saw a big windmill in the park. It was spinning round and round. Lily thought it was weird.
"Mom, what is that?" Lily asked.
"That's a mill," her mom said. "It displays how strong the wind is."
Lily watched the mill for a while, and then she saw a little boy playing with a toy airplane. She ran over to him and said, "Hi! Do you want to play with me?"
The boy smiled and said, "Sure! Let's go fly our planes by the mill." 
Lily and the boy played with their planes by the mill all day. It was so much fun! When it was time to go home, Lily said, "Bye! That was the best day ever!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, she heard a strong voice calling her name. It was her dad! He had come to play with her.
Lily and her dad played on the swings and the slide. They laughed and had so much fun together. Suddenly, Lily's dad said, "I have a surprise for you!" 
Lily was so excited to hear what the surprise was. Her dad took her to the ice cream truck and bought her a big cone. Lily was so happy and laughed with joy. She knew she had the best dad in the world.
From that day on, Lily and her dad had a special bond. They would always have fun together and share lots of laughs.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to listen to jazz music because it made her feel happy. One day, she lost her pretty bracelet while playing in the park. She looked for it everywhere but couldn't find it.
Lily decided to ask her friends for help. They searched high and low but still couldn't find the bracelet. Just when they were about to give up, a bird flew down and dropped the bracelet right in front of them! Lily was so happy and grateful to the bird for helping her find her pretty bracelet.
From that day on, Lily made sure to always keep her bracelet safe and secure so she wouldn't lose it again. And whenever she listened to jazz music, she would remember the kind bird that helped her search for her lost bracelet.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat snacks, especially cookies. One day, Lily wanted to eat a tough cookie, but she couldn't open the package. She struggled and struggled, but the cookie package wouldn't open.
Lily's mom saw her struggling and asked, "What's wrong, Lily?" Lily replied, "I want a cookie, but the package won't open." Her mom said, "Let me help you." She opened the package easily and gave Lily a cookie.
After eating the cookie, Lily felt happy and said, "Thank you, Mommy. You made it easy for me." Her mom replied, "It's okay to ask for help when you struggle. That's how we learn and grow." The moral of the story is that it's okay to ask for help when things get tough.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her blocks and stack them up high. One day, Lily's mom brought home a big bag of apples. "Look, Lily! I got you some apples!" her mom said. Lily was so happy and took one of the apples to eat.
But when she took a bite, she made a face. "This apple tastes spoiled," she said to her mom. Her mom looked at the apple and saw that it was brown and mushy inside. "Oh no, I didn't see that when I bought them," her mom said. "I'm sorry, Lily."
Lily forgave her mom and they went to the store to get some new apples. This time, they made sure to check each apple carefully to see if it was spoiled or not. And when they got home, Lily stacked up her blocks again, happy and content with her new, fresh apples.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up and pretend to be a hero. One day, she found a broken toy sword in the park. 
Lily's friend, Timmy, saw the broken sword and said, "That's no good. It's broken." 
But Lily replied, "I can still be a hero with it. Watch me!" 
So, she tied the broken sword to her belt and pretended to be a hero. She saved her teddy bear from a fierce dragon and rescued her doll from a tall tower. 
As Lily was walking home, she saw a little boy who had zipped his jacket up too high and couldn't get it down. Lily knew just what to do. She used her broken sword to carefully cut the zipper and free the boy. 
The boy's mother was so grateful and said, "You are a hero!" 
Lily smiled and said, "Even broken things can be useful sometimes."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a brown teddy bear that she loved very much. One day, Lily and her teddy bear went on a walk in the forest. They saw a flame in the distance and went to see what it was.
When they got closer, they saw a group of animals dancing around the flame. Lily asked the animals why they were dancing. The animals said they were dancing because they were happy.
Lily and her teddy bear joined in the dance around the flame. They danced and danced until they were tired. Then, Lily and her teddy bear went back home, happy from their adventure in the forest.

One day, a man with a big mustache went to the fair. He saw a small girl holding a red balloon. The girl looked happy. The man wanted to make her even more happy.
He walked up to the girl and said, "Hi! Do you want to hold my hand and we can see the fair together?" The girl smiled and said, "Yes, that sounds fun!" So, they walked around the fair, holding hands.
As they walked, the man saw a game where you could win a big toy. He knew the girl would love it. He played the game and won the toy for her. The girl was so happy, she hugged the man with the big mustache. They had the best day at the fair.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big, interesting rock on the ground. He wanted to show his friend, Jane. So, Tim picked up the rock and hurried to find Jane.
"Look, Jane!" said Tim. "I found an interesting rock on the ground!"
But Jane was not happy. She was sad because she did not have an interesting rock too. This made Tim sad.
Tim had an idea. He said, "Let's hurry and find an interesting rock for you too!" They searched the ground together. Soon, Jane found her own interesting rock. They were both happy and played with their rocks all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had long hair that always got in his eyes. His mom said it was time to go see the barber. 
Timmy went to the barber shop with his mom. The barber was a tall man with a big smile. Timmy felt a little scared, but the barber was kind and talked to him. 
"Do you want a haircut, Timmy?" asked the barber. 
Timmy nodded his head. "I want short hair," he said. 
The barber cut Timmy's hair and made him look very handsome. Timmy felt happy and proud of his new haircut. He thanked the barber and went home with his mom. From that day on, Timmy loved going to the barber.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a cold, and he was not happy. He wanted to feel warm and play with his friends.
One day, Tim found a pipe in his yard. He thought it was very special. He decided to own the pipe and keep it safe. He put the pipe in his room.
The next day, the sun came out, and it was not cold anymore. Tim felt better and went outside to play with his friends. He showed them the pipe he now owned. They all played together, and Tim was happy.

Anna loved chocolate. She liked to eat it when she was happy or sad or bored. She had a big box of chocolate in her room. She hid it under her bed so no one could find it.
One day, it was very hot outside. Anna wanted to play with her friends, but they were all at the pool. Anna did not like the pool. She did not like the water or the sun or the noise. She wanted to stay in her room and eat chocolate.
She went to her bed and pulled out the box of chocolate. She opened it and saw many pieces of chocolate. They looked yummy and brown and sweet. She picked one and put it in her mouth.
But it did not taste good. It tasted bad and bitter and yucky. Anna spat it out and looked at the box. All the pieces of chocolate were melted and sticky and icky. They were not chocolate anymore. They were chocolate soup.
Anna felt sad and angry and silly. She remembered that chocolate could not stay in a hot room. She remembered that chocolate needed to be in a cold place. She remembered that her mom had told her to put the chocolate in the fridge.
She wished she had listened to her mom. She wished she had put the chocolate in the fridge. Then it would be icy and hard and delicious. Then she could eat it and enjoy it and share it.
She threw away the box of chocolate soup and went to the kitchen. She hoped her mom had some more chocolate in the fridge. She hoped her mom would not be mad at her. She hoped her friends would come back from the pool soon. She learned a lesson that day. She learned to remember where to keep her chocolate.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun and pick peaches from her grandpa's tree. One day, she saw a funny looking peach that made her giggle.
"Look grandpa, this peach is so funny!" Lily said, holding up the peach for him to see.
Grandpa smiled and said, "I'm glad you enjoy picking peaches, Lily."
But as they were walking back inside, Lily tripped and the peach fell out of her hand and broke. Lily started to cry and grandpa tried to comfort her, but she was too upset.
"I'm sorry, grandpa. I didn't mean to break the funny peach," Lily said through her tears.
"It's okay, Lily. Accidents happen," grandpa said, giving her a hug.
Lily eventually stopped crying, but she still felt sad about the broken peach. She learned that even though things may be funny and enjoyable, accidents can still happen and it's important to be careful.

One day, a little bee named Buzz went on an adventure. He wanted to discover new things. As he flew, he saw a big tree. In the tree, he found a hive. Buzz was very happy. He wanted to make new friends.
Buzz went into the hive and saw many bees. They were all busy working. Buzz met a mighty bee named Strong. Strong was the leader of the hive. Strong said, "Hello, Buzz! Welcome to our hive. We work together to make honey."
Buzz wanted to help too. He asked Strong, "Can I help make honey?" Strong smiled and said, "Of course, Buzz! You can help gather nectar from flowers." Buzz was excited. He flew out of the hive and started to collect nectar.
Buzz worked hard with his new friends. The bees in the hive were happy to have Buzz. They all became good friends and made lots of honey together. Buzz had discovered a new home and a new family in the mighty hive.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a girl named Sue. Sue had a rare toy in her hand. It was a big, red ball. Tim wanted to get the ball too.
"Can I get the ball?" Tim asked Sue. Sue said, "Yes, but you have to find it first." So, Tim and Sue played a game. They hid the ball and tried to find it.
At last, Tim found the ball. But when he picked it up, it was not a ball. It was a big, red hat! Tim and Sue laughed. They played with the hat and had fun. The rare toy was not a ball, but a hat!

Adam and his mom were walking in the park. They sat down on a bench and watched the people play basketball. Suddenly, Adam said he wanted to play too. His mom smiled and said, "OK".
Adam ran over to the basketball court. He met four kids his age who were playing. Adam said, "Can I play too?". The kids said yes and they all started dribbling and shooting. 
Adam played really hard and made lots of shots. But then one of the other kids started to get frustrated. He shouted and started to demand the basketball. Everyone on the court looked scared.
Adam's mom saw what was happening. She walked over to the court and said in a calm voice, "We are here to play peacefully. No more demands".
The kids listened to Adam's mom and started to play the game peacefully. Adam was very proud of his mom for helping him and the other kids stay peaceful.

Once there was a playful little girl named Sophie. She had a cardboard box that she loved to play with. She would make it into a castle for her dolls, or a house for her animals. Sophie saw this box as her very own toy box. 
One day, Sophie's mom said she wanted to make a pillow with the box, so Sophie reluctantly put the box aside. She was very sad, but she knew that her mom had a good reason. 
The next day, Sophie's mom showed her the finished pillow. Sophie was happy but sad at the same time because she knew that the box was now a pillow, so she couldn't play with it anymore. 
Sophie said, "Mommy, I still want to play with my box!"
Sophie's mom replied, "I know, sweetheart, but this box needs to prevent us from having a cold pilllow at night. And you can still play with other toys!"
Sophie smiled, and she was happy again. She knew that her mom only wanted what was best for her family. So, while she was sad that she couldn't play with thebox anymore, she was also now grateful for the cozy pillow.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally loved to drink juice, especially apple juice. She was very lucky because her mom always had a big bottle of juice in the fridge.
One day, Sally's mom poured her a glass of juice and she drank it all up. But when she went to pour herself another glass, she saw that the bottle was empty! Sally was sad because she really wanted more juice.
Suddenly, her mom came in with a surprise. She explained that they were going to make their own juice! Sally was so excited and helped her mom pick apples from the tree outside. They squeezed the apples and made delicious apple juice together. Sally was very happy and felt lucky to have such a fun and unexpected day.

Once upon a time, there was a big, green snake named Sam. Sam was a flexible snake who could bend and twist in many ways. He lived in a small house with his best friend, Tim the turtle. They were very happy together.
One day, Sam found a big box full of luxury toys. There were soft teddy bears, shiny cars, and pretty dolls. Sam was very excited and wanted to play with all of them. But then, he remembered his friend Tim.
Sam thought it would be nice to share the luxury toys with Tim. So, he took the box to their small house and showed Tim all the fun toys. Tim was so happy to see the toys and thanked Sam for sharing them.
Together, Sam and Tim played with the luxury toys all day. They had so much fun sharing and playing together. And from that day on, Sam and Tim learned that sharing is a very good thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite pillow that she loved to sleep with every night. One day, Lily's mom washed the pillow and it looked very clean.
Lily said, "Mommy, my pillow seems different. Did you wash it?"
"Yes, I did, Lily. I wanted to make sure it was clean for you," said her mom.
Lily hugged her pillow and said, "Thank you, Mommy. It feels so nice and clean now." And she went to bed with her clean pillow, feeling very happy.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a kind lady named Jane. Jane loved to serve dessert to all her friends. One day, she made a big, yummy cake for everyone.
In the village, there was a little boy named Tim who was scared of trying new things. When Jane invited Tim to have some cake, he said, "No, thank you. I am scared to try it." Jane smiled and said, "Don't be scared, Tim. It's just a yummy cake. You will like it!"
Tim decided to be brave and try the cake. He took a small bite and found out that he loved it! All his friends were happy for him. From that day on, Tim was not scared to try new things.
The moral of the story is: Don't be scared to try new things, because you might find something you love.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very busy playing with her toys. She liked to build towers with blocks and draw pictures with crayons. 
One day, Lily went out with her mommy to run some errands. Her mommy told her to zip up her jacket because it was chilly outside. Lily tried to zip it up by herself, but it was hard. She started to worry that she couldn't do it. 
But then, her mommy helped her zip up her jacket and Lily felt better. They went to the store and bought some yummy snacks. Lily was happy again and forgot all about her worries.

One day, Jack and his mom went to the store. Jack saw a pretty blue fork and asked his mom if he could have it. His mom asked him why he wanted it, and Jack said that he wanted to eat his spaghetti with it. His mom said that he already had a fork and insisted that he didn't need another one. 
Jack wouldn't give up though, and he started crying and insisting that he needed the blue fork. His mom knew that if she didn't give in, he would just keep crying, so she sighed and said that he could have it.
Jack ran to the checkout counter and got the blue fork. His mom asked him to try to remain calm, so Jack tried to take deep breaths and be a good boy. Finally, they made it to the car and drove away. 
Jack was very happy with his blue fork. His mom was glad that her son was now calm, and that her insisting had paid off. They went home and enjoyed their spaghetti with the new blue fork.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Ted. Ted loved to go on adventures in the forest. One day, he went on a walk and saw a big bush full of yummy berries. Ted was so happy! He picked some berries and ate them all up. They tasted great! 
As Ted was walking home, he saw his friend Timmy. Timmy asked, "Where did you get those berries?" Ted said, "Over there, by the big tree!" Timmy said, "Great! Let's go get some!" So, Ted and Timmy went back to the bush and picked lots of berries. They had so much fun together. 
When they got home, Ted's mom saw all the berries they had picked. She said, "Wow, those look great! Let's make a pie!" So, they made a berry pie and it was so yummy. Ted and Timmy were happy that they could share their berries with everyone. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a lively little girl named Mia. Mia loved to play outside with her friends. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long. Mia's friends were her pupils, and she liked to teach them new games.
One sunny day, Mia and her friends found a small box. They decided to bury the box in the soft, brown dirt. They dug a hole with their hands and put the box inside. Then, they covered it up with the dirt. They thought it would be a fun secret to share.
Many days later, Mia and her friends went back to the spot where they buried the box. They dug it up and opened it. Inside, they found pretty stones that sparkled in the sun. They were so happy to have found such a special treasure. Mia and her lively pupils played with their new stones and continued to have fun adventures together.

Once upon a time, a big bus was driving down the road. The bus was carrying lots of people to a faraway place. Everyone on the bus was feeling sleepy because it was a long journey.
Suddenly, the bus stopped moving. The driver tried to start the bus again, but it wouldn't work. Everyone on the bus was confused and worried. They didn't know what to do.
But then, a kind man appeared. He knew how to repair the bus. He fixed the problem and the bus started moving again. Everyone on the bus was so happy and grateful to the man. They arrived at their destination safely and had a great time. The end.

Once there was a girl who liked to whistle. Everywhere she went, she would whistle. She even whistled while she played. One day she wanted to find something special to whistle. So she picked up her telephone and called her friend.
Her friend was very serious. He said he could teach her something new. They made plans to meet the next day.
The next day the girl and her friend went to the park. Her friend taught her how to whistle a very special song. She practiced and practiced until she could whistle the song perfectly.
The girl was so happy, she whistled the song everywhere she went. People stopped and listened, impressed by her whistling. She was so proud, she had learned something new!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a journal. Amy liked to draw in her journal with her sharp pencil. One day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. She took her journal with her.
At the park, Amy saw a harmless bug. She wanted to draw it in her journal. She sat down and started to draw. But then, the wind blew her journal away. Amy was sad and didn't know what to do.
Amy, her mom, and her dad looked for the journal. They looked by the trees and by the swings. Then, they saw a big dog with the journal in its mouth. The dog gave the journal back to Amy. She was happy and said thank you to the dog. The dog wagged its tail and became Amy's new friend.

Lila and Sam are twins. They like to play with their toys in the living room. They have many toys, but their favorite is the train set. The train set is modern. It has lights, sounds and a remote control.
One day, they are playing with the train set when they hear their mom call them. "Lila, Sam, it's time for lunch!" Mom says. They run to the kitchen and sit at the table. Mom gives them sandwiches, apple slices and milk. They say thank you and start to eat.
Lila notices something on her sandwich. It is a green leaf. She does not like green leaves. She makes a face and pushes her sandwich away. "What's wrong, Lila?" Mom asks. "I don't want this. It has green leaves," Lila says. "That's lettuce, Lila. It's good for you. It makes your sandwich crunchy and fresh," Mom says. "But I don't like it. It's yucky," Lila says.
Sam looks at his sandwich. He also has lettuce on his sandwich. But he does not mind. He likes lettuce. He thinks it is tasty and fun. He takes a big bite and smiles. "I like lettuce, Mom. It's yummy," Sam says. "That's good, Sam. I'm glad you like it," Mom says.
Lila feels sad. She does not want to eat her sandwich. She wants to play with the train set. She looks at Sam. He is eating his sandwich and his apple. He is happy. She wants to be happy too. She has an idea. She takes a napkin from the table. She carefully peels off the lettuce from her sandwich. She wraps the lettuce in the napkin. She hides the napkin under her plate. She thinks Mom will not see it. She eats her sandwich and her apple. She drinks her milk. She says she is done.
Mom comes to the table. She takes their plates and cups. She sees the napkin under Lila's plate. She picks it up. She sees the lettuce inside. She knows what Lila did. She is not happy. She looks at Lila. "Lila, did you eat your lettuce?" Mom asks. Lila feels scared. She knows she is in trouble. She shakes her head. "No, Mom. I don't like lettuce," Lila says. "Lila, that's not nice. You should not hide your food. You should try new things. They might be good for you. And you should not waste food. Some people don't have enough food to eat," Mom says. "I'm sorry, Mom. I won't do it again," Lila says.
Mom sighs. She is not very angry. She knows Lila is young. She knows Lila will learn. She gives Lila a hug. She says she loves her. She says she can play with the train set after she takes a nap. Lila nods. She says she loves Mom too. She says she will take a nap. She and Sam go to their room. They lie on their beds. They close their eyes. They dream of trains.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing outside and exploring. One day, he saw a big rock on the ground and wanted to see what was inside. He was very careful as he picked up the rock and split it open with a stick.
Inside the rock, he found a shiny crystal that sparkled like the stars in the sky. Timmy was so happy and ran to show his mom. But as he was running, he tripped and the crystal fell out of his hand and onto the earth. The crystal split into a million tiny pieces and Timmy was very sad.
He learned that sometimes, even when we are careful, accidents can happen. And that's okay, because we can always learn from our mistakes and try again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily and her mom were playing outside when they saw a big tornado in the sky. Lily got scared and asked her mom, "What's that?" Her mom said, "It's a tornado. We need to go inside and stay safe."
When they got inside, Lily's mom gave her a big hug and said, "Don't worry, we have each other and we'll be okay." Lily felt better and hugged her mom tight. 
After the tornado passed, Lily's mom asked her, "Did you see how strong the wind was?" Lily nodded and said, "Yes, it was very strong." Her mom replied, "That's why we have to be careful and stay safe during a tornado." 
Lily felt happy that her mom was there to protect her and they spent the rest of the day playing inside, safe from the tornado outside.

One day, a little girl named Mia wanted to mail a letter. She put on her coat and boots because it was icy outside. Mia walked to the big blue mailbox with her letter in her hand.
As she walked, Mia saw a pretty light in the sky. It was the sun shining on the icy snow. The light sparkled and made everything look like a shiny, white world.
Mia put her letter in the mailbox and smiled. She was happy that she could mail her letter on such a beautiful, icy day. Mia skipped back home, excited to tell her mom about the pretty light she saw.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim found a big chocolate in his yard. It was original, not like the ones he saw before. Tim was so happy! He wanted to share it with his best friend, Sue.
Tim went to Sue's house with the chocolate. They were so excited to eat it together. Just as they were about to take a bite, a little bird flew down and took the chocolate away. "Oh no!" said Tim. "Come back!" yelled Sue.
They decided to follow the bird to get the chocolate back. They ran and ran until they found the bird's nest. Inside, they saw baby birds. The bird was feeding the chocolate to her babies. Tim and Sue looked at each other and smiled. They knew the bird needed the chocolate more than they did. The friends went back home, feeling happy that they helped the bird and her babies.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play in the yard. One day, they see a big rock. They want to move it.
"Let's push the rock, Ben!" Lily says.
"OK, Lily!" Ben says.
They push and push, but the rock is too heavy. They are tired and hungry.
"Look, Lily! Mom made a pie!" Ben says. He sees a pie on the window sill. It smells good.
"Yum, pie! Let's go, Ben!" Lily says.
They run to the house. But they are clumsy. They trip and fall. The pie falls too. It lands on their heads.
"Oh no, the pie!" Lily says.
"Sorry, Mom!" Ben says.
Mom comes out. She sees the mess. She is not happy.
"What happened, Lily and Ben?" Mom says.
"We wanted the pie, Mom. But we were clumsy. We are sorry, Mom." Lily and Ben say.
Mom sighs. She is not angry. She loves Lily and Ben.
"It's OK, Lily and Ben. I have another pie. But next time, ask me first. And be careful with the rock. It can hurt you." Mom says.
She hugs Lily and Ben. She gives them a slice of pie. They say thank you. They eat the pie. It is delicious. They are happy.

Tommy was at home with his mom and he wanted to go out and play. He asked his mom if he could go out. His mom said, "Yes, but you have to be calm and not run around too much. Ok?" Tommy said, "Ok."
He went outside and looked around. He saw his neighbor, Mr. Jenkins, paying for a newspaper at the corner store. Tommy asked him, "What are you paying for?" Mr. Jenkins said, "I'm buying a newspaper. Do you want to see it?"
Tommy said, "Yes!" So Mr. Jenkins opened the newspaper to show Tommy. He saw pictures of people, animals and places. Tommy said, "Wow!" He looked calm and happy as he looked through the newspaper. 
Mr. Jenkins said, "Goodbye Tommy. Be safe!" Tommy said goodbye and went on his way, still looking at the pictures in the newspaper. He was feeling very calm now.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat prunes and always asked her mom to buy more at the store. One day, Lily's mom said they couldn't afford to buy prunes anymore. Lily was sad but didn't say anything.
Lily's friend, Timmy, had a big bag of prunes and Lily was jealous. She wanted some so badly. Timmy said he would give her some if she traded him her favorite toy. Lily thought it was a good deal and gave him the toy.
The next day, Lily's mom found out about the trade and was angry. She told Lily that the toy was very special and couldn't be replaced. Lily was sad and regretted trading it for the prunes.
In the end, Lily didn't have any prunes or her favorite toy. She learned that it's not good to be jealous and make bad trades.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to go to the park with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to the park and saw a long line for the slide. Lily didn't like waiting in line, but her mommy and daddy said they had to wait their turn.
While they waited, a dark cloud came over the park and it started to rain. Lily didn't like the rain, so she started to scream. Her mommy and daddy tried to calm her down, but she kept screaming.
Just then, a little boy in front of them turned around and said, "Don't scream, it's just rain. We can wait in line together and have fun on the slide when it stops." Lily stopped screaming and smiled. She was happy to have a new friend and didn't mind waiting in line anymore.

One day, a quiet cat and a loud dog were walking in the woods. They were looking for a shelter to hide from the rain. The cat saw a big rock and said, "Let's go there!"
When they got to the rock, they saw a little hole. The dog tried to poke his head in the hole, but it was too small. The cat poked her head in and saw a tiny mouse. The mouse said, "Hello! Do you need help?"
The cat and the dog were very surprised. They didn't know that the mouse could talk. The mouse said, "I can make the hole bigger for you. Then, we can all hide from the rain together." The cat and the dog were very happy. They all became friends and stayed dry in their new shelter.

Once upon a time, there was a fish named Nemo. Nemo lived in a reef with his friends. One day, Nemo saw something shiny in the water. He swam closer to see what it was. It was a bottle with a message inside. Nemo was excited and asked his friend, "What could it be?"
His friend replied, "I don't know. Let's be gentle and open it together." They carefully opened the bottle and read the message. It was a map to a treasure! Nemo and his friends were so happy. They decided to follow the map and find the treasure.
They swam through the reef and over the rocks until they found the treasure. It was a chest full of gold and jewels. Nemo and his friends were overjoyed. They thanked each other for being gentle and helping each other find the treasure. From that day on, they were the happiest fish in the reef.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a brother named Billy. Timmy and Billy loved to play in the pool. One day, Timmy said to Billy, "Let's splash in the pool!" Billy said, "Okay!" They ran to the pool and jumped in. They splashed and splashed until the water was all over the place. 
Suddenly, their mom came outside and said, "Boys, it's time to come in. It's getting mild outside." Timmy and Billy said, "Okay, Mom!" They got out of the pool and dried off. They went inside and their mom gave them some cookies. They were happy and full of joy. They loved playing with each other and they knew they would always be best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and her mother. One day, Lily's mother had to go to work, and Lily was sad. She missed her mother very much.
In the afternoon, Lily's mother arrived home. She had a surprise for Lily. She brought a small puppy for her to play with. Lily was so happy! She played with the puppy all day long.
But when it was time for bed, the puppy wouldn't sleep. It barked and barked. Lily's mother tried to calm it down, but it wouldn't stop. Finally, they realized that the puppy missed its mother. So, Lily's mother decided to take the puppy back to its mother. Lily was sad, but she knew it was the right thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she found a penny on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mommy. "Look mommy, I found a penny!" she said. Her mommy smiled and said, "That's great Lily, do you understand what a penny is for?" 
Lily shook her head, feeling a bit helpless. "No mommy, what is a penny for?" she asked. Her mommy explained that a penny is a type of money that people use to buy things. "Oh, I understand now!" Lily said, feeling happy that she learned something new. 
Later that day, Lily went to the store with her mommy. She saw a toy that she really wanted, but it cost more than just one penny. She felt helpless again, thinking she couldn't buy it. But then her mommy reminded her that they could save up more pennies and buy the toy later. Lily smiled and felt happy that her mommy could help her understand things.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her friends at school. One day, Lily's teacher asked her to wear a special hat for a game they were going to play. The hat was big and red, and it made Lily feel happy.
After the game, Lily went to the blackboard to draw a picture. She loved to draw and write letters. She drew a big sun and some flowers, and then she wrote her name. But when she looked up again, she felt dizzy. The blackboard was too bright and made her head spin.
Lily sat down for a moment until she felt better. Then she looked at her picture and smiled. She was proud of herself. And she was happy to wear her special hat again tomorrow. The end.

One day, an elderly lady named Sue went to visit her friend, Tom. Tom was a young boy who lived next door. Sue had a big box to unpack. Tom was excited to see what was inside. They opened the box together.
Inside the box, there were many small boxes. Sue said, "Let's have a test! You pick a box, and we'll see what's inside." Tom picked a box, and when he opened it, a tiny toy car came out. They played with the toy car and had lots of fun. Then, Tom picked another box. He opened it, and a small toy dog jumped out.
Suddenly, the toy dog started to talk! It said, "Hello, Sue and Tom! I am a magic dog, and I can grant you one wish." They were very surprised. Sue and Tom looked at each other and thought about what they wanted. They decided to wish for a big playground in their backyard. The magic dog made their wish come true, and they played happily ever after.

One day, a little plane was flying in the sky. The plane was very calm and happy. It liked to fly high and see all the things down below.
But then, the plane saw a big storm coming. The storm made the plane very scared. The wind was strong and the rain was heavy. The plane did not know what to do.
Suddenly, a big bird came to help the plane. The bird was strong and knew how to fly in the storm. The bird told the plane to stay close and be calm. The bird helped the plane feel comfort and safe.
Together, they flew through the storm. The big bird showed the plane how to fly strong and brave. The plane was surprised but happy that the bird was there to help.
When the storm was gone, the plane thanked the big bird. They became good friends and flew together in the calm sky. The plane learned that even when things are scary, there is always a friend to help and give comfort.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim did not like to eat his vegetables. He would say, "I hate vegetables!" One day, his mom cooked a big, impressive dinner with lots of vegetables. She told him, "You must eat your vegetables, Tim."
Tim was not happy, but he sat down to eat. As he started to eat his vegetables, something unexpected happened. A small, green vegetable jumped off his plate and said, "Hello, Tim! We don't want you to hate us. We just want to be your friends and help you grow big and strong!"
Tim was very surprised. He had never seen a talking vegetable before. The little green vegetable told Tim about all the good things in vegetables that help kids grow. Tim listened and thought maybe he should give them a try. He ate his vegetables and found that they were not so bad after all.
From that day on, Tim no longer hated vegetables. He even started to like them. And as he ate more and more vegetables, he grew big and strong, just like the little green vegetable had promised. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to draw on his blackboard with colorful chalk. One day, Timmy slipped on a banana peel and hurt his knee. He cried and cried until his mommy came to give him a hug. 
After his knee felt better, Timmy went back to drawing on his blackboard. He drew a picture of a distant planet with aliens and spaceships. He was so proud of his drawing that he showed it to his mommy and daddy. They both said it was the best drawing they had ever seen! 
From that day on, Timmy made sure to watch where he was walking so he wouldn't slip again. And he kept on drawing amazing pictures on his blackboard, dreaming of distant planets and all the adventures he could have there. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a stubborn cat named Mittens. One morning, Lily woke up early and went to the kitchen to make breakfast. She wanted to make oatmeal, so she put some milk and oats in a pot and started to stir.
Mittens, who was sleeping on the counter, woke up and meowed, "Meow, what are you making?"
"I'm making oatmeal," Lily said. "Do you want some?"
Mittens shook his head and said, "Meow, I don't like oatmeal."
Lily finished stirring the oatmeal and poured it into a bowl. She sat down to eat, but Mittens jumped onto the table and knocked the bowl over. The oatmeal spilled everywhere!
Lily sighed and said, "Mittens, you're so stubborn! Now I have to clean this up."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big palace with her mommy and daddy. The palace was very pretty and had many colorful flowers in the garden.
One day, Lily saw some candy on the table. She wanted to eat it, but her mommy said no. Lily tried to resist, but she couldn't. She ate the candy and felt very sick.
After that, Lily learned that she needed to be flexible and listen to her mommy and daddy. She knew that it was important to resist the urge to do something wrong. But it was too late, and she felt very sad.
The moral of the story is that it's important to listen to your parents and resist doing things that are not good for you. Even though it may be hard, it's the right thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a thin ostrich. The ostrich was very sad because he didn't have any friends. He wanted to play with the other animals, but they always ran away from him.
One day, the ostrich decided to hide behind a big rock. He thought that if he hid, the other animals wouldn't see him and maybe they would come to play with him. But as he was hiding, he realized that hiding wasn't the answer.
He realized that he needed to be brave and go talk to the other animals. So, he came out from behind the rock and went to talk to them. To his surprise, the other animals were happy to play with him and they became good friends.
The moral of the story is that sometimes, we might feel like hiding from our problems, but it's important to be brave and face them instead. And just like the ostrich, we might find that our problems aren't as big as we thought they were.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweetie. Tweetie loved to look at the beautiful flowers in the garden. One day, she saw a big, graceful butterfly standing on a flower. Tweetie was amazed by how pretty the butterfly was.
Tweetie wanted to be graceful like the butterfly, so she practiced standing on one leg like a flamingo. She wobbled a lot at first, but she kept practicing every day. 
One day, while Tweetie was standing on one leg, she saw a big cat sneaking up on her. She quickly flew away, but she was glad she had practiced standing on one leg because it helped her fly away faster. From then on, Tweetie always practiced standing on one leg and looking out for danger.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little girl named Lily. She had a best friend named Tom. They liked to talk and play all day. One day, they found a bottle in the park. The bottle was very pretty and shiny.
Lily and Tom picked up the bottle and looked at it. They saw that there was a paper inside. Tom said, "Let's open the bottle and see what's on the paper." Lily nodded, and they opened the bottle together. They took out the paper and tried to read it.
As they read the paper, a big, funny clown appeared! The clown said, "Hello, kids! I was in the bottle, and now I am here to play with you!" Lily and Tom were very surprised, but they were happy too. They played with the clown all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to help her mom in the kitchen. One day, her mom was making dessert for the family. Amy was very excited to help.
Amy's mom asked her to spread jam on the bread. Amy took a big spoon and spread the jam all over the bread. She was very happy to help. Then, her mom put the dessert in the oven to bake.
When the dessert was ready, Amy and her mom took it out of the oven. It smelled so good! Amy's mom said, "Thank you for your help, Amy. This dessert looks yummy!" Amy smiled and knew that she did a great job. They all enjoyed the dessert together.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to visit his grandma. She lived far away. Tim asked his mom, "Can we go see grandma?" His mom said, "Yes, we can take an aeroplane to visit her."
They went to the airport. Tim was excited to see all the big aeroplanes. He asked his mom, "Which one will we go on?" His mom looked at the tickets and said, "We will go on the big blue one. It has seats available for us."
Tim and his mom got on the aeroplane. They sat in their seats and put on their seatbelts. The aeroplane went up, up, up into the sky. Tim looked out the window and saw the clouds. Soon, they landed and saw grandma waiting for them. Tim was happy to visit his grandma and give her a big hug.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to the park with his mom and dad. They would swing on the swings and slide down the slide. One day, Timmy saw a calendar on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his mom and dad. They explained to him that a calendar helps us keep track of the days. 
As they were leaving the park, Timmy saw another little boy crying. He asked his mom and dad why the boy was crying. They said that the boy lost his toy. Timmy thought for a moment and remembered that he had a toy just like it at home. He asked his mom and dad if they could give the boy his toy to make him feel better. 
Timmy's mom and dad were proud of him for being so kind and thoughtful. They explained to him that being kind to others is important and it makes the world a more peaceful place. From that day on, Timmy always tried to be kind to others and make them feel better whenever he could.

Once upon a time, there was a caterpillar. It was a very generous caterpillar. It liked to share its food with all its friends.
One day, the caterpillar met a little bird. The bird was hungry. The generous caterpillar gave the bird some of its food. The bird was very happy. They became good friends.
The bird would admire the caterpillar for being so kind. The caterpillar was happy to have a friend who liked it. They played together every day. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old bird who lived on a small island. The bird was friends with many other animals. One day, a little fish came to the wise bird and asked for help.
"Please, wise bird, can you help me?" said the little fish. "I want to be big and strong like you, but I can't swim fast."
The wise bird had an idea. "I will help you, little fish. But first, you must promise to help someone else one day."
The little fish agreed, and the wise bird taught the little fish how to swim fast. The little fish was very happy and swam all around the island.
One day, a big storm came to the island. The wise bird was in trouble and could not fly. The little fish saw this and remembered the promise. The little fish swam as fast as it could and helped the wise bird. The wise bird said, "Thank you, little fish. You have become big and strong." The little fish was very proud and refused to forget the wise bird's kindness.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin was worried because he could not find his best friend, Sam the turtle. He swam around, looking for Sam.
One day, Fin saw a big rock. He swam behind it and found a hidden cave. "Maybe Sam is in there," he thought. He swam into the cave and called out, "Sam, are you here?"
Suddenly, the cave revealed a big, shiny scale. Fin was surprised. He swam closer and saw that the scale was part of a big snake. The snake looked at Fin and said, "Hello, little fish. I am Scaley, the snake. I haven't seen your friend, but I can help you find him."
Fin was happy and followed Scaley. They swam together, but Fin started to feel tired. Scaley said, "Don't worry, little fish. We will find Sam soon." But then, something unexpected happened. Scaley opened his mouth wide and swallowed Fin.
In the end, Fin never found Sam. He should not have trusted Scaley, the big snake. And so, the story has a bad ending, with Fin being eaten by Scaley.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot had a red scarf that he loved to wear. He would move around the house with his scarf on all day. Spot was very persistent in wearing his scarf every day.
One day, Spot's scarf went missing. He looked everywhere for his scarf but could not find it. Spot was sad and did not want to move. His friend, a little bird named Tweet, saw Spot and wanted to help him find his scarf. They both looked in the house together.
Tweet flew around and saw a clue. There was a red string on the floor. They followed the string and found Spot's scarf under his bed! Spot was so happy that he could wear his scarf again. He moved around the house with his scarf, and his friend Tweet flew beside him. The two friends played together all day, and Spot learned that with a little help and persistence, anything is possible.

Once, there were two friends. One was very old, and the other was still quite young. They were going to the airport together. The sun was beginning to set, so the sky was starting to glow.
The old friend was not as fast as the young one, but the young one was happy to take the elderly one's hand and guide them both. Together, they made their way to the airport.
When they arrived, the elderly one was amazed by all the colourful lights that glowed around them. They both admired the bright sky, until it was finally time to go inside the airport. Inside, they said goodbye and the old friend waved while the young one smiled.
The elderly friend felt some happiness and joy in their heart, just like the way the sky had glowed before. They hugged one last time, and then they parted ways.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally loved to play outside in the rain. She would put on her yellow raincoat and jump in puddles. One day, Sally found a big puddle and decided to soak her feet in it. 
After playing in the rain, Sally went inside and found her mom's stamp collection. She was very careful with the stamps and looked at each one closely. She liked the colorful stamps with pictures of animals on them. 
Later that day, Sally's mom asked her to try on a new dress. Sally put on the dress and it fit perfectly! She twirled around in it and felt very happy. Sally knew it was going to be a great day because she got to play in the rain, look at stamps, and wear a pretty dress that fit just right.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she went to pick some cherries from a tree. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise and saw a big dog running towards her. 
Lily was scared and didn't know what to do. She tried to run away, but her foot got stuck in a hole and she couldn't move. The dog was getting closer and Lily thought she was going to get hurt. 
Just then, her mom came outside and saw what was happening. She yelled at the dog to stop and it froze in place. Lily's mom helped her get her foot out of the hole and they went back inside. 
Lily was still a little scared, but she felt better knowing that her mom was there to help her. She ate some of the cherries she picked and told her mom all about what happened. From then on, Lily made sure to always be careful when playing outside.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. He had a big red ball and a small watch. The watch was very special to him. It was a gift from his mom. Tom was always grateful for his watch.
One day, Tom went to the park to play with his red ball. He threw the ball high in the sky and tried to catch it. While he was playing, he did not see where his watch was. He was sad and started to cry. Tom looked around and tried to find his watch.
Suddenly, Tom saw a squirrel with his watch. The squirrel was trying to turn the watch around. Tom asked the squirrel, "Please give me my watch back." The squirrel gave the watch back to Tom. Tom was very happy and grateful to the squirrel. They played together and became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly bird. The bird had a shiny gem that it loved to show to all its friends. One day, the bird met a new friend who had never seen the gem before. The new friend looked at the gem and nodded its head in approval. The bird was very happy to have a new friend who liked its gem. They played together and had lots of fun. The bird was grateful to have such a friendly friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toy train on the track in her room. One day, her bossy friend came over and wanted to play with the train too. Lily didn't want to share, but her mom told her it was nice to share.
So, Lily let her friend play with the train. But then, something unexpected happened. The phone rang and Lily's mom had to leave the room. When she came back, she saw that Lily's friend had broken the train track! Lily was sad and her friend felt bad too.
But then, Lily's friend had an idea. She used some tape to fix the track and they played together again. Lily learned that sharing was nice and her friend learned that it's important to be careful with other people's toys. They both had fun playing and became even better friends. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a kind lady named Lily. She lived in a big house with a big garden. One day, she found a shiny gem in her garden. She was so happy and showed it to her friend, Tom.
Tom said, "Wow, Lily! That's a beautiful gem. Can I have it?"
Lily replied, "Of course, Tom! I am generous and I want to share my gem with you." 
Tom was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You are the best friend ever." 
Lily smiled and said, "Let's stretch our arms and give each other a big hug!" 
And they hugged each other tightly, feeling happy and grateful for their friendship.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max was very loyal to his owner, a little girl named Lily. Max loved to play with Lily and follow her wherever she went.
One day, Lily's mom said it was time for Max to get a haircut. Max didn't like haircuts and started to panic when he heard the word. But Lily's mom promised that it wouldn't hurt and that Max would look very handsome afterwards.
Max still felt a little scared, but he trusted Lily's mom and let her give him a haircut. When it was all done, Max looked in the mirror and saw that he did look very handsome! Lily gave him a big hug and Max felt very happy that he was loyal to such a nice family. The end.

Once upon a time there was a King who lived in a beautiful palace. In his palace he had many useful things, but one day he realized he was missing something very important. He asked his servants to go into the village and supply what he needed. 
The servants decided to go to Mary, who was known around the village for having many useful things. When they arrived at Mary's house, they asked her if she had what the King needed. Mary said she did and told them to wait while she gathered the supplies. 
The servants returned to the palace with the supplies. When they presented the supplies to the King, he was so pleased. He thanked them kindly and praised Mary for her useful supplies. From then on Mary was known as the palace's most useful supplier. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big brown dog. The dog liked to play near a fountain. The fountain was in a park with lots of grass and trees. The brown dog would run and jump in the water. The water would splash and make the dog happy.
One day, the brown dog saw a little girl near the fountain. The little girl was sad because her hands were dirty. The brown dog wanted to help the little girl. So, the dog went into the fountain and got his tail wet.
The brown dog walked over to the little girl and let her use his wet tail to wipe her hands. The little girl smiled and said, "Thank you, brown dog!" The brown dog was happy that he could help the little girl. They both played near the fountain and had a fun day together.

Once there was a big hippo named Bobo. Bobo was very popular in the jungle. All the animals liked him. One day, a little monkey named Momo came to visit Bobo.
"Hi Bobo, I want to eat with you," said Momo. Bobo was happy, but there was a problem. There was only one big apple left, and they both wanted to eat it.
Bobo and Momo did not know what to do. They did not want to fight, but they both wanted the apple. So, they decided to ask their friend, Toto the elephant, for help.
Toto thought for a moment and said, "Why don't you both share the apple? You can cut it in half and eat it together." Bobo and Momo liked the idea. They cut the apple and ate it together. They were both happy and remained good friends.

Sara and Tom like to go to the market with Mom. They see many things at the market. They see fruits, flowers, toys, and clothes. Sara and Tom like to look at everything.
One day, Sara sees a pretty dress at the market. It is pink and has flowers on it. Sara wants the dress very much. She asks Mom if she can have it. Mom says no, they have enough clothes at home. Sara is sad and angry. She starts to cry and scream.
Tom sees Sara crying and screaming. He does not like it. He wants Sara to be calm and happy. He thinks of a way to make Sara feel better. He sees a balloon seller at the market. He has many balloons of different colors. Tom asks Mom if he can have a balloon. Mom says yes, he can have one balloon.
Tom chooses a blue balloon. He likes blue. He pays the balloon seller and takes the balloon. He goes to Sara and gives her the balloon. He says, "Here, Sara, this is for you. It is a blue balloon. It is very pretty. You can hang it in your room. Do you like it?"
Sara stops crying and screaming. She looks at the balloon. She likes balloons. She likes blue. She takes the balloon from Tom. She says, "Thank you, Tom. This is a nice balloon. I like it very much. You are a good brother. I am sorry I was sad and angry. I do not need the dress. I have a balloon." She smiles and hugs Tom.
Mom sees Sara and Tom smiling and hugging. She is happy. She says, "You are very sweet, Tom. You made Sara feel better. You are very smart, Sara. You do not need the dress. You have a balloon. I am proud of you both. Let's go home now." She takes Sara and Tom by the hand and they leave the market. They are calm and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very restless and couldn't sit still for long. One day, her mommy took her to the park to play. Lily ran around and played on the swings, but soon she got tired and wanted to rest. 
She found a bench and sat down. But her mommy noticed that Lily kept fidgeting and couldn't get comfortable. "Is something bothering you, sweetie?" her mommy asked. Lily shook her head and said, "My waist hurts." 
Her mommy knew what to do. She requested that Lily lay down on the bench and she gently massaged her waist. After a few minutes, Lily felt much better and was able to play again. From that day on, Lily knew that when she needed to rest, she could ask her mommy for help.

Once upon a time, in a lively little town, there was a girl named Mia. Mia loved to mix colors and paint pretty pictures. One day, she decided to make a special veil for her mom's birthday.
Mia went to the store and bought a white veil. She also got some paint to mix and make different colors. Mia was excited to start her project. She went back home and started to mix the colors. She made blue, red, green, and yellow.
Mia used the colors to paint a beautiful picture on the veil. It had flowers, trees, and a big sun. When she was done, she showed her mom the veil. Mia said, "Look, Mom! I made this for you!"
Her mom smiled and said, "Thank you, Mia! It is so pretty!" She put on the veil and danced around the room. Mia and her mom had a fun day, and they were both very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful bird. The bird liked to fly and play with its friends. One day, it saw some new stuff on the ground. The bird was very curious.
The bird flew down to look at the stuff. It was shiny and pretty. The bird wanted to show its friends. But when it tried to fly, it could not! The stuff was sticky and stuck to the bird's wings. The bird started to cry.
Just then, a friendly frog came by. The frog saw the bird cry and wanted to help. The frog jumped on the sticky stuff and pushed it off the bird's wings. The bird was free! But now, the frog was stuck. The bird had an idea. It found a big leaf and used it to pull the sticky stuff off the frog. They both laughed and became best friends. The end.

Mia and John were playing in the park. John pointed at the sky and said, "Look Mia, a bird!" 
Mia looked surprised and said, "Wow!" 
John said, "We could be like that bird and soar in the sky". 
Mia looked sad and said, "But doesn't the war make the people very scared and hungry?" 
John was quiet for a moment and then said, "Yes - that's true. When the war ends, the people won't be so scared and hungry anymore". 
Mia smiled and said, "Let's point our fingers in the sky and make a wish that the war ends soon". So they both closed their eyes and made their wish.

One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk. She saw an old lady sitting on a bench. The old lady looked sad. Lily wanted to surprise her and make her happy.
Lily picked up pretty flowers and brought them to the old lady. "Here you go," she said with a smile. The old lady's face lit up. "Thank you, dear," she said. But then, a green monster appeared. He looked envious of the flowers.
The green monster wanted the flowers too. "Can I have some?" he asked. Lily was scared at first, but then she saw he was nice. She picked more flowers and gave them to the monster. The monster was so happy and not envious anymore.
Now, the old lady and the monster were both happy. They all became friends and played together. The day was full of surprises and fun for everyone.

Tom and Mia were best friends. They liked to play outside in the sun. One day, they saw a big puddle on the grass. They ran to the puddle and jumped in it. They splashed and laughed and had fun.
But then, a tall boy came to the puddle. He was mean and rude. He said, "This is my puddle. Go away, you little kids." He pushed Tom and Mia out of the puddle. He made them fall on the ground. He laughed at them.
Tom and Mia were sad and angry. They wanted to play in the puddle. They did not like the tall boy. They said, "You are not nice. You are a bully. We don't like you." They tried to get up and go back to the puddle.
But the tall boy was stronger and faster. He kicked the puddle and made a big wave. The water hit Tom and Mia and made them wet and cold. They cried and cried. They were very unhappy.
But then, they heard a loud bark. It was Rex, the big dog. Rex was Tom's pet. He loved Tom and Mia. He saw the tall boy being mean to them. He did not like that. He ran to the tall boy and growled. He showed his teeth and his claws. He scared the tall boy.
The tall boy was afraid of Rex. He said, "Sorry, sorry, please don't hurt me." He ran away from the puddle. He did not laugh anymore.
Tom and Mia smiled and hugged Rex. They said, "Thank you, Rex. You are a good dog. You are our hero." They played with Rex in the puddle. They splashed and laughed and had fun. They were happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One night, Lily saw a bright comet in the sky. She thought it was so pretty and wanted to follow it. 
Lily went outside and started to walk towards the comet. Suddenly, she heard a voice behind her. It was her big brother, Jack. 
"Where are you going, Lily?" Jack asked. 
"I'm following the pretty comet," Lily replied. 
"That's stupid," Jack said. "Comets are too far away to follow. Let's just watch it together." 
Lily agreed and they both looked up at the sky, watching the comet as it slowly moved across the stars. It was a beautiful sight, and Lily was happy to have her big brother there to share it with her.

Lily and Ben were friends who liked to play in the park. They had a lot of fun on the swings, the slide and the seesaw. But sometimes, Ben liked to tease Lily and make her mad.
One day, Ben saw Lily wearing a yellow dress with flowers on it. He thought it was funny and wanted to make her laugh. He ran up to her and said, "Lily, Lily, you look like a big yellow bee! Buzz, buzz, buzz!"
Lily did not think it was funny. She felt hurt and angry. She said, "Ben, that is not nice! You are being mean to me! I don't want to play with you anymore!"
Ben was surprised and sad. He did not mean to hurt Lily. He only wanted to joke with her. He said, "Lily, I'm sorry. I was just teasing. I think your dress is very pretty. You are my charming friend. Please don't be mad at me."
Lily looked at Ben and saw that he was sorry. She decided to forgive him. She said, "Ben, I accept your sorry. But don't tease me again. It is not fun. It is rude. Let's play nicely together."
Ben nodded and smiled. He said, "Lily, you are right. Teasing is not nice. It is rude. I will play nicely with you. You are my charming friend too."
Lily and Ben hugged and made up. They went back to playing in the park. They had a lot of fun on the swings, the slide and the seesaw. They did not tease each other anymore. They were happy friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat her breakfast on a big, round plate. One day, her mommy gave her a plate with a fine design on it. Lily was very happy and said, "Thank you, mommy! This plate is beautiful!" 
Lily's mommy made her some pancakes for breakfast. Lily took a bite and said, "Yum! These pancakes are delicious!" Suddenly, she noticed that her pancake had some green spots on it. She told her mommy, "Mommy, my pancake is bad. It's starting to rot!" 
Her mommy checked the pancake and said, "Oh no! You're right, Lily. I'm sorry. Let me get you a fresh one." She took the bad pancake off the plate and replaced it with a new one. Lily continued to eat her breakfast happily on her beautiful, fine plate.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named Spot. Spot loved to help his family with little jobs around the house. He liked to fold clothes, put away toys, and even help wash dishes. Spot was a very good dog.
One day, Spot saw a big sink full of water and dirty dishes. He knew that his family needed help, so he started to wash the dishes. He used his paws to scrub the plates and cups. Spot was very careful not to break anything.
When all the dishes were clean, Spot started to fold the clothes. He took his time and made sure each shirt and pant was folded neatly. After he finished, he put the clothes in a pile for his family to find. His family was so happy and proud of him. They knew they could always count on their dependable dog, Spot.
